Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: lisa d
Reviews.Content: Beautiful spot with a long stretch of beach (for the area) great pool, great service, clean and swanky. Brought our two year old and she had a blast. Family oriented and relatively quiet. Quite costly but worth it for the ammenities, great location, and exclusiveness. Balcony was fabulous for sunning during naptime :)

Reviews.Title: “Pittsburgh goes South”
Reviews.Author: Debby1212355
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Reach and had a great time. We are repeat customers and upgraded to a suite this year..good move. A little more room and a large balcony. Paul at the desk was wonderful helping us get settled in our room with an early arrival. We asked to see the room first before the luggage was taken up and they were happy to accommodate. We were on the top floor overlooking the pool with a great view of the ocean. Although this was Spring Break, we were not really near or bothered by the activities. Town is about a 14 block walk. The pool and beach area are very well attended by Yanni and Ricardo. Each day we were set-up with towels and an umbrella. Treats during the day included: popsicles, fresh fruit, cool/frozen hand towels and cucumbers for your eyes. Nothing like being pampered while you watch the waves! Brian, front doorman, was always helpful with dining ideas and directions. Gary, the concierge was also helpful. Some suggestions: a mirror is needed somewhere else in the room besides the bathroom. Just having one in the bath area does not allow for another person to do hair, make-up, etc. while the other person is in the shower. The wire shower soap caddie will not hold the bar of soap...it falls through the slats and ends up on the floor of the shower. :( Someone needs to follow-up on room service trays as they are often left in the hallways and it reflects poorly on the cleaning staff. We travel in March and the weather was low 80's. Very relaxing and the staff was very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, fun, great customer service, Yanni & Ricardo (beach staff) and Kevin (front desk) were awesome”
Reviews.Author: Rick P
Reviews.Content: We used our Hilton points and enjoyed every moment. Kevin upgraded our room and ensured our arrival was very welcoming and pleasant. The room was very clean and spacious. Yanni (spelling?) and Ricardo, the pool/beach staff, were very pleasant, entertaining, and accomadating. They were right there when we arrived at the pool or beach to set up our chairs, towels and umbrellas. Ricardo was also quite the comedian. The sister resort Casa Marina was right next door and available for our use. It is also very nice. We would highly recommend the "Reach" as a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but agree with others - not Waldorf Astoria (yet)”
Reviews.Author: cbm64
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a decent hotel overall, but it wasn't quite what I expected from a Waldorf Astoria property. The good: Staff was very friendly overall. Did not encounter anybody rude. The room service server who brought my breakfast tray on the first day was a little cool, but not rude. The property was gorgeous and very well-maintained. No issues with cleanliness or maintenance. The not-so-good: The one day I did room service, I thought it was a little slow (45 minutes is a little too long for a simple breakfast of eggs and toast in my opinion). Housekeeping came to room the first day and took the tip but did nothing. Going to the front desk rectified this immediately, but why did the maid take my money and not do anything? The aforementioned breakfast tray was STILL outside my room after 24 hours. Again, had to go to the front desk to get them to take it away. I had paid extra for a "boutique suite" that I thought would give me at least a view of the hotel courtyard. Instead, I got a view of the street next to the hotel, a view of the parking garage below, and some trees. I had no desire to sit on the balcony because what was I going to look at? Other things to be aware of: I think some reviewers mentioned that there are no tubs. This is correct - the boutique suite I was in (room 348) had only a stall shower. So if your mobility-impaired or have little kids, this may not be the place for you. The hotel restaurant (Strip House) has a lot of burlesque photos of women in it (early 20th century). Nothing gratuitous, but if you're offended by that sort of thing or don't want to have to explain them to your kids, then you may want to at least avoid the restaurant. Breakfast is served on the terrace where the photos aren't visible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 3 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chiliburger340
Reviews.Content: From the time We pulled up, We felt welcomed. Reservations were ready and We had an excellent room. (5th floor looking out over the pool and ocean). Only real down side was the restaraunt, which I reviewed separately. Located at the South end of Simonton St., so it is a little bit of a Hike to the happening end of Duval, but this is a plus at night, since our room was much quieter than When We've stayed right on Duval during previous visits. We had a rental car, so We used it to get to where We had to go. Enjoyed the time on the beach and the beach crew was friendly and proficient setting us up with chairs and umbrellas. We even got a popsickle and a cold towel. Nothing quite like watching a coconut tree sway in the breeze while sitting on a beach. There is a nice observation deck on the 5th floor, so you can watch the sunset or see if the cruise ships are in port. (And hence the day crowds on Duval). There are several good restaurants within walking distance, Louis' back yard, Camille's, and a good deli right across the street. There are also several good places on the South end of Duval, which is not much of a walk. All in All a very good place to spend a few days in Key West.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “The desk and beach staff make the hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgibbonsdd
Reviews.Content: Where do I start, Paul and Cindy Acevedo are true professional that are calm in all storms. They were five star. We plan to spend a month next year. Yanni, Ricardo and Ivan make the beach so pleasant, they really take care of you. They set you up every day, pass fruit, popsicles and smoothies........They are so helpful and accomodating. I never asked for one thing that was not done, from requesting a regular coffee pot to extra towels, and suggestions on water sports. Mary was is wonderful at the concerige desk, helping to book all of our activities and leaving them for us with a kind note and even more fun ideas. My favorite place on earh........Andrea and Larry

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 10 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Natalie D
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 10 day stay at The Reach. The hotel and staff were great and aimed to please daily. It was great being near the quieter end of Duval Street as we could walk to dinner each night but be away from some of the louder bars and clubs located on the opposite end of the street. The balcony, sofa and small refrigerator in the room was great to have and the big bathroom (which had Telegraph Hill robes) was a definite plus! It was nice being able to use Casa Marina's amenities and the spa located on their property. My mother, Sister and I did the island jet ski tour operated by Barefoot Billy (Jon was a great guide from Casa Marina). I would highly recommend this activity. You can start the tour right from the beach at either The Reach or Casa Marina and the tour is definitely worthwhile. Overall, my stay at The Reach exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Linda D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reach for 10 days in March and had a wonderful time. The location was perfect. I could walk anywhere and it was on the quiet end of the street. The staff was very friendly and aimed to please. The hotel is dog friendly and I did bring my small dog with me and that was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay, terrific Staff - Ricardo, Yonni, Kevin and Richard were unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: From the initial phone call with Richard, who promised and delivered; to check-in with Kevin who got us in early, and then to Ricardo and Yonni who were so friendly and attentive; our Reach experience was wonderful and worth every penny. Ricardo and Yonni in particular went out of their way, poolside, to make sure our every need was met. They were warm, funny, professional, efficient, and excellent ambassadors for the resort. We came to relax and enjoy a mini-vacation with another couple who are close friends. Because of the way that we were treated by everyone from the doormen to Ricardo and Yonni, The Reach exceeded all expectations and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great place”
Reviews.Author: Will_Linker
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Reach for 3 nights and we had a wonderful time. It is located a couple blocks from the quiet end of Duval Street. We were able to walk to everything we wanted to do. The beach does have limited space but was well maintained. There is a nice pier, if you walk on to it at night, look up before sitting. There are birds roosting, it appears they are trying to control that. We also were told we had access to their sister property "Casa Marina" and our room key did open the gates there, so we did enjoy access to that property as well. Our room was the "OCEAN VIEW BOUTIQUE SUITE". It was very clean and in very good shape overall, we only had one trash can in the room and it was in the bathroom. Plus there was only one phone and it was in the bed room. The concierge were great, they help us with dinner two nights. They got us last minute reservations and gave us coupons for key lime pie and one place and then a free glass of champagne the second night. We did get bikes there one day and had a great time exploring the island that way.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: 2Faxonroad
Reviews.Content: the location with a sandy beach was awesome. the staff is so helpful and available. i wouldn't look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria!!!! Not in this world”
Reviews.Author: Sonny S
Reviews.Content: The name used for The Reach is very deceptive as it reflects none of the standards of Waldorf.... Full of bugs and their continental breakfast is a joke! Stayed there in January 2012, and was the biggest mistake ever... Tried to check out early but the lovely manager, refused to accept an early check out. Rooms are in the garden view are located over the parking garage and you walk out smelling fumes from the car park.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I was at the Reach right now!”
Reviews.Author: gracelandwendy
Reviews.Content: We have been to Key West several times, and the Reach is one of our favorite places to stay. I recommend upgrading to a pool side suite because they are much nicer than the regular rooms with a separate bedroom and a pull out bed in the living room. Tile floors and larger bathrooms also come with the upgrade and it is not much more. Now, this property is not inexpensive and everything costs extra. Resort fee includes bottled water, wifi, and at a certain time of day, they pass out frozen towels, drink samples, and popsicles. Their website leads you to believe that these things are available at all times, but they are not. I also read on the website that you receive a welcome mojito upon check-in, but we have never been offered such! The food is good at the hotel, but once again, it is pricey. The property is beautiful and very clean. The hotel is walking distance to most things, and they offer bike rentals for a reasonable fee. Even though it is labeled a resort, there are no washing machine facilities available. The Reach is one of the few hotels that has it's own beach. It is very small, but they do provide guests with beach chairs and towels. Overall, it is Key West so you might expect to pay for Paradise, but it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Crystal N
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night and was unable to sleep most of the night. I called down to the front desk multiple times because of a couple of young adults and the parent were arguing in the corridor for hours in the middle of the night. The staff assured they would say something but never did. I wanted to call the police, but was asked not to by my fiancee. I was so tired from not sleeping, the next day was ruined. I didnt have much energy. I am so disgusted at paying 300 for a nice room, but poor staff. I live in Fl and visit Key West often, but I won't be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porchswings
Reviews.Content: The Reach is a decent resort, but definitely not Waldorf Astoria standards. The main thing going for it is the location on the beach, which for Key West is rare, but the rest of the resort is lackluster. Our room was clean and we were upgraded to a courtyard view, but our inside corner location let people on both sides of our room see in if they were outside on their balcony. Just a little weird. Also, the opening for our sliding door was literally only 18 inches wide, we had to turn sideways to walk outside. I think that was just a flaw of our specific room, the others looked much bigger. The rooms also lack a dresser to put clothes in, which was weird since our room had plenty of room for it. Our bathroom was very small and the toilet was literally in front of the sink. No exaggeration, you had to sort of straddle the toilet to get to the sink. The cleaning service was hit or miss, depending on which person cleaned our room and the doors let a lot of hallway noises in. The beach by KW standards was nice, but ended up with a lot of seagrass washed up on it (not their fault). The pier has tons of birds nesting in it, so it was covered in bird droppings, which I never saw get cleaned the five days we were at the resort. The pool/beach service guy sort of gave us a hard time for wanting to sit on the beach one day when it was windy (the pool chairs were full). We were on the beach 2-3 hours and never were offered a popsicle, frozen towel, etc. I did see one of them bring pina colada samples, but he ran out a few chairs before getting to us and never brought more. The guys at the Casa Marina were much more attentive when we were on that beach. The Casa is also much better at night, the gas torch lights and palm trees give a much better vibe. Amenities wise, the Casa is much nicer and more luxurious, it's just further from everything and sometimes gets big conferences, like the one they had while we were there. The positives of The Reach is that you are closer to Duval and several restaurants. I highly recommend the Southernmost Cafe for breakfast and drinks later in the day. It's at the very end of Duval on the beach (about two blocks from The Reach). Good food and a good view (liked it even more than Blue Heaven). There is also a small convenience store and two small delis within a block of The Reach, which is great for cheaper drinks and lunch. Also be sure to check out the sunset decks on the 4th and 5th floors of The Reach, great view without the crowds, and you can also see when the cruise ships are in town, meaning crowds on Duval and tours (noticed no ships Wed and Thurs). Regarding the rest of the resort, I was disappointed by some of the rusty door frames when walking through the halls and some of the stairways. Also surprised at how sometimes the building paint changed from a margarine color to a bright mustard color at random, just lots of details they have overlooked. Doormen standing in the lobby chatting, overflowing trash cans by the elevators, food trays sitting outside in the hallways from the night before, etc, the service could use a little attention. And the resort fee is a joke, plain and simple. The wifi kept dropping off my phone, prompting me for the password I had already entered numerous times. Our stay was free and the place was clean, but I don't think I would pay to come back unless I got a great deal. I would probably walk the other few blocks to the Casa or look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel stay and horrible service”
Reviews.Author: ziaic1
Reviews.Content: I sent an email to Hilton customer support and to no avail I did not receive a response. Email Attached below: 1) Checking In - One person at the entire front desk and it took 30-40 minutes to check-in. When checking in, only one of the rooms was ready (I also purchased a room for my father and his was not ready until almost 5:30pm). I have a call log on my cell (picture included on attachment from when the hotel called to confirm this. 2) I entered the room to drop off all of our bags while the other room was being prepared. I noticed the temperature of the room was very warm, so I quickly check the thermostat to lower the temp. I noticed it was set to 70 degrees (which is more than cool enough in Florida), but the room was clearly around 85 degrees (if not more). I felt the vent to see what temperature the air was coming out and it was also very warm. I decided to open up the panel for the intake and noticed the filter has not been replaced in years and was probably one of the dirtiest filters i have seen. I took a picture which is attached below. I removed the filter and put it outside the room and it was disposed of at a later time. The air then quickly started to cool and that issue was rectified. 3) I noticed in the room (Room 428 (my room) and Room 431 (Fathers room) that there was some sort of insect infestation. I took video of this (I will try to attach it if its not too large) and you will clear see tons of bugs running on the wet bar and through out other areas of the room. In fact, I was woken up out of a dead sleep when I was bitten by a fire ant on my stomach (which I would like to note is not a comfortable experience. The room was also very dirty. The door to the bathroom looked like it has not been cleaned in months (pictures attached) and I would say the same about the carpet. JUST TRIED TO PUT THE VIDEO IN THE EMAIL AND IT WAS TOO LARGE. If needed I will post it on You Tube to share it to whom ever it may concern. 4). The next morning I woke up and I spoke to my father and he informed me check out was at 11am. I then thought that was interesting due to the fact that we were not even able to completely check-in by 5:30pm. Each room cost me a little over 500 bucks per night and I was charged a daily resort fee of $25 bucks. That resort fee allowed me to use wifi and a few of the beach services (I have no idea what those services were, but thats was I was told). At this point we were at a beach resort and were now forced to be checked out. Hmmâ€¦ That almost sounds like a scam to me. I called down to the front desk and was routed to the concierge and was informed I need to talk to the front desk (which is what I dialed, but was informed there was only one person working). I was put on hold and then spoke to a lady who extended my check out to 12:30pm. I informed her of the very late checkin and she said that was the best she could do. 5) Before checking out we decided (4 of us (Father, step mom, girlfriend and myself)) to grab breakfast. We sat down in the outdoor area (right by the beach) which was very beautiful. A waiter came by and informed us that there was a buffet. I politely asked him if the buffet had waffles or if I could just order them ale carte. He started laughing and said if you want waffles go to the waffle house. Everyone at the table looked at me in astonishment that he even said that and that I didn't say something back to him informing him he was an jerk. The four of us went to the buffet and grabbed our own drinks. We came back to the table and noticed there were only two sets of forks and knifes and I did not see any service staff. I then walked across the outdoor seating area to find an empty table that still had silverware out. I grabbed those and brought them back to the table. About 5 minutes later someone came by and asked us if we wanted coffee which my step mother said "yes". She asked if she could get some cream and was not delivered the cream until after we received the check. The check had auto gratuity on it for %18 (which these people did nothing except say I had to go to a waffle house and give us a bill). I also wanted to note that there were three pieces of fresh toast left that were all burnt and the scrambled eggs we received were cold. On the bill it had room for an extra tip which I gladly commented "F@#$ No" on it. I hit my breaking point and this stage. This was the most intolerable stay at a hotel I have ever experienced and I stayed at more hotels than anyone I know. I just got back from Medellin, Columbia the week before and had a thousand time better experience there than in Key West. I think thats an interesting point to be made. The receipt is attached. 6) The only good experience of the entire trip was one individual that worked at the H2O bar (he setup lounge chairs and setup our jet-ski tour around the island for us). He was very polite and we tip him well for his excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: fperry3288
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Key West! The hotel was better than I expected. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We were even given a bottle of bubbly to start our vacation off. I really enjoyed our stay here. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “AVOID PRICELINE BOOKINGS”
Reviews.Author: ddelockery
Reviews.Content: Upgraded Priceline package with a Garden View turned into a Handicapped room looking into the back of Southermost Hotel over the entrance with a 20 foot wall blocking ocean view. Nice bed is only positive note for room with worn carpeting and furniture including a walkiin shower with a fold down bench and hose for a shower. $300 a night does not get you squat. Convenient location to Duval Street and a nice pool and beach. Beware $25 Resort Fee, $28 valet parking, $18 self park, and $25 breakfast buffet. PRICELINE is main culprit in my experience as they sold me an upgrade the hotel says is not available to them and failed to provide $50 a day credit as advertised in package. Lots a confusion over rates. NEVER again Priceline...

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: brodmktg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent three terrific nights here. Great pool and good-sized beach which we shared with our enjoyable fellow guests, all attracted by Key West's blend of laid back meets honky tonk meets Caribbean style. The beach crew of Yanni and Ricardo were a delight. We only ate one meal here...lunch on the terrace of the upscale Strip House restaurant which was noticeably empty for dinner each night. (Pssst...for the typical 3-4 night visitors, we're pretty much just looking for fresh fish, not a steak. Just sayin'.) The Reach is only a 5-minute walk from the beginning of the quieter end of Duval St. but since the island is so small, you can navigate it by food, bike or moped with no difficulty, which is part of the charm. The reasons I didn't give it 5 stars is its not up to the Waldorf or other true resorts highest standards. For example, room service trays, seen at 10P were still outside the rooms at 9A. Also, our bedroom (small) and bathroom were fine but the living room of our suite needed a facelift. Oh yeah, one more: our HDTV was a Zenith. Really?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: AJRDO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. You can walk everywhere safely in 15 minutes and it is on a little natural beach. The rooms with courtyard and ocean view are nice. Opt out of the rooms over the parking garage. The pool is adequate and there is always a friendly pool guy to assist in accomadating your needs. Traveling with a young family we needed an umbrella and everyday they arranged a great set up for us. There is no chair hogging scene here, it is very controlled. Thanks Yanni and Ivan-you provided great service! I do concur with the folks from London the wave runners take over the beach and the smell of petrol takes away from the all natural feel. The doorman, security and front desk are all very helpful. The resort fee is a joke. It is said to cover in room coffee, daily newspaper, Internet, gym, pool chairs, umbrellas, cold washcloths, Popsicles and drink samples. This is a reach! Come on guys! Six days on the beach and I saw 2 Popsicles, 1 cloth, and 0 drinks; as per the rest of the stuff no hotel I have stayed at from Ritz to Best Western charges extra for that stuff. Just up the room price if you must instead of the unsubstantiated resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: sports15
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to enjoy Key West but to enjoy a beach vacation at the same time, this is the place to go. It is very accessible to Duvall St but if you wish to feel like you are in the Islands for a while, you can get that too. I know the reviews of the Strip House have been good, I can tell you that we had a fantastic dinner there. A very romantic setting on the water and the best bone in Ribeye that we have ever had. Crispy outside, and tender and tasty on the inside. The service is very good as well. Louie's backyard next store to the resort is also very good and has a great bar. Go to Louie's or the sister Waldorf resort for a great sunset.

Reviews.Title: “what a disappointment !!!”
Reviews.Author: bruno t
Reviews.Content: It is said to be a luxury resort but it is a 3 stars hotel maximum; worst is the car park which is so close to the rooms, the service at the restaurant is more than average, and with the jet skis on the beach, it smells petrol all day long etc etc...too many examples that have been impacting our family stay...their sister hotel, next door looks much better...hopefully, Key west is a great location to go !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reach Keywest End of Feb”
Reviews.Author: Gerald122
Reviews.Content: Our room was very Quiet and good size. King bed and pull out sofa. Ordered room service the first night and tray sat outside the door for three days. Service at breakfast buffet was terrible and for their part of bringing you coffee if they got a chance they add 18 % gratuity. Watch the bill because there is another place below they leave a blank to enter an additionall tip. Great location , great weather, Nice place but most of the help didn't want to be there. 5

Reviews.Title: “A three star Hilton masquerading as a five star Waldorf ..so overpriced its a joke.”
Reviews.Author: Sgspin
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed in our stay at the reach. The first room was in a car park and stuck in the corner with no views so we moved and were put in roon 410 which is positioned under the noisiest extractor / air con ditioning unit. We were told the hotel was full and couldn't be moved and should have stayed in the first one. We were also told the unit would be turned off at night,it was not! We were looking simply for a weeks relaxation after travelling for four weeks.we feel like we need a holiday after trying to sleep in this room. I asked reception to get the manager to contact me,he did not, so to me it's easy to see where their problems start, at the top. The building itself is like a prison block, all concrete no carpets soft furnishings or plushness normally associated with this brand. Pool service was virtually non existent and servers very aggressive..hey don't feed the birds...not pleae sir we would prefer it if you didn't feed etc, but a shout at us across the restaurant....they should remember who the customer is. I would not recommend this hotel in a month of Sundays to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent at best”
Reviews.Author: jsproven
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending a week at The Reach and must say we were disappointed on several levels. Although the property is beautiful with a lovely beach and pool area, our room was disappointing with worn carpeting that was lifted in places and overall "tired" and in need of repainting, redecorating, etc. The service at breakfast, which was included in our fee, was really inconsistent. Every morning we had to flag down waitstaff for coffee or the check. The resort fee was supposed to include some amenities at the beach and poolside which happened only once during our stay. When checking out, we were asked if everything was fine and when we mentioned a few negatives, we were told "Oh, we often hear that." Then fix it please.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: zeestraat
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by others, expectations for being a WA resort were not met except for the price but we had a pleasant stay at this resort. Hotel and beach/pool services were good. Room was smallish but ok although the bathroom had no space to put any toiletries down. The easy access to entertainment and restaurants is a big plus as is the quietness of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 ALL”
Reviews.Author: Bdhamer
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with help with wheel chair guest - even to one of the few lifts to help the physically challenged. Staff went out of their way to help with our entire stay. Thanks for making our stay so positive.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!”
Reviews.Author: doatsea
Reviews.Content: We went for a 4 day weekend, and had a wonderful time. Great view, Great service, Great Property. Yep, We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: I took my wife here for her 50th birthday. Upon arrival they had balloons at the door and decorated the inside of the room also along with a bottle of champagne inside. The staff went out of their way to make sure everything was great for us. We stayed for four days and can't wait to go back. Thanks to the entire staff at the Reach for a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pat M
Reviews.Content: After staying at numerous hotels around the country this is one of the best. The rooms are just the right size for a nice relaxing for vacation or break. Of course if your a luxurious place like the keys u would want to be out side and that is the best part of this hotel . With its own big pool and one of the very few private beaches in key west it is perfect for being relaxed. There are lots of resturants close by or near the area but no need because the hotel restaurant, "strip house", is a moderately fancy restaurant with excellent food that is definatly worth eating at at least once. The staff at the reach is defiantly a hi- light. They love the guests and will do any thing to make your stay the most pleasurable that it can be. The "casa marina hotel" also owned by the same people is a wonderful place to have breakfast. They have a brunch and a excellent eggs Benedict. The last thing is the casa marina and the reach have tons of fun activities to fill you touristy needs that include bike rentals, jet sky tours, snorkeling tours and much more. If you'r planing a trip to key west this is the best hotel for anyone

Reviews.Title: “We Just Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: LISAFERRARI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, the perfect size, not to big, not to small. The staff was amazing, just couldn't do enough to make you happy. The beach was the best part, a lot of the hotels in the keys do not have beaches. This beach was beautiful, they had water sports for the kids and they attended to your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare of a Short Weekend at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: Megan G
Reviews.Content: It was all going to be our first time in Key West, FL. We were extremely excited to get away out of the cold Chicago windy weather. My boyfriend and I and another couple decided to book two rooms at The Reach for a wedding we were invited to attend for a long time friend of the guys who they served with overseas in Afghanistan. This was a very important trip to all of us! The wedding was held at both the Casa Marina(reception) and The Reach(ceremony). Before we arrived on Febuary 24th, we called to see if we could check in early because of a previous hotel complication within their network. When we called, the night manager stated that our rooms were available and we could check in once we arrived. We thought this was fantastic and were so happy that they were so accomadating! We arrived calmly and ready to start our short weekend vacation around 7:30AM. Once checked in, both us and the other couple were given our room keys for rooms both on the fourth floor. The other couple were given an upgraded hotel room upon booking, so they were super excited to see what room was in store for them. As my boyfriend and I walked over to our room and split from the other couple we inserted our key to open the door. After about 25 times of trying to open the door, and all the ruckus we were causing by turning the handle and trying to push the door open, a man(who was staying in the room) opened the door to grab his morning paper. He asked us why we were trying so desperately to get into his room. WE WERE GIVEN A ROOM WITH PEOPLE ALREADY STAYING IN IT! I grabbed the keys to bring down to the front desk only to find the other couple we were staying with were already down there too. They were also complaining to the manager that they walked into their upgraded room with a couple SLEEPING!!!!!!!! I'm guessing this hotel has NO CLUE if they have guests or no guests in certain rooms. I would say this a major travel/guest safety issue. The manager seemed completely confused at what keys were left the night before that had been attached to the so-called "empty rooms". Apparently, the rooms were NOT EMPTY. You could see her frustration, as much as ours from our long travel from Chicago, and overnight drive from Miami to Key West. The whole front desk seemed to be completely unorganized. She accommodated us with a double queen bed room, with a balcony facing the parking garage where we could shower and sleep for a few hours until they figured out what they were going to do with us because they were overbooked(which wasn't our problem, we booked this trip well over six months ago). The night manager was very nice to escort us to our room at room #436 to make sure we didn't run into another problem with other guests possibly sleeping in the room. We didn't get to that room until about 9AM. Unfortunately, us ladies couldn't unpack our dresses for the evening cocktail party we were supposed to attend for the wedding because we were going to be moving to another room in a matter of a few hours. The guys couldn't unpack their attire either because again, we were moving. I guess our wrinkled dresses were going to look great for the cocktail party. Exhausted, and sleep deprived, we all showered and slept in our crammed room for a little less than 3 1/2 hours only to be woken up to a loud phone call from the front desk. They called to tell us that we needed to be out of the room and they were going to move all four of us into another room with ONE king size bed until they had the second upgraded room available. We all re-packed what we took out to shower and sleep and scurried over to room #427(SAME FLOOR). One of us lucky couples got to keep this room for the night. This room was supposed to be an oceanfront room. The room balcony faced the courtyard and the large chess board and your door backed up the loud and obnoxious parking lot where at night you could hear the crazy car horns. The room I must say was very clean, but for a 5 star hotel, I expected a way better room. With all the frustration, we got ready to go to lunch in Downtown Key West to relax, because we were all too crammed in the little hotel room. I must say, the doorman(I don't recall his name) was very helpful with informing us where to go eat. He suggested Alonzo's for seafood, which was absolutely amazing. We received another phone call(interrupting our long lunch) saying that our other room was almost ready, but wasn't going to be complete until about 4:00PM. We arrived back to the hotel to pick up our new rooms keys after already going down to the front desk a million times that day to drop off and pick up new keys. The other couple decided to take the new room, packed up half of their stuff because we were so desperate for time to get ready for our wedding cocktail party at 5PM. The other couple were put in room #424 and they were supposed to be assigned an upgraded room. Their room was NO DIFFERENT than ours. RIDICULOUS!!!!!!! They paid for an upgraded room, only to get a standard and better yet, nothing was done about it. All the ruckus and frustration of moving and lack of time that THE REACH had taken away from us dealing with their lack of attentiveness, poor bookings, and a million and one other things. we were a half hour late to our wedding cocktail party at the Casa Marina. The next day we awoke to car sirens and horns in the parking garage right outside our room. We didn't even need a wake up call. Thank goodness we had to be up to attend the ceremony downstairs. The Reach hosted a beautiful ceremony for the couple, I must say. I wish they could've been just as professional in accommodating us as they did the wedding. After we left the ceremony, within 20mins of us getting to our room, the other couple received a phone call about credit cards issues. So ONCE AGAIN, we all had to take a break from the wedding and get THE REACH's problem solved. We were planning on going to take that break to go site seeing. Obviously we couldn't do that because we were constantly at the FRONT DESK! Come to find out, the resort was charging one of the cards with FOUR ROOMS when we only had TWO!!!!!! Better yet, they also were using the WRONG CARD, when they were given the current card when we first arrived!!!!!!!!!!! Once that situation was taken care of we had to hurry up to the room to change for the reception at the Casa Marina. Thank goodness were arrived in a timely manner. The Casa Marina took all of our frustration and stress and brought us joy by hosting a wonderful and professional reception. The Casa Marina was truly a joy to go and get away from THE REACH and all their issues. On Sunday, we checked out as soon as we could. WE COULD NOT WAIT TO TURN IN OUR KEYS! Unfortunately, we left Chicago Thursday night, in hopes of a great weekend wedding get away in Key West, for only us to count down the hours until we were going home. For this all being our first time in Key West, FL it was the worst first trip experience we've ever had. I truly will admit that because of the way this was all handled and how we were treated, I don't think we'll ever go to Key West, FL again and most importantly NEVER STAY AT THE REACH AGAIN. Our trip was completely ruined!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: Matt L
Reviews.Content: Just left the reach resort. We'll definitely be back. From the moment we walked in, we were treated like royalty. They really know how to spoil someone. The beach/pool staff really took good care of us. The wait staff at the strip house was very welcoming. Especially Julie, who made us feel at home from the minute we walked in. The room was clean and very comfortable. Bedding was wonderful. Overall a great experience in paradise. Thanks John and all of your staff.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Not worth $379.00/night plus, plus”
Reviews.Author: Lourdes B
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed in our $379.00 room (that's without all the other charges we were not made aware of). Our bathroom was on the other side of the wet bar and down the hall by the room entrance. Crumbs on floor & mirror full of hand prints. We decided to have a cocktail at their lounge/restaurant named Strip House. It is wall to wall photos of nude women (not mentioned on their site). There was not a soul or bartender in the lounge or restaurant. We then sat outside and it took forever to get service even though there were only 3 couples.Truly believe they are under staffed. (during our stay we only witnessed 1 couple having dinner at The Strip) We finally get a drink and the guy on the beach started fueling the jet skis. Fumes were so strong & then he dropped some fuel on the sand that we had to leave. We went to Casa Marina Resort (sister hotel) for cocktails & the ambiance & service was amazing. Came back to The Reach to get ready for dinner, Our room was on the 3rd floor. Right across from our balcony on 2nd floor was a wedding party on the terrace with loud music blasting our way. Needless to say, our balcony was not an option to sit and enjoy our glass of wine. Front desk had no idea when it would be over. Designing of terrace in that area was absurd. Location of the hotel is good and all the porters were very friendly & helpful. We found the surrounding hotels and B&B were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach”
Reviews.Author: Marcia A
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and the location ideal if you like sandy beaches (a rare find in Key West). Our favorite staff member by far was Yanni (the beach/ pool attendant). He is extremely hard working and has a fantastic sense of humor. We literally looked forward to seeing him! The rooms are fine, beds comfortable but we would have preferred a better job done by the housekeepers. Almost daily we had to request toilet paper and I am sure a vaccuum was never brought through the room the entire week we were there. I would stay there again if only to see Yanni and Ricardo - and hey it's vacation...a dirty room is no big deal!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views”
Reviews.Author: cakoenig
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely weekend at The Reach. The room was very comfortable and well-appointed. The staff was friendly and attentive, with just a few minor hiccups. The beach is well-kept, if small, and very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach was very accomodating with excellent service, beautiful and ideal beach front setting low key and relaxing, beautiful ”
Reviews.Author: Sheila_cobb
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort was one of our best stays ever in Key West. The staff was most accomodating and had exceptional services, especially Marcella at the front desk, Wesley the bellman and the pool and beach service attendants Yanni and Ricardo who were always upbeat and spirited. Our room was ideally located in the palm tree tops with a balcony view of the prestine garden and white sand beach and ocean. The resort was small enough to have an intimate feel, quiet and low key. Yet, it was large enough to offer all the amenities of a large resort...we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ABJEbbbb
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel, located conveniently very close to the end of Duval Street. It was very quiet and unpretentious. The staff was helpful (we asked for extra water and immediately had six bottles!), with few exceptions. We made use of the Casa Marina a few blocks away, for the better beach, two pools and festive environment. Our room was very nice. We had a very slight view of the ocean, but did not have to pay for an "ocean view", so I was grateful. Very expensive, I would say, but I believe it is in line with other high-end hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: ZsLuv2travel
Reviews.Content: We left a REAL luxury property in South Beach to visit Key West and stay at The Reach - what a step down. We had to fight for our reserved room type - facing the street is NOT ocean view. After a little fuss we were moved to a room with a fine view overlooking the pool and ocean beyond - but next to an elevator that beeped with every use. Our room was OK - but not particularly special. Overall, the experience was just OK too - not what we expected from a Waldorf property. If we were to return to Key West, we will shop for different lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Laurie G
Reviews.Content: From Paul at the Front desk to Yanni at the pool and Brian working the door, we had a wonderful time. Their service, pleasant demeanor, and quick answers made our trip memorable. The location is perfect to walk downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Weak on Amenities”
Reviews.Author: solandmames
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights (weekend) at The Reach. Overall the atmosphere was cool and not welcoming. The location is wonderful but that is the only positive that we found. The staff was inattentive. Construction work (?) with noisy back-up beeps started daily before 6 a.m. For $400 a day, we expected a lot more. There was no tub, no in-room coffee (only an espresso machine without directions). There are few amenities, no happy hour activities, music, or fun offerings on site. Breakfast for two was $50. Self parking @ $18/day. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine Day Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Robert J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Key West to celebrate our 10th anniversary on Valentine's Day. We stayed 6 days and 5 nights at The Reach and had a wonderful experience. The location of the hotel was great, extremely easy access by car to downtown Duvall St, etc. The room was clean, very comfortable and the hotel staff were excellent, polite and attended to all of our needs. The private beach was great complete with water sports, beach activities, attentive waiters (Derek, Casey) and staff who provided whatever was needed to make your stay comfortable. The strongest asset to the hotel were its staff, from the desk, restaurant, beach personnel (Yanni, Ricardo, Ivan) to the peole who served us throughout the day. The Yamaha Waverider facility on the beach was excellent and managed by a wonderful staff (Joe, Gage, Mike and others). Of course it doesn't hurt when the weather is perfect and the warmest spot in the Continental US that week. On the negative side, make sure you ask about all of the "extra charges", such as $18/day to park your car, $25/day resort fee, plus taxes for a daily total of @$48/day in addition to the room rate. We understand AAA gives the best rate, so ask first before booking. Other than that we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, its staff and its location and hope to come back in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach, a nice place but not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Barbara R
Reviews.Content: My English friend and I planned a one night trip to Key West, driving from Miami Beach where I had already rented a studio apartment for the month. I had done this same trip once, two years ago, and just walked into the Southernmost Hotel and even got a discount there, so I was dismayed when I started searching the Southernmost and other Victorian B & B's (I am an antique dealer), and could find no vacancies. I was afraid, then, to just drive down with no booking, so after several calls with "no vacancy replies," we booked The Reach through Hotels.com. Even with Hotels.com, the cheapest room here was 336.50, and that did not include the parking, and the $25 resort fee, so this was quite expensive I thought, but as it was the Waldorf, I expected to be surrounded by luxury. It was nice enough; I can't really complain about anything except that I think some breakfast should have been included and it wasn't. There was a fancy expresso machine in the room, but I don't drink coffee and wanted tea, so I called the front desk, and I must say they brought a tea maker and tea right up. There was a fridge in the room, with only one $5 bottle of water which was clearly marked which we did not drink, and there were two complimentary bottles of water on a serving tray. I personally did not like the dark, ultra modern furniture, but that's the antique dealer in me. The concierge there was helpful and he booked us a very nice sunset sail boat trip. I was tired and came in from the long walk to and fro from the dock and went to bed, but my friend went down to the bar and she said it was lovely and the drinks were only $10, so that was a plus. We had a nice balcony with a partial view of the ocean which was very nice also, though we really were not there long enough to use it. One minor complaint is that there really wasn't enough room to hang the towels in the bathroom without hanging them in reach of the shower where they would get wet. I was never able to get my ipad online, though I was picking up the signal, but I'm sure they would have helped me with this if I had called. I wasn't there long enough to ask, and I didn't use the pool or the nice beach facilities, so I did not really get any use of the required resort fee, though that wasn't the fault of the hotel. I'm sure if one wanted to stay there, and wanted to spend that much money, the resort activities were nice. We made our trip the Thursday before President's day, and the island was booked. When I make this one or two night trip again, I'll try to go earlier in the month as I did before, and will try again for the Southernmost House which was so beautiful, historic, and which I preferred. Again, my biggest complaint is that no breakfast, not even a continental one, was included. I did view the breakfast buffet and it looked nice, but did not inquire as to the price because I figured it was more than I wanted to pay. In summary, this hotel was nice enough, but not as luxurious as I would have expected one carrying the Waldorf Astoria name to be.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing. Lose the poolside music!”
Reviews.Author: rchiarelli6
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully relaxing resort, right on the beach (if the weather allows for swimming). Front desk manager, Kevin Otway, was very helpful in accommodating my room request.. Recommend booking a bed & breakfast room. Serving staff at breakfast on the terrace were very friendly. The service on the whole was very good at the resort without being stuffy or pretentious. My one reservation is that there is not enough shade around the pool, However, the pool staff is ready at any time to bring umbrellas for shade. I wish all resorts would do away with piped in music at poolside. Most people there want to read, or if they want to listen to music, they have their iPods, etc. I truly find it an imposition in this day of personal headsets to have music (which you do not choose) played at you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but not worth the charges”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I did lots of research before choosing the Reach Resort for a short vacation stop in Key West. We requested an ocean view on the top floor. The view of the palm tree from the balcony was great. When the wind blew, we could see the ocean now and then. The dividers on the balcony are slotted and while you can't directly see your neighbors, the configuration detracted from privacy. The room was nothing special but clean. We purchased the package that included breakfast at the hotel resturaunt and a $50.00 daily resort credit to be used to offset expenses that day )alcohol, hotel charge and parking excluded). The credit was applied to dinners at the resort and the other sister resort within walking distance. The food was pretty good but very overpriced. Overall, the hotel was clean and in good shape. The staff were friendly and helpful. We're glad we went to Key West but now that one is behind us, we'll stop further north and off the beaten path for a better price and a bit more privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Third time's a charm (well - so was the second too!!!)”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLovesMaui
Reviews.Content: We have made the reach an annual trek - last summer was our third - and I forgot to review it!!! The staff has become so much more attentive and helpful over the last few years - the beach is great as is the service. My one complaint would be the excessive smoking - but not much you can do about that I guess. Our room was great and the staff attentive to our needs. Will be staying here again next summer for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but too many extra fees”
Reviews.Author: MoeKell
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but pricey. They tack on extra fees rather than just raise the rate. An extra $18 to self park your car ($25 for valet service) and an extra $25 for a 'resort fee' which basically means that you can use their exercise equipment and they will bring you ice pops if you are sitting by the pool. However, they do make you aware of these fees in advance so you shouldn't be surprised. The room had no bureau with drawers so we had to live out of the suitcases for the time that we stayed there. Our room was very clean and the staff throughout the hotel was extremely nice and friendly. The location was very good. It is at the southern end of the island, 1 block from the quiet end of Duval St. If you want more hustle and bustle, I would recommend staying at the northern end, but this was good for us. It provided us the quiet, relaxing time while at the hotel, but was only 1-1/4 mile stroll up Duval St, past all the bars and restaurants, to Mallory Square and the beautiful sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: My two older children and I stayed at The Reach Resort in early February 2012. The Hotel was perfect in every way. From the moment we stepped foot on the property we felt like we had made the perfect choice for our stay in Key West. The Hotel was extremely clean and provided beautiful views overlooking the water. Because I had my two older children with me, I requsted an upgraded room so we would have more room. The staff was very understanding and upgraded us immediately with no additional charge. The Regis has a wonderful private beach which was very clean and chairs along with towels were immediately placed for us. There was no need for a car because Duval street was located only a block away. Upon arrival, the bag attendant informed us that we could self park at a reduced rate. Parking was close to the entrance and very convenient. When my son attempted to iron his slacks a stain showed up on them. They immediately sent the clothes to the dry cleaners and offered him a very nice customer service bag which included bottled water, champaign, and heartfelt apologies. While in the bar, we met a person who was training the staff on some special tequila. She included us in her discussion and even offered us some to try as she told everyone about the spirit. We immediately felt welcomed at The Regis and I would not hesitate to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Reach”
Reviews.Author: RMNPeterborough
Reviews.Content: We recently spent some time at The Reach and everyone was very helpful and professional. Yanni, was fantastic! We had plenty of space in our suite and enjoyed the pool and beach areas. The location was perfect and the amenities all we were looking for. Thanks to all at The Reach for making our winter get-a-way enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ann v
Reviews.Content: this hotel is under rated. the location couldnt be better. The service was great, even on the beach. The front desk and door men were alert and helpful. The beach crew were outstanding. The drinks,popsicle time and fresh fruit was an unexpected treat. From Yanni, Ricardo, and Ivan who kept my towels fresh.The only draw back was getting our room cleaned before 3 in the after noon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie1997
Reviews.Content: We researched hotels for our stay and this decision didn't disappoint from ANY perspective! The customer service is terrific from everyone--front desk, bar, restaurant, concierge, and service staff. The natural white sand beach and shallow beach water-beautiful! Our room was all it promised to be and then some...great view of ocean even with courtyard room, spacious, clean, elegant. Nice options such as Nespresso in room. The restaurant was outstanding, we ate every meal here. Large portions, you can easily share. Unique items on menu. We will most definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of tranquility”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandLochLomond
Reviews.Content: Despite arriving well before the normal mid-afternoon check-in time, the desk clerk, Paul, did everything in his power to allocate an appropriate room - i.e one with a sea-front view. This hotel was an oasis of peace and tranquility and coming from a cold, wet, snowy Scotland the 80 degree temperatures were a delight In-room facilities were on a par with the 5-star rating - very pleasant friendly staff, turndown service, even a specialty coffee making machine which was much appreciated - not easy to get anything other than "regular" coffee in America When we were eventually allocated our room - and upgraded - again Paul could not have been more helpful in ensuring that any requirements we had regarding eating or facilities were met. Given the opportunity, would not hesitate to return. Congratulations to the hotel management on having such pleasant friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Left of Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: CaribeAzul1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this resort because if was beach front, and the name brought to mind the type of hotel we were looking for. This place is run down, with mold on their umbrellas by the pool, bare cement floors in the breezeways, and nothing to do with oppulence and elegance associated with the Waldorf name. Don't waste your money staying here. There are plenty of other places in Key West closer to where the action is: restaurants, shoppings, clubs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 1foodude
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Hotels in Key West and I really love the location. It is at the quiet end of Duval Street so you can have your fun and then come back for some rest and relaxation. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, but not extravagant. This is the one of the only hotels that has it's own private oceanfront beach and we took advantage of the on site water sports which involved a jet ski around the island. I highly recommend this if you have good weather. I will definitely be staying here again on my next trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Service, activities and sun!”
Reviews.Author: Maryjane89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply awesome! Beautiful private beach, jet ski, snorkeling, and a lot of other activities. The service is incredible and the view is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in Touristy Key West”
Reviews.Author: Drwall57
Reviews.Content: The Reach is on the southern end of Key West, a short block off of Duval. The hotel is moden, clean and nice. Room selection is a bit tricky; the old "ocean view" rooms range from great views to crane your neck and do some contortions to see the top of a boat going by. Not sure how you defend yourself against it. We were able to change rooms after a day and were very happy. The rooms were very nice (except toilet seat in our first room on egg shaped toilet was round, which was quite disconcerting for one of us :-)). All the staff we dealt with were GREAT. Very friendly and willing to please. This hotel has a beach, which we understand is unusual for Key West. It also has a lovely UNheated pool and no hot tub (which was a surprise). Parking is underground and if you do it right, you can park pretty close to your room, even though this is NOT a motel. Overall, we would return. After walking Duval four times, we really didn't see any places as nice or as well located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Not quite Typical of a Waldorf Property”
Reviews.Author: aekjk
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very nice due to a very spacious room (upgrade) with a great view of the pool and Ocean. Good appointments except for "Old" lumpy sleep sofa and wall and doors that needed repainting. The start of looking "shabby". Missing instructions on how to use Coffee maker. We were three in the room and requested "turn-down" service. They forgot to turn down and open the sleep sofa. Overall stay was good but room rate not indicative of room itself

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't have moved to Casa Marina!”
Reviews.Author: i_ferenze
Reviews.Content: Staff, Paul, at the front desk was very pleasant and went out of his way to make sure we got what we asked for. My boyfriend and I went down to Key West for our friends' wedding. They booked everything at the Casa Marina. We arrived to Key West one day prior to the schedule but couldn't get a room at the Casa so we booked at The Reach and stayed for one night. The physical buildings, decor, amenities I would say are the same as the Casa. However the service is far beyond the same. We were expecting a FedEx package (wedding gift) to arrive at The Reach before we went to the wedding. Sure enough it didn't arrive during our stay. We had to check out and moved to the Casa where the wedding would be the next day. Paul suggested that we could have our luggage transferred to the Casa and we did so in the morning. In the afternoon we went to the Casa and the luggage were already there. Great! We called Paul back at the Reach and asked him to call us as soon as he received a package for us. It was frustrated that the package wouldn't arrive in time before the wedding. And Paul called us before noon of the same day. The personalized service that we had at the Reach makes us choose this hotel over any other luxury hotels when we visit Key West next time. I highly recommend The Reach

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Erica B
Reviews.Content: The Reach was amazing! The staff made our stay wonderful! Ricardo and Yanni took GREAT care of us at the beach, wonderful personalities! And Jason took great care of us from the front desk! Next time we go to Key West we will DEFINITELY be staying at the Reach again! Amazing beach, great pool, beautiful view from our room and just an overall great stay! We cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but not Waldorf-Astoria Quality..Book at the Casa Marina instead!”
Reviews.Author: dave k
Reviews.Content: Was there to celebrate New Years Eve 2012, and my friend used points (he's a diamond level traveler) for our two night stay. The room was pretty dirty, seeming more like a time share rental than a 5 star resort hotel. scuffs on wall, dirty doors and bathroom and no mini bar. The common areas were pretty much the same but the pool was ok.. Thankfully, other guests told us that we were allowed to use the facilities at the neighboring property, Casa Marina, which was MUCH nicer, beach area was better, service was better, and had two pools. Common areas MUCH nicer as well. So, my suggestion is book at the Casa Marina, but if you book at the reach, use the facilities next door at the Casa Marina just one block away!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: renotahoe
Reviews.Content: The location of the Reach is perfect. Great view of the ocean and the pool. The room was nice with good amenities. Liked the expresso machine. The beach was great and they delivered popsicles each afternon. The staff was friendly. Close to Duval Street but far enough away it wasn't touristy. Would definately return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We've reached our ultimate key west destination”
Reviews.Author: jjalbrecht
Reviews.Content: Amazing location with its own private beach and cozy pool with an ocean view. We absolutely loved the location. Service was above amd beyond! Thanks to Yanni, Ricardo, Wesley, Jason and all the folks at the Reach!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location... eh room”
Reviews.Author: MMaggieMMae
Reviews.Content: The location of the resort, right on the beach is amazing. A private beach with beautiful white sand and friendly staff (Ricardo and Yanni) waiting on you and making your stay amazing!! But when we got to the room, it was just okay. The pull out couch was less than comfortable and the carpets seemed stained :-( The view from our room was fantastic, but next time I may book the sister resort next door. Same private beach and friendly staff, just a different room. For the amount of time we stayed in our room, it was not that bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MKHor
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location. Great rooms. Staff so so nice! Pool was divine! Especially the pool staff Ricardo and Chris who were there for every request! Recommend for anyone who wants a memorable vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Get What you Pay For....and it's own PRIVATE BEACH!”
Reviews.Author: misterclancy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, well maintained, and staff were friendly. Most important for me is it has it's own private beach! Many other hotels in Key West do not have a beach. The others have pools and maybe a landing that brings them to the water, but no beach. The hotel provides chairs and umbrellas, plus water, and cocktails/food are available. Get a chair early as the front section of the beach fills up quickly.There is a jestski stand rental on the property. Everything in Key West revolves around Duval Street. This hotel is located at the far end of Duval, near the "Southernmost Point" attraction. It's a two minute walk to Duval, but the majority of bars/clubs are at the top of Duval...15 min walk away. Easy to catch a cab for $7 to bring you up/back if you don't want to walk. I didn't have any complaints with the rooms. They were clean, maintained and modern. We asked and received a nice courtyard view. While a bit pricey, the bar/restaurant was very interesting. It had a 1920's burlesque theme. Well worth a stop inside. We didn't get a breakfast package...just easier to walk 1 min up the road to a coffeee/breakfast shop. Beer/alcohol can be found found further up the road too. Paid parking is availble, or on the street if their is an open spot. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel....best beach you might find in Key West. :-)”
Reviews.Author: Richdawg72
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's first trip to Key West and we stayed two nights at the Reach. We liked the hotels location which is down a little but from the bars and everything happening on Duval St. Our room was nice and had a pretty good view. We had dinner at the Strip House house which we both thought was very good. Another good place to eat is Louie's Backyard which is right next door. We enjoyed Key West as we did a mini bar crawl and saw a majority of the bars. It is a cool place to visit and the food we had was pretty good but we checked Key West off our bucket list and may not be back for a while unless it is with a big group of friends. Its a some what scenic drive from Miami but kinda tough. ( 3.5-4 hours) We enjoyed ourselves while Key West and the Reach was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Key West 2012”
Reviews.Author: Sansal17
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close enough to walk to the excitement of Duval St. but quiet enough to enjoy peaceful surroundings of the resort. Our room was quite spacious and very nice. However, I was disappointed with a couple of things. First is the maintenance of our room. We tried to move the table and the legs literally fell off and then the stopper on the bathroom sink did not work unless you reached under the sink and manually operated it. We did not report these problems because we did not want to have workmen coming in to fix the problems while we were there. The second problem was when we left the resort each morning at approximately 9:30 AM and did not return until 2:30 PM. We put out the â€œservice roomâ€� sign each time but on 2 out of the 4 days we stayed there the room was not serviced while we were out. I feel 5 hours should be sufficient time to service a room especially at a resort where the idea is to spend time on your balcony, at the pool or at the beach. I called the front desk each day and the room was taken care of within the hour and on the last call we received a gift from the resort for our inconvenience. They may need a larger housekeeping staff when the resort is completely full, which it was during our stay. The final disappointment is the $25 activity fee which is added on to your bill each day. This fee can not be waved and should therefore be part of the daily room cost when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Key West vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tracy H
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I chose The Reach and was very satisfied. Great location with beautiful grounds, own beach, & within walking distance to Duvall St, restaurants, and shops. All the staff were friendly and so helpful, especially Paul at the desk. I agree with other reviewers that a hot tub would be nice. I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort BUT extra charges are annoying”
Reviews.Author: g1921skiier
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is one of the most beautiful resorts in Key West. The grounds are impeccable. The staff is well trained and accomdating. The annoyng part of my stay here were the extra charges. Resort charges are $25 a day. Parking was $18 for self parking. They are well disclosed but I just do not understand why they do not include them in the cost of the room. The other annoying thing about the Reach is the hotel layout. Very confusing for a first time visitor. The hotel has about four building interconnected with stairways and ramps leading from one building to another. There is no easy way to get anywhere on the property. From my room, I could see the pool/beach area. But it is a 5 minute walk to get to the beach/pool!! The room service was great, but on the morning of our check out the "do not disturb" sign disappeared from our room and at 9AM the maid came a knocking. And then she came back again at 10AM. I find it highly suspicious that the "do not disturb" sign is there everyday until check out day. Maybe a way for the housekeeping staff to get people up and out??

Reviews.Title: “Key West getaway”
Reviews.Author: MarkandDiana
Reviews.Content: We loved the location--close enough to walk to the excitement of Duval, but quiet enough to enjoy peaceful mornings looking out over the beach and the water. Was a bit of a long walk to the room from the entrance, but the room was beautiful. Loved the cappucino maker! Only two very minor cons--1) the music in the restaurant area was awful...sounded like the music played when they give the forecast on the Weather Channel! We liked to linger over outside breakfast in the morning,so we really noticed the music. Second, there was no hot tub in the pool area. After a long day walking (especially since we were there at a chilly time), would have been nice to sit in the hot tub for awhile. That said, we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Get A Way!”
Reviews.Author: Jake B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and spacious. The area on the roof was perfect for morning coffee and a night cap in the evening. Private beach with lots of relaxing areas. Close to Duvall but out of the way of all the hustle and bustle. Paul was exceptional. We were treated like royalty. This hotel will be our hotel for any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but with a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Tlc2010
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, we asked for a coffee maker for the room. We were told one would be brought up right away. The next morning we still did not have it, so called again and also told them, we did not have coffee cups. Three phone calls and an hour later, we had our coffee maker and cups. We always put the do not disturb on the door when we stay in a hotel. This sign was obviously ignored, they came in made the bed, changed out the towels, emptied garbage etc. The next morning, NO COFFEE CUPS or COFFEE, but they left dirty wine glasses. We called again, after two phone calls twenty minutes apart, we received coffee cups. When we asked about the coffee, his response was, how was I supposed to know. We finally were able to enjoy coffee for two mornings, an hour and many phone calls later.The next morning we locked them in the safe so they wouldnt take and not replace. The resort charges a $25 room fee to cover?? the card they give you with the code for free internet access did not work, so had to add to the room. Another hassle to straighten out. The room keys were another hassle. We had three keys, after a day at the pool, not one of the three keys worked. This hotel is spread out with many winding stairs and hallways. Copies of things charged at the pool are not given to you. We had many charges added and reversed due to mistakes made. Overall I would not stay here again. It is located two blocks from Duvall street in a good location, but so are others. For $375 a night I thought things would be better.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Concierge”
Reviews.Author: William T
Reviews.Content: The Pool staff at the Reach is awesome. Very attentive to your needs. Ricardo is always there everytime we return. He takes very good care of us and we look foward to seeing him on every trip! His other boys are awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach Doesn't Overreach...”
Reviews.Author: kkfranklin6300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between Christmas and New Year's, and overall the experience was just okay. Last year, we stayed at the sister hotel, Casa Marina, which is far more luxurious - but a bit stuffier. At The Reach, for example, you just ask for towels at the pool. At Casa Marina, you have to sign for them when you get them, and when you bring them back. The Reach has an excellent concierge and check in/out went smoothly. The staff is professional and attentive. The rooms are comfortable, if a bit spartan. The carpets are in desperate need of shampooing - they are FILTHY. The bathrooms are not cleaned well, and you won't get fresh towels unless you ask. Come on - for what we paid? Now, let's talk about dining. The Reach needs to do some work in this area. The Strip House is a decent restaurant, and the breakfast buffets every morning were ok (not fantastic, but serviceable, and way overpriced for what's available). The only real sour note, for us, was dinner at The Strip House on New Year's Eve, which was a DISASTER. We had 8:30 reservations and we didn't get our entrees until nearly 10 p.m. -- no apology or explanation from our waiter, who seemed annoyed that WE were annoyed. Seriously, dude, find another line of work.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take a suite if you are a family”
Reviews.Author: Clemens H
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our (very pricy) suite and especially the sleeper sofa bed for our kids. Any air mattress for USD 20 would have been better. The manager of the property may now write a response; we would have prefered that he (or somebody else) would have had a helpful response when we were there and asked for it (instead of only "there is nothing we can do" - which is unacceptable if you pay USD 600+ per night).

Reviews.Title: “Less than perfect stay/wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: Delthesea
Reviews.Content: I am writing to review this as a hotel and secondly as a wedding ceremony/reception venue. As a hotel, it is very classy but we needed a lot during our stay. We stayed in an Ocean View suite. It was a little smaller than I thought when I booked it, but we had a beautiful view of the sea and the breathtaking gazebo. However, a couple of amenities were broken. I had to request a new iron. Our air conditioning broke, which was quite the debacle because I needed our suite for me and the bridesmaids/stylists before the ceremony/reception. Because it took them so long to fix it they provided me with another suite on the same floor. It was larger and actually worked better but it didn't have the same ocean view. As a result we had to go back and forth between the two rooms (we chose not to completely move because of the view but to temporarily use the second one until after the wedding). This was tedious and cumbersome since the second suite was at the other end of the floor. However, they provided two bottles of sparkling wine to compensate for the trouble, which worked out as a celebration of my wedding. They also permitted us use of both rooms through the next morning. I also had a frustrating experience with my room service breakfast. They completely forgot one meal and the milk they'd promised for our coffee. However, again, when I reported this, they quickly resolved the problem and gifted me the forgotten meal. Other than that, the bed, the rooms, they were beautiful, of high quality and it was a pleasant stay. We didn't try the pool because of the wedding but the crew managing the jet skis were very friendly. As for a wedding venue, the gazebo is absolutely priceless. The Reach probably knows this since it was very costly but we found it worth our dime. The reception was held on the terrace and partly in the Caribe dining room. Unfortunately the Caribe doesn't open up entirely onto the terrace so there was a separation of the two sections (we had tables on both parts). However, as a whole, also a beautiful venue for a reception. If you choose a reception here you must use their restaurant, The Strip House, to cater it. However, it was delicious and we got many complements on it. Again, it was pricey but worth it. As for alcohol, the options were many, the bartenders were friendly and great, BUT they do not offer a cash bar. They seem very opposed to allowing other options, like one extra hour with just bottles of wine for the tables, so it was very unfortunate that we were forced to limit our time for our reception because we could not offer one additional hour of cash bar to our guests. Also, the manager, Jason Gates, offered assistance as a coordinator for the day of the wedding. He did a beautiful job of directing the wedding party and guests to where they/we needed to be, however, he and his staff forgot a few things. Even though we discussed handing out wedding programs, Jason and his staff forgot to put them out (after we'd distributed them to him the previous day). However, his staff did a wonderful job of setting out our guest book and card box. The hardest part, however, was that they didn't have the courtesy to ask what we'd like to do with our remaining cake. My parents spent a lot of money on it and although I see that we should have asked, I still feel it's a common courtesy the venue should offer. They know how much wedding cakes are and they should understand how busy the wedding party/family are that night. They never once asked about the cake and when we finally inquired it was too late for family to transport it home. Therefore The Reach ended up with an entire layer of a very expensive cake. Overall, it's a beautiful location with very accommodating staff. It is expensive but priceless for a wedding, just try to avoid our mistakes. Also, Key West is a party town, so don't expect too much communication from staff until closer to the event.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: dsul
Reviews.Content: I was in Key West for a wedding and was fortunate enough to stay where the wedding took place. I stay in hotels 30 weeks out of the year and the Reach has to be one of the best. The staff is superb, rooms excellent, food tremendous. I will come back again just to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to stay here for one night recently”
Reviews.Author: OnTheRoadLinni
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my room immensely. It had a view of the ocean and dock/gazebo area and was extremely relaxing. I even was able to lie down in a hammock between two palm trees ... heaven! The employees were very friendly and accommodating. I found their parking garage area a bit strange; didn't like looking down at the garbage containers from the upper hallways but i guess they have to go somewhere! Overall a great stay.
