Reviews.Title: “Should not be a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: willfchicago
Reviews.Content: Pros Good location Nice beach Cons Very poorly maintained...signs of wear everywhere Designed like some kind of open prison....our "suite" was right at the back overlooking the trash Service is poor,, had to call 4 times and visit front desk just to get the room serviced...took 24 hours Overall, Poor value for money, if you can stay at the Casa Marina...this place should not be a Waldorf in my view....really drags down the brand

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: merijanoo
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to thank Jason and Nedja for making my stay at the reach a very nice one. The hotel is very nice and the rooms are very spacious. We had room 301 & 302. 301 was ocean front over looking the lovely blue/green waters. The property is nice and gives a very personal feeling. I would recommend this property to anyone either couples or familes. We stayed in Mid Decemeber. Rooms are good size, but leaves a tad bit to be desired for being a Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Reach in the middle of December. The servive of the staff was wonderful in all ways. I had a boutique suite and thought I would not be able to see the ocean but I could. beach and pool were great. It is close enough to Duvall Street to walk to everything but also located where it is quiet and peaceful. I would definitely stay there again. I have had personal tragedies in the last few years losing my son and husband an I woke up one morning at The Reach and realized I felt more relaxed and rested than i had in a long time. I was a wonderful vacation

Reviews.Title: “Key West Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Bunnyhym
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Reach many times since the renovation of a few years ago and stay for periods of time that usually exceed one week. It is a wonderful place to be and truly does feel like home after a short period of time. The views from many of the rooms are beautiful, the beach is one of the best in Key West, and the staff is knowlegable, helpful and friendly. The hotel is beautifully located on the ocean and close to Duval but still far enough away to feel quiet and private. We have traveled all over the world and have had terrific experiences but we always come back to Key West and The Reach at least twice a year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Location”
Reviews.Author: Alan D
Reviews.Content: We started our trip with an upgrade (always a good start) and really enjoyed our stay here. The pool was great and the overall position of the hotel. We could go onto Duval Street in less than 5 minutes so it was easy to get back if we got tired. After the evening meal at the Hard Rock Cafe we were delighted to find the beds turned down. Great hotel in great location. Hard to fault it

Reviews.Title: “Super first impression”
Reviews.Author: BFLO27
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Key West for triathlon in early December...first employee I met was Brian at the bell stand...he was also participating in the race and was extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions, places to rent bikes, etc. I was told at check-in that my room didn't have an ocean view (I booked late)...much to my surprise I was able to see the ocean beyond the pool...a pleasant surprise...hotel is on the beach and conveniently located near Duval...again, Brian made an outstanding first impression. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: trheitman
Reviews.Content: We were completely dissatisfied regarding the horrific treatment my husband and I were subjected to by the hotel management at the Reach Hotel in Key West. My husband and I vacation in Key West every year because Key West is renowned for being pet friendly. When I booked my hotel stay at the Reach, I was told it was a pet friendly hotel. This is a total lie! I am not going to go into all the gory details, but the hotel manager actually called the police to have my husband and I physically removed from the hotel just because our sweet little, calm, quiet, friendly chihuahua was on the beach. I was laying quietly on my lounge chair with my dog (her name is Mandee) asleep by my side when 3 police officers along with the hotel manager and a hotel security guard confronted me on the beach. I was in shock as were many of the other hotel guests who were actually quite fond of our cute little pet. We were then rudely escorted by the police and the hotel manager to our room where we were subjected to very aggressive treatment by the police and management. They were actually trying to provoke me into doing or saying something that would give them cause to arrest me. Can you imagine the embarrassment and humiliation...and all because I had my dog on the beach sleeping in my lounge chair. We are not a trouble makers and would have complied with the hotel rules about having pets on a leash on the beach, but at no time did the hotel manager or security guard ever state a leash was required. If given the opportunity I would have gladly put Mandee on a leash. Rather, the hotel manager chose to wave a piece of paper in front of me on the beach in front of all the other hotel guests stating we were in violation of the hotel policy. Then after all this harassment and being evicted, I unfortunately left my purse behind. When I called the hotel, the said I could come to the hotel and pick it up, but that if I entered the hotel they were going to call the police...AGAIN! We paid for the hotel in full and DID NOT receive any refund for the three nights we missed and had to pay hundreds of dollars to stay else where. Stay far far away from the REACH!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: lbarlow2_99
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. We decided after a cruise to got to Key West. Found this through Hilton and locked in the room. We were allowed into our room a little early and the staff was very helpful. We enjoyed the pool and the beach. Great locations!!. At night we walked to Duvall Street. Great location, peaceful . Already planning to comeback and stay longer. The Hotel is a bit cut up so we had to wander a bit to get to our room but had another staff member give a few pointers that the front desk staff didnt which made finding our way around much easier.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: JED333
Reviews.Content: My wife and i got married at the Gazebo at the Reach two weeks ago. The staff was awesome, especially our wedding coordinator Jason. The rooms were beautiful. And the cost was beyond reasonable. I cannot say enough about The Reach. We are once a year Key West people and I may not stay anyplace else ever again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beachfront choice!”
Reviews.Author: rainydayinnyc
Reviews.Content: This was a trip for our honeymoon, and we enjoyed it thoroughly. There were a few annoyances which resulted in a four dot rating versus a five dot rating, but I would recommend the hotel to anyone who would like to have access to a nice beach, and a quiet stay. The rooms are a tad dated, which is to be expected for a hotel this old, the furniture and finishes were just worn down across the board, but our room was kept clean. The rooms (especially ours) can be quite far from any of the elevators or stairs. But we're from the city and walking is no big deal to us so I just mention that for the large number of travelers who feel that any walking is an impediment. No evidence of bed bugs. That is a HUGE plus. This is one of the few hotels with a private sandy beach. It is far superior to the Casa Marina beach, but you're allowed to use the facilities for both properties. The clientele when we went (October, BEFORE Fantasy Fest) seemed to be mostly couples, but there were a handful of kids in the pool every day. We're not averse to walking, so the distance from the restaurants wasn't a deal breaker for us - I think we could make it to Mallory Square in 15-20 minutes. The upside to being off Duval is it was much quieter around the hotel than elsewhere. If you don't like to walk, you may want to stay on Duval. We rented a car but didn't need it at all. We would have liked a hot tub (with a no kid policy if we're building a wish list here), updated facilities, and better pricing on the water activities. The jet skis were pretty expensive compared to what you could arrange through kiosks, and we felt like we were being upsold after we already decided to spend almost $300 on a jet ski trip. The resort fee concept needs to be eradicated. Charge me $25 on the room rate if you want more money, but breaking out a resort fee that is mandatory just comes across as greedy and is a pet peeve. Solid Hilton property, and the beach makes the expense worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else next time...”
Reviews.Author: AnnieJ420
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose this hotel because I wanted to be able to trust the accomodations we would get. For the price in the low season, I'm told it's a good deal but I must admit I expected more. We had a water facing balcony but the view was totally blocked by palm tree. The furniture placement was awkward and made it feel like an extended stay motel. Upon entering the room, I walked right into a bar/kitchenette area with a sink large enough to bath in and yet there was no mini bar. The walk from the hotel to the most happening areas of Duval Street and Mallory Square was long and most days, I never went back to the hotel until after dinner because it wasn't convenient. Overall, it was ok but I wouldn't say it was amazing and I probably won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: stefanie f
Reviews.Content: Had the best time at this hotel!, the pool attendants Ricardo, Ivan & Chris they where excellent! would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: dianna h
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful room with a great view from the balcony of the pool and the ocean. The staff was very helpful especially Ricardo and Chris at the beach and pool areas. They made us feel so pampered by adjusting our chairs, umbrella, and even providing popscicles and fruit during the heat of the afternoon. We also enjoyed the fresh fruit and flavored water provided in the guest lobby. The staff at the front door was very friendly and helped us find our way to restaurants, church and attractions. Thanks for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Hmm... Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: I arrived late on Thursday night, and checked in. Because our vehicle was 2'' too tall, they had to park it in a remote parking lot. We had a dive trip planned for the next morning and they couldn't find our vehicle, which made us late for the dive trip. Nothing like riding 6' waves right after the McDonald's drive thru!!! Next day, the same thing happened, where they mismarked our key tag with the wrong color, so from that point forward, we had to remotely park our vehicle and some times had to pay through the nose to park on the street. I was there to run a triathlon, so the night before, I went to bed somewhat early, and kept hearing what appeared to be loud voices, but I couldn't pinpoint them. A call to the front desk seemed to resolve the issue until about 2:00 A.M. when I heard the voices start back up. I finally woke up at 4:00 AM to take a shower and the voices were still going with vulgar words being dropped every other sentence. As it turns out, when I left my room, directly below my room was a maintenance room and two workers were hanging out and appeared to be drunk. I asked the front desk about it and where the manager was and they said that the manager was at the other property. I asked if the manager was on property that night and the front desk worker said that he only comes over if there is a problem. Housekeeping was average at best. When making my bed, one of the housekeepers broke my charger for my phone, and left it on the ground behind the bed. They were very stingy with soap and shampoo, requiring us to make a trip to the front desk to acquire more soap and shampoo. Beds were soft and getting to sleep was easy when there weren't workers making a bunch of noise. The coffee machines in the rooms are nice, as you can make Starbucks quality espressos very quickly (this is the only reason I gave my review two dots instead of one). One nice feature is the fact that they will give you toothbrush and shaving creme if you forget yours. I went down to the gift shop to buy a toothbrush and the front desk clerk gave me a little bag with a razor, shaving creme, toothbrush and tooth paste. Overall, I was disappointed in the hotel and wouldn't stay there again, unless I got a super deal. The sister property seemed a little nicer, but I can't imagine it is better managed.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: KMcH
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights here with HHonors points & were upgraded to a lovely suite with view of pool & sea. From the minute we checked in, I realised that leaving was going to be difficult & it really was. We were very close to cancelling our next hotel in Miami & staying in Key West (it was only the non-refundable rate in Miami that made us keep to our original plan!) The smallish pool area & beach were beautiful, the staff very pleasant and the location good, close to the Southernmost Point & the end of Duval, near to a few cafes and restaurants. We wandered over to the Casa Marina for a walk on the beach & a drink but were pleased we had chosen the Reach as it seemed a bit smaller and more exclusive. Minor niggles; our bed creaked a lot (.... even when just turning over in the night!), bathroom extractor fan was ridiculously loud, and yes, an occasional shuttle to Mallory Square as others have suggested would be a really nice idea as it could be quite a walk especially when done for the 2nd time in a day. Would highly recommend Southernmost Beach Cafe, a few mins walk from the hotel, see the Key West restaurant reviews. Their Happy Hour is so good.... $3 drinks & appetisers....dangerous really!!

Reviews.Title: “There are better options in Key West than this resort.”
Reviews.Author: jenjen10579
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, and it's location is at the quiet, sleepy, romantic, residential- end of Duval Street, which is nice...and that's where the positive review of this hotel ends. We frequent Key West often and chose The Reach once because of its location and claims to be more adult oriented than its sister property, The Cass Marina. The service, from the front desk staff to the outdoor drink service, was terrible and the employees were horribly rude. There were kids EVERYWHERE, and the cleaning staff continually knocked on our door for cleaning, beginning at 8a, despite our tag indicating we wished not to be disturbed. Once they did stop knocking, their noise in the hallway prevented any further attempt at falling asleep. The way the outdoor hallways are designed causes even the slightest noise to be magnified making all the rooms very noisy. At this price level in Key West, there are much better options that include breakfast and/or wine and cheese receptions, and are closer to the heartbeat of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AyannaFlorida
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. On the water. Very small beach but in Key West, this is not unusual. Too cool for us to use the pool or beach, but a very nice gazebo pier. We had a room with a balcony and a view of the water and it was very nice. There were people opening the doors as you approached and left. Delicious apples just inside the lobby. Well appointed, original rooms. There was a small flat screen. I liked it. A lot farther from Mallory Square than I thought, but doable. It was about a 25 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great weekend at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: behindtimes
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Th Reach in Key West; booked there as it was one of the host hotels for the Key West Triathlon...better than the main hotel for the race as it was not at the finish line but just a short walk away and "miles" from the crowd. Within walking distance to Duval St but, again, "miles" from that crowd. We relaxed on the beach and were taken care of by Ricardo and Ivan. Ricardo was entertaining and steered us in the right direction (up to a quiet balcony) to catch the sunset. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at The Reach!!”
Reviews.Author: Robin F
Reviews.Content: Everything and Everyone at The Reach was just Perfect! Ricardo, Ivan, and Chris took care of our every need on the beach and at the Pool. Our room was beautiful and so nice. The high end soft sheets on the bed felt so nice after a day soaking up the sun on the beach! Thanks so much for making our first trip to Key West the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location”
Reviews.Author: JaeBee2010
Reviews.Content: This is the only hotel in Key West with a beach. The location is one block from Duval St, at the quiet end. It is a one mile walk up Duval to the busier end. Personally, I liked being where it was quiet and walking the several blocks, but I am sure this will be a turn-off to lazier folks. Beach and pool service is wonderful, and the staff hands out ice pops during the afternoon. I stayed in a boutique suite, which had a sitting area and a small kitchen area with a refrigerator and coffee maker. My only complaint was that I was in a room near the entrance and could hear vehicles beep as they backed up in the driveway.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Elwood_Italia
Reviews.Content: What a place! After a drive from Miami, which is already worth the journey, getting to a hotel like the The Reach Resort was truly rewarding. We only had two days at Key West, and we almost didn't want to leave the hotel during the day for how great it was. The location compared to the city centre has it's pro and cons. The pros is that it is quiet, and not bustling. The cons is that it can take 15 minutes to walk to the main square, but for us this was not an issue as Key West is such a small place in the first place, walking was not a problem for us. A very kind gentleman at the front desk upgraded our room which was bigger and had a sea view. The beach had a nice private pier which at night was very suggestive for a pre/post dinner walk. The restaurant offered a fantastic view of the distant thunderstorms in the Atlantic ocean, and the key lime pie was superb. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of taking a trip down to Key West. Only downside was having to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation and Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: NewMrsEC
Reviews.Content: My family and I attended a wedding and had a vacation at the Reach Resort. Everything was excellent! The wedding was beautiful and everyone had a great time! From the romantic views on the pier to the sunset on the roof area at the reception, everything is just beautiful! There are a few key employees I'd like to mention that made our stay at the resort extra special. Chuck the bell attendent was extremely nice and friendly. He greeted us the moment we arrived out of our taxi and was very helpful in taking care of all our luggage and making sure it arrived at our rooms. He also was there the day we left the resort and he was still just as helpful and friendly as when we arrived. Ricardo and Chuck are excellent. They were there to take care of our entire family every day at the beach and pool area. They made sure we had reserved chairs and towels with excellent beach location right in the front row. And let me tell you we had about 30 family members each day at the beach! They were always checking on our group and making sure that if there was anything we needed, they would take care of us. I highly recommend the Reach Resort to anyone interested in vacationing in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “A nice Double Tree, no where near a Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: pegsu
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment. Starting at check in, when our two rooms booked together could NOT have been farther apart. When we arrived at the second room, it was horrid. This was purchased not as a minimum catagory but as a Tropical Courtyard (a joke, the views were of a parking lot and a private home, but of course you couldn't sit on the balcony anyway due to the ENORMOUS air conditioner right next to his room and balcony). They were sold out, so I asked the front desk to please keep us in mind to switch when something else came available. He just kept saying I should check back, and I would then repeat, can you please make a notation in the resv that we want to switch, please let us know when something opens. We NEVER heard a word. My husband has a gold vip memebership with Hilton, which usually means they treat us really well. Nothing at this hotel. The walkways to the rooms are painted cement instead of tile, it looks so tacky. We were put in a "one bedroom suite" that is so oddly configuired, you have no privacy in the bathroom. When using it, you have to ask your partner to stay in either the bedroom or living space but they have to pass through the bathroom to get between rooms or the closet, very awkward. The rug and couch were stained and there is only one phone (wierd). We sat at the beach twice and didn't get very good service, having to ask for bar service both days. One day, they were short on towels so we could only get one small one apiece, (tho I noticed when they did get more, others were being seated with two or three, but he never came back to us, even tho we tipped him $5) Little things, like entering the lobby, the deskclerks would be chatting, never even acknowledging us. Small thing but seemed to be the feeling from everyone. We did visit the Casa Marina, and loved the pool and beach facilities there and would consider staying there next visit. We have stayed at the Hyatt and Casa before. The few saving graces were, the beds, linens and pillows were great and it's a short walk to Duval. The espresso maker in the room was also nice. Again, if it would have been a Double Tree, (and priced like one) we would have had more reasonable expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marluci
Reviews.Content: We'll be checking out tomorrow...After never having been here before we weren't sure what to expect but this far surpassed everything we could have hoped for..The Reach had it's own private beach..We were catered to by a totally awesome attendant, Brandon, who engaged us in many conversations, always made sure we weren't without anything and made us feel important during out stay...The Reach Hotel itself was immaculate, all workers there always with a smile or a friendly hello.. Our walk to Duval was minutes..and every day and night we walked the entire Duval Street, shopped, drank, ate, saw beautiful sunsets and many oddities. We can't wait to come back here and will definitely stay at the Reach again...Our only criticism would be that there were no dressers in the bedroom but there was plenty of space to unpack our bags in the cabinet under the TV and under the night stands and closet. Just a note for anyone wanting to stay here...This is the quieter end of Duval but after being out all day and night it was a welcomed place to come to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Kathy H
Reviews.Content: Our 3rd stay at the Reach Resort and we'll be back! Great location and amenities. In a quiet area but still within easy walking distance of the main street, terrific restaurants and sister hotel Casa Marina. Nicely maintained pool and beach. Awesome roof area for enjoying sunset views. Perfect destination for a relaxing couples getaway.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach Resort is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TWA1979
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The Reach resort on Key West is amazing! We arrived on Sunday, November 27th for a four- day 30th wedding anniversary get-a-away from New York. We found paradise. Had I known how well we were going to be pampered by the staff, we would have certainly planned on staying longer. We met Mariya at the front desk as we checked in. She was professional, polite, eager to assist us and seemed genuinely happy to meet us. At the pool each day Ricardo and Chad were never more than a few steps away. They always made sure we had clean and dry towels, and walked around the pool each day with complimentary fresh fruit and frozen popsicles. General Manager Kasha Nowak was always available to assist guests. She was extremely courteous, helpful and eager to answer questions. Cindy and Kevin at the front desk were always available to offer advice as to the best places to eat, as was the doormen. Housekeeping made our bed two times daily and each time left chocolates for us. We had the pleasure of meeting Jimbo, who was one of the painters and provided us with invaluable local history and interesting facts about Key West. The staff at the Reach were all gracious hosts and ambassadors to one of the most charming and fascinating locations we have ever visited. Each and every staff member went out of their way to make us feel special and as if we were the most important guests staying at the resort. The resort is located just a block from Duval Street, the heart and soul of Key West. The Reach is meticulously maintained, intimate, and provides a very and accommodating and warm ambiance. Staying at the Reach was an absolutely wonderful experience that we look forward to repeating for many years. I highly recommend the Reach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Short but amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Littleskatersmom
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West before, I had no idea what to expect. After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was a bit nervous about what to expect. Only stayed 2 nights, but wish we could have stayed much longer! Went with our only goal being to lay on the beach and not have to think... Goal accomplished! Service on the beach was wonderful. Room was great, beds very comfortable. If I could change anything, I would ask that the housekeeping service learn patience... At turn down time, she would knock 3 times before we could get to the door! Had a snafu with reservations (at this point, looks like I screwed up), front desk was amazing! Valet/bell stand super helpful. Already planning return. Asked my daughter if she wanted to try Casa Marina, no.... Reach is her choice too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKiwi
Reviews.Content: The reach is right on the beach, and a short walk to Duval Street with all it's stores, restaurants and bars. The room was clean and quiet, overlooking the courtyard - enjoyed a cup of coffee while reading the paper on the balcony each morning and watching the hotel come to life. The access to their sister resort, Casa Marina, is also an bonus. If I returned to Key West I'd stay at either of the two resorts again.

Reviews.Title: “best spot in key west”
Reviews.Author: oldrivertrucks
Reviews.Content: great location, service is excellent. Especially Ricardo Chad as a beach attendant

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with an amazing view!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ani J
Reviews.Content: Great resort located right next to the ocean with its all private beach. The service is great, concierge very helpful, pool staff helps set you up at the beach with lounge chairs and fresh towels. The resort is clean and located just a block away from the bustling Duval Street and a few blocks from the Southernmost Point. The restaurant 'Strip House' in the resort has a great outdoor dining deck facing the ocean. The food is a bit expensive and there arent too many vegetarian options. Their garlic fries are delicious. The pool area is kind of small and gets full pretty quickly. So if you want a seat near the pool, come a bit early. The pool itself is very small and with kids playing in the pool, it gets a bit crowded. The only complaint I have is about their Spa. The Spa is located at their sister properly - Casa Marina. When the concierge was booking our appointment, she didn't inform us that its not an actual spa, but a setup in a suite. Also - we assumed we would get two female massage therapists, but were surprised to see a male and female therapist. Since there was no one else available, we had to make peace with that. When making a spa appointment, I strongly recommend specifying the gender of the therapist you want. Otherwise, you will dish out a good $150 for a therapist you don't feel comfortable with. Overall - its was worth the money we spent and we would love to come back and stay here. Hopefully, we will get a room with a better view then (this time it was facing a parking lot)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Don D
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this hotel are wonderful and the staff could not have been nicer (special thanks to Ricardo and Chad at the pool and beach)! Highly recommend the Jet Ski tour around the island - a bit pricely but had a blast! The location is great and everything is in walking distance - once you get here there's no need for a car. If you want to go somewhere a bit farther rent a scooter or better yet a bike. Great stay and can't wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great b aware of the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Thomas L
Reviews.Content: The room (409) is very noisy due to the proximity of the central air unit. We will ask to be moved tomorrow. Let's see what they come up with. B aware of the restaurant it is not worth it I had a veal chop which was charcoaled and the waiter still tried to tell me that it was supposed to be that way. What a joke. The lobster bisque was ok but nothing special a little bland and to creamy and the lobster taste was far far away. Well after the veal fiasco i had some shrimp linguine and guess waht the shrimp had a frozen taste to it i could not eat it all. It was also very pricy for what was offered. One appetizer one glass of wine and two entrees for $110.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: RockyRaccoon
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach. Very clean, Nice pool area. Easy walking distance to tons of restaurants and Duval Street. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Masterschamp
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviewers, my wife and I agree that this hotel does not live up to the reputation and expectations of a Waldorf Astoria (Hiltonâ€™s premier hotel) and should more realistically be re-named a Hampton Inn. Although the rates are generally in line with the other â€œhigh endâ€� (whatever that means in Key West?) hotels, the room, furniture, and bed is not. In our case, the picture and description of the exact room in their online web site was not the way it was. When brought to the attention of the Rooms Manager (after we checked out) she apologized with the explanation that the room was â€œdeep cleanedâ€� (?) and the sleeper sofa along with other items were never put back (oops!). It was quite obvious some type of cleaning was performed since the chairs were still damp and required us to put a sheet over them. Be sure to review the list of room amenities and make sure all those pieces of furniture, etc. are there â€œas advertisedâ€� when you enter. Their daily resort fee and costly pay for parking increases the rate significantly, but does nothing to increase the quality of service or amenities. This first rate hotel chain does not even have a courtesy van or shuttle so all local transportation on this small parcel of land is at your expense by taxi. If you like the hotel doors opened for you, need to have your bed sheets turned down at night, and require that 2 pieces of miniature chocolate be placed on your bed then this is the place for you. Be prepared to pay for those simple pleasures. Although we have no plans to return, but if we did there are lots of nice hotels for half the price. We did receive some compensation but nothing for the room that was not â€œas advertisedâ€�. Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation to Key West”
Reviews.Author: Marlene P
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at The Reach. Rooms were quite nice and the staff was very friendly, particularly the staff at the pool (Ricardo and Chad) who were wonderful. Great workout room. Location was good. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Meagan B
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Reach for the first time, and it well worth it. The staff is is so friendly, and helpful. I had even forgotten my key, and they didn't even get upset I walked though the lobby soak and wet. The people who greet you when you arrive are so wonderful and friendly. We really got to know the people at the Strip House, Teresa and Dan, they were terrific. My room was clean, and very classy. I could see the beach from my room. I will stay here again, on my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: mactravelBoston
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location and pool. Views of the water were great. The location to duval is great. Walking distance to everything. The staff was fantastic. Hilton honors members are treated like gold. The price was great. I would choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Recent trip to The Reach”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth visit to The Reach. As usual, everything met or exceeded our expectations. The property was beautiful and well maintained, the rooms were nicely decorated, white-glove clean and well stocked with Nepresso coffee, water, nice toiletries, flat screen TV and iPod docking station among other things. Check-in is always swift and friendly and they remeber if you have stayed there previously. The staff always opens the front door for you and asks if you need anything. The pool and beach are among the best on the island. The staff is attentive and friendly, especially Ricardo and Chad. I will visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel, service & location!”
Reviews.Author: NickyB77
Reviews.Content: Just went to Key West for the first time & stayed at The Reach by Waldorf Astoria. We upgraded to a suite which had a great view of the pool, courtyard and ocean. The staff was very friendly and helpful- especially Chad and Ricardo! The jetski tour was well worth the money! Our guides were super cool- Gage & Nick! A great location because you can walk to all the bars & restaurants on Duvall St. The only thing missing was a hotel bar- but hop over to the Casa Marina & you can charge it to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience overall”
Reviews.Author: Sorella3
Reviews.Content: Just left a fabulous vacation at The Reach! The rooms were nice as well as the rest of the property. My sister and I really enjoyed the beach/poolside service provided by the friendly staff. Chad and Ricardo took great care of us! Loved the fresh fruit delivered right to our side. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Gallupjudy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of a conference in the facility. It's on the opposite end of the action in Key West. The guys at the front door were the friendliest of the staff. The rest were indifferent. The hotel room modest with a 2 chair balcony overlookig the garage and garbage. But it was comfortable and clean. The beach was awesome. Didn't try the restaurant based on reviews. We agree it is hardly worth calling Waldorf property. Oh and the room price is just the beginning of what it really costs..$450 for 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Milestone birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at your property on Nov 4-7th. This was my first time at this property what a superb experience! The staff picked up on a comment from my brother that it was my 50th birthday. When we arrived back at the room chilled champagne awaited snacks and balloons. We used this to toast the distribution of my younger brother ashes who recently died in a tragic car accident. I plan to come back very soon and will tell my friends and family about how I was treated like a king by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Stay !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Flashrabbit
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed at The Reach from November 7-14. Overall, our stay was wonderful. I had used Tripadvisor to explore hotels in the area. I was surprised to find negative reviews of The Reach. I enjoyed my stay. I found the staff friendly and helpful. The pool and beach staff were fantastic. My view of the ocean was as orderd. My only complaint, and it is small, is the cleanliness of the rooms. My spouse and I found the walk to Duval minor and a perfect workout. I had a great time and would recommend this hotel. My plans are to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “I am a VERY positive person but...”
Reviews.Author: Keylimeone
Reviews.Content: We booked a Presidential Suite. At 575 square feet the room seemed small. Poorly decorated, like something I might see at a Hampton Inn. The sofa bed was dirty let alone a lumpy sofa bed mattress. So we had a sofa bed, small round table with two chairs, a small refrigerator and sink/wetbar with a large dresser like cabinet. The master had a king bed with a dresser & one nightstand. We had a TV on each living area. The tile floor would get so filthy that I would wash it by hand several times a day. If not our feet would be black. At every turn I had to constantly ask for coffee service, water glasses, water, dusting and towels. It seemed the longer we stayed the worse the service became. We were there for 5 LONG days. Somehow a heirloom afghan came up missing. I was told that all of the laundry went to Miami, that was 3 days ago. No one knew and yes housekeeping & management would call Miami, note my account and as I am driving home my request for the manager to call me has not happened. My 96 year young Mother and I woke up to bites on our wrists and ankles this morning. When I told the front desk all that was said was an apology. I guess I'll call the Hotel again...

Reviews.Title: “The Reach in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BeaulieB
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very nice, especially Caroline, Ricardo and Chad!! Our stay was for 3 nights and our room was serviced to our expectations, fresh linens and towels everyday. The room was spacious and had a veiw of the water just as requested. We enjoyed our stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!!”
Reviews.Author: jdp968
Reviews.Content: Nice location, convenient to most activities and attractions. Beach area was super clean. Spacious, clean rooms with all the extras. We would defenatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brandon and Chad are awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loveukeys
Reviews.Content: We were going to leave this place because we very unhappy with room but Brandon changed are mind.Chad and Brandon were very funny and pointed us to alot of places we did not even know about. This was are third time to key west and did not know that there were so many places to eat so close to where we were staying this trip was the best one yet and will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Pina colada in my life, ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bacchus2202
Reviews.Content: That was our first time at Key West on monday 7th of november at 4:30 pm, a wonderfull day at the beach, very nice jet ski time.......but when we arrived at the resort pool, that was horrible, the waiter snub us.... we ordered THE famous pina colada ( my wife favorite cocktail), they arrived in the plastic cup ( Why not at the pool is correct) with marrasquin sherry, but orange slice????? and whitout a pina slice???? And what about the bill, 18% gratuity included!?!? After the first insipid sip, my wife decided to talk to the waiter about the wrong taste or the wrong recipe.... he said `` Sorry, I m going to make it myself ``. Ten minutes after we receipt the others, with just a straw and approximatly 4 onces of rum on the bottom (that was not a question of rum!!!!!!). That was a really joke!!!! We decided to let the fourth fully glasses on the table and to get off in a huff!!! My wife and i working in the hospitality industry as sommelier and manager in MontrÃ©al ! And that was our honey moon...... This hotel has been rated four stars by AAA......???

Reviews.Title: “Mariha”
Reviews.Author: vahhi
Reviews.Content: The front desk service is excellent. Mariha attended to my every wish. She is an exceptional asset to the Resort! The whole Team was Great.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated - Not worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: johnmi55
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been rated 4 stars by AAA and received good rating so I thought this would be nice for the 1st time to Key West. We stayed 11/5/11 for (2) nights. Location good but a poor value. Room not cleaned until 4:10 PM the second day ( which we declined after all day of site seeing). Parking is $15 / day self park which after being at the Key's is a bargain overall. Room was small and the bathroom was need of repair. Depending on location it can be very noisy to parking lot and street noise. Faucet loose and the caulking eroding. I would look else where if I was spending $250 / night.

Reviews.Title: “KUDOS to Ricardo at the pool/beach!”
Reviews.Author: PhillyPENN
Reviews.Content: Average service overall but Ricardo was the best! He made our visit to the pool/beach enjoyable with his great smile and excellent customer service. Thanks Ricardo!!

Reviews.Title: “Plans changed, No Problem!”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: I had friends playing at the Ultimate Frisbee National Championships in Sarasota the weekend before Halloween and an invitation to a friend's place in West Palm Beach (he lives in CT, this was his 2nd home) the day after Halloween (Tuesday). With a day and a half to "fill" I decided I'd take the drive and go to Key West for Halloween. A friend recommended The Reach, and I had a great time partying in Key West that night (I went as a pimp and my friend went as Jerry Garcia!). However, the next day I found out that the storm in the Northeast and the loss of power there had forced my CT friend to delay his arrival in Florida. Granted, there's worse spots to be "stuck" in than Key West, but I became worried about having to "scramble". I needn't had worried. The woman who helped me wasn't just interested in extending my stay, she was interested in making sure I got to see some of the best of Key West. So, I went on a Glassbottom Boat sunset cruise, a quirky, fun bike tour with a New Jerseyan who had arrived some 30 years earlier and never left, and she told me where to go to get the most amazing sushi and best Key Lime pie I ever had in my life. (Her name was Maria Bennett, and she was a delight to have on my side!) When I wanted to relax around the hotel I'd go out to The Reach's (private) beach area. My favorite part was the gazebo out at the end of the little pier they have there. Beautiful out there, and so peaceful. The room was fine, give me Wifi and I'm good. And if you go to the hotel's breakfast buffet, load up on the French Toast. (I wish I could have some right now!)

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Beach”
Reviews.Author: pat r
Reviews.Content: If someone asked me what I liked best about my stay..it would have to be the service and pampering my friends and I recieved at the pool and on the beach. We have stayed at 5 star hotels in Miami and Fort Lauderdale and Ricardo was by far the most attentive! Always with a smile, and a little story. Ricardo is certainly an asset to this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pool and beach area”
Reviews.Author: donna c
Reviews.Content: Ricardo, at the pool and beach area, was very professional and really made our stay very enjoyable! He always set up our chairs with wonderful towels and made sure we were comfortable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in their sister hotel, Casa Marina.”
Reviews.Author: LdeS
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, lacking atmosphere, however with a nice small beach. 18% service charge in Restuarant. Nearby sister resort Casa Marina has much more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigKat1616
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reach mid October. The pool and beach are very nice dispite the fact that it poured all weekend. The rooms are adequate although I did not care for exterior hallways entrance to the rooms and the balconies are very small and not private at all. This Hotel is away from the busier side of Deval Street which can have its positives and negatives. All in all a nice stay and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - Thank you CINDY!”
Reviews.Author: cuzinit625
Reviews.Content: Cindy made our stay exceptional! Thank you Cindy!! She went above and beyond to accomodate our group of 8, who were celebrating a 40th birthday and an anniversary. We've stayed at both the Casa Marina and the REach now on HiltonHonors points, and by far the Reach exceeded the Casa Marina in terms of personal service and accomodations. If it's between the 2, go with the Reach. You'll get personalized service and larger rooms. We had 2 minor complaints though....the price for drinks at the pool were outrageous. There's no real 'pool bar', but pool-wait staff, which was limited at best. Also, it would be nice if the hotel had a shuttle. It's kind of a hike to get to the Mallory square/downtown area. When asked about a shuttle, we were told they did have one...but come to find out, it was really just a taxi. A shuttle driver could've made a fortune in tips off our group because the walk got really old going back and forth. All in all, a great vacation though! One of the few hotels in KW that has a beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Underrated”
Reviews.Author: Betsy612
Reviews.Content: I dont get the low rating of this hotel. Location is perfect! Close but not too close. Service is above average. It's clean with a beach. We have stayed here twice and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent time at the Reach, the service was great throughout the hotel. The beach and the service was super; special thanks to Brandon and Chad for awesome service. Loved the favored water. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach Ammenities, but you pay for it”
Reviews.Author: Kendra D
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel while sitting in the Key West Airport based off the fact that it had so many beach activities on site. The one downside was that these activities were not technically free as there is a $25/night activity fee. We spent many hours sitting both on the beach and at the pool under an umbrella enjoying the sunshine. Every day they come out with Popsicles, frozen towels and fresh fruit at particular times and from 4-6 there is a fresh lime/mint spritzer in the lobby which is quite yummy. This hotel is a couple blocks from Duvall street; however, it is on the calmer end of the street, and is about a 10-15 minute walk to all the bars and activities. Being from Seattle I do need my daily coffee so it was nice to have a nescafe machine in the room. :)

Reviews.Title: “awesome anniversary in key west”
Reviews.Author: Kelsey R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 25th wedding anniversary at the Reach which was absolutely beautiful. Our room was overlooking the ocean, private beach the staff here was very accomadating, everyone made you feel comfortable. I cant wait to return and when I do i will stay at this hotel even the location was perfect. Thank you for a great memory.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we transferred to the Reach from Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: travelinsomewhere
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Casa Marina and arrived at 4:30pm - check in time is 3pm. Our room was not ready whch we thought strange given our arrival time. We had woken up at 3:30am to catch an early flight then drove all the way down to Key West from Ft Lauderdale, so we were beyond exhaused and looking forward to a nap, only to be told our room would not be ready for at least 2 more hours. I was exceptionally polite hoping for a room and explained that we really needed a room now, asked for other options, even paying for an upgrade and were told no rooms were available but the clerk left for a minute and came back wth good news, a room was available and gave us a key. We opened the door and were shocked to find a half a room, diagonally cut in half, so small the bed was pushed up against the wall without a night stand and there was no walking space,no closet space - never saw anything like it - ever!! We should have been told that - perhaps they were tyring to accomodate us but they should have explained/offered it as a temporary accomodation. We decided to take that nap and deal with the issue when we awoke but 20 mins into the nap, phone rings and wakes us up - it is the quality assurance manager asking how our check in was and how our room is. I took the opportunity to be honest and politely explained our frustration still hoping they would do something - and was told to come to the front desk to get a key to 'preview a room that was not ready yet', strange I thought! Upon entering the room it was obvious that something had happened as the loveseat was soaking wet, there were fans pointed at it and a odor eliminator machine running. So now I understood why our original room was not ready! ...and why bit would be a few more hours! Not wlling to take a chance that the sofa would be dry in 2 hours (I would never be able to sit on it knowing) or that the odor would be gone, we went back down to the front desk to express our dissatisfaction and were given absolutely no options or appologies. Finally I took my smart phone and stazrted looking for other hotels when it occured to me their sister property The Reach was around the corner - so I suggested a possible transfer and was told initially told no (worst front desk expereince ever and this is the Waldorf!) until I insisted to be accomodated. We were told to go to Reach to preview their rooms. When we arrived it was an instant change in attitude and energy, the manager was welcoming and accomodating and gave us three room keys, we chose an oceanfront room on a high floor with a fantastic view!! We were sincerely welcomed everytime we walked into the hotel. While the pool area was not as expansive as Casa Marina, the rooms we saw were far better than Casa Marina, and every staff member was great. They have a private beach - a rarely in Key West with beach attendants who were very accomodating. I would choose this place over Casa Marina any day!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: anyaandpasquale
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, quiet and relaxing. It is perfect location for whatever you want to do. Brandon and Chad took care of us on the beach. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Time In Key West”
Reviews.Author: ErinNJ1
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and my 3 year old stayed here at The Reach. Its a beautiful resort. I appreciate the location because I was with my son, which is kid friendly. The Reach has its own private beach, which not too many hotels here have. Its a walk from where the action really is, but its not bad. I would definiately stay here again for my sons sake. If my husband and I came alone, I probably would stay on the other side of the island. Only for the excitement & night life.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, pleasant, great location”
Reviews.Author: Melimax97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and had a great time. The room was very nice, and they upgraded me to a courtyard traditional room. The only thing I would change is that I had a corner room, and from my balcony, I could see into my neighbor's room, and vice versa....this is due to the fact that the separations between the balconies are see-through slats. Ask not to be on an inside corner..... The beach and pool amenities are more spacious at the sister resort, Casa Marina, which Reach guests may use. I might opt to stay there next time since they are a similar price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Erachal
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 2 year Anniversary down in Key West and chose the Reach due to 2 reasons - One, it was part of the Hilton Honors and Two, it was the Waldorf Astoria. While checking on line for rooms and using my Hilton Honors points, we found that we could get a much larger room with fewer points by choosing a boutique room. We were very pleasantly surprised upon arrival. First of all, 2 days prior to arrival, i received an email asking what time we planned to arrive. When we arrived, we were greeted by a great bell staff and great staff at the front dest. When we got to the room we found that we were upgraded and that we had balloons in our room for our anniversary and a bottle of champagne, the bellman showed us all of the amenities and then left us to enjoy our room. It was absoulutely gorgeous. The view was a partial view of the water - great, spacious room - i truly couldn't have asked for more. Great trip, hotel was only a block from Duval - made for a nice walk after we stuffed ourselves on great food on Duval. I would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A fantistic place to rest.”
Reviews.Author: TheRegionalManager
Reviews.Content: I have to be fair, I stay in Hilton family hotels about 200 nights a year and so I basicly stay here for free. When you stay at Great hotels using free night certificates you kind of expect to end up in some out of the way basic room, but not at The Reach. This was the second time at The Reach and once again they out did them selves by putting me in a fantastic full one bedroom ocean view suite. Whow! When you work hard, you expect to play hard. You have a choice of doing or not at The Reach as they have all kinds of watercraft or you can just sack out at the wonderful pool or beach and let the great staff, including Ricardo and Chad, pamper you. I highly recomend The Reach as the staff, food, rooms and service are all excellent and only one short block from Duval Street, the Key West Strip. To all of you at The Reach, I thank for another wonderful weekend. The VIP Hilton Millionaire.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property”
Reviews.Author: Cynanne
Reviews.Content: We went here to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The resort is lovely, very well kept, nicely appointed rooms! Great black out curtains to let you sleep late. Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not blown away”
Reviews.Author: travels2eatfromVA
Reviews.Content: To be fair, we used priceline to find the room so we didnâ€™t pick the hotel. We were travelling with 3 people and called after we got the room to make sure we had 2 beds and they said it would be no problem. We called again a couple days before we arrived and again they said it was no problem. When we arrived, we were told that it would not be possible to have a double due to a wedding there but they would upgrade us to a partial ocean view room with a king and a pull-out couch. (The person in front of us checking in was also unable to get 2 separate beds and was very unhappy.) The room would have been perfect for 2 people, but with 3 it was a little crowded and the sofa-bed wasn't very comfortable. Considering the hotel has a beach, it was surprising that there was no laundry facility on-site and the hours for their laundry service were not convenient. It also would have been nice if the bar in the room had a sink and microwave. There were no dresser drawers in the room, so we couldn't unpack (instead there are inconvenient shelves under the tv) and the only closet in the room was in the bathroom. During our stay the front desk staff weren't as attentive as they could have been and when we called down to the front desk twice to get information, they did not answer either time. Also, we tried to play pool on the pool table on the patio by the restaurant one evening but the lighting was very bad. We asked if they could turn on the light above the table and they said they would send someone out to fix it. They never came, so we left without ordering any food. The rooms were quiet and there are a couple of hammocks on the beach that were nice to lie in. The pool area was nice, but there was no hot tub. The place is pretty and does have a laid back atmosphere so if you can get a room with enough actual beds for your group and aren't staying for more than a couple days and don't mind average service from a hotel with that level of rating, this place may work for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Honeymoon Experience”
Reviews.Author: Gabe F
Reviews.Content: This was a very expensive hotel, which I gladly paid since it was our honeymoon. When you hear a "Waldorf Astoria Resort" you anticipate that you are going to get absolute top notch service. Lets start with the basics, for one, the second you get to your room, you have extreme dirtiness everywhere! Carpets stained from what looks like a "frat boy party" the all around room looked run down, the air filter was absolutly caked in dust, in the bathroom, the TP dispenser was hanging off the wall broken, the coffee machine didnt work and the showers were absolutely disgusting! This is NOT for no one no matter what reason why you go to key west, ESPECIALLY for 500 for 2 days. For that price I could have purchased a Presidential Suite somewhere else. So here is even the more interesting thing. They charge a whopping 25.00 PER DAY, resort fee!!!??? For what!!!??? Thier WI-FI didnt even work! Not only that! A 15.00 PER DAY parking fee!!!!! Basically for 2 days in a hell hole, I spent 600.00. Never EVER again will I ever resnt a room from this company or any waldorf Astoria resort again. You have trashed your own image of the waldorf Astroia name in my book and there will be several hundreds if not thousands of people that I hope see this prior to consider booking a room at your resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: sprees22
Reviews.Content: Our room was a little strange (no mirror outside of the bathroom, the closet + safe was inside the bathroom), but it was clean, roomy, and the bed was comfortable. Shared a room with 3 friends, so we took turns on the sofabed, which was not so comfortable. Layering the mattress with two duvets did help. Beach and poolside service were excellent. Ricardo and Chad were friendly and took excellent care of us, advising us how early we should arrive to get the best seats, and making a point to reserve excellent oceanfront chairs for us!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: Larry T
Reviews.Content: We went to The Reach to have a relaxing vacation and that is what we got. The hotel is beautiful with the best ocean views with their own beach. We had a garden view but to our surprise we also had a wonderful view of the ocean. The rooms are so large and like a mini sweet. The amenities were many. The staff was so friendly and made each person feel so special. Ricardo and Chad who are ocean side staff were the best. They made our stay even better than expected. Each day we were greeted with their happy faces and the best seats on the beach. We are already looking forward to our next vacation back at the Reach. The only down side was that they do not have a pool side bar/ restaurant. That might have been a bit more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: DT1973
Reviews.Content: My husband n I stayed here for our anniversary. Absolutely perfect location, close to everything. We had a corner oceanview room with a huge patio. The customer service from beach service to concierge to check in was fabulous. They were helpful, courteous, n they listened. Even delivered champagne n chocolate to our room based on an offhand comment about it being our anniversary. Only negative was the beach was a little small n tons if seaweed.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer C
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews are pretty accurate. I'm really glad we ended choosing this resort. The location was prime---beachfront access and minutes away from duval street. Our suite was spacious and the staff was very accommodating. While the front desk could be a little friendlier, we were well taken care of by Ricardo and Chad for poolside and beach service. Ricardo would make sure to set us up right by the ocean everyday. The service here really made our trip. They also provide nice perks such as popsicles and fresh, cold fruit at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional! From the moment we checked in until we left a week later there is nothing more we could have asked for. The oceanview room on the top floor was wonderful. The staff will do anything for you, at anytime. The refreshing lime water and or champagne in the afternoon is a nice touch as well. I read other reviews before we went regarding bad mattresses and no security locks on the doors and I found none of that to be true. Our room had a security lock, huge bathroom, the bed was a little soft for me, but that was fine. The restaurant had great food, breakfast, lunch and dinner and the pool was nice as well. The location is good too, being a couple blocks from Duval so quiet, but close enough to walk to shops.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in Key West for many years and have stayed at several different Hotels and B&B's. This property is one of the best. We stayed here years ago when it was a Wyndham Resort and loved the location so a few years ago we booked a stay when it became a WA Property and will never go anywhere else. We just came back from our 3rd stay here and was very happy to see that the level of excellence for this Hotel remains the same. Cindy checked us in and when we requested a room upgrade from a traditional King, she easily put us in an Ocean view Suite then had champagne brought to us at the front desk. Thanks Cindy!! As usual, the room was very clean, the bed was fantastic(love the sheets) and the Staff is awesome. Ricardo makes a day at the pool stress free and comfortable. He works hard to keep his guests happy and spoiled. Great job Ricardo! The sister property, The Casa Marina, is a quick walk away and beautiful. You have everything you need at either location....use both if you stay here. The Resort is close to Duvall Street but this side of it is chill so you can relax or walk down to the busy side of Duvall or Mallory Square to see the Sunset. Rent some bikes and enjoy this place.......See you next year!!! Thank you for another great vacation WA !!! Lisa & Tara NJ

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, horrible room and mattresses”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary D
Reviews.Content: We planned to celebrate our anniversary in key west and found some of the reviews of this hotel useful! We were so excited,when we checked in, it was around 9:30-10 pm and the front desk agent was very friendly and funny! I noticed he had appointed a completely different room then what was written on my card holder. When we arrived in the room I noticed it was nothing like it seemed on the website! The room was not ocean view like I reserved ! It did not have any of the furnishings like the pictures online, the bed was horrible! Any little move you make shakes the entire bed and makes the loudest most uncomfortable noise ever! I complained that same night! Only to find out that their were no more rooms available, the front desk agent told us that the manager would callus back in the morning to see what he could do! Well the morning came and went,no call from the manager, so I sent my husband to the front desk after our jet ski tour with "Barefoot Billy's" which is on site! Awesome by the way! They gave him a key to a suite, which we viewed together, yes it was a lot bigger then the original room that was assigned to us! But no view other then the guys playing poker..lol I decided to stay with our original room only because I did not feel like moving all our stuff, only to go back to the original room that smelled like there was a sewer leak! YUCK! We switched rooms ASAP! It was the same situation with the bed in the suite! If the GM reads this, please invest in new mattresses (posterpedic or stern and fosters) you have a jewel of a hotel, great location, friendly staff, but the mattresses really stink!!!! Very uncomfortable to sleep on!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: GalavantWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel. Just Great! We walked everywhere. It was a bit of walk to downtown but not hard to do.

Reviews.Title: “We were welcome and pampered. We highly recommend and hope to return.”
Reviews.Author: Marie K
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Private beach with soft white sand. Water activities at your fingertip. The pool and beach staff were phenominal. Ricardo, Brandon, Chad quickly learned our style. The restaurant was amazing also. The weather was sunny and hot and it seemed they wanted us to enjoy cool slushies, popsicles, fresh fruit - all at the right times and "on the house".

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay. Great customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Zdemsky
Reviews.Content: We had a great room with an excellent view. Staff was quite friendly and helpful. Luxurious place to stay with many extras. There we some extra fees I wish were built into the price. They charge an extra 25$ a day as a resort free and parking is another 15-20$ on top of that depending on if you use self park or valet. If you got the extra cash its worth the splurge. 1 block from Duval st. and 2 blocks from the southermost point.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lump Inc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during the last week of August. The room was very well appointed, clean and bed was very comfortable. The staff are very friendly. Atmosphere is very relaxing and pool is very well kept. This property has a private beach is a bonus. Upon arrival, we were surprised to find out that even on top of the room rate, there was a resort charge. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst resort in the keys...NEVER BOOK A WEDDING HERE”
Reviews.Author: jennifer b
Reviews.Content: My brother and sister in law had a wedding here this passed Labor Day weekend. They had guest fly from all over the country. They never read contracts, the hotel air conditioner did not work and they are NOT handicap accessible (i.e. their restaurant/ bars). They are totally inhospitable, and needless to say the bride left in tears and the groom also were visibly upset. For the price this resort charges, they are poorly understaffed and lack every bit of customer service. To close, the resort employees stole the gifts from the room in where the party was assigned to stay.....

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back, I come down to this hotel every year, this time,”
Reviews.Author: brian j
Reviews.Content: ricardo @ the pool area, his service was outstanding, the customer service was the best, i would recommend this hotel to anyone who travels to Ket West, FL, Rooms are great, outstanding view all directions.

Reviews.Title: “Do not visit!”
Reviews.Author: FroggayFroggay
Reviews.Content: We stay regularly at five star resorts all over the world and is resort compares porely to all of them. Additionally the service and facilities were little better than any cheap alternatives offered in the USA, such as holiday inns and la quintas. The staff was snooty and unhelpful. The maid and cleaning service didn't clear the dustbins, make the bed or give us shampoo. When this was brought to the attention to the staff, nothing was done. The bed was even missing a duvet, which we did not get until two nights in. Key west is an amazing place to be but the reach is not. We felt cheated out of our money and dissappointted.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria - Presidential Suite??? I Think Not”
Reviews.Author: Todd W
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Well let's start with the good. The bell staff/valet are very friendly and professional. Probably some of the best I have seen. Whoever trained/manages these folks needs to take a look at the rest of the staff. Front desk staff were also very good, but as you go farther into the hotel, it get's worse. The lobster tail at the restaurant was fantastic...perfectly prepared and the staff there get's an above average rating. Now for the bad. To begin, I needed to change the date of travel 2 days prior to arrival (most hotels require 24 hour notice), I was denied as this property has a 3-day cancellation policy. We came anyway, because I didn't want to lose one night at almost $800, even though we were unsure of the brewing tropical storm just west of the island and the forecast for storms the entire time. I booked the "Presidential Suite" and when we checked in, the front desk gave us our room number. I asked, is this the Presidential Suite? They smiled and said yes, all rooms go by numbers but this is the only Presidential Suite. I didn't understand then what seemed to be so funny, but clearly it was an inside joke...this is not the only Presidential Suite and it certainly isn't Presidential...nothing about it was Presidential, nor even a Suite other than it had 2 rooms (living and bedroom). The sofa was something that you would expect to see in a low end motel, complete with stains. There was nothing in the room but a mini-refrigerator that was empty. There was not even a bottle opener!! The king bed, which was comfortable, was too big for the room, but they did manage to squeeze in one nightstand. The televisions play the normal introductions that you see in high-end properties, with the latest selections of movies, etc. But when we couldn't get a movie and called downstairs, we were informed that they had discontinued this service. Really??? Waldorf Astoria???? All in all this room was what I would expect to see at a Clarion Suites or equivalent...not a Waldorf Astoria!! The only nice thing about the room was the balcony, which did have a nice view, but certainly not worth twice the cost of a their next room grade down. Then came the very strange moments. When we arrived for our 2-day stay, half of the beach (which is less than 100 yards long) was closed for a wedding party. The next evening we felt very awkward as we sat on our balcony and the wedding reception was directly below us. Awkward in that everyone was looking right at us as if to say, why are you there? Several times they would speak to our dogs, which were also on the balcony. It was just strange and not what you would expect from a Presidential Suite, which is normally somewhat secluded. I also didn't understand why the hotel wouldn't put us in the "Presidential Suite" directly above us, which would have at least offered some level of privacy from the event they must have had scheduled for sometime. I chalk this experience up to learning my lesson. Just because they say this is a Waldorf Astoria Presidential Suite, it doesn't mean Waldorf Astoria as most of us think of it, or Presidential as most of us would think of it!! KIMPTON, where are you when I need you???!!!! Given the comparable rates at this and other high-end properties on Key West, I thnk a fare rate for this room would be about $350, no more than $400/night. Finally a few points if you have never travelled to Key West. First, there are no real beaches. If you want a beach, go somewhere else, like Miami. , as with the other beaches on the island, but that was ok for me, as I have been to the keys before and was not really here for the beach. Also, do not trust your mapping software on this one...the drive may only be about 160 miles from Miami, but it is every bit of 4 hours, because much of it is 2-lane, 45mph and patrolled heavily. It is a pretty drive though and if you are not in a hurry, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “What a great setup! However”
Reviews.Author: ccech
Reviews.Content: Stay dates were July 28 & 29 of 2011 The Reach Resort is tucked back against the ocean on a back street. The pool area, The beach, The restaurant and gazebo are all in gulped and sheltered by the hotelâ€™s structure, against the ocean wrapping the other side. This made for a cozy and comfortable over all environment. The resort is clean and well kept. The valet was prompt and very respectful of me as a guest. The bell man was attentive to my arrival and settled me in my room down to filling my ice bucket. The room was a king and it was fresh, clean and well kept. I have been at a lot of beach hotels where the rooms are musty from the humidity and guests coming back to the room from the beach wet and sandy. Housekeeping must be doing a great job here. The pool area was clean and also well taken care of by the staff. There were only two problems. The beach was one. This was a nine day beach only vacation from the east side of Florida to the Keys and then to the Gulf. The beach had sea weed and roots washing up on the shore and you would have had to wade through it to get to the water. The water also seemed to be dirty. We did not get in the water. We also had to endure gas fumes. There was also exhaust from an ATV that was being used to move around wave runners going into the water. We moved up from the beach to the pool area. The other thing is this should have been a more adult atmosphere, but we had adults playing with a football and throwing it to kids across the pool so pretty much took over the pool. When the kids went to bed, the pool area at night was quiet and soothing to the mind. The pool temperature was perfect. I paid more than 300 to stay here. It was not worth that much. I selected it because in the Keys natural beaches are a premium. This hotel has a natural beach. There are better hotels and better beaches in the Gulf for a better price. When we travel, we travel for beaches. I wonâ€™t be going back to the Keys for beaches. The Westin has a small island off the Keys with a nice fine dining restaurant and some cottages. We did go out to the island for fine dining. The beach was clean and the water crystal clear. I would do that beach but the cottages cost per night is crazy, over 500. I will be reviewing the restaurant called Latitudes.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss A++”
Reviews.Author: allie a
Reviews.Content: Lets just say this was the best hotel EVER! it is beautiful and the staff is very professional. We stayed here for 7 nights during our honeymoon and we were treated like kings! The rooms are all updated and the pool and beach area were not to be matched. I must say that the Casa Marina is much larger and does offer a different type of stay, so do your research and see what fits you best. We went to the Casa Marina for an afternoon and got a massage, which was AWESOME. But DONT, LET ME SAYYYY DONT go to the "strip house" the restaurant in the Reach resort. Not only is it WAY over priced the food is aweful! Overall GREAT HOTEL. BEYOND ALL EXPECTATIONS.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars for the Service...but the Casa Marina is much better!”
Reviews.Author: LEGOROXY
Reviews.Content: We paid $375 including resort fees & taxes per night and were expecting the room to be like a typical "Waldorf-Astoria" hotel. We stayed in the Oceanfront Boutique Suite. The room was very disappointing. The carpets were old and worn, and the room was much smaller than we were expecting. It was very closed off & not open. Shower was small & the room was really just okay...NOT okay for a $375+ per night room. The balcony was nice & the view was beautiful. There is also not a beach bar. We would have loved pool service for drinks, but that was non-existent. We had to go in the restaurant bar for drinks...again...did not like this for a Waldorf-Astoria brand hotel. Brandon was helpful here & recommended some great restaurants. In addition, Brian the bellman/concierge was fantastic. Had our bags & cab ready for us 10 min ahead of time--now that is great service. My tip--book at their sister resort the Casa Marina. We were able to use their amenities as well when staying at the resort. The Casa is awesome! It has way better pools, a way bigger beach area (although rocky) & awesome drink service by the pool. We loved Ron--best server there! We also got amazing service from Scuba Steve & Steven while we were there. They took care of our every need! We loved the eucalyptus frozen towels, and the popsicles every day. The resort grounds were also much nicer than The Reach. In addition, the food menu at the Casa was much better--many more fresh options, salads, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: frdm2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend in May. The hotel was nice and very relaxing. The beach was beautiful and the staff took great care of us. The bedding was very nice and the size of the rooms was great. Would highly recommend The Reach!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Oved G
Reviews.Content: The service was great, from the day we arrived the staff was welcoming and helpful (even with a technology problem at check in)... Especially the Concierge service from Scuba Steve, Steve, Chad, Frania and Teresa, they rendered to us with a smile during our stay at the pool/beach area (The Reach/The Casa Marina Resorts) Except Ricardo he didn't acknowledge us!? The room was clean and ready for my wife and I to relax with no worries. The least I like was a $25.00 daily Resort fee and $15.00 self parking fee ( In my opinion the daily Rate/Taxes was enough to cover the services/amenities). Location was great for us, view, quiet (away from the loudness in the evening), and relaxing, walking distance to Duval St. and all the other attractions Key West offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Escobar652
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a blast! People are friendly and the service was great. The sunset at the end of duval street was spectacular. I really felt it was a "get away". We recommend the jet ski tour around the island that the hotel provided. Tyler was our guide and he made sure everyone was entertained and he was well informed about the island. He took us to the Gulf of Mexico and gave us a period of time to enjoy the jet ski. We also loved the private beach that the hotel hosts. The service was great. Steven and Tony who work at the h2o concierge which is located on the private beach provided us with towels, refreshments, & an umbrella to sit under while we can enjoy the wind that blows in. Ricardo told us a lot about the history of the island and he also told us a lot about water sporting event.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location on the beach”
Reviews.Author: CapeCouple
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is a laid-back elegant retreat, located at the opposite end of Simonton Street from Duvall Square. Therefore, it is quieter, more peaceful, and remote from the crazy frenzy that is Duvall every evening when the sun sets. Don't mistake this to mean that you shouldn't go there at least once to watch the sunset and the crowd. It only means that the other nights you can watch the same sunset from the quiet of the rooftop lounge with a cocktail and a loungechair. All of the major sights in old Key West are within walking distance and given the ample and wondrful selections of food available, walking in required to be able to fit into your plane seat for the tip home.

Reviews.Title: “We had a really good time at the Reach but still room for improvement !”
Reviews.Author: ZazafromMontreal
