Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at The Reach in August and really enjoyed the hotel, pool, beach, garden and room. It was very well maintained and overall quiet. The suite room is definitively what I would recommend. The pool water was terribly warm - somewhere in the 36C. The breakfast was so so, nothing particular, very basic. I was missing a bar for a cocktail, they have only one restaurant-bar which terrase is not very friendly. I learned reading previous reviews that staying at The Reach you can use the next door Casa Maria facilities and restaurant - nobody told us which was disappointing. Yes the hotel is bit far walking from Key West down town but on the other hand it is a calm location. Restaurant tip : you must try restaurant Blue Heaven in the middle of Key West - it is delicious and unique. Have fun !

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful, relaxing trip and will certainly return!”
Reviews.Author: Terri91090
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of The Reach Resort - it was at the opposite end of the island from Mallorey Square, away from all of the action. We were able to walk everywhere and did not need a car rental. The resort is very nice, was very clean and kept up. We had an awesome view of the ocean from our ocean view room. The pool/beach concierge team of Brandon, Tony, Steve, Cael and Ricardo were terrific!!! They were very helpful in recommending places to eat, arranged for our sunset cruise, and always set my husband and I up on the beach every morning in the perfect spot! Anything we needed, they were able to assist us. I especially enjoyed the popsicles at 2:00. Very refreshing! We will definitely visit Key West again and will certainly stay at The Reach Resort. This hotel also has a beach...not all hotels in Key West do. Another positive reason to stay here. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful also. Couldn't ask for a better vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Still nice but not as nice as last year”
Reviews.Author: sjsent01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year about a month later than this time. The hotel is still nice but shows a year of wear and tear compared to last year. We stayed in an ocean view suite which had a lovely, private balcony that we thoroughly enjoyed. The staff at the hotel couldn't of been nicer, friendlier or more helpful. The prices at the hotel are very steep considering you are staying at the hotel and paying a $25 a day resort fee; a cup of coffee cost $4.25 at the gift shop off the lobby and a frozen drink with a floater on top was $18, we didn't want to buy the bottle just a drink. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant due to the prices.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed. Far below our expectations for a highly rated resort.”
Reviews.Author: Labnut
Reviews.Content: We really expected something nicer - a nicer, larger room and nicer facilities overall. The Reach is obviously an older resort. During our stay, the water to all the rooms was cut off for several hours, which was pretty inconvenient if we wanted to use the rest room or shower off after a swim. The shower curtain rod fell down on me and had to be repaired. The parking valets left our car parked in front for so long we thought things would be stolen from it. The location was nice because of the beach, but inconvenient to restaurants, shops, and most of the fun stuff in Key West. Perhaps had we not expected something quite nice we wouldn't have been so disappointed. We will try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo, Cael and Tony made this stay amazing”
Reviews.Author: kelf428
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely decorated, right on the beach, great location, etc... Room was spacious and bed was super comfy. This is a nice hotel for both couples and families. When staying at The Reach we encountered the best pool staff ever. Every morning these three greet you with a smile and help you get set up for the day. My husband loves the shade, myself the sun, so finding the perfect spot is difficult but Ricardo helped. Any questions you have they will kindly answer about the town. When I told a fried where I was staying she said to tell Ricardo "Hello" I was shocked she knew who he was, but this is the type of memory they leave with you. You are greeted by fruit poolside, along with popsicles everyday, all of which is a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not quite waldorf standards. Lots of foreign guests.”
Reviews.Author: t7purch
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Very nice to go between the two properties. Great pool/beach view. Delicious pool food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Wait Staff”
Reviews.Author: RobertAndersonII
Reviews.Content: Fred and Tony were fabulous taking care of us at the Pool and Beach! It made our stay great!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: Templetons911
Reviews.Content: It took me a long time comparing Key West accommodations to finally choose The Reach. While we weren't unhappy, here is my summary of its good & bad points. Good: quiet, clean, relatively spacious room, nice bedding, pleasant staff, w/in walking distance of activities/restaurants (a rather LONG walk), away from the craziness of Duval Street, privileges @ their sister property Casa Marina. Bad: very small & crowded beach & pool area, no beach bar, minimal beach service, outside access to rooms, including no AC in the elevators (& when it's hot in Key West, it is boiling hot!), 4 pm check-in (doesn't seem to matter if you "check in" earlier, you can't get into your room until at least 4) & no easy way to change into cooler clothes and/or beach attire while you wait, no other restaurant besides Strip Club, which doesn't open till 8 AM (we had an early morning snorkel trip scheduled, and wanted just coffee/tea, juice, cereal...& could only get very limited items in the gift shop of all places!)...Their sister property Casa Marina feels much more spacious & has a far lovelier beachfront & bar. If we were staying longer, we would have definitely used those facilities more extensively. Perhaps The Reach relies too heavily on their guests using Casa Marina's property, which I'm sure doesn't go over well w/ Casa Marina's own guests! We were happy enough, but will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay at their sister property”
Reviews.Author: Eric_S_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice. However, our room was right next to the housekeeping storage area and it was VERY loud. The staff was nice and the pool/grounds were clean. The exception was all of the sea grass all over the beach. The walk is a bit far from the night life but it is doable. Casa Marina, their sister property, is right next to it and you can use all of those amenities as well. The pool is larger and it has a nice poolside bar and more beach space. Very friendly wait staff their as well. We are defietly going to be going back to Key West and next time it is the Casa Marina for us!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: gary k
Reviews.Content: Ricardo, Tony and Brandon at the pool were the BEST! They not only got Every thing we need but also told us about the island and great places to go! The best vacation we ever had and We Will Be Back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great!! No bar .”
Reviews.Author: ScienceHollywoodFl
Reviews.Content: The rooms and service were good. But there is no restaurant or bar at the pool. Surely you want a breakfast or lunch or pool drink in the Keys. There is an upscale restaurant, The Strip House, on the property. But they have a $25 breakfast buffet, that's all. Waiters do walk around the pool and offer drinks. but that is a $15 glass of white wine. You can visit their sister property Casa Marina. Spend the few extra bucks and stay there. Nice bar and lunch. However Barefoot Billy's Watersports on the premise has an excellent jet ski tour. Mike was a great tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe hotel and staff unfriendly....”
Reviews.Author: AureliaSC
Reviews.Content: Well - I will start off with the good items: the pool and ocean area. That was very nice. Good number of chairs. Bed and bedding both very nice. I stayed at this location for business. I am an honors member. This was no Waldorf Astoria. My room had problems. I had to call the desk several times, not one "I'm sorry" at all. Two employees came to my room - unrelated to the issues I was having. One knocked once and then just walked right in. NOT what you want when you are a female traveling alone. There are no chains on the doors or security latch, therefore employees can walk in at will, and that is not what I am looking for when I pick a hotel. I will be in the Keys for business often and I did not feel safe in this hotel therefore it will not be on my list of places to stay. The front desk employees were not friendly either. I must agree with other travelers on that point. My room was very late in getting ready, and I checked in early - about 2:30 or so. I was not pleased.

Reviews.Title: “"just o.k."”
Reviews.Author: HospitalRN
Reviews.Content: Check in was a bit frustrating. We were offered an up-grade, but were told that the room was not ready yet. We were early anyway so it was not big deal. The female clerk at the desk took my cell phone number and said she would call when the room was ready in about 30 minutes. We sat at the bar for two hours; I had 3 red stripe beers and shared a pizza with my other half. Without ever getting a phone call we returned to the front desk and this time a gentleman said it would be another 10-15 minutes. 30 more minutes went by and a different female clerk called us up to the desk and said that the room may need another hour to be cleaned at minimum and pressured us into not taking the upgrade and opting for a different room. With disappointment we did not take the upgrade since we were tired of just sitting around killing time. We stayed in room 343 classified at the â€œocean view boutique suite.â€� It was nice but not of superior quality. There were a lot of small issues such as the left mirror light in the bathroom did not work, the left side night table light did not work, large dead bug on living room window sill, balcony railing covered in pigeon poop and the internet was down on arrival and very slow in the room, lots of nicks, scuffs and sporadic areas of grime in the bathroom corners. Hotel wide issues existed as well. The ice maker on the floor was incredibly small. It ran out of ice after 3 ice buckets were used to fill a tiny cooler, the beach was fair but closets 6-8 feet of sand to the water was over-run with washed up plant life. This plan life extended another 25+ feet into the water which was a bit gross to trot through (obviously Photoshop was used for the internet pictures). Parking stalls are tight and very difficult to navigate if you have a large vehicle. The garage/stairwells were littered with cigarette butts; the beach staff would round up the chairs and table and close the beach down more or less at around 5:30-6:00pm. As a whole the place was o.k., but the name â€œWaldorf Astoriaâ€� which represents a higher level of quality certainly is not reflected here. Given the right situation I would consider staying here again, but I would do a bit more shopping around next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very underwhelming for a Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: GATravelGuy
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here recently before heading up to Key Largo. I've stayed at a few Waldorf Astorias before and this was certainly not their marquee property. It sits tucked away with an apartment like approach. We were lucky to catch the bellhop out front and he brought our luggage inside. Check in was pretty good since Jason Carter was behind the desk. I'm a diamond member and he greeted me by name while explaining the perks of the stay. One thing I did like was that the hotel sent me an email prior to our arrival. I liked that touch but unfortunately they never responded to my special requests. The room was nicely decorated but didn't have much of a view. I was using Hilton points so I didn't expect much for a room. My daughter and I headed to the "beach" to check out the property. The pool was decent but the beach was nasty. The seaweed was thick towards the water's edge and in the shallows. I get that they can't control what's in the ocean but what they could maintain wasn't kept up. There was no beverage service when we were there and I had to go get drinks inside the bar. Kind of a hassle. I thought it was odd that no one was walking around the pool or beach taking orders. There was the H2O concierge booth which had water, cool towels and frozen treats for my daughter. That was about it. If I wasn't using points I would not stay here unless you got a ridiculously cheap rate i.e <$100 a night. We drove by the Casa Marina property and it looked more like a Waldorf property. I only picked this hotel because of the better Trip Advisor rating. Just beware.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you stay”
Reviews.Author: thomthornwall
Reviews.Content: Toe nail clippings on the balcony and in the room - we had to ask to have the carpet and the floors cleaned when it was more than obvious. The room appeared to be clean, however looking closer it was dissapointing. - Be certain to check about any specials you are to get at check in as well! I was told at the end of my stay that the special I booked under was not honored!! If you plan your next stay here at least don't be surprised when something like this hapens to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Slanz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and the pool and beach are excellent! A short walk to the Southern Most Point and the strip! Elevator had lots of issues when we stayed. Don't forget to check out the view from the roof!

Reviews.Title: “Make the most of your stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Lauradids
Reviews.Content: We hit Key West in mid July for a long overdue family reunion. We chose The Reach first for it's location and found that we were very happy with our choice! We were greeted at the door upon arrival and the staff could not do enough for us! The rooms are well appointed and stocked with the finest amenities. The grounds are very well kept and offer lots of options. The Strip House restaurant on the property was as good if not better than some of the finest steak houses in New York City! We will most definitely choose The Reach again!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon gone wrong”
Reviews.Author: Jmd5886
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the reach "resort" for the second half of our honeymoon. We had just come from miami where we stayed at a beautiful hotel with amazing service and we were looking forward to key west. Unfortunately for us, this part of our honeymoon was something we would like to forget. When we pulled up to the hotel we were immediately underwhelmed, we were expecting more from Waldorf Astoria. Upon check in, the greeting was not what I would call friendly. The woman behind the desk seemed bored and was very rude. When we made it to our room we were surprised that our room had two double beds... This was our honeymoon. When I called down I kindly said that there must be a mistake because this was not the room we booked. I was told that I absolutely booked that room and even after explaining that this was my honeymoon I was given no sympathy. The man I talked to was awful, he was not apologetic at all and had a very bad attitude. I asked to speak to the manager, expecting to speak to a professional, I was wrong. The manager was worse, she offered no solution for that night and told me they would move us the next day. I am not a confrontational person at all and was very nice to these people even though they were ruining my honeymoon. When I hung up the phone I couldnt believe how I was just spoken to. We had to wait around the whole day the next day to be moved. They told us they would call our room when the next room was ready. When that time they had given us had elapsed by an hour we called to see if it was ready. There was that attitude again from the "friendly" staff. We sat in our room for two more hours until they finally called, we missed half the day sitting inside. Finally we were in our room, we unpacked and headed out. When we came back later we were taken back by how hot it was in the room. We looked at the thermostat.... 86 degrees! We called the front desk and told them the air must not be working, we were told someone would be there to fix it. When we came back from dinner there was no change, still extremely hot. The next day was no different, we dreaded going back to the hotel. It was 95 degrees outside, normally I'd be looking forward to getting back to the room to cool off and take a shower before dinner, but there was nothing refreshing about our 86 degree room. This time we went to the desk and talked to a guy who again acted like we were bothering him. With a could care less attitude, he told us they would look at it again. Sadly our air was never fixed, we couldn't wait to leave. On the last day when we were checking, while staring at the computer, the woman asked how our stay was. I responded by saying " not great at all, our air conditioning was broken the whole time and it was 86 degrees in our room." she said "oh." no apology, nothing. That was it for me, I couldn't get out of there fast enough. In my career I talk to a lot of people on a daily basis. So when I was asked about my honeymoon I talked about the dreadful second half. Everyone told me over and over how terrible that it was that we were treated like that on our honeymoon. It was terrible and i'll have that memory for the rest of my life. It makes me so angry to think of how we were treated and I want people to know this before spening your hard earned money at The Reach. Unfortunately for us we can't get our honeymoon back, don't waste your time or money here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pool and watersports.”
Reviews.Author: Petwriter
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here this trip but did stay here in the past. Re-visited the hotel to take advantage of the jet-ski tour around the island. The jet-ski tour is the most value for the money on the Island, I did a lot of research before booking this trip. They take you on a 27 mile tour around the Island on jet skis. The resort is still as beautiful as I remembered it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great beach!”
Reviews.Author: Erika28
Reviews.Content: This is a really pretty hotel with a small but nice pool and a pretty beach there is also drinks service on the beach which is always welcome! The bedrooms are spacious and comfortable, we had a partial sea view but didn't spend anytime looking at the view as only in the room for sleeping and getting ready to go out! Its a long walk from Mallory Square but not too far from the start of Duval Street where all the bars are. There is a yummy restaurant about 10 minutes walk from the hotel called The Flaming Buoy its in the opposite direction to Duval Street but well worth visiting! Duval Street is fun, plenty of bars and restaurants to keep you entertained all night! We really liked Sloppy Joes and Irish Kevins which both had live music. Mallory Square is worth a visit but it does get very busy! Key West has a fun, vibrant atmosphere (although there are some scary ghost stories about it!!) and the hotel is a great place to relax and recharge the batteries in the day. My only complaint was the snack food in the restaurant wasn't great tasting and was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “luxury stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: kharmannghia
Reviews.Content: hotel was very clean and housekeeping excellent. They cleaned a few times a day. Hotel staff top notched. Private beach is also a plus

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place-would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: jeninin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the end of April for a couple of nights using Hilton Honors Points. The check in was smooth and quick and everyone was super nice. I felt the hotel was clean, pretty and well decorated. A few things worth mentioning: The Beach: I thought there would be more beach at this location. The hotel only has a small section of beach that is their own and the water and sand had so much seaweed, no one was swimming (see picture). The pool: was small but cozy, plenty of seats available when we were there. Location: The hotel was close to Duval (about a block or so), yet very quiet. Also nearby was a small store/outdoor restaurant called Ana's Cuban Cafe. It was very reasonable and good. The room: Ours didn't have a refrigerator which would have been nice to store water since it was hot. The bathroom: No tub, just a stand up shower where water gets all over the floor since the curtain is not long/wide enough. Sounds like I am complaining, but I'm really not. I would stay here again. Some people just like to hear all of the issues so they can make their own informed decision.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: silverbell783
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the reach and I wanted to write about how great the service has been. He guys at the pool are amazing and helpful. Janette at he front desk has been amazingly helpful and friendly. She is an excellent employee and I just wanted people to know. Its nice to walk into a place and have a helpful friendly person greeting you. This is my second stay here and I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this property!!!”
Reviews.Author: NJDiva04
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back yesterday and we loved this property!!! The room was very nice front desk concierge and the beach staff were all very helpful. Its very close to Duval street but away from the busy side of Duval so it was very relaxing. I must admit the reviews on here really scared me about choosing this property but they were totally false. I will most definitely stay at the Reach Resort again! I cant rate the food or drinks at the hotel because I didnt eat or drink on the property. I was too busy trying to get to all the cool places that ppl recommended Harpoon Harry's Red Fish Blue Fish Colombian Grace Camille's Hogs Breath Overboard Bar and Grill The Flying Monkey Bar Fat Tuesdays...etc etc!!!! HAPPY HOUR AT ALL THESE PLACES WAS GREAT!!!! And the hotel is in walking distance to all of these locations! Airport Transportation was about $20 (transportation and tip) he was really nice an offered great suggestions for our first day!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to coming back to the Reach”
Reviews.Author: foxfirev5
Reviews.Content: After sixteen trips to Key West since 2002, we finally stayed at The Reach on our last stay. The location was perfect, great beachside hotel within walking distance of everything. The staff was very accomodating and the room was beautiful. We're planning our next trip in October and are excited about our six night stay. We will submitt a followup report upon completetion of this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: Babasuki
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an overpriced suite and reserved a cot in advance so that my fifteen-year-old twin boys would not have to squeeze together on the sofabed. Not only was there no cot waiting for us, but we received no apologies and no attempts to remedy the situation - and one of my sons wound up sleeping on the floor! To compound our frustration, we had to make multiple calls just to have the sofabed made up. After the first night, still no sign of a cot or any attempts to make arrangements for us. We finally took matters into our own hands and took the cushion from the outdoor couch so that my son would have something to sleep on for the remainder of our stay. We have stayed in fine hotels around the world and have never received such poor service. It was absolutely shocking and our greatest regret was that we did not send a scathing letter to the GM of this hotel chain. Do NOT stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love Love Love this Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Relax038
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were here for a weekend getaway..from the time we parked to the time we checked out the service was excellent! The Front Desk was very helpful and courteous. They were at their best service at all times! The property is gorgeous, a little crowded on the weekend since the pool is small but still gorgeous. Ricardo from the H20 concierge is wonderful, always happy and genuinely nice.. :) The location is great, minutes from the southernmost point and a couple blocks to duval. Walk to the Rum Bar 3-4 blocks from the resort on Duval Street. THE BEST Mojitos ever made by Bob!.. Easy and inexpensive cab ride to Mallory Square. Everything is convenient from the resort, and a better value than Casa Marina ( Sister Property) which is just as nice but not as nice as the Reach. The rooms are large, spacey, well equipped, clean and comfortable. Book through Bookit.com to get a good rate on their boutique suites. I would absolutely stay at The Reach every time i visit KW!

Reviews.Title: “Ok But Not Going Back”
Reviews.Author: Ebobee
Reviews.Content: First time to Key west, arrived via ferry from Ft Myers and stayed one night at the Reach Resort. While room was comfortable, and bed wonderful, beach and general hotel appearance was dissapointing for a Waldorf property. Between thick seaweed on the sand, shallow hot water and jet ski operations sharing space with swimmers, beach experience was not enjoyable. Staff at the pool and beach were helpful and pleasant. Porch arrangement near pool was quite nice. General appearance of hotel was clean and functional but not Waldorf elegant or of high quality. We left with the feeling that we didn't get value for our money, final bill for room was close to $275.00 for one night. Perhaps we expected too much for that amount, but just not the quality that one would expect at a Waldorf. Key West was great, we'll be back, but trying some place else next time.

Reviews.Title: “WARM RELAXED YET HIGHLY PROFESSIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: lysa62
Reviews.Content: From the friendly faces of Chuck and Brian greeting you at the door, the efficient and helpful reception staff offering to show us the rooms before we decided, through to the extremely hard working staff at the restaurant pool and beach area, for whom nothing was too much, this hotel oozed relaxation and the sense of being really well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: rsbktravelers
Reviews.Content: If you come to the Reach try and get room 543 the best room in the hotel with a perfect view of the ocean and beach. The staff from the doorman to the beach were the most accomodating and helpfull of any we have experienced. Special kudos to Ricardo at the pool with his frozen towels, fresh fuit and always with a smile on his face. Also to Cael on the beach. As he put it "This is my beach and I am here to help you make your stay the best that it can be". Mission accomplished... And to Stacy our concierge that helped arrange a great fishing trip for my son, who just turned twenty one, and me making it a milestone memory. A great hotel and staff made this a trip that we enjoyed and would do again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “BEST resort in the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: aegan22
Reviews.Content: The Reach was fabulous! Especially Ricardo, Cael and Tony by the pool & beach! They were always there to make sure we were set up & comfortable. LOVE the 2pm popsicles!! We hope to be back sooner rather than later!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with nice decor and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: ShakeandBake001
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Close to Duval St. yet quiet location. Room was large and clean. Nice furnishings. Great private beach. Staff was friendly and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: lulufp0128
Reviews.Content: not worth the money, snotty staff, overpriced hotel\parking fees, snubbed by entire staff, for refusing"hidden" 25.00 fee, room not clean, no glasses, for a vacation.. you all really stressed me out!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: PStapp
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at The Reach and I truly enjoyed every minute of it. Everything was superb. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful and provided us with great recommendations for dinners and fun things to do. The hotel and grounds was immaculate and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I've ever slept in. I cannot wait until we book our next trip to The Reach in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: LynnTed1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at The Reach Waldorf Astoria Resort in Key West. Our experience could not have been better. I was a little concerned when I read a couple of reviews saying it was nice but not what you would expect from a Waldorf Astoria. I think they must have meant that the furnishing are not as opulent as most Waldorf Resorts. However, I think it was exactly what you would expect from the Keys. It reminded me of the Old Key West Resort in Disney, and I think Disney always nails it with appropriate decor. The beach was beautiful. It was located one street over from Duval Street and was about a mile walk to Mallory Square. Most of all, the staff was exceptional!!!! I can't remember ever having a more accommodating and wonderful staff. We loved it and would go again:)

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever! Thanks Waldorf and Thanks Ricardo!”
Reviews.Author: Jayabusa01
Reviews.Content: This trip to key west was double duty for my new wife and I, it was both honeymoon and a well needed respite from the daily grind. The hotel suites were big and clean and the pool view was also a great ocean view too!. The amenities were excellent and the staff was way better then there pay grade. Special mention has to go to Ricardo the pool side director whose, attention to detail was way beyond 4 star. He or Cael, had our towels rolled out for us on our loungers, before we could sit, down, my wife loved the sunglass cleaning, the frozen cucumbers on her eyes, and the tan mist they would spray on her, the jolly rancher popsicles, and fresh local fruit were great touches also. The restaraunt was sophisticated, and had a steak house atmosphere, and the prices were a little steep. But I really recomend the sirloin burger, at pool side or the breakfast buffet for late risers is also awesome. Over all the local fun was good and the staff had good recomendations for night life and the ablility to recoupe and rest was excellent at the resort. Best of both worlds, for us as my wife got her relaxations, and I got my seedo adventure and parasailing right from our private beach.

Reviews.Title: “We had a Wonderful time....Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy1486
Reviews.Content: We took a mini 6 day vacation in the month of June; the Hotel was great but the services was excellent!! The staff was very helpful and greeted us always with a smile and friendly hello on our venturing out and on our return. The Hotel was in a great location for our interest; we rented scooters from Barefoot Billy's, took the jet ski tour of the island, walked a short distance to Durval Street, took the 4 hour fishing excursion and play around the pool and beach area....Thanks Jake, Ricardo, Cael and Tony!! you guys were great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Darla777
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed in the service and the facilities that I am writing a detailed letter to the hotel. You are charged 20.00 a night for valet service and each night we had to go looking for the valet. One night it was only the valet who was also the bellhop and the cars were lined up. There were problems with the rooms reserved vs the actual rooms which finally did get straightened out, but only because we were not accepting any less. The pool is marginal and the waiter service is few and far between, each day I had to go get my own drinks and ice. The best was on a Saturday (holiday weekend) we were told at 9 am we could not use the pool, it wasn't cleaned and it was disgusting. We had to go to the sister hotel Casa Marina, and they would not shuttle us for free, they would charge us even though it was their fault. The Casa Marina is a much better facility, the service top notch, I would book there over the The Reach any day!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Judyscastle
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Very nice and extremely accommodating staff. Treated us as if we were the only guests that mattered at any particular moment. Nice pool right next to their own private sandy beach with pool and beach service. Nice touches such as complimentary champagne in the afternoons and virgin mojitos next to the elevator. Our boutique suite with a "partial" ocean view would have been called a full ocean view compared to other resorts. Had double sinks, tub/shower combo and separate shower. Our suite was the closest room to the elevator yet we never heard the elevator or people talking outside our room. We also had a view of the pool and beach yet still very quiet. When the gift shop was closed, a front desk employee opened the shop and allowed me to make a totally non-emergency purchase. Fabulously comfortable bed and pillows. We would return in a heartbeat! A few suggestions: Offer complimentary shuttle to sister property and drop offs to the other end of Duval Street. Gift shop needs to stay open at least until dark. Sell those cooling neck scarves that have the beads that you wet and stay cool for hours. Room Service menu should offer common "American" sandwiches like grilled cheese, BLT's, french dip, hot dogs, etc. Sometimes chefs get so caught up in their "artistry" that they forget food is to be eaten to satisfy hunger. Make a real french dip, and make it the best french dip possible. Add a grilled cheese and make it with 3 different cheeses on a fabulous bread. Make homemade potato chips. Every hotel's food service should be able to make a common sandwich at any time of the day or night even if it isn't on the menu. Pool/Beach Service needs to add snorkeling equipment. You can snorkel right from the beach and it would be wonderful to be able to do so without having to bring your own equipment. The only room suggestions would be to have softer towels and make the shelves in the bedroom "pull outs" so you can use them as drawers. Also, have a local newspaper with a daily television guide either delivered to each room or available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money, but nice”
Reviews.Author: FireFlyOjea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Reach for the first time the beginning of June 2011 because there were no rooms available at the Casa Marina. The Reach is the sister property to the Casa, but not by any means the same. We booked a partial ocean view room and they put us in the far corner of the courtyard, 4th floor, facing other rooms and no ocean in sight. When we asked why we payed for a partial ocean view room with no ocean in sight? The answer was, "If you stretch and look past your balcony, you can see a bit of water past the palm trees." Liars. The room was clean. The staff was a bit up tight but pleasant enough. My recommendation is, for the same amount of money, stay at the Casa, it's more charming at least. I won't stay at The Reach again but in all honestly, it wasn't horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sherryo511
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with my 12 year old daughter and her best friend, stayed at the Reach Resort the first week of June. Everything was fantastic! Comfortable rooms, private beach, great food and wonderful service! We especially loved Ricardo, Cael and Fred who take care of the beach and pool area. They were all extremely attentive, friendly and very helpful with tips for things to do on the island! We have never been so pampered! Another great perk was having access to the beach and pool area at the Casa Marina. . We Snorkled, Para Sailed, shopped, I had a facial and massage, biked, took a sunset cruise and enjoyed the sights. We were able to do all of the above from our hotel or the Casa marina next door. We did rent a car one day and drove to the Dolphin Research Center in Marathon and swam with the dolphins. Truly an amazing facility! A MUST! Truly our best vacation ever! If I had to offer any complaint, it would be that our room said Island View but the only way to see the Island was if you stood in the very far corner of our balcony! - Sherry Okolish

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Barclay12
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is the first time I have ever posted a comment about a hotel. I needed to in this case as I found the Reach such a fabulous hotel in a wonderful location. Perhaps a little over priced but then everything in Key West is expensive. W stayed in a boutique suite with sea view and although the room was not huge it had everything you would want and more. The reach has it's own private beech and swimming poole. If you have kids I would say it is a very very safe and secure place to take them. Food in the restaurant is first class and the service second to none. The Poole attendants are very friendly and always looking after your needs. Big thumbs up for the concierge/valet/reception staff. They really were inviting and friendly. If I owned a hotel I would want these people working for me as they were well presented and always attentive and gave a an excellent impression of a well run hotel. I would always recommend this hotel and key west I hope they keep up the high standards should be 5 star

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: neenie024
Reviews.Content: The resort was ideally located on the beach in Old Town Key West yet only 1 block from Duval Street. The property is well maintained and the staff were courteous and very customer service oriented. We had four in a one room boutique suit (the room slept a total of four) . There is only one mirror in the room located in the bathroom which made getting ready in the mornings and evenings a little tricky. Another mirror in the room would make the room much more workable when you have four in a room. The Barefoot Billy's (Ricardo/Carl/Fred) pool serive & beach rental service was excellent. All were friendly, accomodating and efficient. They provided free fresh fruit, lemonade and frozen fruit bars to all guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, met all of our needs and more”
Reviews.Author: econ0513
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach by a serendipitous chance. We were already staying in Key Largo when we decided to take a trip to Key West and liked it so much we decided to stay. I called Expedia at noon and booked 3 rooms for our party of 8. We then went to The Reach and discovered that this is where we should have stayed all week. From check in The Reach provided us with "Yes we can" attitude which can be hard to find now days. We discovered that the beach at The Reach was spectacular compared to the rest of the keys and the concierge at the beach was beyond helpful and friendly. All of the staff was friendly and helpfull. Even the recommendations for a restaurant for breakfast was very good. P.S. My wife has already looked in to booking a return trip to The Reach, 2 days after we returned home from Key Largo

Reviews.Title: “The People here Make This Place Great!”
Reviews.Author: DenverGiGi
Reviews.Content: We started at another resort and promptly left which is how we ended up at Reach. From the manager Cindy to Chuck and Brian at the door, and Ricardo at the pool/beach, we felt taken care of. This is a smaller boutique-style hotel and it may not have the all the bells and whistles but it was just what we needed for a few days of R&R with girlfriends. Thank you everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not great”
Reviews.Author: RexKite
Reviews.Content: Price was reasonable, room was clean, not true Waldorf level of experience, more like a mid-priced quality hotel. Pool is ok, beach is ok, not great, but not bad. Far away from main Duval action/scene. Rent a bike at concierge and you will have a great time. They charge extra for resort fee, parking... All in all, worth staying at if Pier House is booked up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not exceptional given the Waldor=Astoria name”
Reviews.Author: AlexandAmy
Reviews.Content: The Reach is a nice property; but not Waldorf=Astoria quality. The staff was not strong, and it was clear from front desk and bar tenders that they were not that into service. The pool was nice, but not great. The pool boys were over the top pushy. There is no jaccuzzi. The location is good. Just stay at the big sister property, the Casa Marina. We switched over their and had a superier experience for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: gregrmull
Reviews.Content: All the staff were very accomodating, from opening front doors to room service to front desk to pool attendants. Ricardo especially at the pool. He provided good conversation and gave several good tips of things to do on the island.. The location of hotel is perfect. You are close enough to night life to go if you like and far enough away where you don't hear it all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: rayne1269
Reviews.Content: After checking into another resort, my husband and I found The Reach while desperately looking for another place to spend our second night in Key West. The Reach front lobby staff was welcoming and courteous, but also genuine. We reserved a room and checked in the next morning (after a horrible night at another resort). Although our room was not ready when we arrived, the bell hop swooped up our bags and stored them for us. We were advised that we were welcomed to use their facility for the day and that we would get a call when our room was ready. We went for breakfast to Blue Heaven (terrific eggs benny w/lobster, go if you get the chance) and then returned to facility. The pool was clean and cool, the beach was awesome! Carlos and Freddie at the beach provided outstanding service with a great big giant smile! Shout out to Carlos and Freddie...woot woot!!! When our room was ready, it was clean and up to date. Refridgerator, safe, and a comfy cozy bed...what more could a weary traveler ask for. We rode a harley in from Miami... so that bed was a gift! I would definately go back to The Reach...it was such a great time, surrounded by great people...employees and other guests included!! Only drawback....you need to pay extra for parking...and drinks are costly!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and chic”
Reviews.Author: Lilybdog
Reviews.Content: The Reach lobby was a good start with friendly staff and contemporary surroundings. Our room was very comfortable and well laid out with a Nespresso espresso machine! The location and pool area were great but be sure to ask about the "resort fee" which is automatically tacked onto your bill. Seemed like a rip off as though the hotel was lovely, it did not rise to such a fabulous level to warrant the extra $25 day.

Reviews.Title: “The beach service at the hotel was the best I have ever had!!!! Thank you FRED and RICCARDO!”
Reviews.Author: Kaysmom524
Reviews.Content: This review really isn't about the hotel. it is about the beach service AT the hotel. Day one of our vacation we met Riccardo early in the evening. He was super friendly, knowledgeable, and very funny. We told him we would be back on the beach early the next morning and to our surprise (4 of us total), Riccardo had four chairs out on the beach with tables between them and 2 umbrellas up waiting for us. This may not sound like a big deal but the chairs have to be physically brought out for each guest and the umbrellas have to have a spot dug for them in the sand EACH time they are moved!! We also met Fred on this day as well who was just as wonderful! Riccardo and Fred were amazing! They were so attentive and NOT overbearing at all. They seemed to know when we needed anything at all. They served us frozen face clothes and popsicles as the temperature climbed and were always willing to help us move our umbrellas to provide the most shade and our chairs were always covered with towels and they would MAKE towel headrests for us. They were also knowledgeable on the happenings on the island and would rib us daily as our arrival time to the beach got later and later each day (alcohol induced from the night before!). Overall, this was the best beach service I have ever received. The four of us have decided BASED ON THE BEACH SERVICE that we will return again next year at the same time and stay at the Reach resort again! Thank you Riccardo and Fred, you made our whole trip!

Reviews.Title: “The beach at the reach is hot!”
Reviews.Author: dish59
Reviews.Content: It's a few blocks from "the soup," but we had a great time at The Reach, and especially at the well-staffed natural sand beach. Ricardo (think George Lopez), who works the beach is a real gem -- he's personable, funny, and took care of our every need. He knew just when to bring me a popsicle, a piece of cool fruit or an icey cold washcloth. Thanks for making our stay memorable, Ricardo! We stayed in an ocean view boutique suite, and the beds and pillows were super comfy. We didn't eat at the on-site restaurant because there are just so many great spots to try at Key West, but the breakfast buffet was nice. Ambrosia is a super fabulous sushi restaurant at the Santa Maria (the Reach's sister property next door) -- even my friend from San Francisco was blown away! I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely phenomenal -- great place, very quaint, and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: jecropak
Reviews.Content: Wanted to extend a special thanks to the pool staff, especially Ricardo, who was freindly and helpful, and fun, each day were were there. Everyone else was extraordinary as well, so it was tough to pick just one to praise.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: lucey12
Reviews.Content: In celebration of my birthday, we stayed at the Reach for one night. Our check-in was easy and welcoming as was the birthday basket in our room. The ambiance by the pool and restaurant area is laid back and the staff in the gift/coffee shop is very friendly and helpful. Since this was Memorial Day weekend and we booked late, our room did not have the view we would have preferred. However, it was quiet, spacious, and decent value for a holiday weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful honeymoon!! Will be back fro our aniversary!”
Reviews.Author: julieandmike0521
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived here for our honey moon. The view is amazing and the level of customer service from the staff is amazing. I would recommend visiting the Strip house. Hubby and I enjoyed the breakfast buffet (aprox 18 bucks a head) but nothing will compare to having breafast on the beach in the morning. Also having dinner along the beach with some of the best steak we've ever had as well. We realized evryone drives motor scooter and buggies so you really dont need a rental car unless you planning on driving along the 7 mi bridge or other fun activities. Overall this is one of the most fantastic resorts ever. We will be back service is great, place is clean and 2 thumbs and toes up!

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Have Had A Better Vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: BocaTodd
Reviews.Content: I first want to say I was a bit concerned when I read about the negative reviews on here about The Reach - the rooms, the bad service and rude employees, not being able to check in, etc. My wife and I just got home today from a great Honeymoon! For starters we arrived around 3:15 and checked in quickly. The front desk clerk was very courteous to us. We also learned after booking our rooms a month before, they upgraded us after we ended the call when learning it was going to be our Honeymoon and at for the same price of the room we booked. When we returned to our room the first night they left us a complimentary bottle of champagne, chocolates and almonds! The weather was great all weekend and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The beach and pool was a great way to get the day started. It's just a few blocks to the Southernmost Tip and a block from the south end of Duval St. We didn't eat at the hotel but for breakfast I recommend Banana Cafe just a block over and up on Duval. For dinner I highly recommend Pepe's, it's a few blocks east of Duval on Caroline St (the north end of Duval). There are plenty of cool bars and shops to hop on Duval. Our only regret was it didn't last long enough! We will certainly stay at The Reach again!

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo & Cael”
Reviews.Author: rdrills
Reviews.Content: Ricardo Castaneda and Cael, of Barefoot Billy's Pool Service & Beach Rentals were great! Terrific beach service; really great, helpful guys.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing the 2nd time around.”
Reviews.Author: coolmom101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach 2 1/2 years ago and couldn't wait to get back. We were really bummed this time. Staff not as friendly, our room wasn't ready when we arrived even though I had called beforehand to tell them of our arrival time at noon and request champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to be waiting. Instead, they said they would get housekeeping right on it. We had lunch at the Strip House (above average tasting lunch, not terrific) and our room was still not ready. Two hours after our arrival the room was ready. About 3 hours later they brought the champagne and strawberries -- not the same as walking in and having it waiting. Plus, there were 6 little strawberries and nothing else to make the presentation memorable AND the bill for this little celebration -- $68! We ate the strawberries (they were good) and ended up taking the champagne home with us. We didn't want it by the time it arrived and never found the right time to drink it. The room seemed dingy, couch and cushions on chairs worn and dirty looking, not crisp and clean as we had remembered. The 3rd day of our visit they had a 'ventilation problem' in The Strip House and we had to go next door to their sister hotel for lunch by the pool. That hotel had a convention and lunch was a limited menu, drab food. The day before at the other pool had been a terrific lunch with fun drink of the day specials. When we went for breakfast after the 'ventilation problem' the kitchen still wasn't up and running and we were referred to snacks at the hotel store. No offer of free coffee and a danish for our troubles as there was no offer of a free drink when our room wasn't ready. Not that a hotel has to do those things, but I was expecting it from this resort. We had great concierge service, especially from Mary and the plane ride from Fred Cabanas was an amazing experience. Then as we are preparing to leave we discover our laptop was stolen from our room. Not only that, the thief went into a backpack on the floor and took the power cord for the computer and a bag of cashews the hotel had given us for our anniversary (they did give us a small bottle of champagne and two bags of nuts along with a 'happy anniversary' note). As far as we can tell the burglar only took the computer, the cord and the nuts! (Was he hungry?) Good thing he didn't take that expensive bottle of champagne. Security came up and we are making a police report. We consistently put other valuables in the safe but the laptop wouldn't fit and truthfully we weren't thinking that someone would steal it. Overall, it was just disappointing. We know this hotel can be great and hope The Reach finds its way back to being an amazing resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for water beach and not leaving your lounge chair”
Reviews.Author: grandmamajoy
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth for months about spending approximately 40 extra dollars to stay at this resort on my first trip to Key West IT was worth 200 extra a night Beach and pool and resturaunt and bar and waitresses and water sports and excursions were all within a great focal point with breathtaking views of blue water and sand beach ( one of two on entire Key West Island) by the way. I only wish my grandkids and married kids were with us because we could enjoy the beach for a change with the convenience of the Reach. At the front desk, Cyndi made me feel like I was at Disney World when I arrived, she was the best and the bell boy explained the coffee espresso machine in room and he asked if anything else needed to be explained after he gave us a tour of the robes and other items in the room. Free fruit and lime water in common area. If i ever go back to Key West I WILL GO TO THE REACH btw the movie stars go to the Astoria next door but I like the Reach better Astoria was too spread out but you can still use the pools and beach there if you want to. I saw a mob of people trying to sneak in to gated Astoria that's how cool it is >>>> !!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always Can count on Ricardo to take care of everything”
Reviews.Author: Scamp1210
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Reach Resort many times over the years and I always can count on Ricardo to make sure that the beach and pool are always perfect. When you check in stop at the pool and Ricardo will take care of you. He is the best

Reviews.Title: “We were made to feel like V.I.P.'s”
Reviews.Author: eddiemoe
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until the minute we left, this resort made my wife and I unbelievably comfortable and welcome. With ready advice and outstanding service, the staff could not have been more accommodating...a special thanks goes out to Brian, our doorman/baggage handler/concierge. His in-depth knowledge of Key West, delightful stories, recommendations on sight seeing and eatery's etc. were well received and right on the mark. We simply loved staying here and hope to return as a matter of routine. Thanks for making our 20th wedding anniversary so very special and memorable. Ed & Katie Whitley

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: pegrat
Reviews.Content: Your staff and hotel are just amazing. I felt totally pampered and cared for, especially pool side with your associate, Ricardo. I think he just does not know a stranger! Loved the view and the accessibility to the other resort. Thank you for a memorable and lovely vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place but maid service terrible”
Reviews.Author: RNCJR
Reviews.Content: The Reach was in a great location for us, We liked the more quiet and slower moving pace. But was close enough to ride our bikes to the more active locations. The room was very nice. The challenges occured with the maid staff. They really did a terrible job with our room. Most of the time only making the bed and giving us fresh towels. Most of the time had to was our own cups and glasses. Guess that what you get for paying 275 a night (lol).. Did not leave maid service a tip and I usally always leave tip. The only time I don't is when I feel the service I received terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome property with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: TDM516
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here for our anniversary. Jason in the sales dept helped us book our lovely oceanview room. From the moment we got there the staff was great. Front desk, concierge, waiters, pool concierge, bell hops...everyone was so nice and helpful. Our room and the views were beautiful and we really enjoyed the beach right on property. I would recommend this to anyone and if you do stay make sure to speak with the concierge to get some great recommendations. We will be back :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with acess to beach and pool, amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: amiej622
Reviews.Content: Location was on the other end of the island, away from most of the nightlife, but right next to the Southernmost point. Hotel was clean. Rooms were a little small, but we didnt spend much time in the room. Shower water pressure wasnt strong at all. View from our island view room was pool and ocean! It was gorgeous! Staff was great!! Ricardo assisted us everyday with our beach chairs and towels. He was always friendly and attentive. Tony passed out snacks (strawberrys and popsicles which was nice on a scorcing hot day) and was polite and knowledgeable about the area, I think it was only his third day. Laura was also great. She served us drinks on the beach and at the Strip house. The food was good, a bit overpriced but convenient. Felt very welcomed and there was always someone to assist if we needed help or had questions. Overall it was great! Will definetly return!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful wedding reception that exceeded our expecations! Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: jmack_75
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding reception at the Reach Resort on 5-15, on the second floor Terrace. Heidi Greenberg was fantastic to work with, I really did not have to do a thing she handled it all. I never saw pictures of the location before hand, so I was not sure how it would all look. I felt like I was right on the beach, the view was spectacular. Our Bartender Laura, was superb, so were the weight staff and Michael our Captain. Everyone raved about the Key Lime Margaritas, bruschetta, Steak Kabobs, Pink Shrimp and eggs rolls were very yummy. We went with the BBQ, so they had a large grille set up and grilled our ribs, brisket and chicken right onsite. If you are looking for a romantic setting, excellent service with great food I highly reccomend the Reach for your big event. The second floor terrace is GORGEOUS. Thank you very much for making our day so special. I look forward to visiting again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding function”
Reviews.Author: djdaughtry
Reviews.Content: Hotel and accommodations are beautiful (we had a two-room oceanfront suite). Very accessible to Duval and easy parking. Beautiful beach and pool. Staff are very friendly and eager to please. Our Son got married there and the ceremony/catering were fantastic! Ate at the Strip House - wonderful! Only negative is the housekeeping. We needed to request coffee, towels and bathroom products to be replaced multiple times. Maybe they should use a checklist before the housekeeper leaves the room to make sure all is attended to. Overall a great wedding and great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS, clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lauhi99ie
Reviews.Content: Had once stayed at the Westin, which was beautiful, but we wanted a hotel that was a little off the beaten path and, more importantly, with its own beach. We had our own entrance to the room, a perfectly sized balcony, a really nice bathroom (although it was a standup shower) and an amazing time at the Reach. The staff was wonderful and very accomodating. Everything was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: cwatson56
Reviews.Content: We loved the Reach and would definitely stay here again. The beach is great and the hotel staff are amazing. The suites are very spacious and the beds are fantastic. Everyone went out of their way to accommodate us. Only negative is that the pool area could use some additional servers. Other than that a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff a short walk to the restaurants and bars. Best front desk and lobby staff of any hotel I have stayed at in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience.”
Reviews.Author: tbassesq
Reviews.Content: Everything from our room to the food to the service was simply superb.However I would be remiss if I did not mention how incredibly helpful and friendly Ricardo was each and every day of our stay.It was like running into a long lost friend.He was just terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in a lot of things, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Wskin
Reviews.Content: I'm so dissatisfied with the service I'm currently staying at the Reach at this moment and feel compelled to post this. The pictures on the website are misleading. The rooms are pretty beat up. Walls are scuffed, furniture chipped, lights don't work, fixtures (faucet) are loose, grout in the bathroom grimy. Cleaning service is half hearted. The staff came to 'clean' as my wife and I were leaving for dinner. We left the building, realized we forgot something upstairs, went back, and the staff was already gone. Wow 2 people cleaned a suite in 10min? I'm impressed. Evening bartender at the strip house was extremely rude as well (a complete [...] actually), did his best to ignore you. On the other hand, steaks at the striphouse were very good and the concierge and the towel guy at the pool were really awesome and helpful. Location is great too, close to duval but away from the noise. However overall the service and condition of the hotel does not warrant the Waldorf name, and you feel all the more offended that they had the gall to actually call it a Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: asharper
Reviews.Content: Love this place. The private beach area + pool was beautiful. Rooms large with kitchen area (fridge only) and balcony. Yes, you have to walk to Duval but I liked being away from the crowd but yet close enough to walk to it when I wanted. We did not eat in the hotel but yes the drinks were very expensive. Also be aware a daily fee is ADDITIONAL. But from what I saw everything is expensive in Key West. Enjoy the beauty of the ocean, private beach and pool and nice rooms then walk to eat or drink is what we did and it worked great. Down the street is the Southernmost Cafe - go to the bar happy hour - 4:30 - 6:30, $3 drinks and apps - yummy Tuna sliders.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in great location”
Reviews.Author: TheGregstar
Reviews.Content: I visited the Reach Waldorf Astoria Resort in January 2011 for one night, due to HHonors Gold Status received a upgrade to a really great, very spacious suite. Maybe I am a lil bit more critical with this resort, cause I had some fever and felt really bad. Check in was ok, the friendly receptionist told us the -slightly complicated- way to our room, upgrade due to HHonors status worked out very well, the bellman was also friendly and our luggage was really fast in our room. The size of the room (partial sea view suite) was stunning, it was very clean, made a very nice impression on first sight. It also had a huge modern bathroom with nice, high quality bath amenities. It had also a nice big balcony, with a charming view on the pool, palms and the ocean. After having a delicious coffee from the Nespresso coffee maker, we went out to Duval Strees (just 5 min walk) and had a nice dinner and shopping there. So the location of the resort is REALLY good, in about 3 minutes you walk to the "90 miles to Havanna" Point. GREAT! After coming back late - the next important point: Our bed was really good - simply full 5 stars for great sleeping comfort! Wireless Internet is available, with good connection - due to HHonors it was for free. Breakfast in the morning was ok, served in a - lets say interesting location - maybe not the best for families with small children, if you do not want to expain to them, why there are pictures of semi-naked ladies on the walls ;-) Breakfast buffet was just ok, compared to european 5-star-hotels it can not compare neither in size/amout of the buffet nor in the quality of the food. As I said - it was ok, fruits were really nice, but there been no tasty hams, cheeses or other stuff, which I would like to have for breakfast as I am paying a bunch of money for it. Slightly minus - check out was not really nice and even I am used to get it always and the hotel was for sure not booked out (checked it on the internet) they did not give us a late check-out. I got really angry because of this, the receptionist should not lie to a customer, cause Internet proof is really easy to get! Therefore - decrease in Service!! Pool area is really nice, the small sand-beach is really nice and the small pier is just THE extra, which make my four to five star feedback getting Five stars. The pictures IÂ´ve made in the morning show, how lovely and romantic this resort is. With its great location and due to the upgrade a really good price-value-ratio - Five stars and a recommendation as a great place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but the buck outweighs the bang.”
Reviews.Author: Wnygjr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach for 3 nights to celebrate our anniversary & attend a destination wedding. The good: The room was clean & nice but small since we were put in a handicapped accessible room & the bathroom took up a lot of space. The location was good at the southernmost neigborhood with its own beach & a nice balcony. The bad: The restaurant was extremely overpriced ($35 mediocre breakfast buffet & $17 frozen drinks) and the service sucked. I was almost finished with my breakfast before anybody came over to take a drink order. It was impossible to take an afternoon nap. In the course of an hour, we were bothered three times; twice by housekeeping & once by maintenance. Overall, our stay was ok but not great. I might have been happier spending less & being bothered less.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: jgm07974
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably bad service. Bartender rude and complained. Noisy by the pool. One waitress to cover beach and pool. The guy to get the chairs or umbrella's seemed overwhelmed and took forever to bring us an umbrella in spite of a generous tip. For the Hotel be be a "Waldorf Astoria" property is a joke . Property could be nice but needs a new management staff at least.

Reviews.Title: “We celebrated our 30th anniversary in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: joeway
Reviews.Content: We were so lucky to have found The Reach. Our accomodations were splendid. The staff & service was excellent. We ate delicious meals at their oceanfront dining terrace. The private beach & pool was perfect. We want to especially mention the pool manager, Ricardo, who took wonderful care of us & provided excellent, personalized service. Ricardo made the pool experience a dream. Thanks Ricardo!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Hotel Located in an Excellent Ocean Setting Near Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: dalednet
Reviews.Content: We spent our first Anniversary at The Reach hotel in Key West, FL. The hotel was great, services were outstanding, and we were within easy walking distance from all the action on Duval St and all of old town. I would recommend The Reach to other travelers and will stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Waldorf Astoria about this property”
Reviews.Author: trip2828
Reviews.Content: * The Waldorf Astoria name signifies class and elegance - The Reach, Waldorf Astoria Resort has neither. * This hotel is extremely overpriced and I would highly recommend not staying here if you prefer a classy resort. * This is a two star hotel. * My wife and I normally stay at The Ritz in Naples, South Beach and Key Biscayne. The Reach is not even comparible to those fine properties except for the expensive price. * The pool is very small and the beach was full of seaweed. * $425 a night is a rip-off for this property. * You enter your room from the outside (like a motel) and the room was bland and not really updated. * The carpet had spots on it. * This entire property needs a fresh coat of paint. * We checked out a day early because we were so underwhelmed. * The beach attendant told my wife and I that even though we paid $25 resort fee "he and his buddy worked on tips" as he set up our chairs on the beach. * A bunch of guys brought two cases of beer onto the beach. Something like that is fine if the hotel is $99 a night. I did not expect that staying at a Waldorf Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place - but don't have to high expectations”
Reviews.Author: Its_Scandinavian
Reviews.Content: Had a pleasant and nice stay during my fianc'es 30 years birthday. The hotel has an appealing location in Old Key West and a very good beach front location. You have to walk a few minutes to reach the start of Duval Street. I was very happy that I booked a junior suite with sea view. The room itself was clean, nice and with an attractive contemporary decor. I should been very concerned if I booked an standard without view and had to pay high rates. Some rooms have just awkward views over a parking deck and seems to be not as nice as our junior suite. I could expect more amenities and more attention to details, but I have to realize this is not a Four Seasons. However, this place has so much more features that just make it to a great place. The pool area was on our first day crowded with youngsters and children and I was a little bit disappointed because I had expected a more mature and silent place, however the following days it was more adults than children. Good pool service and you have the opportunity to have a sun chair by the beach. The pool servants make sure that it was only residents that used their facilities, but I can hardly believe this was the case our first day because we didn't saw the youngsters around the hotel (in fitness center, bar, restaurant, breakfast etc). It was nice to see how well maintained the beach was. Upon arrival the room wasn't ready. It was a friendly receptionist that promised us to give a call when the room was ready and they did - this is good service. One disappointment was that the hotel couldn't arrange massage or spa appointment at all during our three days, so if you want to visit this (located at the sister resort Casa Marina) make sure to arrange before arrival. We had a breakfast included rate and the breakfast was ok, but nothing special. For us who just stayed at the InterContinental in Washington with a great and to the point well composed breakfast experience the breakfast buffet felt like an average buffet. But to have the breakfast at the terrace with the sound of the sea and the Key West sun is nothing that you can pass. One of our lunches was at the Casa Marina Hotel and I recommend you to visit this place for lunch. It was good wraps and burgers and . The beach at The Reach is just so much better and overall I think this place is just nicer. The building itself is not at all attractive but the location, features and service made is to a good place. I will return upon my next Key West visit...

Reviews.Title: “Can a bartender make you consider changing your flight to stay an extra day?? YES! Visit Laura at the Strip House!!”
Reviews.Author: danabury
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, clean and modern. The location was perfect and the staff was friendly. Then I met Laura at the hotel's restaurant bar, the Strip House- she was amazing! She spun delicious cocktails, gave great suggestions on where to dine and drink in town, and made every guest feel special! I seriously considered staying another night because of her!

Reviews.Title: “An Overpriced Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: bfernathome
Reviews.Content: First impressions are everything, and when we walked into the lobby of The Reach, I thought I was at a Hampton Inn. Not that I mind a Hampton Inn, but not for 289K a night. Everything in the hotel was cheap. Decor looked like an IKEA lobby, grounds were unimpressive. Rooms were done cheaply. Cheap, cheap, cheap. To top it off, the location is great, with what some call the nicest beach around, and there is NO POOL BAR! AND, the beach is loud with jet ski rentals coming in and out. I would not get in the water due to fear of being run down by one. Would not stay there again (unless I was on a budget and the rooms were 175 a night or something. On a positive note, the Concierge was super helpful, they had bike rentals on site, and the breakfast buffet was not bad. I would stay at the Casa Marina or the Southernmost on the Beach next time though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: hmblack11
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing and we had such a great experience. We loved the beach and beach attendant Ricardo Castaneda who helped us all week.

Reviews.Title: “First Class accomedations but with a few unexpected glitches !”
Reviews.Author: traveltrek57
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Key West by car and had a great reception at the valet station. Great start until we got o the registration desk to find out that they had screwed up the reservation big time. We had wanted a room for three grown adults and they had booked by error a room with a queen bed and a sofa bed for the third person in our party. Room 314 was a deligt in cleanliness but a horror in sleeping accomadations for 2 nights. When it came time to turn down the beds, they only did the main bed and not the sofa sleeper. When we requested turn down, after 30 minutes we had to call again to have them come in and turn it down. No one showed up and when we called again we were told they had put it in the system and someone would get there soon. 45 minutes later exhausted one of our party went down and physically got sheets, and pillows to make up the bed. Not an easy thing to do, and a very uncomfortable sleeper. Later ,about 45 minutes later, someone showed up at the door to make up the bed and bring pillows after we were already sleeping. The next day, after enjoying sight seeing and returning to the room the sleeper was made up and left open in the middle of the room. had to walk around it to get anything done and it was very awkward. For the price of the room it was not pleasant or a good experience with the Wadorf. Not high on my return list. The pool was the highlight of our stay. Staff was kind and attentive to people. Some great highs and lows on this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: ohiotraveler0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the reach from 4/17 to 4/21/11. Everything went very smoothly, from checkin to checkout. The room (king regular) was spacious clean, had a comfy chair with ottoman, and had a small fridg, safe, bar sink, robes, balcony-it was wonderful. The bathroom was updated, not huge, but had enough counter space to put out cosmetics,toiletries, etc. Loved the workout room the POOL, and the BEACH!!! All employees were wonderful. Nice location at quiet end of key west, but we walked or biked every day to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Patchy - attention to detail lets it down”
Reviews.Author: MCE63
Reviews.Content: The Reach is a lovely property in a great location but attention to detail and inconsistency in standards and service let it down. I wanted to love it and if I'd have been paying $200/night I might have done. But at $400/night (plus the $25/day service charge and 18% service added to bar and restaurant bills) you shouldn't be even thinking that your room hasn't been cleaned thoroughly, or that the service is lacking. Some of the staff are exceptionally helpful, some appear not to even notice you. The bar and restaurant are okay but nothing seems to be delivered with much flair or enthusiasm. The pool is pretty and well maintained but gets crowded and there's a lot of competition for sun beds. Location-wise, it's well situated, a very short walk from the quieter end of Duval Street and lots of options for restaurants nearby. It's not a great ambassador for the Waldorf Astoria brand and I wouldn't go back unless it was for a much cheaper rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother for the food”
Reviews.Author: ssssss_11
Reviews.Content: Late lunch, the staff obviously burnt out and not cheery at all and reluctant to impress let alone serve. Didn't offer food menus, didn't approach table....when they did it was very rude. Had to go to bar for own drinks....then food served in baskets with plastic forks!! This was in the resto area. Drinks okay but the server more concerned with his personal tale. No apologies by anyone. Embarassing almost for the place. Good location but I suspect a 2 star resort in a 5 star location.

Reviews.Title: “Time for this property to "Clean Up"”
Reviews.Author: Mar9457
Reviews.Content: Staying at The Reach on thousands of hotel points, we were offered a lovely looking room, but it had one bed instead of the two reserved. We were then offered a standard room which we accepted because it had two beds. Bathroom floor was dirty--sporting human hair belonging to previous occupants, as well as dog paw marks on the inside of the bathroom door. Note that pets are welcome for a non-refundable payment of $125, which one would assume would be used to clean up any evidence of doggie damage with this good bit of change. Obviously, not. After a call to the management to clean the floor during turndown service, the floor remained as dirty as when we entered the room when we returned from dinner. Another call for thorough cleaning that night for the following morning, and again before leaving the room the next day, we returned in the afternoon to...dirty floor with same floor covering as the day before. After a third complaint, we received free breakfast and were moved to a one-bedroom handicapped suite with a sofa sleeper. Unfortunately, as we were showing the very helpful bellman where to place our things, we noticed that apparently the maid had forgotten to make the bed after the last occupant left. Later, after the bed was changed, while taking a shower, the faucet handle fell off in my hand followed by the joining ring behind it. Then, I noticed that one of the screws that held the wall plate of the faucet to the wall was about to fall off, so I screwed it back in. The sofa sleeper was so lumpy that I felt like the princess and the pea, only there was a lump for every spot of my body. Needless to say, I got very little sleep. After two nights in the suite, not a mop or vacuum seemed to have traveled anywhere near our room. Coffee cups and glasses were not washed and no coffee supplies were refreshed. All in all, the location of this hotel is prime, but the property is so neglected and in such extreme need of repair, that it is hardly worth even half the points used for the stay, let alone the rate paying guests had to pay. My advice is to wait until news that the owners of The Reach (A Waldorf-Astoria Property) have figured out that they have to maintain the property to the same high levels as the rates they charge their guests.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for my little getaway!”
Reviews.Author: DroogieRN
Reviews.Content: My husband gave me his Hilton Honors points to take a little five-day vacation to Key West with my friend. Someone in an earlier review said that The Reach treats rewards guests like garbage... well, I guess they forgot to do that with us. From the first moment to the last, the service was wonderful. Extras were expensive, true, but it's Key West! Our room had a partial ocean view, the bed was beyond luxurious, the pool was lovely and we just loved the location. I would definitely stay there again! My only complaint, and it is minor, is that the bathroom could've been just a little cleaner, but it's something that maybe a person who isn't a total neat freak might not have even noticed. I wish I could remember everyone's names who gave such great hospitality. I'll definitely stay there on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Resort But Don't Expect it to Be Like an All Inclusive”
Reviews.Author: colmmoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Reach Resort last week and had a nice time there. It's around a 15-minute walk from the ferry terminal to the resort or you can pay a $12 flat fare by cab which would take 5 minutes. The walk is not bad though.
