If you plan it right - you can see the highlights of Key West, including the Southernmost point, the lighthouse, Hemingway's house, the Little White House and walk up Duval Street so you can get a sense of where things are when you go back there at night. The Reach Resort is very modern looking. The staff was friendly. Free newspapers are provided. At one point, we saw some glasses of champagne free for the taking in the lobby. We read reviews here and requested rooms away from the elevators. Our room had a terrace overlooking the courtyard, and pool and ocean in the distance to our left. Toiletries in the bathroom smelled wonderful. No complaints about the room except the coffee maker wasn't working but that wasn't a big deal for us. The room was very clean and in great shape. It's one of the few if not the only resort that has its own natural beach in Key West. The beach isn't huge but it's just right for the number of people who stay there. The sand is powdery and clean. The water is clean - you just have to avoid stepping and stubbing your toe on the scraggly rocks below. If you have a pair of waterproof beach shoes, bring those. After awhile, you'll know where the rocks are and learn to avoid them. The water is around 4 1/2 feet deep for at least 15 yards out. Free popsicles and drink samples are given by the pool every now and then. Note that this service didn't extend to the beach area. There are two small shower areas. At the beach, there's an attendant who sets you up with chairs and umbrellas depending on availability - the earlier you get there, the better your chances of getting them. They also give you towels that they lay down on the chairs. There's a big gazebo with two benches that you can visit. There is a small store before you get to the pool area that sells towels, beach toys, swimsuits, beachwear, Starbucks coffee and sun lotion. There is an area in the beach where you can rent out jetskis and kayaks. The price for jetskiing is $70 for half an hour per person, $110 for an hour per person OR you can take the 27-mile tour around the island for $130 for two people. We didn't try eating at The Strip House - it's an expensive steakhouse but it also offers less expensive fare for when you're at the beach. Drinks were on the expensive side but you can walk a block away to Ana's Deli, buy your beers there and bring them to the beach without being too obvious. We also bought sandwiches at the deli and ate them on the beach. A couple of blocks away is the Southernmost Beach Cafe where you can get a great breakfast (very reasonably priced) with an oceanview (you can call ahead and try to reserve an oceanview table which we did). At night, there's not really anything going on and the Strip House (which has a bar) is closed by 10 pm or so. Your best bet is to leave the resort around 5:30/6 pm to go to Mallory Square to watch the sunset and have dinner there then hang out at the various bars on Duval. At night, the streets are on the dark side so take a cab home for $12. The Reach Resort is related to the Casa Marina and you can supposedly try out the facilities there but we didn't have time. The Casa Marina is farther away too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: NEFAST
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable room, but for the price expected something a bit more special. Expensive for what you get. Next time in Key West, I would consider this hotel, but would also look around for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families but...”
Reviews.Author: extto
Reviews.Content: First off is a basis for comparison. I'm comparing my stay to similar priced hotels (~$400) in resort areas (think Westin, Hyatt, 4 Seasons, W, Regis). My wife and I went and overall a good experience.. but just good. We did think though that had we had our children with us, this is a great place. Nice pool, protected grounds and private beach.. great for families, those who need pool/ocean access or stay far away from Duval St. We'd go back but only with our family. Just the two of us and we'd opt for elsewhere. Grounds were very good... you're paying for location! Our room - a garden suite - had a very loud HVAC which woke both my wife and I up. One elevator on the wing which was shared with the service staff (I'm used to staff having a separate elevator to avoid delays). Service was good for the price point -- not great. Again, if I'm comparing this to a mid priced hotel, it was great, however best to compare to similar properties so hence a good (B) review.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but bring your money for the drinks”
Reviews.Author: AmyRealtor33050
Reviews.Content: Not being a couple that stays in these types of hotels, we really splurged to celebrate our 20th anniversary here. We live only an hour away and we had just one night and we wanted it to be special. I have never spent $400 (incl. taxes, etc) on a hotel room! Frankly I did expect more. The hotel staff was not very friendly, when we remarked that it was our anniversary, a Happy Anniversary, would've been nice. The room was not very impressive, nothing extra special for the money. But I did like the nice shampoo, soap and lotion in the bathroom! The pool looked a lot bigger in the pictures. It really is not very big. We ordered pina coladas at the restaurant and then decided to take them to the beach. The waitress took at least 10 min. to bring back our change, while our drinks melted. That wasn't a good first impression. The service for drinks on the beach was much better; however be prepared, a pina colada was $15! Wow. All in all, I wasn't very impressed, I will look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and nice location”
Reviews.Author: psu199398
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Reach last week. Overall it was a great stay. the property was well maintained and the location just a block of Duval was an ideal location. If there was one drawback for our stay it was that there were some inconsistencies with the service of the front desk and bar/waitstaff. Check in was not as smooth as we would have liked, first, there was only one staff member to check in guests, this was around 4 pm which was the normal check in time and there was a decent line. Second, the room was not ready and they said they would call us in about 20 minutes. after no phone call and about 30 minutes, I went back to the front desk and the room still wasn't ready. they again told me that they would give me a call in about 20 minutes. finally at about the hour mark, I returned and there was a different staff member there and he was finally able to check us in. And as for the bar/waitstaff, the service outside was hit or miss depending on which server you had. An inconvenience was the bar & room service closing at 10 pm. Another was having to leave a resort property to do a happy hour. And it also seemed a disproportional amount of the daily activities were at the sister facility Casa Marina, ie happy hour, spa. I point out these inconveniences as constructive feedback for the resort. Being a Waldorf Astoria property, one would expert a higher, more consistent level of service. However, on a very positive note the pool and beach staff (particularly Ricardo and young blond guy, sorry I don't remember his name) were very attentive to our needs whether at the pool or the beach. They were always very friendly. The daily drink samples and popsicles were refreshing. All in all, we would certainly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “From the Front door to the pool [Si.. Ricardo]”
Reviews.Author: artnyit
Reviews.Content: Even though I had a short period of time to stay at the reach only 2 days and 1 nights but I was really great experience. I couldn't remember her name, the girl with the eyeglass who always opens the with her smile ALL THE TiME. A guy name Chuck from New Jersey who carried our bags with good attitudes [even just few conversation]. And lastly, our papichulo, mr. Ricardo who took a GOOD care of us whenever we spent time at the pool or beach. He's funny, friendly and we loved him. Though we got the room where way too far from the pool or lobby, but we liked everything that The Reach provided to their guest, amenities and service mind, etc. This was a our great experience in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “RElaxing, yet fun in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MWTRVLR
Reviews.Content: We spent an eight night stay at the Reach. Our room was clean, updated, and comfortable. The view we had of the beach and ocean was amazing, especially as the morning sun rose over the palm trees and the water. The housekeeping staff was very attentive and typically cleaned the room shortly after we left in the morning and then refreshed everything twice more each day. This was great because we often went to the pool and then returned to the room for showers before heading out to Duvall Street for the afternoon and again in the evening. The hotel is a short 2 block walk from the South end of Duvall Street and only 3 block from the Southernmost Point. With the island being only about 1-1/2 miles long up Duvall Street, we were able to walk everywhere. The fact that the hotel is a couple of blocks off Duvall and at one end of the strip we didn't hear the noise typically associated with the nightlife on Duvall Street. (We stayed out late, but not as late as much of the younger crowd - I used to be able to do that! LOL) The hotel had guests of all ages from families to Spring Breakers to middle-aged and older couples. The service at the pool was excellent and the entertainment by pool attendant Ricardo was a hoot! Drinks at the pool included gratuity and were competitively priced for a resort. We dined once in the hotel and our meals were very good. Again, pricing was competitive for a resort. In short, we'd stay there again, ad probably will return next Spring.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms with waterviews and balconies”
Reviews.Author: IronBird0
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Although its sister property next door, the Casa Marina, has a much more sophisticated feel to it, I thought this resort was great, too. I've stayed at both and I think the one big difference is that there seem to be more rooms with balconies at the Reach versus the Casa Marina where, although I was a Diamond member, I still got stuck in a small room overlooking the parking lot at the Casa. At the Reach, I was given a very nice room with an oceanview. I think the Reach does a better job at upgrading and accomodating guests. The Reach only has one pool compared to two at the Casa, but I think the beach area at the Reach is more accessible than the Casa, where you have to walk down a pier and step down a few stairs into the water. Our friend got stung by a man-o-war jelly fish out there at the Casa which sort of put a damper on her trip unfortunately, but that is besides the point. All in all, the Reach is very nice and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. Staff seemed friendlier here than at the Casa, although I was told they float between both resorts, so maybe I just caught some on a bad day (or bad week) at the Casa during my previous stay which warranted my less than positive review of the Casa. The only negative is the long walk down Duval Street to get to Mallory Square and where most of the action is. It's a nice walk, but it is a walk, so if you want to be in the middle of the action, but don't want to walk 20 minutes to get there - down Duval with shops and restaurants the entire way, then you might not want to stay at the Reach or Casa - or do what I did and grab a Margarita at one of the bars for the walk (they serve in to-go cups - you can drink out in public) to make the walk even more fun. But, if the long walk is not your thing, then you may want to stay somewhere like the Hyatt, which I have stayed at also and can't say enough good things about. I've stayed at the Hyatt, the Casa Marina and the Reach, and the Hyatt is hands down my favorite due to its location and also the warm staff. The staff at the Casa should take lessons from the staff at the Hyatt. Just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Ricardo!!”
Reviews.Author: Louisiana318
Reviews.Content: Ricardo took care of our every need!! He was friendly and we will definitely come back again. We hope to see him again next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great place.”
Reviews.Author: bkuhn1982
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Key West, and staying at the reach. This was one, wonderful hotel. From the moment we walked in the staff was friendly and helpful. We had a nightmare of a time getting to the island with delays in our flights do to bad weather in the midwest but that all melted away once we got to the hotel. Kristen got us checked in and was so nice and friendly it really got our stay started off on the right foot. In fact anyone we worked with at the front counter was very helpful, bill and Kellyon both were great to work with when we had question and were checking out. The reach has its own private beach which was beyond amazing. Being able to sit back and relax in a beach chair all day and have someone cater to your needs. Ricardo was amazing. Everyday we were down at the beach he was working which was fine by us. He had a great since of humor and was more than happy to help out in any way he could. If your lucky he will be working when your there to stay. The resort is beautiful very open air and takes advantage of the great Key West weather. We ate breakfast at the strip house each morning and enjoyed dinner there one night as well. I recommend trying the garlic toast with cheese fondue appitizer. It was so tasty. The neat thing about staying at this hotel was that you also get all the perks of there sister resort the casa m. My wife and I did a couples massage on the beach one morning and it had to be the most relaxing thing i have ever done. Lucy has magic hands by the way. The sound of the ocean was just the iceing on the cake for that. The location is great well within walking distance of anything you might wanna do, we rented a car and almost never used it. Would have rather rented a scooter or bike instead. All in all this was an amazing trip at an amazing location. I truely dont have anything bad to say about the reach or its sister resort. If you have the chance you should make the trip sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: VL199999
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort and its location. Far enough from Duvall that it's quiet and relaxing, but close enough that you can go eat and hit the bars. We rented a scooter not too far from the hotel and the entire week was a blast. Going to book again for 2011 (probably in April). The only caveat to my review is brace yourself for an additional little "resort fee"....I didn't realize when I booked the room that there would be a hidden charge. All in all though, the extra charge didn't detract and our vacation was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from the beach staff!”
Reviews.Author: JohnOdenbach
Reviews.Content: Went for a relaxing week and found it! Ricardo and Royan made our time on the beach comfortable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: thedone
Reviews.Content: we stay at the reach resort for five nights and we have a good experience white royan e give us the best pool side & beach services

Reviews.Title: “Richardo is AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: taylordseay
Reviews.Content: Richardo and Royan were AWESOME beach tenants!! They provided umbrellas and chairs, along with great conversation and humor. Richardo brought us popsicles, fresh fruit, sunglass cleaner, sunscreen...you name it, Richardo had it!!! The Reach is a great place to stay. They had a great beach and pool area, and the staff was great! Concierge is great, wish I could remember her name!! She gave us recommendations to some of the best restaurants in Key West, and coupons for wine and mimosas!!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: maggiedo1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a spring vacation. Usually choose Casa Marina, but it was booked for the dates we selected. Because the Reach is also a Waldorf, we thought it would be comparable. Unfortunately, we were very, very wrong. Upon check-in we were directed to our room on the 5th floor. After a long, convulted trip to the other side of the hotel, we finally located our room. The view of the ocean was amazing, the room was not. Very cramped with virtually no room for anything and we pack economically. Bathroom extremely small and fan did not work. We were able to hear people hollering, yelling and trooping around the halls all night long. I realize it was spring break time, but we felt a hotel that is a Waldorf, would have been quieter. The pool area was small and the service was not what expected. A definite lack of seating and umbrellas and the grilling we were put through just to receive a towel was rude and uncalled for. Additionally, we had to wear paper bracelets on our arms. Really?!! There were occasional free popsicles, but at the rate we were paying, I expected more and better service. Not everyone there was a 'spring breaker'. The restaurant itself was extremely overpriced and looked like an old-fashioned bordello; dark and all red velvet. Breakfast service was atrocious on the porch. The waitress actually told me to wait while she cleaned all the tables then promptly forgot I was there. When finally seated, it was a full 10 minutes before receiving any service. An atomatic 18% gratuity was added to the check! I never once saw the concierge at the front desk. Chuck, who worked the front door was our go to person for suggestions and helpful tips. He was the highlight of the hotel. As soon as we were able to secure a room at the Casa, we left this hotel. Very, very disappointed and will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the perfect location with very friendly service and special attention from our friend Ricardo.”
Reviews.Author: debbie30643
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort was just what we were looking for to enjoy a relaxing spring break for my daughter and myself. The location is perfect in that we could walk to attractions but didn't have to deal with the noise and hustle and bustle of Duval St. unless we wanted to. The concierge, Tara was very friendly and gave us great recommendations for dining and activities. She did an excellent job making reservations for us to go wherever we wanted whenever we wanted. Another great thing about The Reach is the beach where Ricardo is in charge and does a wonderful job taking care of everyone. He made us feel special and always wanted to be sure we were happy and had anything we might need from refreshments to clean sunglasses! He and Royan do a wonderful job! The Reach is where I will stay whenever I am in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Blondie3--611
Reviews.Content: The trip was fantastic because we have great service at the pool side with Ricardo.

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo IS THE MAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tmac1960
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay the first week of March. The pool and beach attendants,Ricardo & Royan, provided SUPERIOR service around the pool doing everything possible to make sure our needs will always met. Ricardo's humor and willingness to help our group can't be appreciated enough by our group. Thanks Reach Resort for a great time and you cannot imagine the true assets to your staff that Ricardo & Royan really are.

Reviews.Title: “Sun and fun in key west at the Reach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellen1502
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel . Great location.It is within walking distance to wonderful restaurants and Duval Street. Key West is very busy so be careful walking, biking or driving. Ricardo and Mark at the hotel provided excellent service during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and Indulgence in one place”
Reviews.Author: lshele
Reviews.Content: The Reach is a wonderful resort - great sized rooms, excellent views, restaurant/bar, great service. We were blown away by 2 special Reach employees: Ricardo, at the pool and Dan, the engineer sent to fix our fridge. These 2 gentlemen showed us "true Key West hospitality" and made our stay even more special. Ricardo brightened our day with his warm personality and vivid stories. Dan shared a wonderful local chicken shack with us which we visited twice and shared with several other guests. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Bachelotte Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: TravelersFromNJ225
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach for 2 nights with 2 rooms for my friend's bachelorette weekend. We drove down from Ft. Lauderdale, which was an awesome experience in itself seeing all the keys. The Reach was a great choice for us, we loved having drinks by the pool, they even came around with complimentary ice pops for everyone, which was really refreshing in the July heat! The staff, especially by the pool, were so friendly and accommodating. The room and bathroom were nicely appointed and very clean. Our room was located a bit out of the way, it was about a 7 minute walk from the lobby or pool, so it made us think twice about going to the room if we forgot sunscreen or anything. We were able to walk to dinner at Seven Fish and the southernmost point was a stone's throw away. It is quite a walk from Duval St., but the cab ride is reasonable. This hotel was a great choice for our needs and made for a memorable girl's weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: ashley_rawl
Reviews.Content: Everything was really great! Clean property and friendly staff. Ricardo and Darin out by the pool/beach awesome representative for the property. The only complaint would be the pool service for food and drinks. Very slow and unorganized, need to work on a system. Maybe, assigning zonesaround the pool etc. All in all though GREAT Trip. see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo and Royan were great!”
Reviews.Author: burtandsheila
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach Resort March 06 thruough March 10, 2010. The resort exceeded our expectations. Especially the service provided to us from Ricardo and his partener in service, Royan. Ricardo met as soon as we arrived the first day and made us feel like we were his only concern. I was amazed how he seemed to know when we would be going to the pool, beach or restraunt and made sure we had all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “service unsurpassed anyplace anywhere”
Reviews.Author: sgntzack
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week the first part of March with my wife for her birthday. the resort was everything we expected and the service was much more than expected. Our bed was one of the most comfortable away from home we have had. The beach and pool were dynomite...and the staff at them equally fun. the front desk agent, Reggie, was especially attentive. He delivered a gift for my wife's birthday and made every attempt to inform us about the area....thanks to him for the food choice on the big day!! I only wish my wife would stop with the comments about his great smile.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent not happy with service at all”
Reviews.Author: spetro85
Reviews.Content: I am a Travel Agent and travel frequently, I often will stay at one or more hotels so that I am familiar with the hotels that I send clients. I stayed at the BW Ambassador and then went to The Reach. Normally, I will stay at the nicer of the hotels last so its more of an upgrade. Well, in this case I should have reversed it. The Reach does not resemble a Waldorf property at all. The $25.00 resort fee is a joke, nothing at all special about this pool. Nothing. Oh, boy, they have a giant chest game...that was a lot of fun...woo hoo! Their beach is the size of a postage stamp. Come to NorthBeach in Racine WI....now that is a beach! They did make an error on my rate and had to go back and forth to get that straightened out...But, the absolute worst were the beds; both my husband and I had sore backs after sleeping in that torture chamber...The pillows were like rocks. I was very, very disappointed, and wish that we would have stayed at the BW Ambassador....I did try to talk to the front desk when I was departing to tell them about the service and the front desk was not interested in hearing. Too bad, I would think its better to handle an unhappy client at that time then to allow this to occur.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Modern Amenities, Pricey Extras”
Reviews.Author: Aimzhigher
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel, great location, close to quiet end of Duval Street. Lovely 30 mins walk to other end. Hotel room very small, comfy bed, great coffee machine and TV. Lovely shower, no bath. On 5th floor, had to wait a while for lifts and a good walk from lifts to room. Pool and beach nice. Restaurant expensive. Fitness room good. Can also use sister resort next door but one. Main negatives, poor maid service, crockery not washed, ice bucket not emptied etc. LOTS of additional fees...... $15 per day for self-parking, $20 per day for valet parking. $25 per day per room for resort fee (includes towels and Wi-fi - not sure what else!). This is bad enough but then taxed 12.5% on this (normally 7% in rest of Keys) and 22% tip when ordering food and drinks. All of Key West is expensive so be careful when buying goods. Check out Marios Buffet on Duval street - good value at $15 all you can eat if you fancy a cheaper night. Jet Ski tour round Key West is also great for $99 per Ski.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and affordable accomodations--just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: AD0427
Reviews.Content: The price was definitely right for what we got at the Reach Resort. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable and the view was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service. Rude Staff. Avoid The Reach.”
Reviews.Author: MaizeMae05
Reviews.Content: Check in was to be at 4 pm. We arrived at 3:40 pm. Room was not ready. Staff stated he had no idea when room would be ready. He took our cell # and said he would call. We went next door to the Southernmost hotel to have drinks and wait. By 4:45, I called The Reach and the room was still not ready. Same agent again said he had no idea when it would be ready. He offered us a different room that had a king. We declined because we wanted two double beds, which is what we booked. Then we went to the Reach at 5:15 pm. Room still not ready. Same agent was indifferent to the fact that we were still made to wait. We complained loudly and the manager was at the next computer and told agent to give us another room. Manager never even acknowledged us or apologized. When I pointed this out to agent, he angrily stated that he apologized once already over the phone. I cannot believe we paid over $300 for this service. We stayed at the Reach last year and it was nice. So we decided to return. But this service was unacceptable. The agent said the hotel was having difficulty flipping the rooms over quickly because they were booked 100%. This is a five star resort, for this much money, you should get your room at check in time. When we got to our room, we got a call stating that the resort fee would be waived. The resort fee is $25. When we checked out the next morning, only $12 was deducted. I didn't even fight it b/c I didn't want to deal with the severe attitude problem of staff at this resort. We will never ever stay at this resort again. I am extremely unhappy with the service we received at this resort for over $300. Stay away from The Reach. There are lots of hotels in Key West to choose from where you get better service and value. I also think it is ridiculous that you have to pay $15 to park your car in the garage at the Reach.

Reviews.Title: “No separate bathroom door”
Reviews.Author: mmpt_11
Reviews.Content: Despite the fact this was a fiftith wedding anniversary celabration, we would still like a door that separates the toilet and shower from from the bed. There was none when we asked to which rooms we were told all their suites were this layout and the staff was not helpful. The furniture was strange and the sofa spotted. We choose this hotel based on website pictures and Waldorf brand. Not having been in a Waldorf for a while this makes me think it's not what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to get away”
Reviews.Author: KnightPS
Reviews.Content: Overall the Reach was an excellent place to stay. It was a little pricey, but after walking around the island and seeing other hotels it was absolutely worth it. The private beach was excellent and we spent at least half of every day enjoying the sun, sand and ocean. The restaurant was ok, but not excellent. We ate most meals around the island away from the hotel. We arrived early on a Wednesday afternoon at the same time as several other guests and they were a little short staffed to handle us all at once, but that was the only negative thing I experienced. Excellent rooms, and friendly helpful service. It was a little older crowd, which was perfect for a relaxing stay, but if you are looking for action it is on the other end of the island. Also, it is right next door to Louie's Backyard, which is a great restaurant right on the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: galina14
Reviews.Content: Where do you want me to start? It is not Waldorf Astoria. It is a joke. Service is very bad. We booked yoga class for 8 people. They canceled because of weather but we were no notified about this. We were waiting in the loby. Next, we booked a spa. There is NO SPA. We had massage on a beach, ( that is not want we asked ). It was cold, windy. There is no placed to change. We had ocean view suite. Bedroom window facing a hall. TV was not working and it cost us 700 dollars per night. Do not waste your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and property - but tired”
Reviews.Author: Jasder
Reviews.Content: We go to Key West each year decided to stay on the quieter side this year - we normally stay on Mallory Square. We chose the Reach because of its location, brand and a restaurant we love "Louie's Backyard" is right next door. We checked in and went to our luxury oceanfront room - I was shocked - this is a Waldorf - windows were dirty, carpets stained, walls dirty, sofa torn, bent lamp shade...We rarely complain but we requested another room - and the staff were excellent in providing another oceanfront room in better condition. Also I found the elevator, doors and outdoor walkways dirty... On a positive note - pool area beach and views are beautiful - and staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “SLICE OF HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: cherrie2846
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to The Reach, but it absolutely won't be my last. I absolutely loved it - you will never find another place that offers such service. The staff cannot do enough for you. From the time we got there until we checked out it was like being in another world. The food and drinks were wonderful and if you even looked like you were not happy - they made sure you were!! I have recommended it to everyone I see and as of now - 2 weeks back one couple has made reservations and another is booking soon. I will be back myself soon.

Reviews.Title: “great location, wonderful service, rooms need updateing”
Reviews.Author: trekgirl3
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with a friend to Key West, and when we checked into the Reach Hotel, we found that all ocean view rooms only had king size beds, and we wanted 2 separate beds. The people at the front desk tried to help us find a room with a view we liked, so 3 different rooms later, we had a room that worked for us. We found the room lacked a dresser with drawers. They were very helpful in getting another piece of furniture. I must say for a 4 star hotel, the carpet and furniture needed updating. No towel racks by the sink in the bathroom and the furniture looked tired. Other than this, our stay was very very nice. The service was very good and the staff did try to please us. The hotel is in a great location, has it's own beach and only a couple of blocks from Duval Street. You also share the amenities with the sister hotel, the very beautiful Casa Marina. This hotel has 2 pools and a great view of the ocean. I would recommend this hotel to people, in spite of the furniture.

Reviews.Title: “they call this a Waldorf Astoria?”
Reviews.Author: BernieMaggie
Reviews.Content: What does the Waldorf Astoria brand, the finest in the Hilton family of brands, conjure up thoughts of? IMHO that would be attentive and elegant service with a consistent attention to detail, beautiful accomodations, and an atmosphere where the little things are naturally and seamlessly taken care of. The Reach is an older resort (from my understanding recently updated and remodeled) in a beautiful location, but I feel it should not be branded Waldorf Astoria. It doesn't deliver what one would expect from such a high end brand. Example: When we arrived, with bags, there was no bell service available, so that meant we had to drag our bags to the front desk. We put our bags in storage, awaiting the room to be made up. When we returned to retrieve the bags, the bell person asked us "Do you need anyone to take these bags to your room?" At a resort of this caliber, the question should have been, "may I take your bags to the room." This also would seem a better way to get a tip! We purchased one room type, which wasn't available, due to the resort changing room types the week we arrived, as well as some other details. We were surprised when the room we were given didn't resemble the one on the web site. In fairness, this was rectified by the personable front office manager, Jason, after a couple of visits. He lowered our room rate to what it should have been for a comparable room, at our request. We still would have preferred our desired accomodations, but this was a satisfactory resolution. There were other little things which I wuld have expected at a Waldorf...how about writing pads and pens in one's room? Headphones for use in the exercise room? There were other little things I could mention, but I'll leave it at that. I understand mgmt. wanting to outfit the hotel with the new energy efficient bulbs. Couldn't they have purchased the ones with frosted casing, rather than using the ones with the bare squiggly bulbs in the fixtures, including all recessed down lighting that I saw? To me, that's what I would expect in an economy to mid-range hotel, not a luxury resort. In short, a beautiful setting in a terrific location, but the resort itself could use some upgrades both in physical plant, and service.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heavan”
Reviews.Author: LuLu101_11
Reviews.Content: I have to say, I was a bit concerned when I left for vacation to Key West. I read on Trip Advisor about where I was staying "the Reach Resort" - and what I read was not very good. The people were very harsh with their reviews. When I checked into the hotel, for my 4 night stay, I expressed my concerns and I instantly was put at ease. It was a great place, the hotel staff was FABULOUS! (Tara, Doug and Royan) were wonderful. The location of the hotel was perfect and the grounds and rooms were clean, the service was outstanding and I am looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room - Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: ITravel286
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is in the perfect location. It has a great beach and is just a short walk to Duval Street. My room was a one bedroom suite with a full ocean view. The room was totally upgraded with both a tub and a shower in the bathroom. My balcony was large and had comfortable chairs to relax on. The pool was large and very clean with beautiful views of the grounds and the beach area. The common outdoor areas within the hotel itself need to be updated, but the rest of the resort was gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: barrera
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here - a bit on the expensive side, but nice hotel and facilities. Bit of a mix-up on check-in when room we were allocated was already occupied, but quickly resolved. Lovely breakfast, spacious room. V nice pool area and beach. Quiet hotel. Walkable distance to the Duval St attractions

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pool and beach”
Reviews.Author: julieboboolie
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, especially around the pool and beach. Within walking distance of Duval Street but in a quieter section of Key West. Beach and pool are very nice. Housekeeping could be better, our room wasn't cleaned until 3:30 any day we were there and could have been cleaner. Would I pay $350 for this hotel? No way. However, I found a great internet rate with a resort credit and was very pleased. I would definitely stay here again. Used room service for breakfast every day, good service, but the tray sat outside the door overnight. They also have a nice fitness center off the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Poor setup for families or handicapped (multiple outdoor hallways)”
Reviews.Author: bucketcat
Reviews.Content: The rooms are disappointly drab and poorly set up although the lobby is quite attractive. The long walk to the room(14 corridors) was not pleasant. Laundry carts are left out all day in the corridors. Is this a cleanly habit? Staff is helpful with opening doors. Overall, not attractive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a four star”
Reviews.Author: TravelHer
Reviews.Content: For a hotel carrying the Waldorf name this was pretty dissapointing. Felt more like a Comfort Suites to me and definitely seems more like a 3 or 3.5 star property at best. First off the service sucks. Staff was not on top of their game and besides not being helpful some of them were just plain rude - in one instance instead of offering a hand a pool attendant literally yelled at a guest for moving a small side table (that was not being used) closer to where they were lounging poolside. I could tell from when we arrived in our room the bathroom floor was not properly cleaned as there was hair and dirt on the floor. Manager response to complaints was that staff was "in training" - no apologies. Other little attention to details include carpet stains and scuff marks throughout the room - a simple carpet cleaning and a few paint touch ups could have made all the difference. This hotel has exterior corridors which means that the stairwells can be grubby at times with traces of litter. I became very familiar with the stairs as the elevator was out of service the entire 4 day stay. The exterior stairways and corridors also means that you have to dodge a lot of puddles if it rains and you will definitely get wet walking to the lobby area. The saving grace of this hotel is undoubtedly its location on its own private beach on the quiet side of Key West but close enough to walk or bike to Duval Street. With the $25 daily resort fee and $15 daily self parking however, you might as well bite the bullet and head next door to the Casa Marina which is the seemingly higher quality sister resort also with its own beach. Otherwise keep looking, there are many many hotels and BB's offered on the island of Key West. TIP: do have the concierge arrange the snorkelling cruise that departs from the Casa Marina dock at 11:30 and another departure at 3:30, a steal at only $30 per person and a fun crew.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, but worth the walk.”
Reviews.Author: KAllan07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reach Resort for 3 nights to celebrate my 30th birthday. We traveled with another couple and the resort was good to put us in rooms next to one another, which was fantastic. My husband and I have been to Key West 6 times and always stayed at the La Concha on Duval, but we were looking for a little more upscale and relaxing for this trip. Location: The Reach Resort is located on a beautiful private beach near the Southernmost Point. Since coming to Key West, I've always loved it except for the lack of adequate beaches and having the beach at the Reach Resort has completely changed my mind. The sand is soft and plentiful and the atmosphere is beautiful. It would make a wonderful location for a wedding - with the gorgeous pier. It is about a mile walk to "where the action is", but it is a nice walk to and from to work off the calories of the margaritas! Rooms: We had a suite and it was quite roomy and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had a stand-up shower and a tub/shower, which was a huge benefit to getting ready. There were two flat screen TVs, one in the bedroom and one in the living room and a nice wet bar area with a fridge. We did not have an issue but the couple we traveled with did find small ants in the wet bar area and the hotel accommodated them by moving and upgrading them to a new room. Pool / Beach: As indicated, the beach is wonderful. The staff will put out as many chairs as you need in any location on the beach of your choice. They had fun beach games to play and waiter/waitress service so all you had to worry about was sitting and relaxing. The pool is also nice, clean, and large enough to accommodate the guests. It was refreshing and is open at night. Restaurants: We never got the chance to eat at the Strip House, which is the restaurant on-site. We did order and split a sandwich while on the beach which was good. Prices are what you would expect for resort faire - be aware tha gratuity is always added to service by the pool and beach! Parking: There is ample parking if you have a car. They offer valet or self-parking with a difference in cost (I believe it is $20 for valet, $15 for self each day). The parking was a bit expensive, especially considering you pay a resort fee - but this is something I've seen in most hotels in Key West that have parking. Overall: I really enjoyed the relaxing feel of this hotel in Key West compared to our previous stays. The pool and beach atmosphere were perfect for a long weekend trip to ring in a new decade. The walk to and from Duval didn't bother us one bit and it even opened our horizons to different places such as the Rum Bar (a good place for a nightcap on the way home) and two great breakfast places. The staff was always friendly and the customer service was fantastic. I would absolutely stay at the Reach Resort again!

Reviews.Title: “I felt like it was a super expensive motel 6”
Reviews.Author: lm66349
Reviews.Content: So over priced for what it was. I felt like I was staying at a cheap motel because you entered from outside. The power was out almost the whole day we were there and they said it happened all the time. The only good parts were the breakfast potatoes and the beach. Next time we definitely won't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Jaxntomeats
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the resort is the location. Private small beach, chairs, umbrellas all included. The beach is really close and the drink service on the beach is awesome. The staff takes a day to warm up to you but then they are great. Down sides - rooms could be cleaner. Would we stay again? Yes. Oh yeah the drinks are good!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line Service”
Reviews.Author: monroviajudy
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is a fantastic place in walking distance to Duval Street. We arrived on Friday for my sister's destination wedding. The service is outstanding, from Front Desk, Pool Service, Bell Caps.. The staff is friendly and you can tell they like working at the Reach. The brunch selection is awesome, something for everyone no matter what continent you are from. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that was small but had a great view. I plan on visiting again, soon!! The rooms could use some TLC, and the cleaning staff need to vacuum, not sweep.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms overpriced - watch for extra fees.”
Reviews.Author: vlc401
Reviews.Content: Location is great, the staff are excellant. Our king suite was not what we would have expected for the price of the room. We had a problem with an ant infestions, but housekeeping immediately took care of it for us.The restuarant is over priced for the quality of menu item offered. We had much better meals off site. We were there during the boat races and the locaion was great for this, eveything is within walking distance or a short cab ride away. a resort fee is tacked onto your bill each day for the intenet services, fitness room etc and parking

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are not appropriate quality to the price”
Reviews.Author: Nelson_Mi
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed by the rooms at The Reach on our recent stay for New Year's Eve. The hotel is OK, and quite good in some respects. But at an inflated $700/night for the holiday we expected our Oceanview King Suite to be something special. It was not. The problem with the property is the rooms are very ordinary. Our first room 525 was really disappointing: the "suite" was an extra sofa, the room was small, and the view from our supposedly private balcony was way back in a U of other people's balconies. An ok $200 room, but not a $700 one. We complained and the hotel moved us to 543, a much nicer room with more of a separate sitting area and a terrific balcony. Still, way too expensive for what it was. The property is in need of renovation. Lots of mild disarray: grimy surfaces in the bathrooms, lights broken in the elevator, door hardware loose, muddy bocce court, bizarre bathroom layouts, saggy mattresses, worn furniture. The hotel design itself is unfortunate, a long string of rooms without enough elevators and some terrific rooftop terraces ruined by views of the air conditioning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. And the location at the south end of Duval is beautiful and pleasantly removed from the tourist bar scrum at the north end. I'd definitely stay and be happy if the place were reasonably priced. But we were looking for something really special, at an expensive price, and The Reach did not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great local, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellerTink
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I expected more after paying over Â£200 for one night here. My bed was badly dipped in the middle which meant I barely slept. I couldn't have done anything in the middle of the night, especially when I had two children already asleep. The bath had bad chips out of it- which made us feel as though we were staying in a Â£30 a night b&b!! When we arrived we had to clean some of the dirty marks off the door too! redeming features: fab location of the hotel with a nice little (it is very small) beach. The bellboy was really helpful- Chuck. The manager was brilliant though and I couldn't fault her response to the issues we'd encountered. Her name was Cindy, and was exactly how a great hotel manager should be! They gave us free breakfast and waived the resort fee. As I had been unable to sleep- they also gave us $100 back on our bill. She couldn't have done more. I'm sure other rooms are much better and I would pay etra to have a sea view next time- although the smell of the jet skis being filled up with fuel was stomach churning. We could smell it as soon as we went for the lift down. The rooms seemed to be arranged a la Hogwarts! - stairs going everywhere you look! Not sure whether I'd recommend this hotel but I don't feel I could damn it either on one experience, especially as the staff were so accomodating. I think if we had been staying longer they would have moved us.

Reviews.Title: “Gives Waldorf Astoria a bad name”
Reviews.Author: Babs728
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for the Christmas holiday. "Boutique" style sounded attractive, however there were no drawers to put clothes away, carpeting was filthy, and the "island view" was of the rooms across the courtyard from ours. The only restaurant on the property was ridiculously overpriced. One tiny trashcan in room. Not enough hangers in closet to hang everything up because, again, no drawers. CLoset was poorly constructed and clothes hung sideways in order to shut door. Hotel is "open style" which basically means every noise bounces off the cement outside walls. Door to room had huge gaps - shut and locked o.k. but noise and winds blew in all day and night. People that worked there were very nice, but it did not make up for the shabby, small, overpriced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?????!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker1488
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay even though the weather was horrible. The hotel is perfectly fin but what made our trip was the staff. From bellmen to house keeping, they were great. Absolutely outstanding was front desk and concierge. Tara went above and beyond to make our stay fabulous. She did everything she could to accommodate us. If she could only have turned on the sun.........

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and service need improvement”
Reviews.Author: marcel175
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife in early Dec. I must say that after booking it as a "Waldorf Astoria" property, we were very disappointed. The only thing that made up for it was the extremely generous response of the supervisor on duty (Jeanette) when we expressed our concerns the morning after our first night. We booked an "island view boutique suite", not the top but not the cheapest room available. It was one large, poorly laid out space, the couch a mile from the tv and very little counter space, no desk or table. The small closet was in the bathroom, no tub, the water took forever to get hot, there was dust in the air vents, cracked caulking around the sink, scuff marks on the wall, a chip out of the headboard. I could go on! When we came to the front desk with our issues we were reffered to Jeanette who was more gracious than one could ever expect. She not only offered to change our room, but actually came with us to look at options. We ended up in a 2 room oceanview suite. She also waived the resort fee for our entire stay and comped us for 1 bkfst. I almost feel guilty not writing a good review because she was so nice! But other members deserve to get the facts. To be honest, the new room had some issues as well, but after that kind of upgrade, we weren't going to complain. At least we now knew that the !st room wasn't an unusual, exceptional unrenovated room. The rooms really need some updating. The room at the Hampton Inn in Key Largo, where we stayed on the way down, was far superior to the rooms we had here! The cleaning of the rooms could be much more thorough. We attempted to get help from the concierge with mixed results. She was often not at the desk. The first time we saw her, it felt like we were annoying her with our questions, although she did warm up a bit with time. The maintenance and bellman staff we encountered were excellent. We thought the location was great, with access to the ocean and at the quiet end of Duval St. It is a bit of a walk to get to Mallory Sqr. As for the restaurant: We never ate there after looking at the menu. Who needs to spend $40 for a steak that doesn't even include side dishes? The only meal we had there was our comped bkfst. I actually found the restaurant a bit odd. It was called the Strip House and had vintage pictures of naked women with fully exposed breasts on the walls. I'm not a prude, but is that appropriate for the only restaurant at a full service resort? I hope no one with children goes there! We found the bkfst. to be extremely mediocre, especially considering the usual $18 + tax&tip cost. We thought there was a spa but it's actually at the neighboring resort and there, only on the beach. Since it was about 60 degrees when we were there, that doesn't work too well. So on the whole, I can't say I can reccomend this hotel, although I can't say where I would stay instead.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as I expected”
Reviews.Author: SeattleNoi
Reviews.Content: I booked a boutique ocean view room based on the picture on their website but when we got their the ocean view was rather partial. I also was surprised not to have a bathtub. The front desk staff was very cordial but I found that service was not what you would expect from a Waldorf Astoria Collection hotel. The staff knocked at our door at midnight to bring us blankets that we hadn't asked for and when they realized their mistake they didn't apologize. Overall disappointing. HOWEVER THE RESTAURANT WAS AMAZING. BOTH SERVICE AND FOOD WERE PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “Casual Elegance with great service”
Reviews.Author: Sheila0123
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is a fantastic place tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street but in walking distance of the action. The service is outstanding with attention to every detail. The staff is friendly and you can tell they like working and living in Key West. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that was a little small but luxurious. I would go definitely go back to this place!! Don't forget to check out the sister resort, Casa Marina for your spa treatment.. that was so relaxing!!

Reviews.Title: “THE location for a true vacation/getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: cahollis54
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach for three nights and four days. My husband and I have never been treated so well or had such a restful weekend. The resort is quiet and elegant. Spend a day around the pool and have four diamond care by Ricardo and his entourage. We will definitely go back. You can walk to the party or stay at The Reach and feel like you are in another world.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for both younger and more mature couples!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikkel0302
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious and reasonably priced resort. Registered guests have full access to the entire resort as well as the neighbouring resort. Wi-fi Internet, poolside towels and courtesy drink samples are offered free of charge. The hotel has a private natural sand beach and a private illuminated romantic peer, that stretches into the sea. A sister establishmen to the New York "The Strip" steak restaurant is located on the hotel grounds. Great but expensive breakfast buffet (although a seagul flew in and stole my croissant off my plate)... Hilton at its very best!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: sachet10k
Reviews.Content: From the time their pink and white shuttle picked us up at the airport, till the friendly staff opened the door to the beautiful resort everything was perfect!! Our Island View Boutique was lovely, we enjoyed our coffee/champagn breakfast on our balcony each morning. The pool and private beach was beautiful, we had our evening wine and snacks out on the terrace looking out at the ocean. The staff was very helpful in everything we needed from getting us a cab for dinner or giving us coupons to present for free cocktails and appetizers,etc at the restuarants.Just loved Cafe' Sole!The property is well maintained, clean, and just lovley.I cannot wait to return to this Resort, I just loved it!!! All the guests were super nice and layed back.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!”
Reviews.Author: MB4450
Reviews.Content: The Reach is a very nice hotel with an amazing view. The hotel has it's own beach and a very nice gazebo that goes out into the water. There is also a nice pool and restaurant...all with a view of the ocean. The rooms are very nice and the staff as well. The hotel has a very open feel to it, as only the office is in an enclosed building. So, since the weather is usually always warm and nice this is an added plus. The only bad thing is that it is sort of out of the way. All the excitment and touristy things to do are located on the other side of Duval so you will do a lot of walking. But to me this was fine since I knew I would be eating a lot I needed the exercise!!! To me a hotel is just for sleeping. I get out and about all day, come back get freshened up, then hit the streets again. This hotel was nice enough if you wanted to lay around the pool and beach you were laying around an extremely nice pool and beach. Defenitly consider this hotel in your options. And enjoy Key West!!! It is gorgeous and will feel like a second home!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy1318
Reviews.Content: We got away for a long weekend and used Hilton points to stay at The Reach. We probably thought we were staying at the Casa Marina, the larger property also part of the Waldorf Collection, but ended up at the quieter Reach. It is not a grand property but very well maintained and the staff was delightful. This must be a quiet time as they upgraded us to a nice suite which had a great balcony over the pool and ocean, lots of room, fridge etc. It was a quiet area (except for the many chickens that roam Key West and do get up early) We did not eat at the property - just the coffee shop for STarbucks each morning. The workout room was adequate and we used it each day as well. You can use any of the amenties at the fancier Casa Marina, so that is a nice option too. They have a lovely pool/beach area.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for Key West”
Reviews.Author: zebrazeb
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, with our little dog. Yes this is a pet friendly hotel, and the main reason we chose this hotel (I believe it was $125 for the stay for pet). Have to say I expected more for the price, but then again, it was Key West, and similiar to staying in Carribean island. The location is great, as it is on a small beach (not many beaches in Key West!). It is also on the South side of Deval street. Easy walk up the street to get to all the restuaurants, bars, etc. Deval is abouit a mile and a half long, so if you can walk this, it is a perfect hotel. Also tons of taxi's and bike taxi's everywhere. Do not like the hotel fees Florida resorts charge, but most do it, so I expect it. There had people on the beach to help you, and popsicles in afternoon, nice touches, to make up for resort fee. Also, do the self park, to save a few dollars. I drove 30 feet from front door to park. Hotel is an open hotel, in that all room doors are outside. This fits the casual idea of Key West, but will add a bit too room noise. The balconies are small, and some of the corners look into other rooms, because it is a U shape in places. Everyone at hotel was very friendly and helpful. Including the maintenance guys I walked by in the hallway, who helped me understand the expresso maker in the room. There is a starbucks, and rest/bar's at the hotel. Also at the end of street, is a little store. hotel was a bit hard to find, so be sure you take directions/map with you. I forgot mine, but figured Key Wset is small enough, and drove around the area a little until I weaved back and forth, and found hotel. It is hidden, and the end of a street. All in all, if you know what to expect from Key West (layed back, very casual), this may be the place to stay, if you want a liottle luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pamaha
Reviews.Content: All these negative reviews? I don't get it. No, it isn't a Waldorf "standard" but either is the price. We had a partial view boutique room - with an enormous balcony (about 10 x 20!) and it in fact did have a lovely view of the ocean, albeit in between buildings. But that was fine. The room was a good size, clean and comfortable. There is a nice seating area with flat screen TV - the sofa and chair were very comfortable. Also a kitchenette and a good sized bathroom with a very large walk in shower. Water pressure very good, shower amenities, standard. The pool area is nice (the pool was plenty big when we were there - but there weren't any kids, which helped) and there is a nice private beach beyond it. Towels are provided upon request. The resort and general area is very quiet (except for pressure washers on Sunday, which every hotel in the area were using - presumably ahead of the big Thanksgiving weekend), which was nice for a change in Key West. Yes, Mallory Square and most of the action is on the other side of the island, but it was never more than $6 to $8 buck cab ride out or back, and we never had a problem finding a cab. All in all we really enjoyed our stay and felt we got a very good bang for our buck.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: mab108
Reviews.Content: these three words sum it up in a nut shell. If you want to stay at an old, dirty, bug infested resort then this is the place for you. After arriving early, we were told that they would call us once the room was ready, 5 hours later still no call and then were told that they had the wrong number - this should have told us how the stay would be. Next, after spending our first night we woke up to see the entire edge of the room covered in tiny bugs, called the front desk and were moved to a different room then watching from our window saw another couple being moved into our old room. And the topper to all of this was spending $15 for what I can only describe as a piece of charcoal that they called a hamburger in the restaurant next to the pool. It looked and tasted like I took the sand from the beach and threw it on the grill. But have no fear if we ever forgot our way to our room we could follow the trail of empty glasses in the hallway the entire way. Thanks but no thanks Reach Resort I will be spending my money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend, unless....”
Reviews.Author: Cinnam0n
Reviews.Content: You get one of their dirt cheap rates otherwise you WILL be disappointed. We were going to stay at Casa Marina but they had sold out, so we chose their sister, The Reach and were beyond dissatisfied. We booked two nights at about $350/nt and were disappointed from the start. It started with the AWOL valet, then the bellman who put our luggage on a cart and left it in a hallway leaving us to lug it to our room ourselves. The hotel is old and dirty looking. My first thought was "Motel 6". Then, the room itself (a "boutique" suite) was equivalent to rooms I've stayed in for $100/nt. The room was probably clean, but the carpets were dingy, there were fingerprints all over the doors, bathroom was starting to show lots of wear and tear and the closet smelled like puke. Additionally, the hotel is very loud, you hear your neighbors and other hotel guests as they walk to their rooms. Service was poor at the bar and non-existent on the beach. Would I stay there again? No way, nor would I recommend it to anyone else. As a comparison we stayed several nights at the Fontainebleau in Miami Beach for about the same price and the experience there was 1000 times better!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Canuck2475
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time my wife and I have stayed at this hotel, the last two times in its Waldorf-Astoria incarnation. There is no doubt that we will stay here the next time we go to Key West. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I recommend spending the extra for a suite - we stayed in a "partial ocean view suite" it's worth it to have the bigger balcony and room to spread out. The beach is fantastic. Ricardo and Josias took excellent care of us during our stay (only 2 rainy days out of 10), setting up our chairs and umbrella and making sure that we were comfortable and had what we needed to enjoy the sun and sand. We didn't spend any time around the pool, but it was busy every day, and the water was crystal clear. The only caution is the cost of beverage and food on the beach. The first day on the beach, we ordered a couple of drinks and a serving of chips and salsa, and I was a little surprised to pay $10 for a frozen margarita. After that, we did what most other people did - brought our own munchies and drinks. If you do order something on the beach, note that they add an 18% "service charge" - aka "tip". Other than munchies on the beach and coffee in the gift shop, we didn't eat at the resort, so can't comment on the restaurant. We did find out that the restaurant is not owned by the hotel (a very talkative waiter delivering some room service clued us in). That would probably explain why sometimes room service trays stayed outside the room a little longer than they should have (not that the birds were complaining). Just a suggestion - when you're done with your tray, give the restaurant a call to pick up your tray.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a clean, relaxing vacation while in taking in Key West party atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: lebootresort
Reviews.Content: We have been to Key West a few times and stayed in neighboring resorts. They were fine but this year we decided to take in the Fantasy Fest. We arrived at Reach Resort to a smiling valet/bellman who guided us into the office. From that moment on, our experience was fabulous. The front desk staff was smiling and we were taken care of immediately and our room was ready. There was fruit and ice cold water with a mix of mint and cucumber waiting in the lobby at all times. I started my stay with a nice refreshing cup of the water. We went to our room and even though it was a city view room, we were pleased to see the ocean from our deck. Evertthing about the room was perfect and it inclued an expresso machine with complimentary coffee and a refrigerator. We went to the pool and had a great time interacting with the staff who took care of the pool and beach area especially Ricardo. We also ate at the Strip House next to the pool, oceanfront and had many drinks served by their barstaff while sunning. Again, all of the staff there was also great Laurie gave us a great suggestion for a seafood restaurant and again had that great personality like Ricardo, that makes a stay extra special. We extended our stay for two extra nights at Reach instead of heading to South Beach. We were sad to leave but even at checkout we were treated as though we were just arriving. Great place...management should be proud!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Sammibasil
Reviews.Content: My wife, a friend and I stayed at this hotel over the Fantasy Fest weekend and we loved it. The room, the service, the pool, beach and the restaurant "The Strip" were all great. It is nice and quiet enough to feel you're away from everything and yet close enough to walk to the hustle and excitement of Duval street. We felt we got a great value for our money and highly recommend the Reach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beach hotel but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: magtru
Reviews.Content: I don't really get all the horrible complaints or that the rooms are dirty. Here goes: PROS: Great neighborhood. You are close enough to the action on Duval St and it is a 20 minute walk to Mallory Square to see boats, sunsets and tons of tourists. But you are still in a quiet area on the beach. Key West is not a beach town. There are only a couple of hotels on the beach and the beach area is tiny. We found it clean unlike some people who said it was littered with seaweed and smelled. The hotel is beautiful inside and the grounds are well kept. The pool is an average size and found it pretty quiet maybe because we were there in January when kids are at school. The service was decent but not great. Our room was clean and was a wheelchair accessible suite. At first they gave us the wrong room with one bed but after a phone call they accommodated us quickly to a bigger room with two beds. They even lowered the bed for me since it was too high for a wheelchair disabled user. The steak restaurant in the hotel was very good. I love the 1930s red speak easy decor. It reminded me of restaurants in NYC. It was a very pricey meal but quite good. The place was empty on a Sunday night. The restaurant has big windows that open out and you can smell, see, and hear the water. It is next door to Casa Marina which I think is its sister resort. It is more beautiful and has a bigger beach. I think we will stay there next time. You do not need a car in Key West. That was our biggest mistake. You can walk anywhere on foot. If you don't feel like walking they have cabs and trolleys. If you want to venture outside of Key West then rent a car. The airport has cabs to take you into Key West and the ride is quick. There are tons of water excursions you can do without having to rent a car to get to them. The restaurants are outstanding and it is a "foodie's paradise." People are laid back and the vibe is warm and hospitable. I have never felt so relaxed. I laughed when I read a few people complain about "homeless people." Get over yourself. Two homeless people are not a threat. Move to NY to experience true homelessness. CONS: We drove up to the valet and we asked where the disabled parking is. It was all the way in the back and after unloading and trying to find the lobby from that point was a nightmare. The signage was terrible. The place is quite big and circles and circles forever before you see a sign to the lobby. From that point to finally getting up to our room was exhausting. Hilton needs to have better wheelchair parking and have the valets follow people and help them. Next, the stupid parking fee and resort fees. I knew what they were up front but I hate them none the less. These costs should be factored in. I hate being nickel and dimed. We didn't even use the pool, gym or beach so why did I need to pay the resort fees? I should have contested them since I am disabled and couldn't use all the facilities. Overpriced. For $300 a night the service could have been better. People were nice but I expected a bit more. I did not find anyone rude like many people said. Conclusion: We like this hotel but we will stay at the Casa Marina or a few other local ones. I wanted a hotel on the beach and this one is lovely but for the same price I could stay next door and have a nicer hotel. I love the location of this hotel and you are near everything. Please Hilton...lose the resort fees. They are ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Staff that went above and beyond, beautiful location & great accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: sjsent01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for 5 days during the off season. Rich, the front door person found us on the beach when we had an overnight FedEx package delivered when all we asked was for him to call our cell! It was a replacement insulin pump, we spoke with him before the delivery, he knew how important the package was so he went above and beyond the call of duty. A true asset to The Reach. Chris and DJ from Barefoot Billy's on the beach were wonderful! I went into the ocean with my insulin pump on, stupid me, and Chris whom works as an EMT made sure I ordered a new pump and that I knew where the nearest hospital was. Chris and DJ kept checking on me to make sure everything was OK. This was all above and beyond making sure our day at the beach was wonderful with chairs, towels and refreshments! The room was clean and recently renovated with a comfortable bed and nice furniture. We can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: dnasb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the reach for two nights in October, It is close to the main street and it has a nice beach the pool is rather small.Guests at the reach get to use the beach at the Casa Marina as well. The pools there are nicer and the security is much better as well.The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. I had an issue that I wanted to discuss with the manager and the lady at the front desk would not call her to speak with me I also ordered a drink at the beach and was shocked at the $17.50 charge for one Pina Colada. I will most likely stay at the Casa Marina next time I go to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was AMAZING, HELPFUL and Top NOTCH!!”
Reviews.Author: SOGGYDOLLAR42
Reviews.Content: I would like to openly thank the staff of the Reach Resort for helping my friends and I have a wonderful trip! You'll read many reviews on TA about how wonderful the beach and hotel are, and all of those things are true., but the staff was wonderful too. If I could I would have a bag of beignets waiting for the morning shift every Monday through Sunday! Thanks Again REACH STAFF and Management!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Minute”
Reviews.Author: HeatherNW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 5th anniversary. We got married in Key West and have stayed many places. This time we decided to try somewhere new. The Reach was awesome. The view was beautiful. They sent us chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary which was a nice surprise and very thoughtful. Little things mean alot to us. The staff was very friendly. We went to the beach several days and Ricardo remembered us each day. He went out of his way to make sure our stay was enjoyable. Thanks to the Reach for a great trip. :)

Reviews.Title: “At the other end of Duval--nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: MisterSteveB
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to unwind. It is at the other end of Duval--far away from all of the normal tourist stuff. It also claims to be the only hotel that has a natural beach that extends into the ocean--which was a nice plus! We spent an afternoon on the beach with bar service and really enjoyed the time. We had chairs and an umbrella--perfect to do nothing. We arrived in the morning around 10 and there weren't many people there. We did walk by a different day later and heard people were upset that they were out of chairs/umbrellas (so go early). Also we had great drinks from the bar at first and then the bartender changed--to someone who though putting the whole lime in the blender made drinks taste better. Normally I'm not one to send a drink back--but I did and it was promply made--sans whole lime. Bottom line--great place to stay and if something isn't right they will fix it promptly. Also when you check in--check for the "Key West Channel". Take the time to watch it--we found a neat little place next door called Louies backyard--and you will miss it if you don't know to look for it :) We didn't watch until the last day so we almost missed out...

Reviews.Title: “My dream wedding turned into a chaotic nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: beachfan123
Reviews.Content: I was married at The Waldorf Reach Resort here in Key West Florida on June 26th, 2010. My family has lived in Key West for 25 years and my husbandâ€™s family has resided here for several generations. I wanted to write a letter to express my unhappiness at The Waldorf Reach Resort and Striphouse from my event. This is not a short story but yet a long story of what I personally and my family went through. Iâ€™m writing this letter to have some closure with all the feelings I have. Iâ€™m writing this letter to the people with who The Waldorf Reach Resort & The Striphouse have to answer to. Iâ€™m writing to those people, the ones that think everything is perfect and everyone is doing their job to the best of their ability at this resort and restaurant, because thatâ€™s just not true and itâ€™s not fair to have worked so hard and planned and spent so much money and time to have these feelings. Being a Key West local, operator of a Key West restaurant and associated with more than 300 weddings per year I thought it imperative that I write this letter. My family & I started looking at location in January of 2009. We looked at everyplace in town and I was in love with The Reach. The Gazebo was perfect and I loved the idea of setting up a tent on the beach for a reception directly after the ceremony. You see we offer similar things here as far beach weddings and receptions. However, I was not thrilled to get married where I spend every waking moment. I wanted someplace special. I wanted a place that offered what I offer and could deliver what exactly I wanted. I started speaking with Luke Vossen, Sales and Operations Manager, January 12, 2009. I explained what I was looking for: ceremony in the gazebo, a tent on the beach for reception afterwards and a customized menu. We went back and forth through email for a few months while he discussed with his bosses. He came back April 3rd, 2009 and said it was a go if we could start set up at 8am the morning of the June 26th, 2010 and break down immediately after. I was ecstatic; my dream wedding was going to come true!! I signed a contract with The Waldorf Reach Resort & The Striphouse on April 16th, 2009. We are all in the same business here in Key West and I soon heard through the grapevine that Luke was leaving. The last time I spoke to Luke was July 24th, 2009 he gave me Cheryl Kahn-Brocco email address if I needed anything or had any questionâ€™s to contact her; she was based out of The Waldorf in New York City, which I have been to several occasions and actually had a phenomenal brunch with my family there one year. I did contact Cheryl a few times regarding alcohol packages and menus. She got back to me quickly and with the requested information. September 17th, 2009 Cheryl emailed me Heidi Greenburgâ€™s contact information and told me she was the new onsite contact that would replace Luke Vossen. My event was not until June 26th, 2010, I did not have the need to contact Heidi until I finished my menu. I secured other needed vendors, tent rental, photographer, flowers, specialty linens, DJ, etc. March 1st, 2010, I completed my menu and emailed it over to Heidi with a cc to Cheryl. It took 2 months to get something in writing from the Striphouse regarding my menu. Getting closer to my event my mother & I went by introduced ourselves to Heidi and walked around the venue, going over set up & looking at hotel rooms for our guests. May 18th, 2010 I met with Heidi and I brought the local tent rental owner with me. You see I am a wedding planner at my familyâ€™s beach cafÃ© and I understand there can be surprises. However, I wanted to make absolutely sure there would be no surprises because I could not be a bride and a wedding planner on the day of my event! So I put Heidi and the party rentals owner together. The three of us walked the site, talked it all throughâ€¦..so there would be no surprises when the party rental showed up at 8am with tent in hand. Ha! About two weeks prior to my event, my mother, me and a close friend whom is also a local business owner came over to The Reach and drew a layout on paper so all the vendors had a picture of the event I was trying to create in their hand. My mother gave Heidi a copy of the layout that day, I will attach a copy. In my mind everything was golden. I had a fabulous menu, great bar, beautiful tent with special lighting, beautiful tables! Everyone is local we are all friends we do business together all the time The Waldorf Reach Resort & The Striphouse have approved everything, we are all on the same page! Right?! No, Wrong!!! June 24th, 2010 * Day Rehearsal I had hired a close friend of my Julie Shreck-Fuhrman with Simply You Weddings to help me with day of coordination. On the day of the rehearsal Julie directed an entire run through of our event, Heidi was present at this rehearsal. Everything went fine. June 26th, 2010 *My Wedding Day! 8:00am With a preauthorized plan the tent rental company arrives. They are immediately held up by Heidi and told they have to set up on the opposite beach which at this time is underwater!!! Four hours later Kevin Speidel, General Manager for The Casa Marina & Reach Resort, totally unaware of our wedding and our plans that have been approved by The Reach and Striphouse. Kevin shows up at The Reach resort at 1:30pm and tells my vendors that they can absolutely NOT set up a tent on the beach. Not knowing what else to do, my friend, my wedding planner, totally distraught shows up at my motherâ€™s house at 2:00pm.
