Please picture thisâ€¦.You are the bride surrounded by your family and bridesmaids. You are drinking champagne, celebrating this joyous occasion. Everyone is getting their hair & make up done, taking picturesâ€¦.CELEBRATING! Poor Julie knocks on my motherâ€™s door and takes her outside to talk and tell her they wonderful news! "Kevin Speidel & The Reach cancelled your tent! Nothing is set up and your daughter's wedding starts in exactly four and a half hours with 90 people attending." Can you even imagine that scenario? I notice my mother outside talking to Julie and I walk out to there to hear whatâ€™s going on. I knew it had to be something big because Julie can handle almost anything. As Julie tells me the story of the day, I get nauseous! To the point I start drinking pepto bismal on my wedding day, thank you Kevin, Heidi & The Reach! What a fantastic memory. At this point, my mother has to get dressed and go down to The Reach and sort things out. Can you believe this? My mother in the middle of our celebrating with champagne, hair, makeup, her first daughter getting married she has to leave to go sort out this CLUSTER! My mother meets Kevin Speidel and begs him not to do this and he relents, thank goodness and my mother is back home forty-five minutes later. So now we have exactly four hours to set up a 30 x 50 tent and $10,000.00 worth of lounge furniture, specialty linens, specialty chairs, extravagant centerpieces, etc. What a nightmare. My vendors are scrambling all over the place trying to get this done. What really upsets me is nobody from the Reach is helping them. You have this huge resort, that has a huge staff, and THE REACH has caused my team to be delayed 6 hours! You would of thought they could have pulled people together to get this done. Why did they not help out? I donâ€™t understand? If I did not have rent specialty linens they would have set up white linensâ€¦why could they not put linens on the tables? Or put the chairs around the tables, or help with furniture? Why why why? It absolutely makes my stomach turn to have such a plan turn to crap because a â€œfamous resortâ€� cannot get it together or communicate with each other. 6:00 pm On my invitations my guests were told to arrive promptly at 6:00pm for a 6:30pm ceremony. My guests arrived and 60% of my event was set up. At this point my guests were all waiting in The Striphouse bar, from what my Aunt has written to me. There was no â€œReachâ€� point of contact. The bartender described by my guests, male, dark hair, was telling people who requested a glass of water â€œthat they were not serving water today.â€� Just out of curiousity, those of you that are reading my letter, have you ever heard of a Waldorf Resort â€œnot serving water todayâ€�. I find that pretty unbelievable. Iâ€™ve planned a $60,000 + wedding and the bar will not serve my guests a glass of waterâ€¦WOW. Just a FYI, I was told by numerous guests how rude this bartender was to them. Why? Why was he so rude? I know my family was tipping him? Why? I donâ€™t get it? 6:20pm Everyone was directed by my wedding planner to the Gazebo and seated. 6:30pm I pulled up with my parents and my wedding party in a limo and we all jumped out. Only to be told sadly that we were not ready. So we all got back in the limo and sat there for 20 minutes. Then my planner came and got us. We unloaded the limo and lined up on the side of the Striphouse and waited another 15 minutes. While we are waiting Iâ€™m watching my vendorsâ€¦let me say that againâ€¦my vendors scramble with linens and equipment and centerpieces. Heidi was there and 1 guy from The Reach helping. So, the Reach & The Striphouse delayed my set up by 6 hours and then they only have 2 people helping. From what I was later told they did not do anything except set up the bar and put out some linen. I started my processional at 7:15pm, forty-five minutes late. I had planned (for a year and a half) to walk by the tent and see everything set up & ready. This is why I chose the Reach & The Striphouse, I felt confidant that Luke could make it happen. He saw the vision. Well let me tell you, my father and I walked up and stopped at the tent and looked at it. The chairs were still in a pile, the linenâ€™s werenâ€™t on the tables the centerpieces were in a pile, the dÃ©cor was laying in the bushes, but I have to say this â€œthe bar was set upâ€�. I continued my processional to the gazebo where my fiancÃ© and my Pastor were waiting. Julie, my wedding planner, could not attend the ceremony she had to stay and set up everything that The Reach & Striphouse Staff could not. Because of this, the microphone that was rented for the ceremony, so my 90 guests could hear the beautiful ceremony that my fiancÃ© and I worked on for months could not be found. (we later saw it in the corner, but who knew?) So, only the first two rows (30 people) could actually here the ceremony. Very sad. Ceremony was complete at 7:45pm. We took 30 minutes worth of family pictures. (a little rushed since we are 45 minutes late) then at 8:15pm my husband & I with our two photographers took off in the limo to Fort Zachary Taylor State Park to take some sunset photos. We did not return until 9:00pm. By this time everything looked beautiful. My husband and had 2 hours to greet all of our guests, have our first dance, cut cake, etc. Nobody in my entire wedding party got to eat dinner because it was so rushed. I never even got a chance to sit down. I did have a few appetizers when we were taking pictures and the food was excellent. Absolutely excellent! All of my guests raved about how wonderful the food was. It far exceeded my expectations. However, when we asked if we could get boxes to go, just for the wedding party we were denied. Which is unheard of, at our events we always set 3 bags aside for the bride and her family at the beginning of the event. As for my husband and I we went through thru at Miami Subs. I ate a philly cheese steak in my $5,000.00 dress on my wedding day. HA! My parents purchased a very special case of Moet Imperial Champagne that was supposed to be set up at my table for my wedding party. Instead Heidi used this champagne for my champagne toast and never even chilled it. This interesting because I tried to cancel the champagne toast for the event. I have found with our events people donâ€™t even drink the champagne they usually toast with whatever they are drinking. Last year, I planned a surprise 50th Birthday Party for my mother at Atlantis in the Bahamas and paid extra for a champagne toast that nobody drank. So when I asked Heidi if I could cancel the toast 1 month prior to the event she said no. So in actuality I paid for champagne toast and provided a case of my own champagne! And it was warm! Lastly, promptly at 11:00pm we had to leave. Even though weeks earlier we tried to extend for an extra hour and I had it in writing from Luke Vossen that we could for a fee, we were denied. We all stood and watched as one male staff member, blonde with a pony tail started clearing tables. Let me explain to you how he cleared up the tables before my mother and my friend who owns the specialty linen store stopped him. He threw the centerpiece on the ground, took the 30 inch mosaic mirrors that were rented, through them on a table behind him and proceed to take the chocolate satin linen with the gold beaded overlay and all the plates and silverware in the middle!!! Do you understand he bunched the linenâ€™s up with plates and silverware still inside!!! When my mother tried to stop him, in front of my planner and numerous friends, he started to swear at her!! $60,000 Event and I have a staff member in my motherâ€™s face swearing at her. Julie, my wedding planner immediately went and got Heidi. My friend and her boyfriend started breaking down my tables, so the linenâ€™s and the equipment rentals wouldnâ€™t get ruined. I do not know if this employee was reprimanded or not but as a small restaurant owner I am very embarrassed for the Striphouse. I cannot imagine one of my staff members cursing at the Mother of the Bride at one of our events. That incident is remarkable! Overall, because of and only because of my friends and my vendors my event was a success. However, it still breaks my heart to think about everything my family went through to make this event happen. Why could we not start at 8am like we were supposed to? Why did Heidi stop us? How could the GM Kevin Speidel pull the no tent card 4 Â½ hours before my wedding started? How could no one at The Waldorf Reach Resort know that there was a lunar high tide and try to move us to the beach that would be underwater? How come no one at The Striphouse communicated our event to the GM? Why was The Reach staff so incredibly rude to my guests? How can you not serve a glass of water at a restaurant? Why did the wedding party not get to take a meal home? After the time was taken away from us on such a memorable day, we should have been given meals to take home. We should have been granted more time even without music. The Reach Staff and Striphouse staff should off joined forces and made this event happen gracefully and they should have been overly nice. It was a wedding! I needed to write this letter to have closure, because all of this unfortunate stuff cannot be changed. I cannot go back in timeâ€¦.this was my wedding day. My friends and family all describe this event as, â€œintimate affair, full of genuine love and natural beautyâ€� I need to remember that and that June 26th, 2010 was happiest day of my life. However, in reality The Waldorf Reach Resort and The Striphouse caused a lot of unnecessary stress and anxiety. The Waldorf and The Striphouse let me down and for the amount of money we paid it is absolutely ridiculous. I believe we are owed compensation for this event, if not 100%, it should be significantly close.

Reviews.Title: “A great property with breathtaking views of the sunrise and sunset”
Reviews.Author: lmheick
Reviews.Content: The hotel is slightly off the beaten path at the opposite end of where all of the "action" was but was exactly what myself and my newly acquired fiance was looking for as we wanted some peace-and-quiet! We actually preferred the walk to the the bars, restaurants and nightlife and when we wanted too, had the bicycle taxis ride us back and forth. Very nice pool area and beach and the staff was very accomodating with setting up chairs and towels for you. Although the prices were very high for drinks at the pool, it wasn't a surprise as most resorts are like that. The room was very clean, nice and the bed was super comfy. The best part of this resort was that we were able to go out onto the pier and see the sunset as well as the sunrise. It was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Key West Haven”
Reviews.Author: BigAppleGal
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights here with my fiancee in April. Although we travel a lot, we had never been to Key West before and did not know what to expect. Friends had told us that the town has great Bed and Breakfasts, but we wanted something a little more upscale since we were celebrating our recent engagement. The Reach Resort was absolutely perfect! Elegant, clean hotel with very friendly staff and luxurious feel. It has the only natural beach on the island, and though it's small, it is really nice and private. The buffet breakfast were wonderful! The veranda overlooks the beach and the food was excellent. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk away from the main street of the island, but we liked the fact that it was a little more quiet, but still within walking distance from all the bars, restaurants and shops. I fell in love with the friendly, laid back atmosphere and the coziness of Key West, and if I ever get a chance to go back, I'd definitely stay at the Reach again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location and great views”
Reviews.Author: 8lettersuk
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort was lovely and obviously has been refurbished recently. Service was excellent although we stayed out of season so there weren't many guests. Our room had great views and was a nice size with couch and chair for lounging and relaxing and balcony overlooking the resort and beachfront. Food and drinks were a little expensive and when you add in service and the $25 a day resort charge it all adds up. It's well located close enough to the nightlife without having to deal with the noise ;-) I'd definitely recommend the hotel but I'd suggest if you want a romantic meal that you go to the sister hotel as dining on the beach at Casa Marina Resort was much more romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: hlibebe
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice (not over the top, but nice.) Bathroom was clean and had a great Florida vacation feel to it ( I love the Florida vacation feel.) The pool and private beach was great! The private pier/gazebo gives the scenery a nice touch. Staffing was friendly enough. You're close to Duval Street but set far away enough to give you that bit of a retreat feel. Only downside was on the day we left. The ONLY elevator available was down for maintence. So, we carefully wiggled our luggage from the 3rd floor down the narrow staircase to the parking garage on the 1st floor. Please also note there is an internet access fee as well as $15/day parking fee to park under the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “How this hotel is part of the Waldorf...”
Reviews.Author: DCGirl924
Reviews.Content: How this hotel is part of the Waldorf brand I have no idea. It was falling apart, literally. Rust everywhere. Our shower leaked into the the hallway of our tiny room. The bathroom could fit 1 person in at a time max. The restaurant was subpar at best. The beach and pool areas were nice and the service wasn't bad, but the housekeeping was so LOUD in the hallways and you can hear everything. How this resort got any diamonds is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, friendly staff, everything you need at your fingertips!”
Reviews.Author: Sahalee5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our 5 night stay at the Reach Resort. Beautiful, relaxing atmosphere with its very own beach. The manager, Clay Phillips was excellent, friendly and gave us alot of helpful information!! Highly recommend staying at the Reach!! Love Key West!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was great except.”
Reviews.Author: beverly4099
Reviews.Content: Everyone was great except the front desk Support Staff. We booked early for bike week and wonder why we were placed at the far corner of the hotel with a view of neighboring roofs and garages. This will turn out to be a good location to watch the Swat Team. We had two incidents at the hotel and both times the front desk did not handle the situation at all. The first was: I reported I had bites on both ankles after my first nights stay. They inspected the room and all the bedding. They assured me the bites were not bed bugs. They said, â€œ it might be from ants.â€� Who cares what it is. Just clean the room. They assured me the room would have all the bed linens replaced. I returned to the room and noted the sheets had not been changed. I did have more bites our last night. The second situation: I returned to my room and was met by two members of Key West's Swat Team with Rifles In Hand. They shooed me into my room and said, "Donâ€™t come out of your room". I called the front desk and they did not know the swat team was on the hotels grown. They agreed with the swat team and said they would call me when I could leave my room. We watched the police cars from or room patio. When the police cars drove off I called the front desk and asked if I could leave my room. After 13 rings, no one answer the phone. The hotel was locked down for 45 minutes and the front desk never did call me.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: KenH8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is placed directly to own private beach. Breakfast on terrace with wiew to the sea and pool. Fantastic hotel. Super rooms big, clean and nice. Very friendly staff. Nice pool with free sunbeds and towels. Do you want to go to rhe beach just say so to the staff and your get a sunbed there also with towels. Placed close to "where it all happens" Duvall Street. Roughly 15min walk to harbour and Sloppy Joes bar. Expensive but value for money if you want to spoil yourself this hotel is definately worth visiting, but take care this you might get addicted to it.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: amdealba
Reviews.Content: It is an embarrassment for Hilton and the "Waldorf Astoria Collection" to place this property in this category. Although it is obvious that the rooms have been updated to reflect a new ambience, the condition of the rooms is very poor and generally in very sad shape. When I made my reservation I was told that the hotel had "recently" had a $35MM renovation, but the furniture and rug was worn out and mostly stained. The worst part is the building itself! It is sub-standard, dirty, and generally a very unpleasant place to be in. The puddles of water collecting mosquitoes on a daily basis, the cigarette butts all over the floor every where we walked, and the filth on the stairwells is beyond words. This property is not worth the money we paid ($300/night), in fact, compared to the property next door (the Santa Maria) we felt we were being robbed by the Hilton. To boot, the service was awful, rude staff, lazy and uptight. The Reach Resort is more like a cheap motel with grandiose aspirations AND it is certainly not worthy of the prestigious designation of ANY Collection. Shame on Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “OMG You must be Kidding me”
Reviews.Author: rokitrik
Reviews.Content: My wife booked a surprise 10th anniversary trip to Key West as we were married in Key West 10 years ago and love the island. She picked the Reach - Waldorf Astoria as you would think Waldorf - WOW. Well it was Oh My God I can't believe this dump. The staff was completly stoic and uninterested in dealing with us. We paid for a Ocean View room ($350/night) and they gave us a room looking over the parking lot on the street side of the hotel. They refused to compensate for this. I have had nicer rooms at the Holiday Inn then at this place. Limited ammenities in the room. The web site states a desk in each room, there was not even a chair in the room to sit on. We requested a desk and chair and they said" we don't have any desk or chairs and we know our web site says we do but we don't" The room was fairly unclean when we did arrive and had to demand that the room be cleaned properly. We requested to talk to the manager and was told none was available and one would call us. Well here we are 3 weeks later still waiting for a call. The have jetski rentals on the beach here and it is right next to the outdoor restaurant, bar and pool. Guess what happens when they fill the jetski's 3 times a day with gasoline? Pool, Bar or restaraunt has a strong smell of gas for about a half hour long. Food at the restaurant..... $70.00 for a hamburger and fish sandwich with 2 ice tea's. We did get a complimentary plate of Chocolate covered strawberries and a nice note from the hotel, in our room wishing us a happy anniversary. Well done effort however the empty plate sat in our room for 2 days and outside our door for 3 more days. All in all very poor service, attentivness and atmosphere. Oh and the free in room wireless internet service cost you $25.00 per day. Stay at the Southernmost on the Beach right next store ( this is where we stayed when we got married and several times since). I would never recommend or stay at a Waldorf Astoria property in the future, the bar has been set by this property and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: lizziebill
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we were only able to stay one night at this awesome hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, and upgraded us to an ocean view despite being nearly fully booked. The rooms were comfortable and clean with only one complaint. More air-conditioning please. We never uncomfortable, but could have used a little better air flow. Of course we were in Key West, and warmth, especially in summer is to be expected. All in all an excellent stay, and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GET MARRIED HERE!!! HEIDI IS TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bestie4
Reviews.Content: To those happy couples looking to get married here....DON'T. Heidi, the woman in charge of putting together the weddings is unorganized, unprofessional, unreliable and is a LIAR. The couple I know arranged a meeting, traveled to Key West from quite a distance and made arrangements for their ceremony on the pier. There was a verbal and email confirmation, but no written agreement sent from Heidi. After waiting for the agreement to arrive the couple called to find out that HEIDI had given the ceremony site to the next highest bidder!!! She CLAIMED to have left a voice mail (LIE) and informed them that the site had gone to another couple who were also holding their reception there. YOU DO NOT MAKE ARRANGEMENTS AND THEN BACK OUT! YOU DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT GIVE AWAY SOMEONES CEREMONY SITE!!!! SOOOO unprofessional and inconsiderate. RUDE and TERRIBLE is all I have to say about the hotel management's response to the issue. DO NOT GET MARRIED HERE. DO NOT WORK WITH HEIDI!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for location & accommodations”
Reviews.Author: DebbieAdkins
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice but overpriced for location. Several things were not working properly in the room, and we got a "special" rate and were put at the farthest corner of the hotel when most of the rooms were vacant. The view for a price of $220 a night overlooked someone's garage and roof. For the price we paid, I was totally disappointed. Perhaps we paid for the name rather than the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC Pool & Beach!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKimberlySmith
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just wonderful. We stayed here for our honeymoon and arrived right after a huge rain storm! The second day, when we were able to actually use the pool and beach, we were so pleased! D.J. and Tom bring over towels and beach chairs and put up umbrellas willingly and are probably the best of all of the service staff that we encountered in our entire trip. With the exception of Petra, most of the other wait staff did exactly that: made us wait and wait for everything. The food and drinks were excellent though(for a high price), so waiting was okay with us. Petra was our server for a few days and she was wonderful, personable and definitely worked very hard. Our room was cleaned daily and we even used the laundry service once. Though expensive- it was nice to have a clean dress to wear to dinner just a few hours after coming back from the pool.The bed was comfortable, and we had a beautiful view from the 5th floor. Turn down service is available, if you request it. The concierge was wonderful- with many ideas for things to do if we wanted to avoid the hustle and bustle of Duval Street. The front desk staff was friendly and wonderful. This is a beautiful hotel with a great beach. If you stay here make sure to say hello to Tom and D.J.- and give them a nice tip- They're the hardest working people at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Crypooley
Reviews.Content: We usually don't spend this much on hotel but it was our honeymoon so we did! So totally worth it! We had an ocean view room with a balcony! Service was excellent even tho we arrived at 2 am. Concierge gave us some great recommendations! If we weren't roadtripping we would have stayed here a few more days! Great pool, view and location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great price”
Reviews.Author: sbrameister
Reviews.Content: it was our first time at The Reach. We all loved it. It was part of our Florida vacation that included 4 hotels in total (Cocoa Beach, Vero Beach, Miami and Key West), and so far this one was the best. We always look for an average price hotel between $100-$200. We found a special rate for $200 and the 4th night free. This hotel has a concept of a "Boutique Hotel", is like a compact resort. There was plenty to do and we loved the small beach. We even did some snorkeling in it before doing our open water snorkel trip. Even though at the entrance you have some rocky areas, it is easy enough to get in and start swimming to enjoy the marine life. Our 8 year old loved it. Staff was friendly and helpful. The room was big, and the style was all about simple lines, Ikea style. On the furniture I did not like the shelving system for the clothes, I rather have drawers, but it was ok. Nice bathroom. Very clean room. Great bed with an awesome duvet. Small little balcony. We booked a Boutique Suite with partial view, which meant that you could see a little of the street (in between tree foliage) and a little of the beach, but we did not care because we don't stay at a hotel to look out in the balcony. We used the balcony basically to dry out swimsuits and diving gear. We had few problems but they compensated in a fair way. Our internet connection never got to work except for few minutes, there was an error on the connection that we believed it has to do something with the firewall. After they tried to fix it and it did not work, they actually offered to move us to another room, but we were all set there and we really did not need to be hook to the internet, it was just a convenience. They removed the $25 hotel fee where the internet connection was included (and we did not ask to be compensated), which was fair to us. Another little problem was that we had a pillow that was ours and one day the pillow disappeared after room service. We told them and after few research, they realized that our pillow went with the rest of hotel laundry to Miami! it was kind of funny though, but we were not really upset about the whole deal, it is an honest mistake and it is just a pillow with a nice pillow case. But they said they were giving us $40 credit to our bill. That was a nice gesture. The last room service lacked a little bit just because they forgot to put 2 more glasses and the coffee cups but they brought it as soon as we requested them. The breakfast buffet was the best buffet so far from all breakfast buffet I tried out there. Pricey though, but good ingredients and selection, it was $17.50 but they include the tip which take it to $22. It has the regular items, eggs, bacon, good sausages, potatoes, biscuits and gravy, and then an array of some fancy cheese, pistachios, cold cuts (ham, turkey ham, cheddar, salami) smoked salmon with toppings (capers, fine chopped onions, red peppers, chives) bread selection, lettuce, tomatoes, a variety of some small and really good danishes, and of course butter, cream cheese, little spread jars (jelly, ketchup, mayo, dijon mustard), 3 different juices, and they will bring you milk and coffee if you wanted it. The pool was heated, I was worried at the beginning because is a small pool and a small amount of lounge chairs and I thought it would be crowded but for my surprise it never was that way even though there was plenty people at the hotel. It was nice that we had access to the Casa Marina, which we might try on another trip. Not sunset, but you can enjoy a beautiful sunrise. Nice covered pier with benches and hammocks. We did not eat at the restaurant so I cannot review anything, just the breakfast buffet but according to them they serve the best steak on the 2X4 island. It was a quiet area, a block away from Duval street, which was nice. We did not want to stay right by the hustle and bustle (and drunken sailors) that comes along with Duval. The concierge was very helpful when we wanted to book a snorkel trip and fishing trip and she did everything for us, we just needed to put a deposit and show up at the marina with our reservation and paid the rest before boarding the boat. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The reach was the best, very clean and the most comfortable beds in key West”
Reviews.Author: saleencraft
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Reach Resort for our anniversary and it was great. The rooms were very clean and the hotel was right on the beach. have stayed in key west many times and this was the best yet. i would recommend it for anyone looking to get a way and be taken care of. Also right next to Duval st. and a cab to down town was 6 dollars. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “First time in Key West. Great spot.”
Reviews.Author: Jonh63
Reviews.Content: First time in Key West. Great price. Room was big and clean. Bad Views. On the quiet side of Key West and you need to take a cab down Duval to get to all the fun stuff. But if you want to relax for a day, you can stay here. The pool is great and they seem to be the only place on Key West with a beach. The service by the pool and beach is amazing. Anything you want, they will hook you up. I would recommend lunch only at the Hotel restaurant (grouper sand. grilled), too many other great dinner places in Key West to stay there for dinner. Overall, nice spot.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: bmc8754
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Reach in Key West. We received incredible service from Charles and Clay who went out of their way to accomodate us and DJ who was always attentive for our needs at the pool. Our hotel room attendants kept our room immaculate and the turn down service was a nice touch, too. The back of the hotel is a mini paradise with a pool and private beach with activities and hidden jewels. Some of the choices include playing a life size game of chess, renting a wave runner or relaxing on the hammock at the end of the enclosed dock. The hotel's restaurant has a great ambience whether you eat outdside on the inviting deck or inside at the cozy restaurant. Great food. Key West is a beautiful place to go and the Reach is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Redeem Your Hilton HHonors Points for a stay here”
Reviews.Author: Minnisnowda
Reviews.Content: This hotel treats reward stays like garbage. I redeemed a few nights for a night using a GLONP2 award from Hilton HHonors. Apparently because I was not a revenue generating customer the hotel treated us like feral dogs. The room we were given had a lovely view of the rusty septic tanks and and car park at the rear of the property. Staff member said "No rooms with a view were available to guests staying on points" Well, what is flippin' point of accruing points or being loyal if we are treated like lepers while trying to enjoy a vacation. In-room Espresso Machine did not work, bathroom was not cleaned to standard (tile floor was littered with pubic hairs from previous guest(s)). The beach is TINY. Location was very isolated from Duval Street and the populated/happening end of the island. The stay here left a VERY sour taste in my mouth. I will try the Westin on the good side of the island next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: FLGirl25
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights starting July 5th. Like the previouse couple of reviewers have mentioned I was also a bit concerned after reading some of the recent negative reviews. We were pleasantly surprised. We booked a partial ocean view boutique suite and when we arrived we could not have been happier. Our room was spacious, clean and gasp...had an ocean view. We would definately book this room again due to the fact that the partial view (to us anyway) turned out to have a great, unobstructed view of the ocean. We spent most of our mornings and nights relaxing on our balcony and taking in the beautiful view. Houskeeping was great and did not disturb us by being loud as other reviewers have mentioned. Here is a tip: If you do not want housekeeping disturbing you at 8 am in the morning, insert the do not disturb card into the key slot of the door, then phone them later to let them know when you would like your room serviced. This worked great for us and our room was always cleaned when we were out for the day. We ordered room service for breakfast one morning and yes, it is pricey but it was good. I wouldn't necessarily order it again but we mainly did it for the experience and because we wanted to eat out on the balcony. The grounds are well maintained and the beach area is not huge but it is nice for what it is. We did not book this hotel because we wanted to lay on the beach- we really just wanted to be on the water so we can see, smell and hear the ocean and once again our needs were met. We booked a jet ski tour with Barefoot Billy's through the concierge. The tour left right from the hotels beach and we had a great time. I was scared to drive at first so my boyfriend ended up doing most of the work. Near the end of the tour I worked up the courage to drive and of course I tipped us over, but the tour guide came to our rescue and we were up and running again in no time. We also rented bikes through the hotel so that we could explore the island. The bikes were in good condition and served their purpose. Renting a bike is a great way to do some exploring. One inconvienience on our last night- the AC went out for the entire hotel. It was out for several hours (in reality it didn't really bother us to much because we decided to do some exploring while this problem was being fixed) I called guest services and inquired if there was any discount we could recieve and our resort fees were waived for our entire stay. The AC was fixed by the time we returned to our room later that afternoon and all was well. Sometimes, all you have to do is ask (firmly, but nicely) and you may be surprised. Your experience is what you make of it and if you have concerns but do not voice them, they will not be addresed. So speak up if there are any problems and they will be taken care of. The resort fee is another thing people have complained of and I'm not sure why. This type of fee is pretty much standard at a hotel that is not a Best Western or a Holiday Inn(and I am not a hotel snob- I've had excellent stays at wallet friendly hotels such as country inn and microtel). You know this going in so it does not pop up like some sort of surprise charge as some would have you think. When you book the hotel you are informed of this fee and the total you are shown before booking includes this fee. You are also informed of the parking fee beforehand. If this is not something you agree with you do not have to book the room. I don't know if you book through another party how it is but if you book directly with the hotel you can be assured that there are no surprises. So, if you are looking for a nice property with an ocean view consider giving The Reach a shot, we are very glad that we did.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: FlRod
Reviews.Content: At first, we were a little concerned about booking this hotel due to the reviews, but having had nothing but good experiences with Hilton properties, we gave it a chance. We had a great time! It all started from the check-in. We arrived around 10:30 am and their check in time is usually at 4. Evelyn at the front desk told me that the room was not ready, but she would have housekeeping get it done as soon as possible and that she would call me when ready, meanwhile, she said, enjoy the facilities and we did. We went to the hotel's beach and it was gorgeous. Small and clean. The staff at the beach area (DJ and Tara) was great and they set us up a couple of beach chairs and umbrella in no time. I was just getting settled, when I received the call that the room was ready! Not even an hour after we arrived! The room was a double with a great view of the ocean and the pool. Now, we have a 7,3 and 1 year old and the room was a little small for them to play. (It was solved the next night!) so if you are traveling with small kids, go for the one bedroom suite, which is the one we got for the second night at almost the same rate as the first night!! (Again, Gustavo at the front desk was very helpful with this!) Our whole stay was very enjoyable and the staff was extremely friendly! We had a great time at The Reach and Key West and will definitely plan on coming back!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dump- Don't be Fooled by the Waldorff Name”
Reviews.Author: weidnerlaw
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from my dirty, stained beat up room at the "Waldorff Astoria Collection"...I was fooled by the name, hopefully you won't get suckered like I did..just about every Mariott or Holiday Inn for that matter is better than this place. I have previously stayed at the Casa Marina which is a fine hotel just next door and about the same price. This hotel makes a big deal about their beach, and while there are not many hotels on Key West with a beach, this one is not much to talk about. Booked this with a Travelocity package and was first put into a handicapped room looking over a street when we paid for a Ocean view room, between Travelocity and this dump of a hotel I don't know who screwed that up, but even after they moved me into a correct room, it's not much better....stay away. I cannot imagine that the other positive reviews are real....they seem very suspect to me.

Reviews.Title: “Dumb staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldWideWon
Reviews.Content: The pool guys were great. But the beach is about 15 feet long and 40 feet wide, and brown water for 300 feet out. No snorkeling unless you take a boat out about 8 miles. The front desk and concierge were dumb as bricks. The concierge insisted that Key West had the only reef in North America. When I asked her if Mexico was part of North America she said absolutely not?? The hotel claims it is a 5 star, but I would rate it as an old refurbed holiday inn. $30 for the breakfast buffet, with raw bacon, no omelet guy, same exact luke warm trash every day. Next door you can get cooked to order breakfast for $12 bucks. Maid wanted to clean the room at 8am and if you asked for later she wouldnâ€™t come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacked service”
Reviews.Author: jo4012
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the reach late on a Friday night after travelling for a long time from the UK to Miami and then driving down. We were immediately greeting by being informed that our travel company had booked us into a two double bedded room at our request which I immediately questioned and then we were given the option to move after the weekend. I asked the check in girl on my behalf to contact the Ritz Carlton in South beach to comfirm whether we were in a kingsize bed there and we were. When we ariived in our two bed room we had a phone call from the reception staff stating that by chance a kingsize bed room had just that minute become available because another guest requested a two bed room! We had been given an upgrade because this room had a sea view and I think they realised that it was their error not ours and were worried if they were found our. The beach and pool were never overcrowded but what slight worried us is that a number of people would just come on to the beach ot hotel guest and have access to the beds our resort charge ( ours was included in the deal from the booking agent) and did not seem to be charged for them. Breakfast was included and there was a good selection of the usual food but only the food was really healthy. I don't think I would have been paying the $46 dollars for the breakfast if it wasn't included. Service in this area was good with Laura and Petey providing excellent service. There were only two pool beach attendances and at busy time you just had to wait for them to service you this meant that the 12pm drink of the day and 2pm ice lolly was forgotten on a number of days as they were two busy. The lady whom attended our room was excellent and the service we recieved from her was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Great week-long stay at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: CarmieB
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at The Reach for five nights and we had a wonderful expierence there. We really did our research before booking, and after spending a week there, I am convinced we got a fabulous deal. This is not a grand hotel. It's not the Hyatt and it is not the Ocean Key, so if you are looking for the fanciest hotel in Key West, this isn't it. But, it is a Great hotel that does have the resort feel for a better price. The staff was great- from the front desk, to the pool area, to the housekeeping staff. They were very upbeat, positive, and really interested in making your trip to Key West a good one. They also offered good advice on the nightly "hot spots" as we were looking for fun! The room was plenty big, with comfortable beds, a nice tv, a bathroom with a generous bathroom, and a full-length mirror for outfit checking! The hotel grounds were beautiful, great for taking photos. The pool/beach area was really nice and despite what some reviewers said, we had no trouble finding lounge chairs, as long as we got to the pool before 1 pm. We had a good expeierence with the Concierge; she was a bit pushy, but we were very please with the two things that she booked for us ( A sunset sail and a snorkeling trip) On the negavite side, the staff at the pool/beach and in the lobby were a tip-hungry, trying to do every possible thing to get good tips, but then again, it was nice to be waited on so thoroughly by staff. I would just recommend that you make it clear if you would perfer not to be assisted. Overall, a great stay at The Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: TVSpy
Reviews.Content: I want to be fair to this hotel, which is why I am giving it an average rating, when my impulse is to give it one star. I stayed here for two nights with my wife for a quick getaway. Key West is one of our favorite places in the world, and we enjoy finding new hotels and guest houses to try out. As a Hilton Honors diamond member, I thought I'd burn off some points and try the Reach resort. What a major disappointment. This is supposed to be a WALDORF property. I travel a lot, and have stayed at numerous Waldorfs. There is an expectation of quality that you expect -- even in laid-back Key West. This hotel misses the mark .. BADLY. Where do I start? How about at the airport, where we find the friendly-looking fella holding up the signs to the Reach resort and its sister property. I thought, "Great." Always nice to catch a shuttle over a taxi, right? Wrong. Turns out it was nothing more than a taxi ride. I was a bit surprised when we were asked to pony up $8 each for the 6-minute ride. In nearly every city in the world to which I've traveled, I have never paid one penny for a shuttle ride. It's part of the hotel's service. Not at Reach. We reach the Reach and our bags are immediately taken hostage by the bellman. Wait a minute! Did I ask for your help? If I need it, I won't be shy about asking for it. These were very small bags that my wife and I could easily carry ourselves -- and prefer to carry ourselves. I understand they work for tips, but good grief. Let ME decide whether I need your assistance. I travel a lot, and it's one of the biggest pet peeves I have about the hospitality industry. Stop it. Good service starts with a simple question: "How may I help you?" Get inside to the reception desk and quickly learn that I did not get the complimentary upgrade to a junior suite that almost automatically comes with being a diamond-level Hilton Honors member. No worries, I thought. The hotel must be surprisingly sold out -- surprising because hotels in Key West struggle during the summer. It's the low season. Too hot. We get to our room, it's 76 degrees. No problem. I'll crank the AC down for a few hours and cool the place off. The wife goes for a swim and some sun for a few hours. I run out for some sandwiches for us both. We run out for a bite to eat. We come back to the room -- after the AC's been running SEVEN HOURS -- and the thermostat reads 75 degrees. Uncomfortable. I go downstairs to complain -- and to ask about whether they're able to switch us to another room. No way we can sleep with temps in the mid-70s. We're told they are not sold out. I then remind the receptionist that I was on the standby list for an upgrade and if any of the junior suites were available. Sure enough, there was one available. At the very back of the property. No view to speak of, but at least the AC worked. I will give the staff points for correcting this situation for us so quickly and without pushback, but that's the service I expect from the start as a loyal Hilton Honors member -- not seven hours later. My other complaints involve the almost-desperate attitude of the pool boys. One guy almost bragged about what good service he offers by offering to get my wife a towel. Really? Are they paying these young men so little that they all but beg for a tip -- FOR DOING THEIR JOB?! Further, every guest is charged $25 extra each day for a "resort fee," for use of the pool and those towels and those lawn chairs and the big chess board and wireless interent and all the other amenities -- most of which are never used by individual guests. Here are my other issues with the property: The furniture is not as nice as it should for a Waldorf property. Laminate furniture?? That's Hampton Inn, not Waldorf. The stairwells near our room at the back of the property couldn't be more rundown (spilled paint, discarded furniture strewn about off to the side, dirty). This is supposed to be paradise. Not a public-housing project. If you go to the pool here -- which is way too small for the size of the property -- you might not find an open lounger, even though many of them will be unoccupied. Apparently, management allows the pool boys to "take care" of customers by reserving chairs. Nothing could be more infuriating to a guest who's paid $25 to use the pool, only to learn that someone who handed a tip to the pool boy got "reserved" towels placed over the chairs they want, while they go explore Key West for hours. Absolutely unacceptable. I could go on, but why. I didn't like the property, nor the fact that I squandered 100,000 hard-earned Hilton Honors points for the privilege. Despite my frustrations, I am happy to report my wife found a way to enjoy herself .. and nothing really matters more than that to me. We're looking forward to going back to Key West -- somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed, but would stay at The Reach again.”
Reviews.Author: kristylwood
Reviews.Content: Overall we were pleased with the resort. The beach and location were great and the resort was quiet. It was a hot walk up Duval Street and to Mallory Square, but I prefer to stay on the quieter end of town so it was a good trade off. Ultimately, I would stay at the resort again mainly because of the location and the beach, but I do have several complaints. The first night we noticed a light fixture dangling over the bathtub. I tried 4 times to contact the front desk to get someone to repair the light and the front desk never picked up. I finally had to go down to the front desk and speak face to face with someone. Later that night we realized there were no linens and pillows for the sofa bed. Once again I tried to contact the front desk 4 times with no success. I had to change from my pajamas back into my clothes and go back downstairs to the front desk to speak with someone. Housekeeping was knocking on the door within 5 minutes, but it was annoying to have to go to the front desk twice in one day. The next day we had a voicemail on our phone. When I checked the message I found that it was from a prospective guest inquiring about having his wedding at the resort. Someone had put him through to guestroom voicemail rather than the front desk voicemail. Additionally, housekeeping came by twice a day even if you didnâ€™t have your â€œservice pleaseâ€� sign out. They would knock repeatedly in the mornings and if you didnâ€™t answer they would just come in. Another crew would come by at night. They did a good job and I guess this is a minor complaint, but having to answer the door or having someone walk into your room can be annoying when you are trying to relax. My final complaint is with the misrepresentation of the guestrooms on the hotelâ€™s website. We booked the ocean view one bedroom suite which is the most expensive room. After looking at the photographs I thought we were getting an airy room with a balcony running across the living area and bedroom. The photo shows a living room with a sofa and balcony. The room we were given had a sectional sofa with a small window in the living area. The balcony was off the bedroom only. The living area seemed very dark, small and closed off. It looked nothing like any of the photos and its hard for me to believe this was the most expensive room in the resort. Not to mention that the only way we had an oceanview was by standing at just the right position to see a tiny bit of ocean through the palm trees. I thought the palm trees could be trimmed or removed altogether to give guests a better view and more enjoyment of the balcony. I questioned the front desk and was told we were in the correct room, but I could look at another room in 2 days to see if we wanted to move. We decided it wasn't worth it. I felt very disappointed and let down upon check in, but we decided not to let it ruin our trip. That said, the room was nice and we slept soundly every night, but I feel we were either given the wrong room or the website's photographs are misleading.

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend the Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Brigid90
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great experience staying at the Reach Resort. All the employees were very friendly from the cleaning staff, to the conceirge, pool attendants, and door man. We never had to ask for a thing. The rooms were clean and decorated nicely. It was our 25th anniversary and we were greeted with chocolate covered strawberries. We hope to return there again sometime. The only down side was $15/day self parking and resort fee of $25/day needs to be taken into consideration. This is above the hotel price per day.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - Simply Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: satellitekamm63
Reviews.Content: My husband recently booked our 5th wedding anniversary/2nd honeymoon vacation at The Reach. We were a bit worried about it after reading a few bad reviews concerning service. I don't know where those people stayed - because everyone at The Reach were professional and courteous and extremely helpful. I would stay no where else in Key West! Loved it, loved it, loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !”
Reviews.Author: CowgirlBeachBum
Reviews.Content: All was just about perfect : beach, pool, staff, rooms--all great.. Beautiful sandy beach. this place " has it going on!" as my kids would say . My only less than stellar spots were hadr mattresses and flat pillows ! On our arrival, the AC in our room was not functioning and it was HOT. We were whisked next door and all was well for the remainder of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach-more like a Doubletree than a Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: pajacara
Reviews.Content: This is our second time at the Reach as we stayed here in August 2009. Seems like the hotel is doing some improvements to better fit the Waldorf name by adding a shop, updating some of the interiors, and lowering their daily fee from $25 to $15 (includes parking, towels, beach games and etc.,). Personally, I liked the fact that the hotel is located 1 mile from Mallory Square and a block from Duval Street. Some complained that it's far; it's not a long walk at all as you stroll pass the shops, restraurants and just sightsee with a delicious drink in your hand. I appreciate that it's in a quieter part of Key West. PROS: -Private beach with soft white sand brought in from the Bahamas, as most of the natural sand in the Keys is coral or limestone and rough on your feet. The beach to the right is top optional. The beach staff is great, and a tip here and there goes a long way. CONS: -Onsite restaurant expensive and not worth it, as there are great places to eat on the island. -Front desk personnel not very knowledgeable and incompetent as they missed a requested wakeup call and put us in the wrong room. ( I rarely complain about staffing, but the 5 days we stayed here, they just lacked in service). -The hotel itself is more of a Doubletree standard than a Waldorf. -Housekeeping lacks on certain days.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTrvlr
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we came to Key West, and booked The Reach Resort. I utilized my Hilton Points, but the pricing for the, hotel was still very reasonable. Service from the minute we pulled up in the taxi, was excellent. They immediately took our bags, opened the doors, took them to the counter. We were 4 hours early for check in, so our room was not quite ready. They took our number, and called us as soon as it was ready, they held our bags for us, and brought them to the room once we checked in. The amenities for the beach were excellent, DJ and Ricardo were great to deal with, and would setup our seats and get us towels immediately. The hotel even recognized our Honeymoon by sending us room service with a 24 layer chocolate cake!!! Very good!! Took 2 days for us to eat it, but very tasty. Remember when reading these reviews, the staff at the resort work for tips. Your experience with the staff is greatly enhanced if you show them kind gestures. There are fantastic people working for the resort, and from our stay, they deal with a multitude of different people, which some are very ignorant. This was by far one of the better resorts I have stayed at compared to the HYATT, Westin and others. And don't forget Louie's Backyard is very close, with excellent food. And you have full access to the Casa Resort which is a block away.

Reviews.Title: “BE TREATED LIKE ROYALTY”
Reviews.Author: CodeRN2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the The Reach Resort, Fl The Waldorf Astoria Collection, Florida Memorial Weekend and can't rave enough about the Hotel. This Hotel was an in a perfect location right on the southern most point of Key West. The beach, pool and room were excellent and the food at the restaurant on site was great. The customer service was top notch. You can tell that the staff takes alot of pride in their work and all work as a team in providing their guests with excellent service. From check in to check out, all our needs were handled quickly and in a professional manner. The resort is an easy one block walk to Duval Street. Old Town Trolly stop and scooter rentals directly is a easy walk right down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNative35
Reviews.Content: The Reach was fabulous! Since Key West has a very limited expanse of sand beaches, this hotel is a gem. Do your research, Key West hotels simply don't have endless, white sand beaches, so you can't go to the Reach or Casa Marina and then complain that the beaches are small. These are literally the only hotels on the island that allow you to enjoy at least some private beach area. Truly a find. The Reach is at a great location, not just because of the lovely beach front, but it's also within walking distance to Duval St. We found the property to be very quiet, clean and modern. Some folks complained about the price, but our rate was only $149 per night which we found to be a tremendous value for what the property offered. The pool staff was wonderful and attentive and the concierge was extremely helpful. The sister property to The Reach, Casa Marina Hotel, is a short walk away and staying at The Reach allows you to use all the amenities there as well. It's like a 2 for 1. Loved this option and got to enjoy two very different beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaRBurton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wouldn't normally spend this much on a hotel, but we decided to splurge. I have to say I was disappointed. The parking attendant that greeted us was very friendly and helpful, even when we decided to pay the $15 parking fee instead of $20 for valet parking. The front desk staff was just average, I feel at what is supposed to be a luxury top-of-the line hotel they should have been better. The room was smallish, no bathtub, just a shower that took forever to heat up. Beautiful view of the ocean and pool. The room wasn't particularly clean, bits of paper and dust around. Again, not a big deal, but I expected better from a luxury hotel. We went to the restaurant, but there was a long wait, even though we didn't see anyone there. We were happy to leave though, since I am not particularly fond of looking at vintage pictures of naked people while I eat anyway. Room service food was very good and delivered hot. Within walking distance of anywhere you would want to go, but honestly on Key West, what isn't? Overall, nice enough, but considering the expectations from name and price point a bit of a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “A+ all the way!! Beautiful suite-style...”
Reviews.Author: Mdvirtual
Reviews.Content: A+ all the way!! Beautiful suite-style room, gorgeous grounds, pool and beach. The staff bent over backward to make our stay perfect. Great laid back location with easy access to all the Duval Street action. We'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, went out of their way to make the trip wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Beachingbaby
Reviews.Content: This is the best kept secret on the Island. The beach was incredible. Sand bar all the way out. Pool and beach covered by cabana boys. Staff went way beyond to ensure a comfortable and pleasant stay. We would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Only if you get a deal...”
Reviews.Author: badwaiter
Reviews.Content: The best thing the hotel has going for it is the beach which is pretty rare in Key West. The rooms are average, the service is a bit below average. For instance, I stood around in the lobby with my bags for about 10 minutes before I was able to check in. There was only one other person in front of me but the desk agent was training someone. That's fine but when the door person or the bell hop or any of the other people walked by they might have asked if they could take my bag, did I need help, etc. We booked on priceline so this hotel picked us more than we picked it. The location is at the quiet end of Duval St. The room was clean but could have been a little cleaner. The amenity fee is a bit of a rip off when it basically entitles you to some beach chairs and towels that you don't have to bring from your room. $15 a day tacked on for parking is also a bit over the top. In sum, you know what they say about beggars and choosers. In that respect I can't really say anything bad but had I chosen this hotel on my own I would have been let down.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: shoeinnfuntime
Reviews.Content: I have traveled for business for several years and found that the staff at the Reach Resort was outstanding, especially the beach and pool staff. D.J. and Julian went above and beyond to accomodate us. The front desk easily allow us a late check out, which was so nice. I have been to Key West twice in the past year and typically try new places when I travel for pleasure. I will be staying at the Reach during all of my trips to Key West from here forward.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is a rip off for the money.”
Reviews.Author: dyh48
Reviews.Content: When you check in they hit you with a $15 a day for parking and $25 resort fee to cover your beach chair, beach towel, internet service-which didn't work, maid service for your room. The rooms are so small! Only 1 restaurant. The beach staff were VERY nice. However the front desk could care less about customer service. I've stayed in many hotels in Key West. This was the worse!! Very disappointing. $200 a night should get you more.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but far from Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: jsilva12
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and on the beach. The staff was helpful, room clean, pool/ check in/out easy but what made it so great was the value. Priceline gave it to me for $159 on my bid. it's far from Duval but you can cab it to Duval on the westend for just $7 or park your car there for $10.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay, very nice and helpfull staff, direct beach”
Reviews.Author: guekko1
Reviews.Content: Coming from Paris, France, I stayed there with my two kids (16 and 13) during one week in February 2010. The room was decent, although not to the level we could be awaiting for a waldorf astoria hotel. However, my comment here may be tainted, since Iat 47, am an extensive traveller, and have personnally stayed in a lot of luxury hotels in the world, so yu have to take this into account. However, the room was clean, bathroom was large and well furnished, we had a very nice terrace overlooking the ocean, and the hotel, although full, was very quiet. A nice heated pool, a well furnished gym. As well, nice rooftops where you could sip your wine with a outstanding view on the sunset. From the pool, you access directly to a little beach, and I think this might be the only hotel on the island offering this. The pool is just from walking distant of the main street, dining and activities, which was a blessing. Most of the staff was nice and helpfull, although, sometimes, we would have loved the guys at the restaurant showing some smiles. As well, I must say that I hate this insulting habit they had at the restaurant to bring the check with the gratuity already included,. But this was the case in most of the restaurants on the island (but not at the Hard Rock CafÃ© !). A special mention to one person of the staff, John Drake, who was very comprehensive and helpfull and largely helped us out when we noticed, once back in France, that an additional 300 $ had been withdrawn on our Amex, because of supposedly damages to our room. We explained that we had nothing to do with that, and the hotel was kind enough to re-credit my CC (although being 6 000 miles away, they could easily have been less cooperative). Anyway, taking all this into account, I would definitely recommend this hotel, and stay there again in a future trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs in a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: alex0123
Reviews.Content: I didn't stay at this resort long enough, or use many of the amenities to give a fair review. However, I can tell you watch out for bed bugs. Yes, bed bugs! I've never had this experience in my life and don't wish it upon anyone. The morning we checked out we began to notice welts on our bodies. It turns out we were eaten by bed bugs. For someone who travels a lot and stays in a variety of accomodations this is the first time this happens to me. Therefore I assume this is an isolated incident for this hotel. But be mindful if you stay there and check the bedding before you lie down. I will.

Reviews.Title: “Calling this even a three star hotel is a "REACH"”
Reviews.Author: atlgirl46
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to stay in this hotel after checking out the website and thought our Island View Boutique Suite would perfect for our trip. Upon checking in to our room I noticed very quickly how some of the furniture appeared somewhat shabby (new furniture that had seen alot of use) . The balcony did have a view of the ocean which was a pleasant surprise but the balconly furniture was dirty and had stains on the chairs. Not good. Then walking into the bathroom I noticed several stains on the floor, hair around the toilet . GROSS. I immediately call housekeeping, the supervisor told me those stains couldn't be removed without a special chemical they did not have, but lo and behold once our housekeeper came in and mopped the floor the stains were miraculously gone! That did it for me , a hotel that does not mop the bathroom floors between guests is a hotel I would never stay in. And the housekeeper acted quite put out that we objected to her cleaning skills. Needless to say we found another hotel and left immediately. Do not waste your money here!

Reviews.Title: “Relax with Reach”
Reviews.Author: Scoobmeister
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant three-night stay @ the Reach. I much appeciated the quieter end of the island. Rooms were quiet @ night as well. The small beach is lovely. The pool is nice, but I do think the photos on the website make it appear larger than it actually is. The bed is incredibly comfortable. They need hooks to hang towels/bathing suits in the bathroom. They have two computers available in the internet kiosk, but they are soooo slow- bring your laptop! The room service food is just okay. They were very helpful about leaving bags on checking in early / out late.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location . . . Service Needs to step up”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly972
Reviews.Content: I have a mixed review on this resort. The location and overall appeal is perfect. Sitting on it's own corner of the Key West world, they have their own sand beach as well as a fantastic pool and lounging area. The hotel is that understated tropical style. Tile floors, cool colors, white trim. We stayed in a one bedroom suite. What we were put into was a converted ADA handicap suite. Unfortunately, there was furniture missing, and the place was pretty dirty. Not dust, but more like food stuck in the furniture dirty. We discussed the furniture issue with the front desk and they indicated that they would locate a dresser for the bedroom (there was only a bed and two nightstands in the room in order to accommodate a wheelchair). Nothing ever arrived, and no further response was ever received from management. :^( So our clothes were put in the living room, and also stacked up in the closet for our stay. . . I'm on vacation to relax, so I'm NOT going to stress over this. . . We did have a really nice large balcony overlooking the pool area and out to the ocean. It was totally relaxing to sit out and just people watch and also watch the ocean. The Reach is located at 'the opposite end from Mallory Square", but Key West is so small that you are only a couple blocks from all the main attractions of Duval Street. Right on the corner is a place to rent bikes and/or scooters for those that don't care for a short walk. All in all, I would recommend The Reach Resort, and I would also stay there again. I did receive a letter of apology from the resort management after I had returned from vacation. A nice gesture, but why couldn't they rectify the issue while I was still there?

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Blueberryhollow
Reviews.Content: Reach Resort was great for just kicking back and relaxing. Hammocks on the palm trees, nice beach great pool and popcicles at 2PM. Also great being able to use sister resort. The $25.00 resort fee was not a problem, if that is what they want for free internet and a great friendly staff...no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Location: paradise. Service: ordinary”
Reviews.Author: benaround
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at The Reach recently. It is on the "quiet" end of Duval Street, and has a beautiful beachfront setting. Our oceanview room was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The facilities are very nice: small but adequate pool with lounges, manicured lawn, well maintained buildings. I was disappointed in the service and offer as examples: at check-in, no bellman was seen and no offer of assistance with luggage. Tried to rent a bike for an early morning ride and was told I couldn't get one until the concierge arrived at 9:30 (how hard can it be to train a desk clerk to rent a bike?) Had a difficult time attracting attention of wait staff to order drinks at the pool. The staff is "friendly" but need to be tuned up on anticipating and meeting guest needs. At least, I'd expect that at a Waldorf Astoria. I booked online at the property website, and was offered an ungrade option based on availability, to be determined at time of check-in. Although I had committed to the upgrade if available, I found it odd that the clerk didn't mention that when we checked in. Also, no mention of our Hilton Honors status and any perks that might have come with that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Chilli-Willey
Reviews.Content: We got married at this resort last weekend, and everything was wonderful! The rooms are great, our view from our balcony was outstanding! I will say that some of the ocean view rooms are blocked by palm trees though; we had to request a room change because of that. The location is convenient, only 1 block away from Duvall. However, it's at the opposite side of the bar scene on Duvall so it's pretty calm and quiet. The hotel is slightly pricey, but it was nice and I'm very glad I chose it as my wedding location.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise... Should have stayed at the Sister Resort Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: trooperNorthvilleMI
Reviews.Content: Great location, the hotel was ok. not a Waldorf Astoria level so was expecting something a bit nicer. Small pool, only 1 restaurant and no other options for drinks or food/snacks. Pool table and activities right in midddle of restaurant and bar area with lots of area to expand so not sure why they crammed everything into a porch. The pool staff was great. DJ got us set up most everyday. Wait staff had to work pool/beach and restaurant did not make a lot of sense to do it that way. It resulted in a warm $15 mojito. You could always get a table at the restaurant so I think we were not alone in our assesment. Strip House "Easter" was good but the service made the evening spectacular,Luther was one of the best I have ever had he was oen of the highlights of the hotel. This property has lots of potential just missing some tlc.

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurants, right on the beach, 5 seconds to Duvall St!”
Reviews.Author: dprowe
Reviews.Content: Traveled for Spring Break getaway with two adults and two teenagers...much to see and experience on Duvall Street. Hotel had a good beach and great pool. Walking distance to all Key West attractions...Hemingway House, Butterfly Conservatory even could walk to Mallory Square for sunset celebration. Taxi service reasonably priced when needed. Hotel concierge extremely helpful and friendly. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with beach”
Reviews.Author: juliette1417
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and boyfriend for Christmas 2008. The hotel was beautiful, service was great, and having a beach in Key West was definitely nice. I found a special online, the room rates advertised on the hotel website seem somewhat overpriced for this place. I'd definitely do some research before booking directly with the hotel as room rates seem to vary wildly. Also, they may have changed the descriptions but I booked a suite thinking that it had a separate sleeping area. Luckily, they let me add a second room at the same rate. The rooms are more like studios so book two if you don't want to have everyone sleeping right next to each other.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Vacationman3
Reviews.Content: The reach is a class act! The beach boy DJ is one awesome dude! He will attent to your every need! What a place to vacation! Thanx folks and a special thanx to DJ...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: alligatorpgr
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Saturday the 27th and we will be sad to leave tomorrow the 31st. This hotel has some of the best customer service professionals in the business! From the bellman, to the towel guys on the beach to the nice lady who cleaned our room everyday, we coudn't have asked for a better stay. Service was just a little slow when we were at the beach, but the food and drinks were good, so that made up for it. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: pittsburghpals
Reviews.Content: The idyllic location was only surpassed by the tremendous staff. The rooms are immaculate. The bedding luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTeca
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott Platinum member and I was kind of skeptical when learned that we were not going to stay at Marriott this time. It was our anniversary celebration and we booked it thru priceline and of course the room reserved to us in the hotel was with a view to the parking lot. From the time we arrived to the hotel to the minute we left the employees on reception were so great that just made the whole experience an unexpected surprise. They upgraded our room to a partial ocean view; they sent sweets and a card to our room, helped us to book a sunset cruise, gave great advices where to go for breakfast and dinner. They absolutely took care of us. Great location with private beach in a quite side of the Key but if you want to enjoy some bars, restaurant or shopping you can go for a nice 15-20 minutes walking to Duval Street. The one thing that was not was great the food from room service. Overall great hotel; we will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: SadieSue10
Reviews.Content: Even the name is deceiving. This is no resort! And, to top it off we were told on check-in that there would be a $25 per night "resort fee". (Generally the check-in experience sets the tone for the visit & ours was not particularly pleasant - rather patronizing) There was a tiny beach (Key West is not known for its beaches because of the coral reefs), a decent pool & attractive grounds behind the hotel but hardly in the category of a resort. There was one steak restaurant, no apparent place for breakfast. There are lots of good hotels in Key West & as we walked around,many charming B&Bs. We booked this through Priceline & it will probably be our last. This is not the first time we have been less than happy with them.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but pricey...”
Reviews.Author: CaptBlack
Reviews.Content: Our first night was spent in a standard room in a corner of the hotel that could not have been further from the pool and beach area with little natural light and overlooking the parking lot. We upgraded to an ocean-view boutique suite for an extra $50.00/night and it was well worth the extra expense. This new room was overlooking the pool area, beach, pier and the ocean, creating a stunning vista. The hotel staff was very friendly and they went out of their way to make us feel welcome, as if we were their personal guests. Cindy A. at reception even had a tray sent to our room (while we were out catching the sunset) containing a massive slice of chocolate cake and a welcome note for our nine year old daughter. The concierge (Tara) was remarkably helpful and arranged a glass bottom boat ride and para-sailing for us. She also suggested a fine Irish Pub (â€œFinniganâ€™s Wakeâ€�) where the food was excellent and inexpensive and there was an excellent selection of draught beer as well. Be warned, however, when eating or drinking at The Reach, the prices might take you by surprise. Room Service = the price on the menu + a delivery charge + 18% gratuity making a $14.00 item come to more than $22.00 by the time it reaches your room, not to mention the expectation of an additional gratuity by the steward that delivers the food. Even the prices in the bar and around the pool were a bit startling, but hey, youâ€™re there to spend money right? A final tip: half a block from the hotel is Annaâ€™s Cuban grocery and restaurant where you can get great Cuban coffee, breakfast, and, well, groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: pghhckyfan
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Reach Resort. Loved the Beach, star gazing from pier and having my picture taken on the giant chess set (have it framed in my bedroom). If you could only see the picture of my boyfriend playing cards at the poker table-LOL. The staff was friendly, would definately recommend. Pittsburgh Full Throttle

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed, beach-front, on the quieter side of Old Towne”
Reviews.Author: hoyt01
Reviews.Content: We had a good 4-night stay at The Reach. Only a block's walk from Duvall, but at the quiet end of all the activity on that street. Duvall is about 15 blocks long, but we enjoyed walking down to the other end where the sunset celebrations happen. Guys pedaling "bicycle cabs" are also plentiful if your feet give out. The Reach bldgs & grounds all very well-maintained. Very helpful & friendly staff. The private beach was not as big as expected, but still ok for the # of people, even during spring break week. Beach-front pool & courtyard area was a real plus -- fun games available in courtyard & bar patio areas. Pool staff was also very attentive. The Strip House Restaurant was good, but over-priced. We only had one problem while there, and that was with Room Service one night. But the hotel staff was very professional in making sure we were satisfied in the end. Guests are also granted access to facilities at their sister property, the Casa Marina. We walked over there each morning to satisfy our latte habit. Beautiful place with a much bigger beach. Even though it's about 2 blocks farther from all the sites & Duvall Street action, we might try to stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JulieC22
Reviews.Content: One word. Awesome. Service and room were wonderful. The staff were very helpful, friendly and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was wonderful. Very helpful with area attractions. Beach is very clean with great service.

Reviews.Title: “KEY WEST 2009”
Reviews.Author: kenstarmia
Reviews.Content: Private beach in back of hotel. Great service. Near Old Key West, clubs, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “NOT The Waldorf. Like a nice Hampton.”
Reviews.Author: DMVDV
Reviews.Content: Hilton is WAAAAY overreaching to classify this as a Waldorf property. Very small rooms with weak A/C. Nice staff. Quiet location on East side. Small but nice beach and pool. Hilton is stupid to create inflated expectations for this nice property. Charge a little less and leave patrons happy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort - Best Location”
Reviews.Author: MN_Larry_M
Reviews.Content: We were trying to get in to the Sourthernmost hotel and selected the Reach Resort because they were nearby and had a vacancy. Well we lucked out ! They upgraded us from a King Room to a Suite. I would definitely stay here again - great accomodations. I would definitely recommend staying on this side of the island!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, friendly staff, awesome town”
Reviews.Author: keywestkel
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in, we found everyone at the Reach to be helpful, friendly and welcoming. We were upgraded to a suite with a beautiful view of the ocean & pool. We usually stay at a B&B at the other end of Duval where we spend most of our time frequenting the bars & restaurants. But we found it easy to get around. The front desk personell called us a taxi when we were heding out and we only waited a few minutes before the taxi arrived. My only complaint is that the restaurant only serves a full b-fast buffet in the morning. So, there isn't anywhere just to get a light b-fast and/or a cup of coffee. For that you must go over to their sister property, the Casa Marina, which is only a short walk. But, it would be nice to have the option at the Reach. The property is beautiful and clean as was our room. The fitness center is one of the nicest and largest I have seen in a hotel. I would highly recommend the Reach for a beautiful KW escape.
