Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in Key West - Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Marie49125
Reviews.Content: My husband and 16 months old baby stayed at The Reach resort during President's day week end. This hotel has georgeous grounds and probably the best private beach in Key West. The Reach is not located close to Duval Street (which is the downton area kinda) and we were happy about that (quieter). For those of you who prefers to walk to shops and restaurants and don't minda bit of noise, I suggest Crown Plaza, it's right on Duval. We booked a 1 bedroom luxury suite ocean view that was originally on the 4th floor (hotel has only 4th floor) but in February it was so cold that with the A/C not willing to go on higher level (kept at 60F) we had to change room to 2nd floor (same line : we were at 430 and got 230). It was actually a better view (4th floor unless you are facing the Chess game panel, you only get to see top of the tropical trees...) on the 2nd floor you see the beach, the pool and the ocean, funny isn't it ?!). We had a good King bed, and our baby a crib (playpen type). Just be aware that like most hotel in the Keys, they don't have heaters. The room itself was average, needed new furniture (coach and carpet were old and stained), bathroom was large and well appointed (one shower and one bath tub, 2 sinks), however I would not recommend the 1 bedroom suite to new couple since there is no doors to the bathroom (toilet is there too), so you really need to be comfortable about that. Flatscreen TV and Ipod dock were a nice touch! The living room area had a kitchenette with Nespresso coffee maker (we loved it!) and a fridge. Having a baby with us we would have loved to see a microwave in there but there was none. Internet access is not free, but if you have an Iphone and stayed on line "29 & 30" (230,330,440 etc.) you can catch the free Wifi (for Att&T customer) of Starbucks , then plug your Iphone to your computer and share the connexion (it will go faster than 3G sharing). Staff was above courteous, they were so nice they gave a balloon to our little boy. Room was always cleaned up during our stay, and lunch at the pool staff very polite (they also will help you with your baby food if needed microwave). By the way We recommend the restaurant by the pool the view is fantastic and menu not expensive, fish fresh. Parking is not free, even if you park yourself ($15 dol/night), they make you pay a resort fee of ($22/day) unlucky us we could not even get to the beach or the pool it was so cold outside...All add up to one night worth of a hotel room, so be advised. I would recommend this hotel if you want to be away from the noise of Duval (especially during spring break or St.patricks day), but next time we may try the Hyatt or the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: BruceMcD
Reviews.Content: Thi property knows about top service and have one of the most comfortable beds I have slept in in a long time. You have to grab dinner in the Strip House on site.

Reviews.Title: “Service is no longer a priority at the Reach”
Reviews.Author: NJSara
Reviews.Content: Having been to the Reach four years ago and enjoying every minute, my husband and I were looking forward to returning and seeing the new renovations. The renovations made the hotel a bit nicer BUT the service (except for the pool staff who couldn't be more pleasant and helpful) has gone down considerably. The wait staff around the pool would dissappear for long periods of time and then complain about how hard they were working. Having been in the service industries ourselves (bartender & waitress), my husband and I are usually very understanding BUT there was no excuse for the horrible service we received. Our meals and drinks in the restaurant and at the pool (even for just the two of us) were automatically charged an 18% gratuity fee, even for the breakfast buffet! My husband consistently tips over 20% but had the gratuity fee been up to us, I would've argued with him if he had tipped higher than 10%. The group with us all felt the same way. On Friday night after dinner we stopped by the bar for a drink, it was closed. They had kicked others in our group out at 10 p.m. as it was "closing time", can you believe a bar in a resort on Key West closing at 10p.m. when people are in the bar? The next day we complained and on Saturday night the bartender was overheard complaining to a friend that he had to stay since he had customers. I can't believe a resort would allow this to happen. I've been in Holiday Inns that stay open when they have customers. The front desk also had its issues. We had no air conditioning when we arrived which we told the desk before we left for dinner. We came back over 2 hours later and still no air conditioner, no message, nothing. We called the desk who had no clue what was going on and contacted the engineer. Finally, after another 45 minutes, at least,. we were asked whether we wanted to stay or go over to the Casa Marina for a couple days (where we enjoyed our stay much more and I have a much nicer review). After our stay at the Marina, we came back to the Reach to finish our vacation. Other than that, our rooms were clean although half our lights in our bathroom never worked (I know, I should've said something but by this time I just didn't want to deal) and the beds were amazingly comfortable. I doubt our group will return.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: nctravelbug
Reviews.Content: I was in Key West for a conference which was being held at the Casa Marina which is the sister resort of Reach. Casa was sold out so I decided to stay at Reach. Initially the room rates were crazy high. I watched daily and got lucky. The rate for my Ocean view suite dropped $150 so I snagged it. I have stayed at Casa so I can fairly compare the two. Casa is more elegant. Reach is more relaxed. The room was larger than the room we had at Casa which was a Ocean View Grand room. The bed was awesome. Cleaning service was prompt. Beach is smaller but you are free to walk over and use Casa's if you like. I like the bar at Reach better. They have a pool table outside at the bar which was fun to play. The food at the pool side restaurant was better than Casa. Overall it was a great experience and I would probably choose it over Casa next time.

Reviews.Title: “GOT ENGAGED HERE AND IT WAS PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaFenwayI30
Reviews.Content: First of all- best location ever!!! my Fiance choose the balcony overlooking the gorgeous ocean to propose and it's a moment that will be special for the rest of our lives! Plus the staff helped him set it up by providing a table, candles, chocolate covered strawberries and champagne. I found it to be walking distance- if not a short pedi-cab ride to all the best bars, resturants, and they were so helpful in terms of finding us places to eat. The pool is perfect- beach is gorgeous- I can't wait to make this place an annual tradition!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BMC-CMC
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West for an overnighter the first week in January 2010. Coldest weather they had experienced in several decades. The hotel was very nice. Well kept and very clean. Looked liked it had recently been renovated. Our room was very large, well equiped and vary comfortable. Great bed. Staff was very pleasant, friendly and helpful. They gave us some great suggestions on places to eat. On the evening we arrived one of the staff walked us to a nearby restaurant which turned out to be a great experience. The hotel is located one block from the southeast end of Duval Street. Great access to restaurants, bars, tourist shopping and sightseeing. The pool area and beach were really nice except it was so cold we only got to look. For the short period of time we were there we had a great time. Next time in Key West we will definitely stay at The Reach Resort. Great Place, Great People and Great Location.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Malibob
Reviews.Content: Only natural beach on Key West and what a nice resort. I left the Casa Marina motel (that is all that place was worth) to come to this wonderful resort because of staff and room problems. The Reach Resort was hands down the nicest place in Key West (we checked 5 other hotels while we were there). The staff was more than accomodating and the ammenities were spectacular. The beach went out forwver and only up to your chest. Did I mention the only natural beach and it is the biggest attached to a resort as well. Dont waste your money on some place that has 4 foot of beach behind the marina or no beach at all, do you want to go out on rocks to get into the ocean? Most Key West resorts have just that. Trust me, if you want the nicest place in Key West, The Reach is for you. My honeymoon was made better because of The Reach!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Good location.”
Reviews.Author: crestheaven
Reviews.Content: "The Reach" is NOT the Casa Marina, but it is very nice. Thyey are calling it a sister property. Use of the amenities of the Casa Marina are included in guests' stay for an add'l $20. The Casa Marina is a few blocks away. but make sure you see it. Has its own Starbuck. Our Reach Resort room was clean and the bed was comfortable. There were warm robes and an expresso machine in the room. The hotel staff was pleasant, especially the manager Evelyn who ugraded us on our second night to a partial ocean view room. This was a nice touch. The hotel is a short walk to Duval Street and there is a little deli accross the street. Parking at the hotel is $20. The complimentary bath products were very nice. Resort has a nice bathing beach, and gym. The pool is not heated. We had a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting if you can get the right price...”
Reviews.Author: MrsPrince
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West for his birthday in August. This was our first trip to Key West and we wanted to stay outside the busy part of Duval Street, yet be walking distance to most attractions. We found a package deal on Priceline that included hotel and airfare direct to Key West from Seattle. The price for the hotel was very reasonable considering that the weather was extremely hot and summer vacation was over for local kids at that point, so many locals had just left the previous week. I failed to understand in booking the trip that 85-89 degrees was actually about 115 considering the humidity/heat index. I recommend hydrating yourself well in advance if you are traveling to this area during this time of year. I spent quite a bit of time inside the hotel during the day due to this! When we arrived we were on the third floor overlooking the pool, with a partial view of the ocean and private beach area. Due to some work they were doing on the air conditioning system, we were moved after the first two nights of our stay to another room. Initially we were placed in a room overlooking the parking area and garbage dumpsters when we were moved. I requested a change to a different room due to the obvious availability of space in the resort and the fact that it was mid-week. We were moved to a suite at that point for no addiitional charge. The new room was absolutely amazing. Located on the third floor, it overlooked the pool and ocean. There was a huge bathroom located near the entry. It had a large tiled shower on one side and a separate shower and full bath on the other. The sink/mirror area was separate and I appreciated this while trying to get ready in the morning with my husband. This would be great for a family with young kids as there was also a large living room/eating area with a pull-out couch. The suite had a fridge with a small freezer, sink and counter area. I would have appreciated a microwave and coffee maker given that there was abundant counter space for both. There was a seating area for four and two large LCD televisions, one in the living area and one in the bedroom. The bedroom was around a corner but not closed off by a door. The beds in both rooms were king size and very comfortable. The air conditioning was perfect and there were also ceiling fans above the beds. The pool staff, especially Ricardo, were very helpful and engaging with their personalities. Getting food/drink service by the pool was impossible even during slow times from the restaurant, however. The restaurant was overpriced and the staff were not terribly friendly. There was a topless-permitted beach area to the right of the gazebo area according to the staff. I did not take advantage of this as this area was in perfect view of the bar/restaurant staff and some people at the resort had families with small children. This area has one of the only private sand beaches in Key West. That was a major draw for us. Swimming in the ocean from the resort was fantastic. There is a watersports business on site that rents jetskis for use around the resort area or tours in a group if you want to go around Key West in its entirety. The drinks were incredibly expensive at the restaurant/bar and we chose to walk two blocks to a bar that was also a liquor store and stock up there instead. I was not impressed with housekeeping as room service trays were left in the hallways for up to three days at a stretch. In this heat, that is really gross. We had a very brief walk to my husband's birthday dinner at Louie's Backyard. We had breakfast each day on Duval Street at a variety of intimate coffee houses and casual breakfast joints. The walk to the other end of Duval was long given the heat and we ended up using a taxi due to this. I would recommend this hotel for the location if you are looking for quiet with relative proximity to the action (maximum 20 minute walk) or if a sand beach is an important aspect of your trip. The hotel is also close to the off leash dog beach next to Louie's Backyard. We did not bring a pet but it is our understanding that dogs of a certain size are allowed for a fee. We bid $140/night plus taxes and fees on Priceline. The hotel adds a $22/day resort fee (they even tax this fee). The resort is adjacent to a sister property-the Casa Marina-and the resort fee includes use of the activities and amenities at this property, and you can charge meals and drinks there to your room. There is a daily list of activities and events, and most of these took place at the Casa Marina. Most resort amenities are ones that a tip is expected for providing, so I would not say this is a good value. If you can get the right price, it is worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff! Nice Beach!Not sure why so many negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Happy2travel_10
Reviews.Content: As stated in the title, I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews. I have stayed at many nice places, and though some were better, this is a very nice place. Easy check in, nice staff, clean rooms, and great location. It is right on the beach and a 2 block walk to DuVal Street. It was quiet ...but...again ..close to DuVal when/if you wanted more going on. I have no complaints from this resort beyond the $20 addtnl fee per day..per person that you don't find out about until you get there. We had great weather..low to mid 80's...that sure helped the trip! ha....Maybe I'd feel different if the weather wasn't so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views, superb room, personal attention from resort staff”
Reviews.Author: RutaOttawa_Ontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 12 days and enjoyed every minute. We had a room with a great view of the ocean, used room service several times, and interacted with hotel staff often, to get information about Key West and to request personal assistance of various kinds. Housekeeping staff kept our well appointed room meticulous. Although this is an upscale hotel, it felt like we were staying in a friendly place in our own hometown. We would especially like to mention the friendly personal attention we got from Keith Johnson, Tara Brannigan-Ivanova, and Rich, Hugh, Corey, and A.J. (we didn't get their last names). We had a great time and hope to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place, don't even consider it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bose_rock
Reviews.Content: The temperature in Key West was very cold during our stay. A record low. But unfortunately, we had to sleep in this cold weather as well. The temp. inside the room on the first 2 nights was around 48F!!! The rooms had no heat at all. The staff had no extra blankets, no portable heaters and didn't seem to care. One staff member explained that they didn't have heat at home either. That certainly helped me out. The room wasn't clean and the furnishings were more like Motel 6. The shower, as explained in many other reviews, would deposit about 1 to 2 inches of water on the floor no matter what we did to prevent it. Imagine stepping out of the shower into a 50 degree room and standing in water!! Security didn't exist, homeless people were found sleeping in the garage area. When returning to hotel late at night, I was able to walk through the main entrance without seeing any staff or required to use a key card to gain access. The advertised partial ocean view, didn't exist due to large palm trees blocking the view. The advertised "botique suite" wasn't any better than a standard room at a Hampton. No microwaves, no coffee makers, (unless you like "nespresso" machines). Had to pay for internet use which was about as fast as "dial up". On arrival the room didn't have a clock or the promised i-Pod docking station. The beach area was "ok" at best and the grounds looked nice. The location was ok as well. Other than that, as many others have said, there are many nice places to stay in Key West. The people that give this place good reviews obviously haven't stayed at nice places. Either that, or they have relatives on the staff. This hotel will not survive in this competitve market. We can only hope that the next owners will transform this to a nice place. It certainly has potential. But for now STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. It is giving Waldorf Astoria and the Hilton properties a bad name.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chattykathy28
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel!! My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was fantastic. The hotel had it's own private beach. the staff was very friendly. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. They were very helpful in booking all our activities. The food was a liitle pricey, however location was close to everything. We also really loved the jet ski tour! We would definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Reach?" More like "It's a Stretch!"”
Reviews.Author: DCSteveTraveler
Reviews.Content: "The Reach" alone is NOT a five star property. (Maybe 3 at best.) Nearby sister property, Casa Marina, might have a shot at possibly being maybe a weak 5 star on a good day. Seems "The Reach" and it's nicer sister property, "Casa Marina" are selling themselves as a duo package hotel, which, with "Casa's" amenities factored in, it MIGHT be weak 5 star. Our HH points reservation was for Casa Marina, but when we arrived, and keep in mind we're HH Diamond members, we were given what was probably the worst room in the entire place. Hideous. A closet. Windows didn't open. No balcony. Small, Musty. no air. (OK, you get the point.) Fortunately, we quickly called nearby sister "The Reach" and Carlos set us up w/a a basic partial ocean view room with balcony which was so much better than what Casa had to offer. In fact, Carlos and housekeeping really tried to win us over. More so than the Casa which had no options and didn't seem too interested in making us happy. Unfortunately, despite our willingness to TRY to love The Reach, the overall experience does not warrant a return visit. Oh, almost forgot BUGS BUGS BUGS in the room! Though not bed bugs, they were annoying to say the least, especially from alleged "five star" resort. MAYBE stay here if you get a great discount or deal, maybe Priceline, or if using points, but do not pay full price for this place. Check out Westin and Hyatt properties on other end of Duvall. Finally, this being the fourth "Waldorf Astoria Collection" Hilton property we visited this year, noticing HUGE inconsistencies between properties. Hilton's trying to make them their "luxury collection" but unfortunately, the four we've seen need (another) major makeover and some money pumped into their rooms to bring them up to date. Have been more inclined to be a Marriott Rewards devotee since their five star/resort properties are much nicer for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo is the Man!”
Reviews.Author: BigDog2743
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is awesome! Service was outstanding. Ask for Ricardo at the beach/pool. He's the man! Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff, beach, pool and beds!”
Reviews.Author: edwb49
Reviews.Content: Everything is walkable from here. We never felt crowded anywhere in the hotel. The room was comfortable and the bedding was fabulous. Very up-to-date machines in exercise room. While the look of its sister resort, the Casa Marina, is more resort-y, we found the smaller size of the Reach rewarding. Reach guests can use all the amenities of the Casa Marina, although we never did. At the Reach, it was easy to find space at the beach and pool, and rarely was the exercise room filled. We had only lunch items at the restaurant, and they were good. The front desk staff was very helpful and easy to deal with, especially Carlos. Even the doormen/bell staff were a pleasure. Just a few very minor negatives: The in-room safe is on the closet's high shelf, so shorties, like me, have to find things by feel; before checking out, I got a chair so I could look in to make sure we didn't leave anything. The restaurant only has a breakfast buffet; if we could have ordered a la carte, we would have eaten breakfast there. Also, the decor could have just a bit more pizazz--nothing artificial or glitzy, maybe some more plants/flowers or something to add a bit more color.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a respite from the cold with young adult kids and friends”
Reviews.Author: pcs1
Reviews.Content: Just home from 5 days at The Reach Resort in Key West. We were there with 4 young adults -- our two "kids" with friends. My husband and I had a one bedroom suite, we had two island view doubles for the "kids". We enjoyed our time and would recommend both the resort and Key West. I chose the Reach primarily for location and services (including access to Casa Marina) and we weren't disappointed. The location was quiet but close enough to the Duval Street nightlife so that our kids and their friends could walk there at night. Lots of activities in Key West -- golf for my husband and son, I rented a bicycle and had fun exploring the island, my daughter and her friends went to the spa, did jetskis and parasailing, and I also went on a kayaking trip. And of course we all spent time enjoying the sun at the pool and/or the beach. Specific to The Reach ... Good points were: * Rooms were comfortable and well serviced. All have a small balcony. Beds comfortable. * Pool and beach area are nice albeit not large -- pool service attendents were cheerful and helpful. * Full access to the larger beach and pools at Casa Marina if you want -- and it's a less than 5 minute walk. * Concierge helpful with restaurant recommendations and reservations. All in all service was friendly and helpful. * Not alot of young kids -- which at our stage of life we really appreciate. We enjoyed the diversity of the guests -- quite a few Europeans and family groups with older kids. Some less favorable feedback: * The layout of the one bedroom suite was awkward in that the bathroom was open to the bedroom - no door. Even us old married types prefer more privacy. This would be worth fixing in a future renovation. * Restaurant service for breakfast and lunch was limited. Breakfast was an OK buffet. Lunch service limited. Lunch at Casa Marina was better. * And as always at this sort of resort -- prices for drinks and food at the pools and beach was very high. But that's to be expected. All in all we enjoyed our time and feel we made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money going here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: warner12308
Reviews.Content: What a waste of money! Room was very small and not very clean. This was definately not a 4 diamond 'resort'. Not even a tub in the small bathroom, shower didn't work properly, toliet paper holder glued onto wall, electrical sockets coming off too. No maid service for 5 of the 6 days we were there. No such thing as an ocean view unless you stay in a executive suite = false advertisment. Small beach, maybe 100ft., and you can't walk the beach. Kids everywhere, even running the halls past midnight, every night! Price for a small bottle of water at the pool bar was $10 bucks plus they automatically add 18% tip. Pool was small. The only plus was a restaurant 3 blocks away called the "Abbondonza" - Italian food to die for. Awesome!! Key West was dirty and homeless people everywhere, drunks everywhere. Save your money, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and still charged extra for Internet.”
Reviews.Author: Ange1024
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach Resort on December 26, planning a 2-day visit while we did some relaxing and sightseeing in Key West. The hotel was very expensive, just over $400.00 per night. We checked into the hotel and found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. When we got to our room we found it to be quite small and had no bath tub - something we had specifically requested when we reserved our room. We called front desk and asked if they had any rooms available with bathtubs. Unfortunately, they had no suites available, so we checked out a day early in order to find a hotel with a tub. We were also disappointed to find that they also charged $11.95 for 24-hour Internet . At $400+ per night, I would have thought that the Internet could have been included. The hotel was very noisy but maybe that was just this time of year. We moved to the hotel across the road, paid $100.00 less/night and Internet was included.- and they it had a tub.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Poorly maintained Beach - Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Fenske
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a Beach we could actually use but found the un-kept, seaweed covered beach to be just nasty. I even asked them a couple times during our stay if they were going to rake or remove the seaweed from the beach and was told that it was a natural beach? Whatever ! It stunk & was funky! The Covered Dock is cool, Beautiful sunrise and sunset pictures off the dock and beach. Hotel room was nice but again.........way too much $ for what we got. Location is near the Southernmost point so it is a bit of a walk to the Duvall Street party but not bad. Ridiculously high priced Hotel restaurant and parking fees for using their paring garage were high too. We enjoyed our vacation but definitely will not stay at this over priced, over rated, hotel again. Save your money and find a weekly rental of a beachfront condo. We paid more to stay at the Reach ! Pool was not heated so it was too cool for anyone. Nobody in it the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best vacations that I've had in a long time”
Reviews.Author: 09beachbum
Reviews.Content: I totally enjoyed my stay at the Reach Resort. I loved the convenience of a beach on the premises. The staff at the pool and beach area were very courteous and were always available. The Strip House restaurant had great food. Rob, the bartender, was awesome. He was attentive without been intrusive or pushy. He made excellent recommendations for my meals and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A truly relaxing tropical getaway.”
Reviews.Author: readerFlorida
Reviews.Content: I love Key West ---the sunsets/sunrises, climate, restaurants, places to see, walks on Duval and those little side streets. Key West is a magical place that just makes you relax and forget about anything else. We are just too crazy up north. My daughter wants to live there some day. We found a little cafe not too far from The Reach where we had breakfast on the porch. What a relaxing experience. Our accommodations were top notch. We were on the beach everyday and the staff was so friendly and helpful...especially Ricardo. We did not want to leave and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendliest place in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Beachfan88
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Keys and we stayed at 3 hotels over a 9 day period. This hotel was by far the worst of the three we stayed in. The front desk staff was terribly unfriendly and unprofessional. They did not answer the phones or put us on hold for so long that we hung up. They couldn't answer even basic information about the hotel or the surrounding area. The Keys are such a friendly laid-back place, but we just hated this place. The room was nothing special and the bathroom was quite small. I can verify what a previous poster said about the towel rack in the shower and non-working coffee machine. The bathroom also had a walk in shower with a half-door, i.e. the floor got soaked and stayed soaked whenever you took a shower. The view from the room was nice, but the front door of the room opened onto the parking garage and a hideous labrynith. Also, we were there during a storm and the "open air" lobby area flooded, so we had to go in water up to our ankles to get into the main lobby. We did go over to the Casa Marina, and although the resort was MUCH nicer, they seemed to be at least marginally more friendly. Tip: Stay in one of the guest houses or motels on Simonton, and you can walk to the beach by the Southernmost Cafe. The beach is public and beautiful and you can rent an umbrella and chair for under $20.00. Skip this overpriced dump!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMimi2_7
Reviews.Content: The resort was pretty, but laid out in a fashion that unless your room was right next to the elevator, you had to walk "forever" to get to your room amid many twists and turns. We made 15 different turns to get to our room, so leaving to get ice (next to elevator) was almost out of the question. There was no coffeepot in the room and no complimentary coffee anywhere on site which we found unacceptable for a hotel that expensive. There was an "expresso machine" in the room, but we weren't sure what the beverage was it made - certainly not any type of coffee (we tried it and dumped out). We were told if we wanted coffee we could walk 2 blocks to the nearest restaurant or go to the restaurant on site for breakfast ($22). The hotel had recently been rennovated, yet there was only one towel bar in the bath and it was in the shower. The beds were fine, but we were expecting two queen size beds and they were double. The staff was nice enough, but poorly informed. Key West isn't very big, yet when we asked one staff member at the desk one question and then later asked another, we got entirely differfent answers. This happened daily. There were also ants in the room - on 4th floor, despite no food in room. They also tack on a $20/person/day fee for use of "facilities", like weight room, pool, etc. whether you use them or not.. It was an expensive resort for not a lot of amenities, none that you would expect from a resort part of the Waldorf Astoria chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations, we will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: ValerieC62
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the internet, though I called the hotel directly to make the reservation. I forgot the name of the representative but she was very friendly and helpful in making our room choice. This hotel is on the southern end of Key West, not in the heart of Duval, so if you want quieter accomodations, this is it. We were impressed with how large the room and bathroom were and how clean everything was (I believe we had ocean view king deluxe). The bed was very comfortable. The staff always greeted us, helped with all questions we asked, and one staff member went out of his way to help us drill a fresh coconut to get at the inside of it. The large lounge/chair (not sure what you call it) on the outside deck of the bar at the Strip restaurant was awesomely comfortable. We want one for our pool deck! We did not dine at the restaurant on premises, so I can't comment on the food. The beach area isn't huge, but it was fine during our stay. The pool was nice, but not heated at the time our visit. Accomodations at the sister hotel and another are also available to guests. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cs10
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent. Jenny at check-in was very helpful, but most notable was our beach staff, Ricardo and DJ. Ricardo really made the pool and beach experience delightful with his joyful exuberance, his delicious drinks and popsicles. He even requested songs for us as a surprise. Definitely this resport is worth a visit! Our room was beautiful, always clean and our view was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great all-around experience”
Reviews.Author: r0ckysdad
Reviews.Content: My partners and I take our top employees and their spouses away each year for a long weekend. This year we decided on Key West and stayed at the Reach Resort. We made the right choice- the resort was very cozy- rooms were clean, had a great view, the beach was beautiful, and the staff was incredibly friendly. The concierge helped us schedule a few offsite group dinners and the proximity to all the fun on Duval Street just added to the experience. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect for a Luxury Resort”
Reviews.Author: vmptravelr
Reviews.Content: I rarerly write reviews but if you stay in Luxry resort you should get more. Our first room had ant's running all through the room including the bed My daughter had several bites with mild reactions as they were in the second room also. We booked 5 months in advance and paid over $250 per night for a room that overlooked the parking garage an an alley or back street. We were told all rooms with 2 beds were in that area of the building. House keeping said they were out off coffee for the room when we asked. The referidgerator in the room worked intermitent one moring warm one cool. The people on the grounds were friendly. Ricardo interacted with us by the pool and did his best to see people were having fun. Overall a poor expierence for the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....not a Resort.”
Reviews.Author: thegame34
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon in August. We stayed in Naples for most of the trip but decided to take a 2 night trip down to Key West. The Reach is a very nice hotel for the money you pay. The staff was very friendly and willing to help us with anything we needed. They even had a fruit basket sent up to our room upon hearing we were on our honeymoon. The Reach is on the quiet side of the island which is what we were looking for. Its only a short scooter ride or about a mile walk down to where all the excitement is. The rooms were decorated nicely and were clean. We had an ocean view suite which the views were incredible from. My only complaint was the $40 per night resort fee. Seems like the fee really went to nothing since you have to pay for everything on top of your room fee anyways. But given the price we got I cant complain. Overall, the Reach Resort was a great stay and we would defiantly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: 2girlygirls
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I flew into Ft, Lauderdale and took a drive down to Key West, Florida. I had a little trouble finding the hotel, but made one stop and had the correct directions. Once we arrived, the staff was very friendly and helpful. It is a maze of rooms at the hotel. It can be kind of hard to get around, but was easy for us to figure out. The rooms are decorated nicely and the air conditioner works well. We had a little issue with some condensation leaking from the a/c, but was addressed quickly. The front desk attendant and bellhop were extremely friendly. The man who run the pool was awesome! Always had ice water and towels ready. We rented a jetski for an hour on the beach and it was wonderful just as well. We would both love to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place for a wedding”
Reviews.Author: DRCJFamof4
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort was incredible! Our view was so beautiful and so was our room. The service was great. Our dear friends were married here and the setting was perfect! Their wedding planner did a great job making it a special celebration. The food and drink at the reception was incredible! We cannot wait to make another visit to Key West and stay at The Reach!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jgeiser
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled to Key West and stayed at the Reach Hotel for our entire stay. The room was exactly as pictured but hardly a resort. All spa, gift shops are located at their sister resort The Casa Marina. We ordered room service our first morning there It was basic and overpriced and then our tray was never picked up. We assumed after a day we had to put it outside our door where it stayed until we left 4 days later. The staff was friendly but we really weren't impressed with anything this hotel had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “a calm haven, with some issues”
Reviews.Author: bubbles4352
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2009. On the whole it was a nice building and location, but the experience was let down by a few things. The hotel is well placed, modern, clean and on the whole beautifully equipped. Itâ€™s at the southern end of Simonton street, about 100 metres from the southernmost USA marker. It is a fair distance from all the activity at the other end of Duval St, but that's arguably a good thing... It's a quiet location. Most noise seemed to come from the large air con on the roof. The rooms are pretty and our one (443) had a balcony overlooking the pool and the hotelâ€™s small private beach and jetty. The aircon was effective and the bed very comfortable indeed. The room safe was in a second wardrobe, somewhat unusually placed beside the toilet. Our room had no coffee or tea maker or bathrobes, even though the room description said there was both. We rang reception and they delivered a coffee maker. But we never saw bathrobes. The bathroom had some issues. The handbasin when we arrived had a very obvious dripping leaning wobbling broken tap/faucet. We were amazed that something like this was not spotted by housekeeping during their between-guest cleanings. We reported it to reception and it was fixed promptly. The shower was form over function - it looked state of the art but water leaked all over the floor. We learned to set up towels to catch the leakage. Exterior signage was a mess. If we followed the signs from our room to reception then it seemed to take us on a 100 metre wild goose chase around the level. There was a lift 10 metres away; an arrow pointing at that would have been simpler. There were some issues with the staff. Reception were friendly and tried to be helpful but were mostly useless. They do need to work on their local knowledge. For example, I asked one guy at reception where was the nearest convenience store, as I wanted to buy some razors and things. The guy said that I should go to a place called (I kid you not) Denny's! He said it was more of a restaurant than anything else... I ignored that advice and went looking by myself and found a convenience store about 50 metres away, on the same street as the hotel. Later on we asked the concierge (a different guy) to recommend some restaurants; he gave us a list of two, and told us to give the restaurant a card with his name on it (presumably so he could get a kickback). He also had no idea how long it was take to walk to Mallory Square, saying that it would probably take 45 minutes to cycle. They weren't all bad; we did find one efficient woman working at reception, and their presentation (clothing) was impeccable. The Pool/beach staff deserve a special mention. I got the impression that they worked very long hours and weren't hugely motivated. Service was only sunrise-sunset and somewhat unenthused. They would snatch the deck chairs and towels away on the stroke of 18:00, even if the sun was shining and people were still there. If you went down at eg 18:15 then odds were that there would be neither chairs nor staff. One particular staff member used to prowl around the pool area doing this weird grumpy vaguely threatening passive-aggressive banter with the guests but not actually helping them i.e. forgetting to deliver promised towels. My girlfriend found his attitude invasive and unwelcome in a supposedly calm, relaxing environment. We sat down by the beach once and were forced to see quite an unpleasant shouting match between some of the jet-ski staff. I'm not sure if they are affiliated with the Reach resort, but they share the same private beach as the hotel and it doesn't make a good impression. In any case, it doesn't sound a nice place to work. There was a daily "resort fee" to cover tips etc, but the bills still came with a section for adding tips. We were vehemently against this resort fee and suggest the Reach Resort find better ways to top up their coffers. We didn't try the restaurant. If you are staying there for any length of time then I'd recommend getting bicycles for travelling around, as it is a good walk to any of the sights. Would we go there again? Yes â€“ the hotel itself, although expensive and needs polishing in some areas, is still a calm haven away from it all, but would resist paying the resort fee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SMN-FLL
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel right on a beach. It's on the east side of the island, and it was a long walk to Mallory Square and the night life.

Reviews.Title: “on a return trip, I would stay at the Reach the entire trip”
Reviews.Author: AstridWilson
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Reach Hotel for 2 nights and the Casa Marina for one night. I could not decide between the Reach and the Casa Marina. I am glad we did both, but on a return trip, I would stay at the Reach the entire trip. The rooms were the same price, but at the Reach, we had an Ocean View Suite with a corner balcony and at the Casa marina, we had a partial ocean view small room. The grounds at the Casa marina are FAR superior to the Reaches grounds; however if you stay at the Reach you are welcome to use the facilities at the Casa Marina. The Reach has one pool and a small, but very clean beach. The Casa Marina has two pools and a very large rocky beach. There Casa Marin beach is lined with palm trees and Hammocks while the Reach beach is open. We attempted to snorkel under the pier at the Casa Marina, but the visibility was very poor. We ate Breakfast every morning at the Casa Marina as you can order ala carte at the Marina. Average breakfast is $10 per person + coffee or tea or $16.00 for the buffet. We played Bocce Ball at both locations. The Reach has a real court and it was actually the first time we ever played on a court and not just in the sand or grass. My only complaint is there was No coffee maker at either Hotel. The beds were comfortable at both locations and both places were quiet at night. There is much more activity at the Casa Marian then the Reach. They are both within easy walking distance of Duvall Street; however the Reach is a little closer, as we had a car it really did not matter to us. We paid $12 a night to Self Park at the Reach and at the Casa Marina we parked free on the street. This was easier then in the lot, at least this was true for us as we had a room at the end of the hall and there was an easy elevator to the pool area and the back entrance. Our first evening in Key West we ate dinner at Sloppy Joes. This was the worst meal, I had on the trip. I had Conch Fritters which tasted more like bread then Conch. Dave had a club sandwich, his was much better than mine. We then walked over to Irish Kevinâ€™s. This has got to be my favorite bar in Key West. Yes, itâ€™s a little Raunchy, but it really is fun. Donâ€™t leave Key West without stopping in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect wedding location and relaxing resort, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: mnjs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Resort's gazebo on the ocean. It was absolutely perfect. The view and setting were amazing, the garden is great for photos too afterwards. The Resort's staff were extremely pleasant and professional. They were very understanding and accomodating. The gazebo/wedding was handled by Jason Gates, from their Strip House Restaurant (which is also excellent by the way). He made the day very easy for me and was always their to answer any questions or address concerns. He even asked the jet ski tour guys to wait to put in that morning til after our wedding so it was not noisy and they were not in the photos. He was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and if you are looking for a wedding destination there, it is great. With the hotel being on the beach away from the bars a bit, but close enought to walk, it is a great location. Hung out on the beach a lot with chairs and not rocky so easy to swim in ocean. Rooms were very modern and updated. Comfy bed. Overall, great experience. Service was excellent too!!

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF --Stay next door at Santa Maria Suites. Same price but 10 times the value.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024_9
Reviews.Content: Everything here was a rip off. We checked into our "suite" and were surprised to find it was just a larger room with a seating area. Front desk was not helpful -- they claimed this was their suite and they had nothing better. Also they refused to honor the breakfast that was supposed to be included in our stay (we booked through Hotels.com ). Staff were generally unhelpful and cold. Pool was hot -- we wanted to take a refreshing swim and it felt like swimming in a hot tub. After that 1st night we went right next door to Santa Maria Suites, the #1 rated place on Key West, and checked into a beautiful, luxurious, clean, well appointed TWO BEDROOM APARTMENT for the same price as we paid at the Reach! We were kicking ourselves that we wasted a night at the Reach. The Trip Advisor reviewers were right: Santa Maria is #1 for a reason and it is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel-great location-awesome price”
Reviews.Author: meesha714
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this place. It was beautiful. The only disappointment was unexpected charges. There was a high parking fee and a daily resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip - Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sinasi01
Reviews.Content: I spent four wonderful days in Key West with my 15 year old daughter at The Reach. The hotel has all the amenities one might need to enjoy a secluded vacation as well as an informative staff including a concierge if you would like to venture out. The concierge set us up with a scooter immediately and even arranged shuttle service for pick-up. We were also lucky enough to have a snorkeling trip set up by the hotel which departed a short walk away. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a pleasant vacation whether traveling with family or that special someone.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was filthy!”
Reviews.Author: Rbudreau
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to start. Our room was so dirty the cleaning staff had to come back and clean it 5 minutes after our arrival. There were ants in the bathroom as well as tufts of hair. The mini fridge was broken and our floor was dirty. The elevators are not air conditioned and while this may not seem like a big deal. It is July in Key West...... very hot. We requested our linens be changed on our second day this did not take place until 7pm. There was sand on the lobby floor and did not look as if it had been swept in days. The pool bathroom was so dirty with paper towel and tissue all over the floor. There was also standing water on the floor. There were dirty towels on the chairs with piles of dirty towels at the towel stand. This is absolutely not worthy of the Waldorf name.

Reviews.Title: “adequate not sensational”
Reviews.Author: eagertraveler09
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at the Reach and agree with many of the reviews here. We chose this property due to the pool/beachfront and the summer escape package they were offering. We were told it was one of the nicest hotels on the island. I simply expected more from the Waldorf name and from the fact I was paying a resort charge. The front desk had minimal information upon check in - just gave key and room number. There are very few extra ammenities at the hotel, so I guess there's not much to say at check in. While it was mentioned in our room description, we didn't have a coffee maker or a wet bar in our room. The refrigerator was very useful to keep water cold. And you will need water as the temps. are hot in Key West. You have to pay for internet access from your room and to park in the garage. We saw room service trays being delivered, but never received information on how to order room service. There was no property information in the room. Just a little description on the card that your room key was housed in. I'm sure we just needed to call the front desk to find out the answer to any question we had, but it was odd to receive no information and have no information available in your room. I was there at the same time as the previous reviewer and agree that when it rains/pours the resort floods - as does most of Key West. You don't expect a pond of water when you exit the elevator into the lobby area. But you're already wet from your walk to the elevator. The loud music into the night was due to a wedding reception being held on the beach. I was thankful my room was on the other side of the hotel. The food is overpriced and the automatic gratuity added to your bill means they don't have to serve you quickly or attentively. But there are nice options down Simonston Street that are easily accessible. I also agree with another reviewer about the dirty a/c filters. Disgusting. Overall I'd expect a Waldorf Astoria property to have better upkeep - not to have mold on the shower curtain and something that looked like ketchup on the window curtain. The pool and beach area are nice, but anyone can access them. And they become crowded. Peaceful swims can be had early in the morning or late at night. You can't beat the full moon view through the palm trees on the beach. The location on the quiter side of the island is great, but be prepared to walk or rent some kind of transportation, it is a hike to the attractions. I would not rule out staying here again, but I would research other opions on the island first.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Waldorf caliber.”
Reviews.Author: jh183116
Reviews.Content: WE'll start with the positives: Room was pretty good. Bed was comfortable. Housekeeping was good. HOWEVER, -Super slow checkin.. -Shower design that guarantees that you will have water all over the bathroom floor. -Elevators that did not work. Got stuck in one elevator this afternoon with 8 people in it. -Nobody at the towel station by the pool. Packages with clean towels all had super small (hand) towels) but no big towels. Dirty towels all over lounge chairs by the pool.. nobody picking them up (mind you, you pay $20 RESORT FEE EACH DAY) -When it rains, you cannot get from your room to the elevator, lobby, or restaurant without getting wet. -After it rains, there is standing water everywhere in the corriders, etc. -Parking garage has so much standing water (even though covered) that it is almost impossible to get to your car without walking through puddles that are at least a half inch deep. -Music from downstairs last night that was so loud we could hear it in our room with everything closed up. Music did not stop until after 11PM. -Breakfast here (which we only did because it was pouring rain) had buffet only for $18 or $19 per person. Added an 18% service charge automatically without saying anything.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is okay, but service was great”
Reviews.Author: jayfe13
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is above average, but I had a higher expectation, since it's a Waldorf Astoria Collection, the hotel is a little bit small, the beach wasn't that clean when we were there, probably cause the rainy and windy days before we got there. we had a boutique suite, it was very nice, living was big and the balcony you can see the beach. and the service was outstanding there, the staff was very friendly and the housekeeper always did a good job. and i just want to mention this, my girlfriend left her swimsuit in the room after we checked out, and i called them up, Ray from lost and found dept called me right away and sent me back the swimsui.t =)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Notranto
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to visit The Reach for a wedding and was very happy with the hotel. I had never been to Key West before and definitely made the right choice by staying at the Reach. The hotel was a resort in every aspect and they take great care of their guests. I am definitely going to go back again next summer

Reviews.Title: “beach: great; staff and service: great; rooms: not so much”
Reviews.Author: njbnorton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a five-day stay at The Reach in Key West - our first visit both to the hotel and Key West itself. The hotel itself was what I expected after reading all the review on this site. The beach was great - as were the pool/beach service staff, DJ and Ricardo. Food/beverage service at the beach/pool was outstanding; the food and drinks were great! We travelled with another couple so the company was more important than the accommodations, however there were a few things that I would have expected that The Reach lacked: most importantly: no coffeemakers in the rooms!!! If you like your am coffee, be prepared to pay $5 per cup - PLUS an 18% gratuity tacked on top! I personally found this to be outrageous! The nearest "coffee shop" (where you can get a cup of coffee with pre-packaged creamers and day-old pastries from Publix) was located on the next block! The Reach should consider SOME kind of "continental" breakfast or coffee for a minimal fee -- the only breakfast choice is the $18 per person buffet. My husband ventured to the dining room to bring coffee and a pastry to the room for a quick, light bite...he ended up bringing back two small coffees and a small croissant and was $18 poorer! Shame on you, Reach! Secondly, a comment about the ac in the guest rooms: I set my thermostat at 65 for the duration of our trip; my room never felt that cool, however...felt more like 70 at its coolest. A quick check of the air filters revealed that the Reach needs to replace them! Yuck! A third suggestion to The Reach is to follow the example of another area hotel that has to deal with heat and humidity during the summer months: how about putting a few giant ice cubes into the pool? Besides being a novelty, it would cool down the temperature - which was HOT most days we were there!

Reviews.Title: “helped make are trip fantastic”
Reviews.Author: mangledtrip
Reviews.Content: Were to start, the whole staff at the reach was great. The rooms are nice ,although their isn't much to them ,but we were only in them for a short time each day.haveing your own private beach makes it worth it though.

Reviews.Title: “Not great.”
Reviews.Author: vg411973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just OK - and definitely not what I expect a "Waldorf Astoria Collection" hotel to be. The staff was super friendly and very helpful, but the hotel is disappointing. The rooms have balconies, flat screen's and overhead fans above the beds (excellent feature - kept us cool!) however the amenities in the guest room were lacking and I didn't feel that the room was clean enough for my standards. The pool area is great, as is direct access to the beach, however the restaurant service was slow and the bar was disappointing (part of the restaurant, not a true hotel bar). The grounds are small and I didn't feel like there were enough guest amenities or luxury offerings befitting of a five star / Waldorf Astoria Collection hotel. The hotel needs work and is a 3 star at best. The location is good because it is one of the few hotels that has its own beach - and Duval Street is just a minute taxi ride (the taxi's are inexpensive and plentiful - we wrote the # down and called them each time we needed them, and the taxi service never made us wait more than 10 minutes to be picked up). I would recommend this hotel b/c of the beach and location - but not to someone who really wants a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the resort made our trip special”
Reviews.Author: truck5456
Reviews.Content: We had a great time while at this resort! The staff made our stay so much fun and really had the no worries attitude! The reosort had many features that made it tought to leave at the end of our trip. From the pool to the private bach and of course barefoot billies crew sure made the trip relaxing. The front desk staff and the Concierge's were top notch as well. there were a few minor things that the resort need to fix like the shower door and curtain set up and they need to do serious a steam clean of the furniture and the carpet. Other then that the bed was comfortable the view was awesom and the stay was relaxing A+++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: “our hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: redman74
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the reach resort in key west in july and while the service was excellent and the beach view was perfect there are some drawbacks. the room we stayed in was small and the small refriderator kept kicking off so our sodas would get cold. not enough room for clothing storage, not enough hangers in the closet for hanging shirts, (we had clothes for a week).no microwave, come on every hotel has microwaves now. you wernt allowed to take your own drinks to the pool or beach area so they charged $5.00 for cokes (and expected a tip). and last but not least you had to pay to park in the hotels garage, i mean it was under the hotel it wasnt as if they were renting garage space.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we had a Reach Resort in the Poconos...”
Reviews.Author: fritzie07
Reviews.Content: There is alot to say about the Reach Resort!!! For starters they are very family friendly with a very adult atmosphere. I have a three year old and they were so kind and sweet and really tended to all of ours needs. We were there for 11 days and had a BLAST!!! The staff is friendly and professional. Ricardo and DJ that worked pool side were amazing. I would recommend the Reach Resort to everyone....in fact.....I already have. I would visit again in a heartbeat!!!! KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just left The Reach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lora609
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Reach four nights. I spoke with Catherine when I made my reservations, she was there when we checked in, her great attitude, information about the local attractions and dining made our trip so enjoyable. Catherine should train all front desk reservation agents on customer service, she is awesome! DJ and Brian poolside worked tirelessly to make sure everyone was taken care of, they even handed out popsicles to everyone just at the right time. The unusal bad weather limited the time at The Reach beach and pool, but when we could make it, the service was great! Marta never lets your drinks run dry. Yes, the drinks are 12.00 with tax and the tip included it was $15.00! But the Mango Colada was REALLY good! Our room was very comfortable, we were upgraded as Hilton Honor members. We had some issues with the air conditioning the first night. Catherine and the Manager offered us another room to use just a couple of rooms down, we stayed in our room but the next day maintenance was there ready to fix it. The bedding was very comfortable. The only negative was the attitude of the concierge, she was very rude when she realized Catherine had called a about a dining reservation in her absentence. She didn't make a reservation, she only called to see if the place was open, it wasn't. The concierge didn't want to help us after that making comments like "I don't get paid a salary". It was very weird. We loved The Reach! It is very nice. Visit the Casa Marina while your there too. Lora

Reviews.Title: “Nice horel but lots of extrasI”
Reviews.Author: longhaultraveller_9
Reviews.Content: Our room was a good size, with two patio doors, and very well furnished with a well appointed bathroom - no bath - just a large shower. On entering the room there was a small kitchen area that housed a fridge and sink with a high table with bar stools adjoining. There was a flat screen television, iron & board and large room safe housed in the clothes closet within the bathroom. We had a lounge area with a settee and armchair and occasional tables, and all in all it looked very nice and modern. The balcony was the length of the room but not very wide and very exposed being the centre of a three sided square and was overlooked by, and looked into, all other balconies. It was furnished with a small table and two upright chairs. We had requested a sea view and it was there in the distance, across the gardens with other room blocks much nearer than ours. The balcony area was also very noisy from the air conditioning system housed on the roof which gave a loud hum all the time. The gardens were well kept as was the beach area, which seemed to be private to the hotel with access to boats, etc. for the guests (not sure how much these cost of if they were free). Beside the beach was a bar and restaurant which we didn't use as there were so many in town to try. On the down side, the internet was not free nor was the parking which was under the building and was unecessarily costly. The block could also be accessed via the street, bypassing the reception area, up a flight of open, outside stairs leading to the open balconies where the room doors were located. This made security very poor as anybody could come to the hotel door unseen by hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Key West, the Reach was nice but little things ruined it for us”
Reviews.Author: bkcesc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I gawked at the great photos of the reach and all of the ammenities they offered per their website, we had a great time in Key west and the location of the Reach was perfect for us but it could be so much nicer if they fixed a few things, some easy some not so easy. The room we stayed in was very small and I was suprised not to see a coffee maker, hand lotion, and no second mirror in the room, these are all things that even the cheapest economy hotels offer. On the website it talks about wireless internet but makes no mention that it's 11.95 per day (per device!). The way it's worded on the web site it seems like it's included in the price, I had work to do and papers to complete for school so I had to suck it up and pay what I though was an insane price for a wireless connection, imagine the profit margin on that one! Also, every time we flushed the toilet it would take at least twice to clear the bowl (even without toilet paper) and the handle had to be held for this to happen, very annoying at an upscale resort. In the shower, the knob would fall off very easily, also very annoying. I've read other reviews on here talking about how rude and unfriendly the wait staff were around the pool and beach, I can personally vouch for that one! My suggestion is to take out the included gratuity from the checks and make them EARN their tips, maybe then they would have a reason to be pleasant with guests. On a bright note, DJ and Ricardo were great and were always ready to go out of their way to make us feel like guests, they need to train the rest of the staff, or maybe promote them to GM and assistant GM and turn the property around from a guest services standpoint. We also ran into the problem with the resort activities sheet, many of the activities were down the beach at the Casa Marina, but my real gripe is that there was an "*" by anything that charged an additional fee and things without the "*" we assumed to be free.....not the case. When I asked the front desk about this she said most of the activities were additional and not to pay attention to the "*" and they had had other people complain about the same thing, from then on we just avoided all of the hotel activities. To the credit of the resort, upon checkout I addressed all of these problems and the front desk person after consulting with the manager refunded our entire stays worth of resort fees, would have been nice if they came out and did it in person but I was happy with the money back. There are such a variety of places to stay in key west I don't think I would go back to the reach though. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined plans”
Reviews.Author: east12
Reviews.Content: we had made reservations well in advance for a 4 night stay in an oceanview luxury suite. We were taken to our rooms with our bags and initially thought we would be very happy with the room. The view was very much of the pool, the ocean in the distance. I was pleased to see the double vanities in the bath, then I noticed there is no door on the bathroom at all. (I do realize that some people would not mind this set-up, but I do.) We called the front desk and they said they were too busy checking in guests to attend to our concerns. I thought we were guests! We were told that all the luxury suites are designed not to have doors on the bath. We offered to be moved to Casa Marina but they had no availability and all the suites there are under renovation. We were told there were no other rooms available at The Reach. Finally we were shown a smaller suite that we did not like at all. So we left and went across the street to Southernmost on the Beach and booked an oceanfront king room, which had a fabulous view and a large balcony with lounges. This shouldn't have happened. If the hotel's website had mentioned there was no door, we simply wouldn't have booked that room.

Reviews.Title: “A wedding to remember!”
Reviews.Author: mrabinowitz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate enough to book our wedding this past April at the Reach Resort. We knew we wanted a destination wedding and when we narrowed it to down to Key West, we checked out all of the hotels and resorts to decide where to have it. We obviously chose the Reach, but I'd like to give the reasons why: First, the location is perfect. Whether you are planning a wedding or looking for a romantic getaway, or taking the family for a vacation, the Reach is situated perfect on Key West. It right next to the southern most point, and has a breathtaking view of the Gulf meeting the Atlantic. Looking out past the pool and the private beach, the water is the purest blue. For our wedding, the Reach's gazebo, located at the end of a pier, was an ideal locale that made our ceremony that much special. Also, situated at the end of Simonton Street and Duval, you are not on the "seedy" side of Duval, but not that far of a walk if you are looking to have fun. Second, the staff is unbelievable. Luke Vossen, our wedding coordinator, was unbelievable. Living in Tampa, FL we were understandably nervous not being able to oversee all the details that Luke handled until the actual day. Yet, everything went without a hitch. He accomodated all of our requests, directed all of our vendors, and made incredible recommendations that gave the experience just the right touch. When considering a wedding in KW, the coordinator is vital as he is your extention and your proxy to insure that everything goes right. Luke, and his staff, went above and beyond the call of duty in making sure our wedding was special. I cannot reccomend him enough. Third, the food at the Reach was unbelievably amazing. I can say this with complete objectivity--even though it was my wedding!--that the food Luke and his staff at the Striphouse served was the best food I ate a wedding ever. Like most resorts, the Reach has a restuarant on site, but unlike most resorts the Reach actually uses the restaurant to prepare the wedding dinner. Check it out. Most resorts rely on the cheap catering standby of preparing your dinners way in advance, hence the dried out taste you experience at most wedding dinners. At the Reach, all of our guest meals (filet or grouper) was made to order, just like a restaurant. This insured that the food was served at its freshest. We are almost 3 months past our wedding and I am still getting compliments from our guests about the food! Finally, even with an upgrade to a bridal suite, the rooms at the Reach were top notch. Clean with modern furniture, the rooms were a pure comfort, a perfect retreat during our honeymoon. (Yes, we remained in KW after the wedding.) Like I said, I cannot recommend the Reach and Luke Vossen and his staff enough. If you have any detailed questions about having a wedding at the reach, feel free to email me: [--]. I would be happy to assist.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Private Beach, and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: chrayug
Reviews.Content: Definitely do not stay anywhere to far away from Duval street when you visit. That is the best advice I could give. The Reach is on the complete opposite end of Duval street than where all the bars are. And we enjoyed it. It was fun to go out and walk back through all the craziness to the hotel. So location was great. We also loved the private beach (very rare in Key West). By the way, it's an actualy beach, not like the 10' stretch of rocks that the Westin calls a beach. We had an island view suite but in fact had a dual view of the island and the ocean. The staff was very friendly and our room was cleaned meticulously. The air did go out for a night (a truck in the parking garage took out a cooling line) but they refunded us for 1/2 a night and all 3 nights of the $20 per day resort fee. Also, got a great deal through travel zoo, we paid $149 a night for our sutie to begin with. Don't waste your time eating at the hotel, but definitely try the sushi place next door. Oh, and no free internet :(. They have a business center with 2 slow computers, but otherwise its like $9 a day for internet in the room. I found this odd as our $28 a night hotel in orlando had wireless free. Overall, one of the best hotels on the island. One last piece of advice, do the jet ski tour. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “epcted average and got the best”
Reviews.Author: randylc
Reviews.Content: we were surprised. The hotel was great, I was very happy with the the way they kept everything clean and that includs the private beach , the sand was even cleaned every mourning. The 20 bucks aday was well worth it, the beach and pool staff run to give you towels and set up chairs when you enter the pool or beach. They have a nice little gym we hit every mourning. We did the 12 bucks a day self park and that was good enough. The staff from day 1 was great, AJ at the checkin counter, Ted, the bell man. Our bags were late from american airlines, again. We told Ted we had medications in those bags and Ted made sure we got the bags asap. On check out we had a small problem , Jeselx , not only fixed the problem , but found a discount I didnt know about and failed to take, she made that positive ajustment ! I left with a tear in my eye,. yes , this tight , clean freak was impressed! " i'll be back"

Reviews.Title: “A level of friendly service above expectations that keeps us coming back”
Reviews.Author: suehan
Reviews.Content: We love going to the Reach because it has it all! The property is gorgeous, and the services and ammenities are wonderful. We especially liked the employees who made us feel so welcome and were willing to do anything to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. The Beach staff Ricardo and DJ were rhe best!! We plan on returning next year! Friends from New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “We totally enjoyed out stay and want to come back soon!”
Reviews.Author: sodwyer
Reviews.Content: The pool guy, Ricardo Taylor was very funny, friendly and made our stay so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “The Reach was the perfect location, quiet and inviting but...”
Reviews.Author: beachbabe1002
Reviews.Content: There is always a but and it has to do wth what I have read all along between the parking and the resort fee the price of the hotel is far more then you are quoted. We loved our room although it was small - the drain did not work in the bathroom sink but on the other hand it was the best shower I have had in a while. They do not replace toilet paper - which can be a problem. As far as the resort goes - nicely maintained - no pool bar at all and the inside bar closes at 10pm so if you are thinking of a night cap - not here. The best news which we did not find out until the last night is that on the 5th floor there is a big space with couches to watch the sunset - it was amazing and soooo convenient. Wish I had none sooner - but you will so pass it on. Overall - a great experience and fantastic location if you want quiet and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “The best! - perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: Nani1212
Reviews.Content: It's perfect! The rooms are super nice, it has a beach which is ideal and the service from the staff at the beach is great! The location could not be better just a block away from Duval street. I highly recommend it. It's not cheap but it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite location, friendly people and fun in the sun!”
Reviews.Author: HarveyHelper
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Reach for 5 nights for my wife and I's honeymoon. We had the best time ever! The location is perfect, private beach, next to everything, like two blocks from Duval st. AJ at the front desk was so helpful and really took care of us. Also want to mention Luther at the restaurant, who gave us the best dinner experience we had while we there. Overall the price is a little steep for the rooms you get, but the service from the front desk all the way down to the beach attendant's were really accommodating. Can't beat it for location and service. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: TheNewALG
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is the beach - they aren't common on Key West. The rooms are pretty and clean on the inside. From the outside the place still looks like a cheap hotel that they did their best to fix up without having to level it and build again. There was nothind BAD about The Reach, but also nothing particularly impressive either. The food was just OK, the pool was OK, the service was OK, the view was OK. Luckily, if you stay here you can also go to the far-better sister resort the Casa Marina. For the amount of money we spent, I would have preffered something better.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach was outstanding, the service was great, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: GinoOhio
Reviews.Content: The staff was superb. The location was excellent with a bueatiful view of the ocean. Rooms well appointed and serviced. Ricardo, DJ and the staff servicing the pool all made us feel like we traveled to the hotel frequently (our first time). The location provided easy access to the entertaniment area with privacy if required.

Reviews.Title: “On the Beach At the Reach”
Reviews.Author: ladybengal
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my son's Key West Wedding at the Reach....we were overwhelmingly pleased with the entire affair - our guests were so impressed. The ceremony was in the beautiful gazebo and the cocktail hour and reception upstairs was handled with elegance and professionalism. Food and drinks were superb...we were treated exceptional. I would highly recommend a Key West wedding at the Reach. Special thanks to "Luke"....

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: brittanynmiller
Reviews.Content: We booked our first vacation down to Key West and choose the Reach Resort because we could use Hilton points (pretty sure we would have been more disappointed had we actually paid for the hotel stay). Our first impression of the Reach and sister resort, Casa Marina was pretty poor. We ordered drinks and appetizers upon arriving on-site since we'd been traveling all day. We were served spoiled shrimp - now I've eaten in some pretty divey seafood places before but never been served rotten food. It was gross - bad point. Upon arriving on our room, we were impressed with the decor and personal espresso machine - good point. We dined in the hotel restaurant for breakfast the nest morning and encountered some very "fishy" salmon - bad point. We had a great encounter with the concierge and booking our watersports activities - good point. We experienced rudeness and bad service when ordering drinks around the pool - bad point. Got a great recommendation for dinner in the area from the front desk - good point. Never received our NY Times as promised on check in paperwork and when mentioned to the front desk for our refund, as instructed on the check-in papers should you not wish to receive the NY Times, were told this was one thing they were in the process of changing. So overall, we had a great vacation the experience at the Reach was inconsistent to say the least and if we went again, I think we might look to another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: transampam
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from the Reach Resort. This was our third time to Key West and our first time at the Reach Resort. We will definately stay there the next time we go. We arrived late on a Tuesday (after 9pm) and we had no problems with the check in went to our room (a boutique suite) on the fourth floor and dropped the bags and went to dinner at the Strip House. Anthony our waiter was so wonderful. Even though they were so close to closing time he did not rush us and was very personable. My Steak Frites was the best steak I had all week. There was so many other places to dine that we did not make it back to the Strip House for another dinner, but I will say it was one of the best meals I had all eight days I was in Key West. Before returning to our room my husband stopped by the reception desk to see if we maybe could get an upgrade from the room we were in. I want to state that the original room was beautiful, you could see the water, it was just above the new chess board they installed on the lawn and the pool was just ahead of us towards the beach, the only issue i had with the location was the large air conditioner across from us that was very loud and didn't seem to shut down at all. Anyway, they said maybe the next day another room might be available. So on Wednesday we got up and went to breakfast then to the private beach at the resort. As in other reviews, I agree that DJ, Taylor, and DA (waiter at beach) are so accomadating. They work from dawn to dusk it seems and always with a big smile and making sure you have everything you need for the day.
