We spent every day relaxing for quite a few hours under our umbrella just enjoying the water and ocean breeze. When we got back to our room on Wednesday there was a message from AJ at the front desk that another room was available if we would like it. My husband went to check it out and came back to get me--we were offered room 543 which is right on the end overlooking the beach and pier--of course we took it! This room was perfect! You could hear the waves and the breeze was wonderful! Also the Reach Resort has a lot of weddings. We saw three while we stayed there. First wedding was very large ($$$$), second wedding was the opposite just the couple and about a dozen guests on the pier and the third was in between the others and a nasty rain storm blew in just after the ceremony so they had to run for cover--they say rain is good luck on your wedding day! Restaurants I would recommend: Louie's Backyard (on the water next to hotel), Abondanza! (best scampi I ever had!), Antonia's, La Te Da, Camille's, and Strip House. Tried to get to Seven Fish (too busy first night and closed Tuesday) will have to go next time. Also El Ciboney is a favorite, but didn't get there this time. I found the entire staff to be very helpful and kind. Always a hello and a smile. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: wizardnolo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West early in the morning, no hotel reservations. We visited many properties and we were able to get a fantastic rate at the Reach, the same as the local B& B's. Check in was mid-afternoon and they allowed us to check in at 11:00. Everything about our experience was perfect! The room was clean, the beds very comfortable, the balcony was a plus. We spent every morning on the private beach and the pool. The walk to town is only a few blocks, we left our rental car parked at the hotel the entire stay. We stayed for 5 days and have nothing but great things to say. The front desk was always pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome modern minimalist hotel which saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: zss56
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! I am a huge fan of modern minimalist boutique style hotels and this was exactly it. We started off at the DoubleTree which is total garbage because of a Pet friendly policy that wasn't so Pet friendly and crappy location along with their junk filled resort. We then quickly moved to the Reach. Everything was awesome after that. This hotel has been completely redone. I know they are way too far down on the list of Key West Resorts; I don't think there is another resort with the same type of accomodation! This resort should be 1 or 2 with out a doubt. I see that there are a ton of reviews on this hotel from 5 and 6 years ago influencing its numbers which is terrible since it has new owners, Waldorf/ Hilton and it has been completely remodled. The rooms were awesome but the key is the private pool and the beach along with the location a block of fDuval. The pool and beach are right there on property; there may not be a better beach in Key West. The pool guys are incredibly attentive. Cheers, DJ an Ricardo! The Strip House bar/ restaurant has a nice swanky vibe...a little expensive and a little slow to bring drinks to the pool but hey your on vacation and you can always order two drinks! I highly recommend this place and we are definately going to stay there when we go back no questions asked. I travel a lot and love to try different hotels but I am sold on this one in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Beach”
Reviews.Author: JillyMcWilly
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend at The Reach Resort. I was in Key West for my nephews wedding and booked six rooms. The Reach is in a great location, one block off of Duval Street and right on the water. It has the best beach in Key West and the staff on the beach is excellent, especially DJ, who set up our chairs every day. The Reach is also right next door to its sister hotel, Casa Marina, and it has a Starbuck's on site if you like your morning coffee. The rooms are nice; modern and very clean. The beds are divine, majorly comfortable. Every room has a balcony with a couple of chairs and a table. The beachside restaurant is good with a breakfast buffet and a pretty decent lunch menu. However, the buffet at the Casa Marina is way better and you can charge to your room over there too. I didn't use the pool, but it was very nice and has no specific hours so you can go for a dip at midnight if you want to. I only have two complaints about this hotel. Firstly, it is like a damn maze. Seriously, I don't know who designed this place, but you will most likely end up in the parking lot at least once trying to find your room. :-) Secondly, the business center is not up to par for a Waldorf property. I tried to print my boarding passes the night before flying out and it was a gong show. Two ancient computers and a barely functioning printer. Overall, a great place to stay and I would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Slow is Fast”
Reviews.Author: NATALMA53
Reviews.Content: family vacation for son's wedding. 4 different types of rooms and Tia at the front desk made everyone happy! Ricardo and D.J. were fantastic and met all our needs and more at the beach and pool. the rooms cleaned by Sebastiania topped off our day. Ron, the bellman arranged for our clothes to be laundered and made our departure smooth. Emmanual and A.J. always greeted us warmly at the front door. the employees really make this place a little slice of Heaven! Already planning our next trip. PEACE

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Key West, Best Beach for Sure!”
Reviews.Author: FromOCroundtheglobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort fo 5 nights. Hilton has bought the property and refurbished it. I do miss the bar on the beach! We booked an oceanview boutique suite. We were first placed in a room but could barely see the ocean through the palm trees! We asked for a different room. They did not have many available since the hotel was sold out for the weekend, most likely due to Spring Break, but they were able to accomodate to a better view. Room is great, especially for three people but even for two! It has a nice mini bar and great balcony. We never felt like we were cramped, plenty of space. Despite some issues with the air conditioning, we did enjoy our stay. The beach is the main attraction of this hotel as there are very few hotels with beaches on the Island. The walk to Duval Street to do the "Duval Crawl" is short. Don't recommend breakfast at the Reach, it is small and overpriced. Much better is the sister resort the Casa Marina next door. Better breakfast, service and overall a nicer property, although the beach isn't as good! This is why we stay at the Reach, too many rocks at the Casa Marina. The steakhouse at the Reach is fantastic though really expensive. $250/3 people. If you want a spectacular night out it is worth it, although you can find much less expensive food in the city. All in all, don't expect the Ritz, but for location and beach, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sammiegirlmn
Reviews.Content: OMGâ€¦ We had the best time everâ€¦ I loved everything about this hotelâ€¦ especially are pool boy DJâ€¦ we love you DJâ€¦ I would recommend this hotel to everyoneâ€¦ it was very very cleanâ€¦ everybody was so friendlyâ€¦ in the hotel that isâ€¦ not everyone was so friendly everywhere elseâ€¦ but I did not have one bad experience at this hotelâ€¦ it was absolutely relaxing and fun all at the same timeâ€¦ loved it !! :):) I will be going back there with my husband next timeâ€¦ I cant wait !! :):)

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect from a Waldorf brand resort”
Reviews.Author: dogmom0806
Reviews.Content: I should have known that at the moment I made the reservation, I was doomed. I asked specifically for a room with 2 beds, and was told that they "do not guarantee bed types". This was the FIRST time I had ever heard this - nonetheless, we still went. As we arrived the doorman was very friendly and so were the desk attendants. However, while we were in the lobby there was an irate gentleman arguing loudly with one of the attendants. Still, we headed to our room looking forward to an enjoyable stay. The hotel layout is a bit odd, as you have to snake around several corridors to get to your room (all with outdoor access - not an interior air conditioned hallway). The room was very nice, clean and spacious. The balcony was an added bonus since I was with 2 smokers!! We quickly changed and went down to the pool area to have some drinks and lay in the sun. Well...........the pool was pretty busy, as we expected. We asked for assistance in getting some chairs and towels and he told us "look around and see if you can find some chairs and if you do, I'll get you some towels". Once we found the chairs the pool attendant mentioned that he only works on tips and that we aren't charged for the chairs and towels. He must not have known that we are charged a daily "resort" fee for the use of these amenities. To add further insult to injury, there was ONE person handling bar service to the pool AND beach area!! And, he only served ONE guest at a time. Needless to say, we never got a drink for the 2 hours we sat there (without going to the bar). My last complaint.........the conceirge..........she was not professionally dressed as you would expect to see at a "high end" resort. The dinner recommendations were awful - I think I knew more about Key West than she did! As we checked out, there was yet another unhappy guest arguing with the desk attendant....not a good sign to see this happen twice! With all of this being said, the hotel was nice and it's in a GREAT location if you want to be right on the beach. Just don't expect 4 -5 star hotel quality or service. You'll be gravely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSeeker03
Reviews.Content: "HEAVEN" from the moment we arrived the service,resturant, the location, the beauty, and the Wonderful Beach! It was perfect and everything and more we dreamed of for a girls trip. We are two friends in our 50's and could not have enjoyed it more. The great pool side beach service was wonderful Mike and Ricardo and team were always there to make the sun time a great experience. Loved the popsicles! Perfect location! We ate key lime pie everyday and with the great walks to Duvall Street we did not gain a pound! We cant wait to go go back next year! We actually wished we could of stayed! Two Women from Sacramento,CA P.S. Beware! You will want to stay! I miss my balcony with view of the lovely resort and ocean!

Reviews.Title: “REACH-able”
Reviews.Author: GldnGrls
Reviews.Content: After our 5-day stay at the Reach, my husband and I felt that the hotel is very comfortable, but questioned the term "resort", because it seemed more like a high-end hotel. During the week, the lobby did not appear to be as fully staffed as on the weekend of our arrival. Our luggage was efficiently delivered to our room, and Stacy gave us many tips about activities in and around the hotel. Our room was clean with a very comfortable mattress, and we were fortunate to have an unobstructed ocean view. (We had overheard some hotel guests complaining about not having that, despite reserving ocean view). We greatly enjoyed the expresso machine in the mornings, and liked sipping the coffee out on the balcony. As Key West visitors should know, there are ocean waves only if the winds are strong...but we'd have been unlikely to be able to hear waves anyhow due to the loud air-conditioning unit across from our room. However, the warm breeze ruffling the palm trees seemed to counteract the noise. Taking advantage of the reciprocal arrangement with Casa Marina, we visited that hotel several times, and decided right away that it's our destination for our next Key West vacation. It has a "classier" feel in the lobby, and the grounds are more stately. There is also a lot more room on the beach, pier and pool area, plus the bar is more accessible than the one at the Reach. There is also a greater variety of water sports at the Casa. Whether staying at the Reach or Casa Marina, it's advisable to heed everyone's advice about wearing comfortable footwear. It's over a mile walk-(very enjoyable)-to Mallory Square via Duval Street, and blisters could ruin a vacation. There is a trolley stop near the Reach, plus there are many "pedi-bikes" (bicycle taxis) all over, especially on Duval. On the walk to Duval, be sure to stop at Ana's Cuban Cafe for cafe con leche, or a mango or watermelon smoothie. Sandwiches (such as "ropa vieja") are also delicious, and much more reasonably priced than at most restaurants...plus the outside seating area is great for people-watching! Also, from the pier at the Reach, dog-lovers can watch the canine regulars frolicking on the "Dog Beach", which is adjacent to the deck at Louie's Backyard, a great place for an evening drink. To sum up, our get-away at the Reach was enjoyable. It's much nicer than many other Key West hotels, and the sandy beach is a nice feature...(except for the seaweed problem that the staff reported as ongoing this season). Those who plan to stay at the Reach should compare similarly-priced hotels before making reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful romantic stay”
Reviews.Author: SatinderG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights, for a romantic Easter getaway, and it lived up to all our expectations. The private beach was well maintained, the pool staff were always helpful and lovely and the room maids did a great job everyday making out ocean view room look stunning. The only downside was the prices at the Strip House restaurant (which is why I gave the service a 4 out of 5), but with plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from in the centre of the town, it was only a minor complaint. A perfect stay for anyone looking for some peace and quiet with plenty of sunbathing thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for Key West”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Reach after doing loads of research for resort options in Key West. We have been to Key West roughly 7 times now and stayed all over the island. Used to stay right by Mallory Square but have gotten beyond wanting to be by the noise and crowds all the time. The Reach is close enough, that if you can walk a mile.....you can get to the crowds and noise anytime you want. Also, you can see lots of things along the way and make a "find" or two as you go. The Reach is located right down Simonton so you can go straight down that street or head over a block to Duval and head straight down. Check in went very smooth. We had booked an Island View Boutique suite, however, they moved us to an oceanview instead which was very nice. The boutique suites are great with a refrig and bar area, plus a balcony. Pretty good storage and bathroom size for two people, no problem. We had a car so headed to Publix for booze, beer, juices and breakfast foods, bread, cheeses to stock our refrig. It saves us money but also we don't always like to wander looking for breakfast and lunch options if we are sitting at the beach or pool. We are glad we did this too.....more on that later. Beach and pool are nice considering this is Key West and is not known for their great beaches. Walk over to sister property, Casa Marina is really easy if you go out to the pool and talk the picket fence gate right there. Takes a couple minutes. They have two pools and beaches and allow you to charge to your room there also. Very nice options. The Strip Restaurant at the Reach is pretty expensive from our perspective. There really isn't a "big" restaurant at the Casa Marina other than a breakfast area and pool cafe. We just had a couple glasses of wine at the Strip House for $16.00 each and it was barely drinkable. But, there are so many other options nearby that it doesn't matter at all. Next to The Reach is a nice restaurant/outdoor bar called Louie's Cafe which was great for drinks. We met several people there and enjoyed watching the water and talking with some of the locals. Other places we hit were LaTeDa, a bar on Duval which was not too far away. Restaurant looks great and bar is very nice for hanging out and meeting people also. Nearby is Nine One Five (Duval) and serves small plates. Camille's is another option not very far away on Simonton that has nice food options. We found it very easy to walk down to the other end of Key West. Taste of Key West was going on and we went to that and had a great time. They had loads of options for tasting food and wines/beers. Always is towards the end of April. Overall, if you don't want the busy cruise ship/noise of tourists around the Mallory Square area and can walk ok....stay at The Reach or Casa Marina for a very nice experience. There were only two complaints we had, one was that we had room service delivered one time and it stayed outside our room for two full days before they came and picked it up. Also, we found the $20.00 resort fee really pretty silly. You really don't get anything for it....free local calls (most everyone has a cell phone), popsicles are the pool, and a daily newspaper. Just add the $20.00 to the room rate and don't make people feel they are being charged extra for something they may not even want or use. Anyway, that being said, the value was still good and the resort service and amenities were great. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location on Key West”
Reviews.Author: LvToTrvl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before it was a Hilton-Waldorf Astoria. If you don't mind walking a bit this is a perfect place to stay for those who want to be a bit off the Duval Street buzz. We love this location because the beach is sandy, white and like being in the Caribbean. The water is gorgeous shades of blue and looks like a Corona commercial. The boutique rooms are worth a bit more money because they give you room and the balcony is very large. The staff was very accommodating and E.J. the manager was great. You need to know that you are paying for the location which is well worth it. We don't mind walking and went from the gulf side and back with no problem. We loved the casual relaxed atmosphere of this resort. The pool was also relaxed and the concierge was available if needed and did not bother you if you didn't want it. If you check regularly you can find a pretty decent deal. We paid only about $20 per night more than if we stayed at the Doubletree which is not a walkable distance from Duval Street or the Historic area, therefore you have to take a shuttle, which creates many other restrictions on your roaming about town. We found this a great deal for the location. There is a charge to park a car no matter where you stay and you need to be willing to pay for internet here. We just purchased one day and used their business center the rest of the time. Be forewarned that the business center has very slow internet and aol is even slower, but hey, you are in Key West, so slow down and enjoy...let go of some technology. We hope we will be able to return to this Caribbean and eclectic spot in the U.S. Love the Cuban food and Turtle Kraals crab cakes!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, everything else was mediocre or belowâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: BeachBum4567
Reviews.Content: We really liked the rooms they were very clean and aesthetics were beautiful. The cleaning staff did an amazing job everyday. However, the front desk fell short of friendly and helpful. The first night we arrived we asked if it was possible to get a room that didnâ€™t overlook the black tar parking lot- The front desk couldnâ€™t answer our question and were somewhat dismissiveâ€¦it took 2 days (3x) to finally let us know we could not move rooms. Secondly, the beach is very small and we found a handful of glass pieces all over the place. We found out the 2nd day of our trip that we could use all of the facilities at the â€œCasa Marina Resortâ€� which is affiliated with the Reach, and located around the corner from the Reach. We went to the Casa Marina everyday and had a wonderful time there. The staff was very helpful and friendly. If you have the choice to choose between these two Waldorf Astoria resorts- definitely stay at the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Should be a Hampton Inn, not a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: tinainvirginia
Reviews.Content: When I stay at a Waldorf=Astoria, I expect a certain level of class and service. I never once saw it during my stay at The Reach Resort. First of all, we were not assisted by a bellhop when we arrived - we had to drag our bags up the stairs to the lobby ourselves. I might add too that it wasn't busy - there was 1 other car/couple at reception and it was 3:00pm. When a bellman finally arrived, my husband handed him the keys to park the car in the garage and he told him to go park it himself. When I checked in, I was "greeted" with all of the reasons why my room wasn't ready rather than a friendly, "hello, welcome to our resort. how are you today?" Honestly, I really didn't care that the room wasn't ready, just offer to store my bags and show me a place to relax and have a drink! Unfortunately, that didn't happen. While the concierge and 3 front desk associates acted "busy", we waited another 15 minutes for a bellman to show up and store our bags so we could "go walk around" as we were instructed. The room was "ok". The shower door was broken so water got all over the bathroom; however, there was a note left in the room telling us it was broken. The pillow on the chair had a huge tear in it exposing the stuffing. On a positive note, I did request a late check-out and my request was granted. I think the concierge summed it up perfectly....as I was waiting in the lobby for my husband to bring the car around so we could leave (once again, we were not offered assistance), I overheard a guest ask the concierge how to get to a particular restaurant. The concierge pointed her in the direction; however, the woman didn't seem to completely understand how to get through the gate. I am being completely serious, the concierge came out from behind her desk and started walking briskly out of the lobby and said to the woman, "I am on a short fuse today so I'll have to just show you myself"!!! Actually, I think calling this place a Hampton Inn would be doing a disservice to the Hampton Chain.....

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: barfie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and we have a wonderful view of the pool and ocean. I would have liked to have some warm water pressure when taking a shower. Also if the hotel had a shuttle service to Deval street too. I ordered a pina colata on the beach and it was $15! So, the food and drinks were a little pricy. Overall the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Remodel Job...Managed and Staffed by Incompetent Kids”
Reviews.Author: SosakanSama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights in early April for a friend's wedding, after an extensive study of Key West hotels and B&Bs indicated that there was really nothing available on the island at less than 200 clams a night - unless you wanted to go bargain-basement and/or miles from the main drag. So why not go for the Waldorf-Astoria just a block from Duval Street and right at the south beach? First impressions are everything, and we had a meaningful hint at the level of management of The Reach when we approached the front desk. One of the staff had locked herself out of her computer terminal (one of two available at the check-in desk,) so we had an interminable wait behind a couple of other parties despite the off-rush time we arrived. We overheard enough to learn that there was apparently nobody on site capable of hacking into that formidable PC, so we...waited while people were funneled through the last functioning check-in station. The physical hotel itself was no disappointment. It's right at the end of a recent renovation and the place looks brand-new; there were none of the serious vermin problems that plague other facilities reviewed here, except for some tiny winged termite-like things crawling here and there in the room ('didn't get any bites though, so no real foul.) The first problem is that renovation itself - it's...not quite finished, and the management and staff don't seem to take seriously the idea that rooms should be fully equipped before they're booked to paying customers. Shower curtains are rather important, f'rinstance. Otherwise water tends to just fly all over the place, strange as that may sound. When we mentioned that the otherwise elegantly-appointed bathroom had only the metal hardware for a shower curtain rod (still crossed over with blue masking tape,) but no rod and no curtain, the front desk staff immediately did that thing where people talk and nothing is said. It's that familiar certainty you get from just the first couple words and before the sentence is even completed that you are dealing with disinterested staff who haven't the slightest interest in solving anything in particular, who wouldn't know where to begin solving it if they did, and have no interest in ever finding out. We walked back to the room resigned to a weekend of towels as flood-mitigation - we would "deal with it." A couple hours later my partner asked a room attendant she'd bumped into in the hallway if he could get us a shower curtain; he retrieved one from a storage closet and had it installed within a half-hour. It was a simple spring-tension rod and curtain but it did the job. Kudos for the room staff (we tipped the guy a twenty,) but a big zero for the front desk bozos and another zero for simple staff communication. If a room attendant can readily locate a simple shower curtain on request, why are the front desk staff utterly oblivious to that information? Later I noticed that dreaded combination: the absence of a toilet plunger, and one of those environmentalist "water saver" toilets that you either have to flush eight times in carefully-planned steps during use, or it plugs. [Clearly the Japanese company Toto is the only bathroom fixture manufacturer left on Earth with a functional understanding of basic hydrodynamics.] Despite our most meticulous planning, plug it up we did. We searched the room for a plunger, but that's apparently as exotic an item as a shower curtain, so we...called the front desk. Ohhboy. Once again there was that unmistakable sound of evasion, then the incredible news that (get this:) there was nobody available with the expertise necessary to locate and deliver a toilet plunger, but that a "technician" would be called from "another property." Allow me to recap: The front desk staff at a Waldorf-Astoria resort are incapable of producing a toilet plunger for a guest with an insistent GI tract and a plugged environmentally-trendly toilet, without calling a "technician" from a resort somewhere across town to do it for them. We waited, and waited, and waited, until I called again and asked if it might be better if I walked to a nearby grocery store, just bought my own and donated it to the cause. More hemming, hawing and practiced evasion in reply, so I hung up and used the public restrooms at the other end of the wing that I'd located a few hours earlier. Shortly after I'd got back a "technnician" arrived with the exotic, sought-after high-tech hydraulic impeller mechanism and performed the function that's now beyond the capability of our politically-hamstrung restroom fixtures. We, like others here have related, were also kicked in the crotch on checkout by the $20-per-night "Resort Fee" and the $12-per-night parking fee for the rental car. So another unadvertised $80 was tacked onto our expenses. Look, if you're running a hotel and you have some expenses that need to be covered, just include them in the room rate up front, rather than sneaking them in as a parting shot. It's incredibly sleazy to borderline unethical, and it's not a great way to instill in your customers a burning desire to return. In a PR sense it's flat-out stupid. On the plus side, the rooms are small but comfortable - though they lack a simple table & chair set. The bedding is luxurious and clean, the fridge is big enough to keep several days of consumables in, and doesn't charge you for anything unless you open the Evian bottles. The fitness room is surprisingly well stocked with good, solid weightlifting equipment including free weights and basic benches, some treadmills, ellipticals and bicycle machines, and a heavy-duty multi-exercise machine. The pool area is clean and nice, though we didn't have time to use it. We can cut The Reach some slack for getting sloppy with their post-renovation loose ends, but this high-quality property is currently managed and staffed by the equivalent of high school or college kids. We'd stay here again, but only after hearing of vast improvements. And that's really too bad, because the Waldorf-Astoria Reach resort is a great facility at a great location - you leave the place almost feeling sorry for the physical building for its being operated by incompetent kids.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden secret that I want to keep to myself but they deserve it!!”
Reviews.Author: clauner28
Reviews.Content: Not many people know that even though Key West is an island there are very few beaches. This hotel happens to be one of the only I saw at least that have their own private beach. The beach is small but the perfect size for the resort and the pool is literally 20 feet away from the beach. There is a beautiful deck that goes out into the water with a cabana house you can sit in and enjoy the views. There is a water activity company right on site. We went on a two hour jet skii tour around the island. highly recommended! The service at the pool and the beach was fantastic. Everything from chairs, towels and lunch were served right to you. They also had sand toys available for the kids. It was a very kid/family friendly place but still a romantic getaway for just a couple. The famous Duval Street was one block away and highly recommend walking it to the end to Mallory Square to see the sunset celebration and performers. Duval Street has tons of restaurants, shops and bars with live music. The restaurant at the hotel, The Strip House, was the most amazing dinner both my husband and I have had. A bit pricy but absolutely worth every penny. It's a carribean getaway in the US and we will definitely be returning next time we want a quick warm getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: rsully
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Reach at the very end of March and were not disappointed. The per night rate was more than we had planned on spending, but being associated with the Waldorf-Astoria, we felt we had a better idea of what we were getting for the money rather than at a boutique hotel or B&B - we were not disappointed. The Reach has a nice beach and you also get access to the facilities at the sister hotel the Casa Marina which was really nice. The service was also great. I had left something at the hotel and when I called about 5 days later, they found it within an hour or two and mailed it back to me.

Reviews.Title: “Resort Done To Perfection”
Reviews.Author: travelsonabike
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous place. The location, which is the best Key West has to offer, is only the tip of the iceberg here. The staff is so welcoming and helpful. But the buildings and the rooms, oh my, they are amazing. The decor is chic and simple but so fresh and clean and comfortable. The views are stunning from many patios and decks. It really is as good as it gets and I can not wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: flst1r
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. The location & beach were perfect. The staff was friendly & effeciant. These people made a good time a great time.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful spot.”
Reviews.Author: Little_Lulu45
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Reach Resort when we were in Key West for a business meeting. We upgraded to a one-bedroom suite with a balcony overlooking the beach and ocean. The view was fabulous, and the suite was well worth the extra cost. The Reach is lovely, low-key and not fancy-shmancy -- our style, and a lot like Key West. The staff, without exception, was friendly and helpful. We stayed at The Reach five nights. On our way back to Chicago, I realized I didn't have my coat. I called Security at The Reach, but no one had seen my coat. Two days after we got home, Ray Sigismondi in the Security Department called. He had continued to look for my coat and found it where it had been hanging since my arrival at the hotel. The coat came back to me in the mail the next day. This is high level service, which I was very grateful for. I will think of Ray, and The Reach, every time I put on my well-travelled coat.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mac1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort at the beginning of April. It is a bit of a stretch to call this hotel a "resort". If you want true resort--then Casa Marina is probably more to be recommended. But the "sister" relationship between the two is very advantageous to the guest. We quite appreciated the opportunity to hang by the much larger pool and beach areas at Casa Marina and then retreat back down the street (about a two-block walk) to the quiet of the Reach. The one amenity that the Reach has definitely better than Casa Marina is the beach access for swimming. If you have any desire to go into the ocean, Casa Marina's beach is held together with poured concrete chunks and has large rocks. Reach is sandy and easy access. However, Casa's beach is preferable if all you want to do is lie under a palm tree (or have a massage there). In our experience, service was equivalent at both resorts as far as towel/chairs and pool bar/restaurant. The internet service at the reach was HORRIBLE and the idea that they charge a daily $20 "resort fee" is completely laughable. They should get rid of this nonsense immediately and save themselves considerable bad press. The self-parking fee was in my opinion reasonable for the area. The location of the Reach cannot be improved upon. Quiet and away from the craziness of Key West, but an easy walk to the craziness if you want it. I felt comfortable walking home at night from Duval street, despite a number of drunk people around. Remiinded me of New Orleans. We were, however, very cautious about carrying money or purses with valuables. Don't know how necessary that was. Highly Recommended: If you have any desire to be on a jet-ski, do the island circumnavigation tour. Leaves directly in front of the Reach and is a fun adventure. Much better than just going back and forth in front of the resort. Overall the Reach is recommended, especially if you get a rate that is significantly less than that at the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet side of the key”
Reviews.Author: justin071099
Reviews.Content: This resort was nice - the staff were friendly and helpful - Ricardo, the pool manager, was incredible! The bad part is that this resort is it is on the Atlantic side of the key and the water is colder and murkier and the surf is rougher....BUT it is the quieter side of the key - a block from the more tame side of Duval street. The food is expensive at the Resort but a few blocks down you will run into some more inexpensive restaurants and grocery stores. I would recommend that they get an additional Concierge to help people book tours etc. There was only one person and there was always a line - who wants to stand in line when you are on vacation unless it is at Disney?

Reviews.Title: “We're planning our return trip”
Reviews.Author: cooltheo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Reach Resort in Key West. It was quiet, there was ample parking, the staff was great as was the food. Our ocean view was not quite what we wanted and the manager gave us another room and upgraded. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, service and location”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomMichigan
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 plus another family of 2 satayed at this beautiful resort in March. The location is excellent for anything you want to do in Key West all within walking distance. The room (we had oceanview boutique suite) was beautiful, spotless and with an awesome balcony. House keeping were wonderful making sure all our needs plus more were met. Everyone from the front desk, housekeeping, valet, wait staff at the pool and sequirity were incredibly kind, friendly and very helpful picking restaurants, activities etc. all with a huge smile and incredible friendliness. The entire place was in excellent condition. Considering all those wonderful things BEST of all were Ricardo, DJ and Mike (let's not forget their manager Billy). These guys pampered us with fresh ice water, popcicles not to mention towel service and more. These 3 guys made our vacation as enjoying the sunshine at the pool and beach were one of our top priorities (we are from Michigan). Saying their service was fantastic is really an understatement. Oh, and they were very fun to chat with and awesome with our 3 kids. So..... while everything was really wonderful at the Reach these 3 guys are what would bring us back next year!!! By the way this is the first review I have ever written; but I thought it was really important to let future traveleors know what a treat they are in for at the pool and beach.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karma105
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from vacation and we absolutely loved The Reach. As beaches are hard to come by in the Keys, the hotel's location on Key West's only natural beach was our number one reason for staying there. The rooms were well-appointed, the beach was lovely, I enjoyed going to the gym everyday, the restaurant's food was tasty, every staff member we encountered from cleaning to concierge were pleasant and helpful and it was within walking distance to the Duval Street area. I'd recommend The Reach highly.

Reviews.Title: “Do not waste your money on this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: riv3
Reviews.Content: The website looks great and it having a beach on site was nice but that was the extent of it. You pay a resort fee for chilled towels by the poolside at 1pm only and we never saw them. You also get a popcicle at 3 pm, a safe ( most hotels offer this), fresh fruit daily (old, cheap apples and every other day oranges and you had to go to the lobby for them. That is what $20 a day pays for. There is another $12 a day to self park or you can pay $20 and they will park your car in the same spot. We went right before spring break in the off season and we paid $330 a night for a regular room. Management was nice when dealing with my husband but the two times I called to complain about not getting the room I wanted they didn't want to help out any. We got upgraded to the room we booked after 2 hours. Housekeeping was horrible. Never cleaned the tables, counters, floors or the tub and you could see the grime. I left two notes and was even tipping and then we had to contact management. The place was still dirty after they left. They did clean the inside of the bathtub. The poolside waiter was so rude and made it known he was not happy helping you. Why should he...there was an 18% gratuity already on the bill. Do not order roomservice!!! Three times the price for food and drink, 22% gratuity, and the food is nasty. The funny thing is; I read all of the reviews about this hotel on different sites and everything I read was true. I will never go back to this hotel and belonging to the Hilton family really makes me question if they have lowered their standards.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach is a great retreat in Key West”
Reviews.Author: keysgator13
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I was only able to stay at the Reach for one night, but it was a great experience. The bell and front desk staff were very welcoming upon check-in. I booked an Island View Boutique Suite and was lucky enough to end up with a partial ocean view. The room was very modern and comfy, and there was plenty of space. I had a few hours to spend by their pool and beach, and this was the best part of my stay. There are not many true beaches in the Florida Keys, but this one stands out as one of the best. The large dock was a unique site and I am sure great for private events and small weddings. The pool was refreshing and there was cocktail service readily available. I didn't get the chance to dine on property, but I passed though the Strip House and it is very posh and sexy. Would certainly have tried it given the time. The Reach is in a great location. It is just one block from the south end Duval Street, so it is a bit of a walk to the other end where you will find most of the great nightspots. It is very easy to hop in a pedicab or take a short cab ride, though, and still much more convenient than most key west hotels. Basically, if you want a quiet place to relax, but still be close to all the excitement of Key West, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun, very relaxing, great beach, great pool!!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki777
Reviews.Content: The resort was in the best location on a private beach within walking distance to everything. It was a great relaxing stay with very few children around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: liveforvacation1
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful and the staff was very accommodating, Ricardo and Josh went above and beyond to make our stay absolutely wonderful. The hotel was very clean and the everyone was very friendly. I would recommend this resort to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Not a real resort”
Reviews.Author: KevinKFLA
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was above average but when you take into account the cost of staying there it just falls short. We did go during peak season so if you stay here in the off months when you can get cheaper rooms it would make it a little better. Some good things: Room was clean and very nice, large (after upgrading to a suite for $50/night) Staff was all around friendly however we didn't get much service at the pool except on our last day Some annoying things: Resort Fee! This place doesn't even have a hot tub or tubs in the room and they want a $20/day resort fee? I don't understand why. $12/day for parking seems like a little much No tub in the room - seems like for that much a night suites should have tubs weird bathroom setup - hard to get in/out of shower outside room entry = noisy all the time - You can hear college kids running up and down the halls 3 floors down because everything echos and bounces off the the hotel right next to this place. Housekeeping entered the room on multiple times and knocked on multiple times when the do not disturb sign was out. Also they called all the time to let us know they didn't clean the room because of the sign. What don't they understand about do not disturb? We extended our stay an extra night because my wife unfortunately became ill with food poisoning from a Bob Evans on the way down to the Keys so I wanted her to have some time to see the island once she felt better. However instead of just extending our stay we found out the hard way (room keys stopped working ) that we needed to go down the lobby, checkout and then check back in, pretty stupid. Then when we did get back the room housekeeping came by twice (with the sign up) to clean because they thought we had checked out. Where the communication with the front desk? I mean all in all this wasn't that bad but we were there on our honeymoon and the constant interruptions were getting old. In their defense though they did comp $100 on the last night when I told them about this. Overall just not worth the money and I wouldn't stay there again. Instead I would look at renting a house with a full kitchen and free parking. Key West was great though. great food and great fun. Would go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “It was an exceptional time”
Reviews.Author: bolo6489
Reviews.Content: THe Staff was extremely Friendly from the pool/beach guy ricardo and julie giving advise and tips on what some of the fun thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel will juice you out of your money upon chekout.”
Reviews.Author: Divexxxtina
Reviews.Content: The fire alarm kept going off in the middle of the night during the 1st night of stay. I had to call the front desk 4 times, and they kept telling me that the technicians were working on the fire alarms. It is frustrating and aggravating to be awoken by very loud high pitch alarms. These alarms were ear piercing. That kinda off noise could rupture your tympanic membranes, specially when you're asleep. 2nd, the amenities fees of $20 per person should be removed. I had to shell out extra $80 for party of 4 upon cheking out. Their so called "high speed internet" is the complete opposite. It took me forever to open windows when I was looking for another hotel. I would have given this hotel a 5 star if it weren't for the fire alarm noise, $20 amenities fees, slow internet and location of my room. So I only give this hotel 1.5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Resort in walking distance to Dival Street”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker054
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West and we liked the resort very much. Rooms and property were clean, hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The pool was heated and this hotel has the only natural beach which is private and owned by the resort. So the best of both worlds. There is a staff that provides you with towels for the pool area and also for the beach area, they provide you with lounge chairs, tables, umbrellas, towels and also wave runners if you have an interest. The person in charge of the staff for these amenities is RICARDO. He is fat, lazy and rude and complains about how hard he works. On almost every encounter I had with him, he told me he was too busy to help me or shouting at me to come back later. Resort needs to get rid of him and keep the rest of the younger, more accommodating staff. Ricardo had the nerve to give us a card and ask us to write something nice about him so he could get points and go on vacation. I tore it up and tossed it. Unbelievable. I hope he is not there when we go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room - Very friendly staff - would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: K76
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful room with king size bed, sofa, large bathroom, LCD-TV, Nespresso coffee maker, balcony. Everything we needed was there. The way to reach the room is a bit akward zigzag-balcony-like path. The Reach Resort offers the same breakfast as the Casa Marina. You can choose where you want to have breakfast, it's the same price and it's charged to one bill. The terrace in Casa Marina we liked more, but with more children around though. The room in the Reach Resort was nicer, the bathroom larger. So, you can have best of both hotels and enjoy the walk between the hotels. The staff was very helpful organising our stay and helping with activities and restaurants. They also kept everything very clean. Thank you to make our stay so good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and close to good restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: SandyTO
Reviews.Content: The staff were smiling, helpful and friendly. Never have we had a staff that was so sincere in being of service to guests. Cindy went above and beyond when she found my credit card that was mixed into papers and drove to the airport to return it to me before I left on my flight! In fact, she had to borrow a collegue's car to get to the airport. Cindy knew we were there to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary and she did not want our trip to be spoiled by discovering a missing credit card at the end of a great trip. The hotel has recently been renovated and looked great. Our room had a large flat-screen TV, iPod player/alarm clock, balconey and ocean view. The view from the hotel includes sunsets, pool, ocean, and gazebo. There was plenty of space for sunbathing by the pool or the ocean. There are hammocks and rental of water sports equipment. Outstanding restaurants are an easy walk from the hotel. We also liked the convenience of a small market that was a half block from the hotel. The hotel and it's sister resort have social events each day. We will return to this hotel when staying in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a 5 star”
Reviews.Author: Mimi&papa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two days. Got at hotwire for 169{ I would not pay the price the hotel wants]. And , the price of the grill on the beach for breakfast was 45.00 all we had was the buffet and it was cold! Also the charge all kinds of fees for everthing we had a bill for over 100.00 with just fees. I payed for the hotel when I booked and they charged us twice for the room. Took us two weeks to get that fixed. I would stay again but at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Reach Resort : Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: schubutt
Reviews.Content: You know it's going to be a great weekend when everyone on your flight applauds when you land at the Key West landing strip! We were checking into the Reach by noon and even though they didn't have our original accommodations ready, No Problem!, we were upgraded to a very nice suite on the 5th floor! The only hiccup was the prolonged testing of the fire alarm system. Ricardo took care of us for 3 days aound the pool and on the beach. He was super friendly and funnier than hell. They made it real easy to rent bikes right from the hotel and it made for a great way to cover a lot of ground. We loved the tapas at Santiago's Bodega and Louie's Backyard. We heard some great music at Cowboy Bill's, Schooner Wharf, The Green Parrot, and the Keys piano bar. Literally stumbling upon Jimmy Buffett's first performance at Margaritaville since 2005 for 3 songs was something I'll never forget. The weather was great too, even the freak fog on Friday the 13th. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & nice but not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBuckeye
Reviews.Content: According to other reviews, the Reach seems to have problems at check in and we were no exception. We had reserved a room with 2 double beds but at check in they wanted to put us in a room with 1 king bed. As a couple with 2 children, this would not have worked. After insisting they finally gave us a room with 2 double beds. Each day that we were there we would see people checking in with that same frustrated look on their face. That said, our room was decently clean and the beds were very comfortable. We did not pay for a view and so our room looked out onto a residential alley and our door overlooked the parking below. But the room was quiet so I can't complain. The toiletries are very nice, the room was cleaned promptly each day, but as another reviewer noted, they failed to give us any spare toilet paper! Also, it would be nice if they put some towel bars in the bathroom, they chose decor over function. We also had the same problem with the tv that others mentioned, the sound would randomly go out, but would come back if you turn the tv off and back on again. Also, our room safe only worked sporadically. We also had to get our room keys re-activated twice during our 5 day stay. The pool isn't very large but it is nice and loved the view of the ocean from the pool. The kids thorougly enjoyed the pool and really loved the daily afternoon treat of popsicles (nice large popsicles!). As others have mentioned, Ricardo is a priceless gem. The hotel is in a great location, close enough to walk to Duval, but quiet. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend The Reach (it's sister hotel Casa Marina looks nicer but is further from Duval and more expensive). Other have complained about parking fees, but $12 per day isn't bad considering the cost of meters and/or garages all over Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed for the money”
Reviews.Author: dobies7
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was no toilet paper in our room,with a call to the front desk and going down to the front desk twice we finally got toilet paper an hour and a half later.The floor of our balcony was littered with cigarette butts.The volume on the tv went off for awhile the back of the remote where the batteries go had no cover,the bathroom sinked didn't drain properly,at one point the phone didn't work,I had a message I couldn't retrieve.My husband and I had breakfast at the strip club.No one was at the door to greet us so we helped ourselves,to find out later my husband paid 17.99 the buffett price when all he had was a bagel and coffee.The waiter told us he could only ring in the register coffee or buffet,which we found out later that wasn't true.Then you have your $12.00 aday parking fee.I have been to many resorts,and in know way is this a resort more like an average hotel.We would never go back,what a shame as it looked so nice on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but the food prices are way way too high”
Reviews.Author: blmontgomery
Reviews.Content: We loved the place but the restaurant food prices are way way too high. $15 dollars for a run of the mill hamburger is outrageous. I didn't see hardly anyone using the restaurant except for dinners which were way too pricey (2 of us cost $130) with only 2 drinks. There were many families there and there is no way you could afford to feed a family at their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: SallyFoss
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort has the best location in Key West with the only natural sand beach. Ricardo and Jeff gave the greatest pool and beach service. I love the pier with the gazebo allowing great views of the amazing sunsets! The front desk and concierge service with E.J., Cory and Stacy went above and beyond. I enjoyed the Strip House both for breakfast and dinner and their management should be commended as they accomodated my request for an omelette even though breakfast was no longer being served. Our day server Yarasslow was most friendly and professional. Our room was great with perfect decor and many little extras. I loved the IPOD docking station, the wine glasses, the wet bar, the HDTV's, the balcony seating, and the wonderful plush comfortable bed. This resort is a great value...I did comparison shopping and we definitely selected the best!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a dud!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingisablast
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this hotel has a great location. Right by Duval Street. Unfortunately our stay here was not as expected. Even at the $200/night we paid, this place was not worth it. I would say maybe $120/night would be appropriate with the suites worth $150/night. The guest rooms are very cramped and awkward as described in some of the other posting. There is little room to put your stuff and no room to relax. We even looked at the suites and realized they aren't much better, especially given the price premium! Unfortunately the hotel does not live up to its billing. Everything is a little off. From the loud construction taking place right by the hotel that wakes you up every morning (no way to spend a vacation) to the inconsist service at the pool. The beach is nice to have but it really isn't a swimming beach and the pier gets in the way, making it far less attractive and really just a pool resort. Also the rooms are on stilts and the parking is on the first level below the rooms...kind of a weird feeling for what is billed as an upscale hotel. Key West is a great vacation spot but I would recommend finding a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Off by about half a beat”
Reviews.Author: MnBigdog
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is a very nice place and we had a good time overall. Unfortunately, as mentioned in a previous review, there were a number of small issues that really detracted from our stay. None of them alone are a big deal but these are the sort of things that we didn't expect, especially from a place affiliated with the Waldorf-Astoria group. First the good: Our room was very clean and quiet. The bed was very comfortable, the AC worked well as did all the fixtures, lamps, etc. The door to the balcony was very solid and blocked out any noise from the construction across the street (they worked only in the day hours and we were gone most of the time anyway). The staff was very friendly from the doorman to the front desk. The decor is attractive and the entire place seems well maintained and clean. The Reach is on the east end of town, the quiet end of Duval very near the "southmost" point in the US and it's an easy walk to a number of excellent cafe's, shops, and galleries. There is a small deli half a block away that was good for stocking up on some sodas, fruit, and munchies. The room included a small fridge (worked very well) and a much appreciated Netspreso coffee machine. Lots of towels and high quality shampoos, soaps, etc. Plenty of hot water too. We particularly liked the in room digital safe which was large enough to hold a laptop computer. Now, some of the "misses;" The in room info about the hotel was incomplete. Nothing about the facilities or the hotel's restaurant (The Strip House). Some of the information was wrong. It says there is an ice machine on each floor. Not true. We had to go up or down one floor for ice. The folder said there were bathrobes in each room -- not in ours. There was a small closet but really no other place to put our clothes; a few open shelves in the room, but no dresser space. As others noted, there were no towel bars in the bathroom. While the Netspresso machine was nice, there were no instructions on how to use it. The phone had the usual set of buttons to contact the desk, housekeeping, etc. but no button for a wake up call. I called the front desk and they told me to push the 'wake up call' button. When I told them there was no such button, they took my wake up info. Unfortunately we never got the wake up call. All the extra charges were disappointing; $12/day for self parking, $12/day for internet connection, and one of my personal peeves; they put a quart bottle of water in the room with a tag saying it costs $5, all this on top of a $20/day "resort fee!" (What does the resort fee cover anyway?) We had one breakfast at The Strip House and it was good; not outstanding, but good. There was the usual set of chafing dishes with bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, french toast, etc. The 'cold side' of the breakfast buffet was much better; fresh fruits, thin cut meats, and the lox/capers/egg/shallots on toast were excellent! Dinner at the Strip House was ok. The steak was good, well presented, and prepared as ordered. The prime rib sandwich was average. I find the decor of the Strip House rather sad. It strikes me as a throwback to the long-gone "hip" style of the rat-pack generation. Deep red patterned wallpaper, very low lighting, and back-lit photos of nude women (neither alluring nor artistic). Dean and Frank might have liked it but I found it dated and sad. Upon checkout I was asked how we enjoyed our stay and I said we had a good time but also had some concerns. To their credit, they knocked the "resort fees" off our bill so I do feel a bit better about it. In summary, it's a nice place, great location, friendly people but not up to what I consider the standards of a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Parity
Reviews.Content: You can do a lot more with your money and we got a pretty good deal on the hotel (~50% off rack). The location is great and the bedding is a duvet, the look inside is new, but there are so many little things that are wrong. Sometimes its the little things that all add up and drive a person nuts during a stay since they would be so easy to fix. The non-suite rooms are tiny and awkward, not even a rack to hang your towels on, the faucets are facing the wrong way, no drawers anywhere, tiny closet, a sink in the room for no apparent reason, the coffee maker doesn't come with coffee, no hot tub, the pool is tiny for no good reason, some rude employees, no valet when we arrived, tiny parking spots when you are left to park yourself at $12 per day, limited in room dining menu with about 5 dinner items after 5, small beach, tiny tv, lots of extra costs. The place is stuck in limbo between being a hotel with service and leaving guests on their own in an apartment. Everything is tiny and done 'posh' on a budget. Its pretending to be a 4 star and I would spend my real money staying somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I never had to leave!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Berneses
Reviews.Content: Ahhhhhh.......heavenly from sunrise to sunset!!!!!!! The hotel is right on the beach (a valuable commodity in Key West due to the amount of rocks/coral) with a beautiful pier and gazebo that you can watch the sunrise from. Hammocks in the trees, great beach and pool service. It is a BEAUTIFUL hotel. The Strip restaurant has good food and funky decor. The rooms were spotless, nicely decorated and the beds were actually COMFORTABLE for a change! The hotel staff went out of their way to be both and accomodating and genuinely nice. I would go back to the Reach (and Key West!) in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Zeussdog
Reviews.Content: Geat choice for winter get away; entire staff Hotel, Restaurant, very helpful and friendly. Enjoyed Ricardo daily routine on the beach & pool; Stacey very helpful in arranging activities, food and beverage selection at Strip House was Four Star. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “What a Blast!”
Reviews.Author: freejames
Reviews.Content: I justed wanted to write and say what a wonderful time my family and friends had at the Reach Resort. Ricardo had our lounge chairs ready for us every morning and could not have been more helpful. Stacy helped us plan many activities and went out of her way for us. Dinner at Strip House was wonderful!! mmm great steaks and seafood. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Time at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: NJBunch
Reviews.Content: Great location near Duval and all the restaurants and nightlife, beautifully decorated and spotless. Front desk and staff were the best! I will miss the nice people there. We love the icepops at the pool and even enjoyed going to Casa Marina for other pool side activities. We will stay at the Reach again. and Thank you Ray in security for sending me back my beach robe I left behind during my stay. Also Stacy at the front desk thank you for everything!!! "The Girls from NJ"

Reviews.Title: “Lost some great amenities”
Reviews.Author: starrdrew
Reviews.Content: The pool is the best as is Ricardo who has been there for years. Front desk personel , Jesely and Danielle were outstanding as were the doormen. However, the place lost something by taking out the Pool Bar/ Snack Bar...back then it seemed alot more like a resort rather than a stuffy "wanna be". Also bring back the hot tub. Great resort next door...brand new.....the Southernmost have no resort fees and no $12. per day parking fee...Wake up Waldorf, don't make it difficult for your faithful to want to return.

Reviews.Title: “assistants from hotel”
Reviews.Author: naplesred
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Reach Resort, Key West we had a great time. We were there with a group of ten close friends and entire staff was very accomodating & friendly. Upon our depature to arrive at the Marina on time my husband overlooked retrieving his car keys. Not having time to return to the resort I immediately called the resort to inform them of the situation. Gave security our information & recieved keys by UPS Tuesday afternoon.. Our great appreciation to housekeeping and security.Definately a return stay. Please forward review to Jon Drake director of security. Thank you again, R & J Fenton

Reviews.Title: “The best surprise ever!”
Reviews.Author: TooSmart
Reviews.Content: This was the absolutely BEST place we could have chosen to stay! All of the photos do not even come close to doing it justice. It must be known that the private beach is the most important reason to choose this hotel! It is so quiet, relaxing and super fun all wrapped into one. Having the jetskis to rent is so convenient as well as having the chairs, umbrellas, towels, hammocks and drinks from the bar readily available. We also loved all of the decks with lounge couches to just sit and watch the sunset on the ocean. Our room was the least expensive "island view" but gave a beautiful view of the gardens, pool and ocean. This resort is so cozy and quiet that you feel like it is all just your own private backyard to run around and play in! The renovation has made this resort clean, comfortable and beautiful. The staff is very friendly as well! The only suggestion we would make to this resort is to offer better information at check in and better communication for pool hours, drinks, morning beach activities. Perhaps the list of activities could be updated on the hotel info spot on the TV in the evenings? We had no idea where the board was until we stumbled upon it and that they even had all these things going on (Yoga at 7am, jetski tours on the water, mimosas at sunrise etc.) Don't get me wrong though, the staff was there to help if needed!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy decision”
Reviews.Author: jorgensenb
Reviews.Content: We chose The Reach based on website description and location. We were pleased all in all with the facility. Staff very friendly. Rooms very pleasant, however, slightly smaller than imagined. The coffee/espresso machines were a godsend! Closet space quite tight, and storage areas limited. The decor was very tasteful and modern. View absolutely fantastic! The pool was smaller than what I expected, but the beach is only feet from pool. Breakfast was excellent buffet style, however, very pricey. I would most likely stay again at this establishment. Key West is a very fun place to come during New Year's eve and great location in regard to walking distance to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sizzar
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with Reach Resort. The trip almost started off on the wrong foot, as when we arrived, we were told they couldn't find our reservation. They informed us that they had been bought out by Waldorf Astoria and were in the process of changing their computer systems, which was probably the reason for the confusion. They did find our reservation, and upgraded us from an ocean view room to an ocean view suite because of the wait, which was so nice. We typically don't have that kind of luck in those situations! The room was beautiful, and the view was even better. The only problem I had was that there was something wrong with the door lock, but if you just kinda slammed the door, it would shut. The beach was great, especially for Key West. They provide you with chairs, towels, and a little table to put your drinks on. The only problem we had here is when we asked about the chairs, the man told us to just head over to where we wanted to sit and he'd bring everything over to us. 15 minutes later, we were still waiting for him...I think he must've forgotten! After asking another person, our chairs and towels were promptly delivered. The drinks at the bar were pretty pricey...$10 for a Corona, so I would recommend walking up the street a couple yards to Louies Backyard. We didn't eat at the restaurant, but they have a bar on the deck right on the ocean and are a bit cheaper. All in all, we had a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort”
Reviews.Author: Vic5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for 3 days including New Years Eve which is a very busy time in Key West. I have traveled to Key West several times and stayed at several different places. I chose this one based off of their website and proximity to Duval street. I must say that I was extremely impressed with the Reach. The room was very clean and very up to date including expresso machines. We spent the day at the pool/beach area which was as nice as any I've seen in KW. The service/staff was even more impressive including poolside service. I would highly recommend this hotel to all. The only negative at all which is no big deal was the Striphouse restaurant was very pricey for poolside food. I must also add that the ocean and sunset view at the Reach is fantastic! VK

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Service”
Reviews.Author: melfly
Reviews.Content: Great place in Key West...look no further. Excellent rooms, pool, beach, and hotel. Ricardo is great.....he will be on the beach to assist you.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Reach Resort!”
Reviews.Author: kazola
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort a few hours early, but went to the bar by the beach and had lunch and a wonderful cocktail! After 2 hours of waiting out room was finally ready. Unfortunately, we did not like where the room was located in the hotel, so the wonderful staff found a room that was perfect for us! The pool and beach were nice and private, and the resort was beautiful! A block from Duval St. and very quiet! Most of the action on Duval is at the other end of the island. Not far at all, and it was so nice to come home to some peace after a night of partying! Every morning we would go down to the pool, before we could even get to the chairs Ricardo would have towels and water for us, then bring samples of frozen drinks! What a great guy! Ricardo won our hearts with his stories and happiness! Thank you! Thank you all for making our trip so special! We will def. be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Had to "Reach" for it”
Reviews.Author: Colo_Powder_Skier
Reviews.Content: Our stay got off to an "antsy" start (we found ants in our room). After a couple conversations with the front desk to rectify the situation we were (finally) upgraded by E J, the manager on duty, to a wonderful suite. After this rocky start, we went down to the private beach and were pleasantly surprised to have been paid so much attention to by Mike P., an incredibly friendly, accommodating, and helpful member of the beach staff. He and the entire beach staff helped smooth over what could have been a "buggy" problem. Also, special thanks to Mike as well for being a great wave runner tour guide and "friend on the beach" who knew exactly where to go, for dinner, for dancing, or for beach activities. We are likely to visit The Reach again, not because of the nice rooms or the private beach, but because of the hospitality of Mike. Peter W and Julie G

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: hayes003
Reviews.Content: The Resort was wonderful, I have never had such great service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Servicce”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West to get married last December. We stayed for 8 days at the Reach Resort. The customer service could not have been better. We did have a couple of issues needing resolving with the room. We called the front desk and the issue was resolved immediately. Before we could get to the front desk after making the call the issue was fixed. We also had an incident with the restaurant. Before we could mention the issue, not only did the Hotel Manager Cindi approach us and wanted to know the details but also the bell captain caught on to the problem and the issue was resolved immediately and thoroughly. The concierge desk was over the top with service. Heather and Stacy were wonderful to work with their great suggestions and ability to make reservations whenever possible. We had a service issue with the Conch train (which was not the Concierge fault) and they more than made up for the confusion. Finally, we spent just about 6 out of our 8 days at the pool. Ricardo extremely attentive and he had towels to us immediately, popsicles, and when asked to bring periodical beverages to us he was there just exactly when needed. We also took a tour around the island and he made us up a complimentary cooler filled with drinks. We had a wonderful experience and it was all due to the service of the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: bjt1231
Reviews.Content: The resort was really nice and clean. Great location, and very nice decor. The pool and beach on property were very nice and the service from Ricardo by the pool was excellent! Great restaurant in the hotel. Great resort for a couple, a family, or just a great place to relax and enjoy Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Almost really nice, but just misses the mark”
Reviews.Author: KathTN
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: the staff was very nice. Most especially the guys at the pool/beach area were kind and attentive, particularly Ricardo, who was outstanding. These guys truly provided exceptional service. The meals we ate at The Strip House, the restaurant on property, were high quality and delicious, as was the food they catered for our meetings. The hotel's decor and landscaping were generally updated and attractive, and the fitness room was bright, clean, and modern. The beach is small but lovely and the resort provides chairs, towels, tables, and beverage delivery on the beach. A+ on the beach service! On the minus side: our reservations became a problem at check-in - I had received an e-mail confirmation of an upgraded room but the front desk didn't have record of the upgrade and I had to access my e-mail to prove that I should have the upgraded room, all of which took the better part of an hour late in the evening when I was already tired and traveling with kids. Other than the kind attentiveness of the pool/beach staff (plus a friendly bellman from Ohio), the hotel is really not kid friendly. There are no kids' channels on the tv. The restaurant is full of paintings of nudes - fine for adults, not so great for kids. Upgraded rooms are available with king beds and a sleeper sofa but not two beds. The rooms come with two bathrobes sized to fit large, tall men (I am a small woman and traveled with my two little girls). There was no place to put wet bathing suits. Balconies have two chairs, but if you travel with family, it would be nice to have enough seats for all. The pool was theoretically heated but the heaters weren't turned on until requested and then it took a couple of days to even begin to heat the pool, which also was full of bugs. Housekeeping was a little erratic in restocking rooms - we nearly ran out of (crummy quality) toilet paper every day and they didn't leave an extra roll, yet we had boxes of tissues. We had tons of shower gel but the hair conditioner didn't get restocked. Then again, when we called housekeeping to ask for what we needed, they were very prompt and pleasant in delivering it so they made up for the inconsistent restocking. There was not a hottub on either this property or the sister property next door, which was disappointing. The Internet wasn't working properly in our meeting room and the bathrooms for the meeting room had three stalls: one under construction and another that didn't lock, leaving only the handicapped stall perfectly maintained. This resort is close to providing a luxury feel but it's all the little things that make it miss the mark. Just a bit more attention to detail would do a lot to elevate its elegance.

Reviews.Title: “The Pool Staff Made The Visit”
Reviews.Author: ernie0918
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable and the private beach was a real plus. The pool area was wonderful and Ricardo, the pool supervisor, made you feel like royalty. He would be the reason for a return trip; and is the reason for the above average rating. The food and drinks were very highly priced and we felt there should be at least one other option on property, especially since we were travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service at The Reach!”
Reviews.Author: WannaBislanders
Reviews.Content: This being our 4th trip to Key West, we had a pretty good idea concerning our hotel selection. We always enjoy staying on the beach. As most return visitors know, properties close to all the action (Mallory Square, Old Town and Duval Street etc.) are not beach front. We have tried several different bed&breakfast/hotels and finally found our favorite in The Reach Resort. We enjoyed a very nice room, great food, a nice sandy beach and the location we had been looking for in the past. But the service is what prompted this review. We arrived prior to check in, therefore our room was not ready. The front desk called housekeeping to inform them of our arrival and then took our cell phone number, contacting us as soon as the room was made up. We enjoyed both Chris and Ricardo, our pool/beach attendents. Both were friendly, helpful and "served us with a smile" even though they were busy. They assisted us with onsite bike rental (the way to travel in Key West - even at night) then was more than happy to answer questions and make helpful suggestions concerning our interests. We suggest trying a stay at The Reach if you enjoy the beach, but want all the action just a short bike/ taxi ride, or slightly longer walk to the hot spots of Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated”
Reviews.Author: UkWigan
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in an excellent location, away from the crowds of Duval St but close enough to walk to all the local restaurants & bars. It was very quiet & was a lovely place to relax. The hotel has been recently renovated so obviously all the rooms are pristine. The staff were extremely friendly. They were undertaking building works to the hotel next door (Southermost Point) & at first we were we allocated a room directly overlooking the building site which was noisy ++++ However, when we asked to be moved we were accommodated without question & ended up with a much nicer room overlooking the pool & beach. The pool area is excellent - although the pool was freezing (even though claims to be heated we were told not at that time of yr). The restaurant serves breakfast & lunch & evening meal, which although is a little pricey it is convenient. The beach is small but given the lack of beaches on Key West we really liked it. The jet ski are a little noisy but they go out fairly infrequently & this didn't spoil our enjoyment. Parking is easy & works out at $12 a day plus tax (most places charge so reach is no different). My only criticism would be that people not staying in the hotel can easily access the pool & beach & so given that you are being charged a resort fee for such luxuries it was a little irritating. However, we would definitely stay here again as we really enjoyed our stay. It was worth paying that little bit extra. If you do fancy hiring the jet ski then don't pay directly through the hotel, come out of the hotel & walk to the first crossroads, there is a little booth next to the cafe on the corner & the guy there is really helpful & will give a discount on various trips. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to get back to The Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: coolmom101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach Resort for a birthday getaway, we wanted a room with an ocean view and we were on the 5th floor overlooking a small but beautiful sandy beach with the clear water beyond. We loved watching the ships come in and out. We had dinner and breakfast at the Strip House Restaurant and had a perfect view overlooking the water.
