The food was delicious and the wait staff excellent. The hotel was room was extremely comfortable and we loved the decor, warm and unfussy. We could walk anyplace we wanted to go and used the nicely equiped workout room a couple of times. This was our first visit to Key West and we are already planning to come back, bring the kids and stay at The Reach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “The New Reach”
Reviews.Author: Drvmd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Reach once a year for 8 years. Under the previous owners - Wyndham - the hotel had an old Florida look and atmosphere which we found charming and comfortable. Recently extensively renovated the look is now non remarkable and the rooms while comfortable and clean look like rooms I have stayed in around the world. Sort of some take on pseudo oriental which seems to be the big trend in new hotels. The hotel advertises itself as luxury but there is really not a lot of luxury. There is less staff now, vans from the airport now charge what a taxi charges, so my advise is just get a cab. The bike rentals are substantially more than just walking a block and renting from the local bike rental place. The location is, however, wonderful and as soon as the construction on the SouthernMost hotel is finished, the hotel will become peaceful again. If you go while the construction is still going on ask for a room on the side of the hotel away from the SM hotel. Construction starts early and is loud. I attend a conference which is held yearly at the Reach and I will certainly return next year. Maybe with time the Reach will be able to establish some charm or character, perhaps realizing that the hotel is in Key West and not mid town NY or Omaha.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Key West Address”
Reviews.Author: srbnlb
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West to celebrate my wife's birthday with our closest friends and family. The Reach provided the perfect location. Having undergone a recent renovation, the rooms were incredible. The friendliness of the staff and the service they provided was top notch. Our block of rooms was on the fourth floor, surrounding the sunset deck, overlooking the ocean and beach. Several members of our group had never been to Key West, so being able to wake up in the morning to a sunrise over the water and sunsets in the evening was a real plus. The Reach is one block from Duval St., so it was very easy to walk to all of the local attractions. During our stay, we took advantage of the water tour around the island of Key West via jet ski, which proved to be a very exciting and memorable experience. Our experience at The Reach was best summed up by my wife - "This was the best birthday ever!"

Reviews.Title: “A Little Piece of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: HonuAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we were in Key West and this hotel was fabulous! We must admit that we are a bit particular about where we stay and everything at this hotel was as perfect as can be. Check in was as easy as anything we've every encountered. And after a very long trip driving down to Key West, our room was a little bit of heaven. Spotless accommodations, beautiful views and a bed more comfortable than you can imagine. As for the staff, everyone we met was so warm, friendly and attentive. I had hurt my knee and was sitting on the beach with ice in a plastic bag. The gentlemen from the pool kept getting more ice for us and the next day when we walked down to the beach he told us he had a cooler with extra ice and plastic bags all ready for my knee. The location is perfect for viewing the ocean (even caught a couple of dolphins swimming by). You can walk everywhere from this location and after enjoying the sights and sounds of Duval Street it is a very lovely and easy walk back to the hotel. This place was definitely a Little Piece of Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: keywest1211
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reach for our honeymoon. Everything was beautiful..the room, the view, the beach, the pool, EVERYTHING! The staff was really nice but we did have a problem with our billing for an extra night. The front desk staff is a bit unorganized and billed the wrong credit card which caused us problems. Otherwise, it is a beautiful place to stay with great people. The guys at Barefoot Bills are really nice and helpful. I would go back in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a 'Reach'”
Reviews.Author: JSmith76
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to return to Key West for our anniversary and stay at the very same hotel we stayed at for our honeymoon, The Reach Resort. The property had undergone a complete (and needed) renovation since we had last visited. It has also lost the Wyndam brand label in lieu of the Luxor Hotels label. We anticipated the stay to be similar to our previous one, but noticed that the environment certainly was more 'stuffy' this time around. Once checked in by the extremely nice, fake european accented front desk clerk, we headed up to our room. (Note - ask for a room close to the elevator or you'll be walking through a maze of left and right hand turns until you eventually get to your room). The room was very nice and well put together. The bed was fantastic and we ended up sleeping 10 hours non stop with no distraction. The view was also great. To our left was the Atlantic ocean and to our right was a view across the island. The only disruption was the sound of contstruction directly across the street, but hey... the sounds of progress can be everywhere. I've read other reviews of the 'nickel and dime' mentality of the Reach and I couldn't agree more. In fact, I'll save typing the same stuff everyone else stated, because IT'S SO TRUE!! The pool attendant making you sign for towels is hilarious, but not as funny as the ole' tactic of putting dollar bills on the clipboard to make you feel like you should tip. The pool and beach area were great, but they removed the Tiki Bar next to the beach that my wife and I had come to love during our prior stay. They instead offerred us drinks from the bar. Tasty, but worth $16 each, plus 15% tip and 8% service charge?? BUT, the classic story of our stay was when we decided to go to the pool early in the morning. No one was at the pool and we decided to sit on two chairs of our choosing. We were quickly yelled at by the pool attendant stating the chairs were taken! Then yelled at by the 'non-accupying' party from the balcony that they had those chairs saved. Ever have one of the momments where you didn't know whether to get ticked off or laugh?? Guess they feel for the clipboard trick... We do like the fact that this hotel (not resort) is on the quite side of the island. DO stay in this area if you like the night life, but can deal without the people yelling on the street all night. It's only an $8 cab ride to sunset square and all the night life. Other hotels in the area that are more economical and just as nice are the Best Western Hibiscus and Southernmost Hotel. Yeah, we've stayed at both of them also : )

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great”
Reviews.Author: TampaKen
Reviews.Content: We origially had booked a room at one of Key West's more famous hotels close to Zero Duval but not being "party people", we couldn't handle the noise. We moved to a room at the Reach's sister property but found the A/C was inoperative. By this time my wife was frazzled and just wanted to go home. She took a walk and sat at the Reach's beautiful pool area and soon was noticed by one of the staff, who's name we didn't get. He noticed that my wife was quite upset and inquired why. Once he got the story, he introduced her to the hotel manager, EJ. EJ volunteered a room for us, a nice suite that was clean and modern. The rate was comparable to the sister property and very fair. He arranged for our luggage to be brought to the hotel and even had wine and cheese delivered to the room. We enjoyed the hotel so much that we ended up staying extra days. The hotel is close to some great restaurants and the pool attendants couldn't have been nicer. We've already planned out our next trip to Key West and we will be staying at the Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere in changing Key West”
Reviews.Author: buddyt
Reviews.Content: Our stay was so grand at The Reach, this past week. We spent most of our time at the sister hotel-The Casa Marina, as the beach was better for a six year old boy(playing in tide pools) , the grounds very lovely and the food and drinks at the beach seemed a bit less expensive than at the Reach. My only criticism is that some of the activities the hotel lists on their weekly newspaper, did not happen and hotel personnel didn't even know what we were asking about when questioned also they apparently have a lovely breakfast buffet every morning that we found out about when checking out-bummer. So communication to guests is not the greatest for a hotel of this caliber but all in all loved it and would return.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach is not a resort”
Reviews.Author: burner1996
Reviews.Content: The Reach is not a Resort. At check-in, they informed us of the $20 a day surcharge resort fee (we knew about it already) "for our convenience." Since it was "for our convenience," I said, I'll waive it. They chuckled and said it was worth it. It includes a turn-down every night and some other stuff I never saw. We didn't even get the turn-down every night. It's just a way to cheat on advertising the rates. The room we had was nice, our balcony was useable, and we could actually see the Atlantic if we leaned out over the rail. Our room was at the L of two buildings, so the balcony of our neighbor was right in our face. C'est la vie. The Strip restaurant is over-priced; breakfast for two from the steam table (and there's no other food offered) was $45, and it opened at 8:00 am. Lunch from the restaurant was served to us on the patio; it was pleasant but unmemorable. We didn't try dinner. We had drinks at the bar a few nights, and the service was good, but I didn't bother drinking my completely taste-free pina colada - rum and cokes were what I ordered the rest of the time, and they were fine. The cleaning staff stood out in the center court of our building and yelled to each other on all the floors every morning, waking us up. We couldn't get packets of coffee in our room one day, despite repeated requests (and being sent to the Strip to ask for coffee packets there - the bartender said he was busy and wouldn't even respond to the request). We had maybe a dozen little espresso plastic bubbles, but no espresso machine. Just a coffee maker and no coffee. The staff is very pleasant, but just not always competent. There is WiFi available in the rooms, but it's an extra charge billed to your credit card for your convenience by the service provider. (We didn't try it.) There is room service, but it's from a restaurant somewhere else that delivers. (We didn't try it.) I have no idea what resort features the motel offers; we saw nothing that other motels lacked. The motel ls located on the Atlantic side of the island, which means it is too far for a convenient walk to most of the hot spots on Duval Street. We rented bikes and had no problem riding all over the little island, but the Reach is definitely out of the way, which has its good points if you don't want to be in the thick of things when there's a festival. On the whole, the motel was not worth the price even without the convenient $20 a day surcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Not quite a resort”
Reviews.Author: kevbro21
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Reach for 7 days in October. Though it was a very nice hotel, I wouldn't stay there again. This place nickel and dimes you to death even though you are paying a somewhat hefty tag for the rooms to begin with. Don't forget to ask about parking as it doesn't come with the package and isn't stated on their site (my biggest peeve). If you want parking it will cost you $12 a day, and hopefully it won't rain while your car is parked in there because the parking garage floods with every rain with literally 6-8 inches of water...bring your floaties. The rooms were nice...quaint I should say...with no cooking apparatus in them i.e. microwave. There is no vending on the premises, both of these items force your hand and if you want a coke during your stay you have to go to the bar and pay 3 bucks for one. Housekeeping was above average as they went so far as to organize our shoes during their visits. The overall resort is nice and quaint but lacking the grounds for anything spectacular. The restaraunt is nice but extremely overly priced for such a remote location and in a hotel where people might just want to grab a bite instead of sitting down to drop a couple hundred for dinner. Needless to say the place was empty most nights. Overall a nice stay with nice people, but I would suggest the Santa Maria Suites Resort about a block away (sister hotel). You will have access to this resort if you stay at the Reach, but it is far nicer than the Reach with two pools and a very large beach (beaches are hard to come by).

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back to the Reach!”
Reviews.Author: ambern66
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Reach Resort... WOW!!! Ever look at pictures on a resort's web site and wonder if that's what it will really be like? Well, The Reach Resort is just like the pictures! Rooms were very clean and quite spacious, we were thrilled with the cleanliness of the the entire place, including the poolside restrooms. Staff was super friendly and courteous... Ricardo and Chris are the absolute best at the pool. We spent 4 of our 5 days with Ricardo as our pool attendent and enjoyed every minute we spent at the pool. Popcicles, watermelon, frozen washclothes to cool off with... It was really hard not to leave there feeling a bit spoiled. Service from the bar and Strip House were great while lounging by the pool. Witin walking distance of everything, although Zero Duval Street is about a 30 minute walk but we knew that and didn't mind it. We made the trip every day. Within a matter of 2-3 blocks from Louie's Backyard, Southernmost Cafe on the Beach, and the Southernmost Point. Rates were awesome for the experience at the Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: natasworld
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding here and it was truly all I had hoped for and more. Since my friends and family flew all the way down for the event it was very important to me that everything went smoothly. It was fantastic! The staff was very friendly and accommodating: both the front desk staff as well as waiters and waitresses, giving us a little special treatment since it was a festive occasion. The rooms were lovely- nicely decorated, comfortable and feature an espresso machine which to me definitely beats the standard mediocre hotel room coffee. Most importantly, the manager of the Strip House, Luke Vossen, provided the professionalism, attention to detail and hard work that helped make the wedding a hit: the event went smoothly and the food was phenomenal. The resort itself is nice with both a pool and a beach. My friends had so much fun that we're thinking of trying to make the trip a yearly event.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Dutseluts
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst hotel I ever stayed in. Our family of 3 (2 A + 1 C (age 3)) chose the one bedroom luxery suite in order to have a spacious room with seaview, peace and quiet. However this was anything but what we got!!! A one bedroom all right, but spaciuos and quiet; NO. There was almost no seaview, the A/C in the bedroom was out of order and there was so much noise from the fan to the hotels A/C system outside so we could not sit in the balcony. We were offered another room but not until the next day. In the process of moving our bags etc from one room to the other, they suddenly lost our daughters balloon bought in Disney World, Orlando just the day before. After WE asked for the balloon several times (no comm between receptionists) we did got a box of nuts/chocolate. The new room we got had less noise on the balcony, but then the indoors A/C made so much noise that it was impossible to get a nights sleep. If it wasn't the indoors A/C it was the outdoors and vice versa. Did we get a discount/free breakfast? NO! After WE requested it, we were relocated to the quiet & beautiful Casa Marina Resort. The only positive thing I can say in regards to The Reach Resort is their beach. Ohhh and I even forgot to tell you about the ants all over the floors... The floors came alive... Don't ever stay there....

Reviews.Title: “The horrible generator!!”
Reviews.Author: Busterluv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reach Resort 9/21-9/23/08 and really loved the atmosphere and room BUT they have this monstrosity of a generator on their rooftop that ruined our stay there. At night on the balcony when you wanted tranquility all you could hear was this awful generator that was so loud! We moved to their sister hotel Casa Marina and absolutely could not say enough about how wonderful this place is. Go to Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mgruen78
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our honeymoon at the The Reach Resort in Key West. The weather was so nice. Sun every day and the ocean and pool water was as warm as the the air temp all week.. We couldn't have asked for anything better for our honeymoon. Joseph, the first to greet us when when arrived at the hotel was the best.. He upgraded our room to a sweet for our honeymoon. My brother had called in earlier before we arrived and wanted to know if he could do anything for our trip to make it even more perfect and what Joseph could recomened. When we got up to our rooms there were Chocolate cover strawberrys and Champain. BEAUTIFUL!!!! About 4 hours into our stay i had noticed that I had forgetten my Cell phone in the Taxi that had brought us to the hotel.. I spoke with Joseph and His assistant that afternoon. They called the taxi service and spoke to them.. At that time my cell seemed to be lost for good. the next morning I was told that they had located it. The hotel had kept calling the taxi service until it was found, And then to make it more perfect; Joseph had offered to go and pick it up on a different island. I couldn't believe it!!! If anyone that reads this and decides to stay there i recommend speaking with Richardo, the pool manager. He was extreamly funny, and helpful.. We had told him that we had never been to the Island before and he then began to give us all kinds of recomendations and ideas. Every day we wen to the pool he made it a point to greet us by our names. Always on the move, he was bringing towels and cold towels, water and anything else our hearts desired in his reach. Each person that i have mentioned in the little review has found a place in our hearts so profound. each and every time we vist that little island at mile 0, we will be staying there, and we recomend the same to you all. So to Joseph and his assistant (I am sorry i didn't get your name) and to Richardo; thankyou for a beautiful stay

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, But Not Quite What it Could Be...”
Reviews.Author: chester1006
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our Honeymoon in March of 2008. The staff was excellent and very helpful. We had an excellent room and a decent view of the courtyard/pool/gulf (kind of). Our only real complaint is that they neglected to tell us that parts of the hotel were still under construction, thus there was the racket of that going on during the days. Other than that, we had no real complaints, other than having to go back to boring old Illinois.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestBaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top of the line. From the newly renovated rooms to the beautiful views. The pools were fabulous and the beach was spectacular!!! We were greeted each and every day by two of the most friendly people ( Chris & Darrell Henshaw) and they always made sure we were taken care of. They provided us with cool towels beach side, great tropical drinks and plenty of laughter. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to enjoy a truly fabulous vacation. It is my intention to return myself next year. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Poker Run!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagingGeorge
Reviews.Content: We took our 25 yr old daughter and 3 friends for a birthday weekend, stayed in two rooms. They were clean, well decorated, good AC, weak water pressure. Rooms were far apart, even though we booked adjoining/close rooms several weeks prior. We happenned to be there for the Poker Run/Motorcycle weekend. It was extremely loud with motorcycles coming and going all day and night. Best to avoid this weekend (September), unless you are a biker. RICARDO at the pool makes the resort! He is all about fun, he is articulate and discerning. He offers free towels, chairs, cool hand towels. He brings out watermelon and water to everyone! He is an excellent conversationalist, and quite a key west character. On Sunday, the hotel would not let us check out later than noon, without paying $50.00/hr. They have no changing rooms for those guests that remain to enjoy the pool/beach. Would stay again. It is on the quiet side of Duval street (apart from motorcycles), easy to walk or short taxi ride to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The pool with Ricardo serving popsicles”
Reviews.Author: girlychc
Reviews.Content: The strip house was a great restauraunt in the hotel, and There was such great service by Ricardo at the pool serving popscicles and watermelon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “New Reach”
Reviews.Author: lj8460
Reviews.Content: The Reach has changed from my last visit. The "tropical" atmosphere has been replaced by a "modern" feel. While I missed the old Reach, I was much more impressed with this stay. The rooms are nicely furnished, the beds are ultra comfortable, and the property was nicely kept. One thing that has not changed since my last visit was the pool attendant, Ricardo. The Reach would not be the same without him - always a smile and most times a joke, even when it's a million degrees outside. The only complaint I have is the noise level outside the room doors. The doors are clearly not insulated and you can hear everything that goes on outside the rooms. I was awakened in the early morning each day of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: LRF62
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at the Reach Resort. I just added photos to trip advisor. Our room had bed bugs! Absolutely revolting!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: shu_shu_vic
Reviews.Content: We just back from staying at the Reach Resort and want to tell everyone what a great place it was. The rooms were clean and the location of the resort was perfect. Ricardo was the best and took great care of our every need by the pool. Congats to The Reach Resort for a great resort and great poolside staff. Victor & Denise Salazar

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: kpietri
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Reach because it was on the other side of the island and it looked nice. It also had pretty good reviews here. They took poetic license with the word resort; this isn't a resort. We think that they call it resort b/c of the number of rooms they have. Something was missing in this hotel. We payed for an ocean view room (with tax and all theire fees, it was over $300 per night)- got a partial ocean view with a very big construccion next door. the room itself was nice and the bed was really comfy. We left for our day in Key West before noon and returned arounf 4 pm, and our room was still unmade. Had to call the front desk to get housekeeping to come clean it. The beach is small and dirty (w/ seaweed) but it has some chaise lounges in the area if you want that beachy feel. The pool is tiny. We've read about the ricardo, the pool man, who was supposed to be a sweetheart but in fact was kind of rude, yelling to all the guests to get out of the pool b/c it was closing. We also saw people w/ coolers around the pool area drinking beer. The resorts we've been to, this isn't allowed. My husband saw a couple w/ big coolers and blenders on their way to their room which was surprising. Didn't eat at the Strip House but we did have breakfast our last day there. It was very good, but expensive. Also the resort fee was unexplained and completely unnecessary. But the staff were nice and cordial w/ us. In the end, we had a great time in Key West, but would not return to the reach. We saw so many b&b's and historical inns that looked much nicer than the Reach, and were probably cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay here”
Reviews.Author: teacherelise
Reviews.Content: If you're thinking of staying at the Reach, stay at Casa Marina, their sister resort, instead. The layout of the Reach is a little weird - finding your room can be difficult! Also, there is only the Strip restaurant, no casual dining available. Worst of all, the tiny beach is loaded with jetskis, which churn up the water, smell like gasoline, and are obnoxiously loud. When we checked in they told us we had "privileges" at their sister resort, Casa Marina. To get to Casa, you must go out a little gate and walk half a block down the street. We liked it much better there - two pools, casual dining/bar outside, and a more expansive beach with hammocks and lots of beautiful palm trees. We wish we had stayed there instead - we will know for next time! One thing that was disappointing, neither resort had a hot tub, although they advertised it in the in-room brochure. On a positive note - the rooms at the Reach were lovely and the staff was fairly friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cpalewine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach for 7 nights and really loved it. I highly reccomend it to anyone. Ricardo the pool guy was the best. When it was really hot out by the pool he brought around ice cold towels to cool you down and he was great with my grand daughter. The olnly thing that I found I didn't like is there wasn't any room in the room to keep your clothes you had to live out of the suit case for the time you were there and the lobby staff couldn't speak very good english but Ricardo made up for any of that. Everyone there was really nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The wonderful men of The Reach”
Reviews.Author: Keedons
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I are visiting Key West for the first time and as I write this review we are sitting in our beautiful room. I felt compelled to write (while still on vacation!) because the gracious and accommodating staff went out of their way to make our stay a delight even amidst a few little bumps along the road. When we arrived, the power on the entire key had recently been off due to lightening. Graham & Joseph (the two fantastic front desk reps) wasted no time getting us into a temporary room while the entire reservation system was re-booting. Chris, the bellman was also very helpful in getting us to our temporary room. When we were given our "real" room, we were disappointed. We had booked an ocean view room and found the partial ocean "look" that we had from our first room, to be somewhat lackluster. I contacted Joseph via phone and he tried his best to accommodate us, We were still somewhat saddened by the room we were left with, and I proceeded to the front desk to see of there was anything more that could be done. I knew what a long day Joseph had already endured, and with our reservation alone, he had to deal with me on three occasions. Joseph never seemed annoyed or frustrated. Joseph was friendly, kind and genuine from our very first encounter to our last. Joseph truly wanted me to be happy, and he was willing to go the extra mile when most people would not have done the same. My husband and I travel often, and the staff says a lot about the place where you choose to spend your vacation. We all know life is not perfect, and unfortunately, neither is vacation, But when people like Joseph are at the helm, acting with professionalism and courtesy, you know you have chosen the right place. The Reach has found gems in both Joseph and Graham and I hope you will take the time to experience their phenomenal customer service which helps make this resort a place people will come back to. Thanks again Joseph! ~Tara & Matthew Cahoon

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisanthony
Reviews.Content: The Reach is ideally located on the beach, on the south side of Key West. It is a short walk to the center of town. The hotel just underwent a major renovation and is very nice. It still needs some fine tuning with its infrastructure but overall a nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the other reviews fool you! This place is horrid!”
Reviews.Author: ADA81
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved the Florida Keys so much that we decided to extend our stay by 2 days. Instead of staying in Islamorada (where we had stayed for 7 nights), we thought we'd spend our last few days in a fabulous resort in Key West. We booked at The Reach (an Ocean View Boutique Suite - not cheap btw) and found upon arrival that our room was not an "Ocean View Boutique Suite", but a room overlooking the construction site which was opposite to the hotel!!! We called down to reception and explained that we had booked an "Ocean View" Boutique Suite, and could we possibly change rooms. We were met with a surly response stating that all rooms were completely booked and there was no chance of an "upgrade" (?!) Calmly, we explained that we had in fact PAID for an "Ocean View Boutique Suite" and had the receipt to prove it. We were then offered a room half the size of the original room on the 2nd floor of the hotel with an obstructed view of the pool. This was supposed to be a good substitute! We said "no thanks". So we stayed with the terrible view of the construction mess across the road for the first day. We were then moved to another room (i.e., the type we paid for) on the 2nd night. Not once were we offered a discount for staying in an inferior room for the 1st night (even though we'd paid ocean-view price). This is just the start of it. The resort has a dirty beach (junk and lots of seaweed everywhere with the water sports company right next to you - jetski's whizzing around as you swim). The pool is very small and crowded (don't let the pics fool you) - they also have a "pool guy" who spends all of his time trying to pick up women rather than help you get towels/drinks etc. On our last night we came back to the hotel at 9pm and thought we'd dine at the Strip House restaurant. The restaurant was mosty empty and we thought we'd have no problem getting a table. We were greeted by a horrid woman who said there are no tables available (despite the restaurant being almost empty). We were then told we would have to eat in the dingy bar area because they were understaffed in the main restaurant! We didn't fancy sitting by ourselves in the lonely bar, and again requested a seat in the main dining room. Afterall, we were only two extra people. The real reason came out eventually - they didn't want to seat us because they were closing in half an hour and didn't want us to hold them up! Furious, we complained to the hotel manager (the same guy who said we couldn't get an "upgrade"). He was (once again) very unhelpful and said there's nothing he could do about it. Don't stay here. The staff are rude, and it's a small and pokey little "resort". The place doesn't deserve it's 4* rating.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Gijon23
Reviews.Content: The Reach is the best, been going there for four years in a row and a lot better since the renovations, The beds are to die for, they are so confy, great pool and the staff is awsome and you get what you pay for........from neighboring Pembroke Pines, Fl

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Reach”
Reviews.Author: Ian S
Reviews.Content: Have recently had a wonderful time at the Reach Resort in Key West. Holiday from 13th July through 22nd July, saw rain on first day for 15mins and no more for duration of stay. Pool/sea view room was excellent and cleaned every day. Pool was very good, this is one of the things that is a must for us, and we were not let down at the Reach. Restaurant/bar very good with special mention to Mike the barman, professional but also very friendly, cheers Mike. A few nights we walked up Duvall and back, but most nights taxi to top of Duvall and bar crawled back down the way. Would recommend the Reach to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Pool Guy”
Reviews.Author: 1trueaustinite
Reviews.Content: Robert, the pool guy was excellent, always a smile and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at The Reach!”
Reviews.Author: diversHouston
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful!!! The rooms are modern and the new updates really take the resort to a new level!! We did have some minor issues while we were there but the front desk was extremely helpful and they discounted our room one of the nights because the water was not working. (Lots of construction going on around the vicinity of the resort). I have traveled extensively and I am pretty harsh critic. As far as resorts go in Key West - this is by far one of the best. If you have never traveled to Key West be aware that the beaches are not that good and the town in generally really dirty with chickens roaming the streets! However, the scuba diving is amazing which is the only reason we chose Key West. If you do dive, use South Point Divers. Contact them directly since the resorts increase their prices to pad themselves a commission. The hotel is also about 1 mile from Duval & Front St. where most of the bars and stuff are located. This really didn't seem to be an issue at first but after a while the walking really got old!!!! One last note - there is a "resort fee" of $20 per day. We were told by the front desk that if we had booked directly with them we would not of had to pay this. However, since they discounted our room because of the water issue, we didn't argue about the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, decent location, nice view, but not clean.”
Reviews.Author: SeeTheWorld77
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at the Reach last week because it was at a decent price in a location that sounded good. Pros: - Staff was friendly and helpful. The electronic safe was not working when I arrived and someone came to fix it fairly quickly. I phoned about the air conditioning, which seemed a little weak upon arrival and someone came up to take a look within about 10 minutes. The air-con still might be a little weak for the summers. - Location is near the southern-most tip of Key West at the quieter end of the town near Duval Street. A walk to the other end of Duval takes about 20 to 30 minutes and is about 2 km. - Beautiful view of the ocean and the place has its own private little beach. - Rooms had a nice modern decor and was in good condition. Cons: - Not clean! The floor tiles were dirty. The shower had hair. The bathroom counter-tops had dusty film. Worst of all, the linens had stains and hair. When I asked for new sheets, I found that they too also contained stains and had hair in them. - There was no hot water for the shower. It wasn't too bad though as the cold water was not so cold. So, for me, the dirtiness of the room made this just an OK. If cleanliness were not an issue, I would rate this Above Average. As you can see from the photos, the decor, facilities, location and view are quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Reach on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Altkunst
Reviews.Content: The Reach Resort is a lovely hotel nestled on the beach in Key West. It is located at the opposite end of the island from Mallory Square which was a fifteen minute stroll. We arrived at 12:30 pm and our room was available to check in early. The self parking rate was $12 per day. Room number 536 was on the top floor and had an ocean view, but it was far enough away from the pool for plenty of privacy. I've noticed that some people have complained about the amount of children at the pool, but I enjoyed the lively family atmosphere. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. The plentiful breakfast buffet was $17 but provided so much food that I skipped lunch most days. Room 536 was elegant and had a Nespresso machine, small refridgerator, large screen TV, chair, sofa sleeper, safe, and plenty of drawer and closet space. Beware: there is construction of a new hotel on the other side of the Reach, but it was not obtrusive to our room. There were small ants in the bathroom. However, I realize that in the Florida rainey season the critters do come indoors at times. One can rent a bicycle for $15 per day from the hotel, and I enjoyed seeing the island with this mode of transportation. What little beach area there is in Key West is always dirty and smelly. This is a fact that one must deal with when visiting the Keys. Overall, the hotel was a pleasant experience and good deal for a three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: Susanf31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Reach for 3 nights in July. We were not impressed. The hotel simply does not meet expectations. Granted, it TRIED really hard to be "swanky" but it just didn't succeed. Their basic rooms are the size of a postage stamp...very small and the most disfunctional room I've ever stayed in. Let me start with the shower because it was the most painful, annoying thing to me! The showerhead shot out the water so fast and hard, it was downright painful! And if you have a sunburn or bald head, you will be in agony. You can't adjust the water pressure at all. The knob only adjust the temperature, not the water pressure. Secondly, the shower only has about an 18" glass partition, the rest of the shower is wide open to the bathroom. That means two things...one, the shower never "warms up" or steams up. It's cold as the air comes in freely. Secondly, as you can imagine, water gets all over the bathroom floor. It's the most ridiculous design I've ever seen. In an effort to have a "fancy" sink and faucet, you have little counterspace in the bathroom. As for the rest of the room, it was fine. The bed was comfy with nice linens. It has a little wet bar with great coffee. The pool is small and the water was cloudy. The "beach" isn't much at all and so covered with dead sea grass, it's not very pleasant either. It's definitly not a swimming beach. But, you really shouldn't be going to the Keys for beaches anyway...even their nicest beaches aren't very nice when you compare them with other Florida beaches. Don't let their claim of having a natural beach persuade you to stay there. Ricardo, the pool guy was there and he does a great job. Lastly, they charge you $12 a day for parking and $20 a day for "resort fees." What the resort fee covers? They told me it was for the coffee in the room, internet, gym, etc.... That's some EXPENSIVE cups of coffee! We stayed at the Sheraton Suites -Key West for 2 nights prior...they didn't charge anything extra for in-room, Starbucks coffee, parking, etc... Reach management, if you are listening, your resort fee is the biggest rip-off ever! For your prices, you should be able to provide free internet , a gym and in-room coffee! I will never stay at another resort that charges a "resort fee" unless I get free parking, internet, in-room coffee and a resort with tennis, free kayaks and lots of other things. All in all, the resort is nice, it's clean, nicely landscaped. You won't be miserable there. But for the cost, I highly recommend you look elsewhere...it's not a 4 start hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Key West”
Reviews.Author: Superrealtor
Reviews.Content: We are glad we stayed at this end of the island. Much quieter. College party days are over. The resort was very clean and nice for the special price we got but I heard in the winter it could be 400.00 then it is not worth it. Pool area could be a little bigger and the reviews are right about a lot of kids. But Ricardo saved the day. He was great!! Fun to talk to. Love to you also Lexy. Thanks so much!! The only thing I wished for was a soft sandy beach even in the water with no rocks or seaweed but I knew it wasn't going to be like that. Yes I would stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing Vacation at the Reach”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly1961
Reviews.Content: Guests from Disputanta, Virginia: This recently renovated resort was a pleasant surprise. We made reservations on the way down to Key West and the rooms were very tastely decorated - modern decor. I would like to see the carpet replaced. When we checked in, the gentlemen at the front desk made sure our room had a better view than the one previously selected. Our poolman - Ricardo was fabulous! He made sure you had everything you needed plus he made sure the pool was clean and safe! It is a great place to stay on the other end away from all the activity at Mallory street and the walk is not bad, you can always get a scooter or cab for the ride back! There was construction going on next door but you would have never known it. Thanks for a wonderful time, all of the staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Completely not worth it”
Reviews.Author: anhellica1979
Reviews.Content: Pros: Bed was very comfortable and clean. Flat screen TV and iPod docking station were awesome. Balcony was nice and you can tell the building has been newly renovated. Staff very friendly and helpful! Mediums: Construction is going on next door and can get loud, but not too terribly bad on our side of the building. Not in the most central part of town but everything is a short walk or bike ride away anyway. There was a jet ski rental booth right on the beach. Cons: Pool was small with lots of kids. "Beachfront" was an absolute joke!!! It was filled with smelly, rancid seaweed that permeated the entire property and made the water unswimmable!!! There are some beaches in the vicinity but you still have to hoof it off hotel property. No shower curtains or doors; they put half of a glass pane next to the shower head but that was it. Did they not realized splashing makes the floor wet? The room next door ordered room service for breakfast on a Tuesday. Wednesday afternoon the tray and the food was still out collecting flies. Seriously, I'm glad I didn't pay for it because I'd feel really ripped off. It's not worth the high price at all. For the fee, I'd expect to feel luxurious and all I got was a comfy bed that would have served me better further down the street closer to Duvall.

Reviews.Title: “MUCH better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: allieoooop
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a tad worried about staying here but we got such a great rate and the location worked for us so we figured we'd give it a shot. It turned out to be a great experience. First, the service was exemplary. We never encountered a sour face on the property. Everyone from the bellmen to the front desk were always greeting us with a smile. Second, the room were very nicely appointed with a nice little bar area and a nice sized room. We stayed in the jr. suite. Thirdly, location for us was great. The hotel is a short walk from Duval Street -- the quiet side of Duval which suited us fine. It's about 1.5 mile walk to the other side of Duval which we did several times but we preferred staying away from the hoopla on the other side. This side of Duval also has plenty of restaurants, shops and other stuff to occupy us when we weren't in the middle of being in the hoopla. The only thing that was a tad disappointing was the pool area. It is rather small and there were lots of kids. The beach was nicer (albeit small) and we rented jet skis from there which was really convenient. We actually walked over to the Casa Marina (sister hotel) for pool services and were VERY happy with their pool. They had two large pools with full pool service. The pools were fabulous there and the vibe was much more adult oriented. Also, because it is the sister hotel we had full charging privileges to our room which was a nice added benefit. Tip: There is a short cut from the Reach's beach to the Casa Marina that makes the walk there very short. Overall, I was very happy with the hotel and would definitely stay here again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “If Casa Marina is booked, stay here”
Reviews.Author: Rachelg
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our Key West trip mainly because the reviews here were so great. The hotel told us that we'd have an ocean view and that all renovation was done and there was no construction being done at the hotel. WELL...when we arrived--there was heavy construction going on at a complex DIRECTLY next door, and the hotel attempted to give us a partial ocean view right next to it!! We said 'no way', and they gave us a better room with an ocean view--blocked by trees, but a view still. For the good, big pool, giftshop, poolbar, luch place, and major hotel resort amenities, we werre advised to go over to the Casa Marina, which was a block away. THAT was nice & like a Caribbean beach resort without a beach. There is one, but it's un-swimmable and full of seaweed and dangerous rocks. It's a contrast to the island's southern state charm and decor, but it was still nice. Good things--the location of the hotel is very nice--it's one block from "The Most Southernpoint" point, as well as the start of Duval St.. Most thing are walking distance, and it's quieter, more adult part of town--which if you're not a drinking spring breaker, is a good thing . Near very good restaurants (Louie's Backyard particularly), and the rooms were a good size and very comfortable. And the staff friendly. Bad things--the pool was smaller and loaded with kids, which was odd since Frommer's noted it was more for adults. And if you're not careful to ask for otherwise, your room can be very loud because of the heavy construction going on. Plus the beach was a disappointment. As well as the 'Resort Fees'. Still we had a great time. Terriffic island, very relaxed with great places to eat and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_UKZoec
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the reach, great location just a 5min walk from Duval St, hotel has recently been refurbished and is linked to the Casa Marina Resort. Rooms although small are very contemporary and stylish. have a small sink and coffee machine as well as a fridge there are balconies which overlooks either the courtyard,ocean or pool. The bathroom is also very nicely decorated in a contemporary style. Check in was very smooth no need to use valet parking as the car park is directly adjacent to reception. There is a gym and an excellent steak house onsite. The pool is right next to the beach where there are lots of watersports as well as a pier which goes out to the ocean. The service was excellent. Food was excellent and atmosphere was great would highly recommend a stay at this hotel and will definately stay here next time i am in key west I will upload some photos shortly.

Reviews.Title: “One week stay was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dianeblondie123
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive since the hotel was recently renovated in a major way and just completed in May. We arrived June 7 and stayed a week -- had a boutique suite with two searate rooms, two patio doors, two tv's and a large balcony. I asked to be upgraded to a pool view if they had one when we arrived and they did so without hesitation. We paid $199 a nite from a special on the web, including the resort fee. We enjoyed the pool, the proximity of the beach to the pool, the rental of toys right there and the easy walk to the Casa Marina, the sister hotel. Though the Casa doesnt have a nice beach, they do have two pools and a bar. Housekeeping was great, attentive, the expresso machine was nice to have, as was the wet bar and frig. The shower was excellent, plenty of room in the bathroom for three women to get ready to go out, and then it was also close to Duval Street as well as the little grocery store for odds and ends. I would recommend this place to others, maybe not for much more than $200 a nite, but then everything is around that price in KW. Ricardo was wonderful at the pool and delightful to speak with. Only improvement I can think of is to have a less expensive restaurant there for all meals and drinks. It cost me $33.00 for two drinks and one kid's drink at the pool! And their menu was just too high priced for us. I do believe the restaurant is leasing the space, so maybe that will change some day. All in all we were pleased with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: shelleyPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Reach Resort, we spent the last week of June and were pleased with the experience. Ricardo, at the pool, was aware of patrons needs and wants, and worked to make sure everybody was comfortable. I am looking forward to seeing him again when I return with my mother and daughter on the 7th of July. The new renovations are chic and modern, rooms are equipped with all necessaries and extras: iron and ironing board, hair dryer, espresso maker, and robes. The location is great, on the Atlantic Ocean with beach front property, and walking distance to Duval. Duval is close but the resort is quiet and relaxed. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: padMpls_Mn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and had a great time. Pool and beach were great. Ricardo took excellent care of us at the pool !!! Rooms were clean and re-cleaned every day. Within walking distance of Duvall Street and many restaurants. We only had to take a cab to and from the airport. Nice bar and restaurant at the resort. We were able to book the excursions that we wanted through their sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel, but no resort”
Reviews.Author: EAinKY
Reviews.Content: There are lots of nice things about the Reach - the rooms and landscaping are both clean and beautiful; the pool is nice; the service good. Unlike other reviewers, we had a good experience with the front desk staff - Jocely (sp) was helpful, friendly and efficient. However, there was plenty not to love as well. Rooms are expensive and our "oceanview" room only had a slim view of the ocean, and only when you stood up on the balcony. Sitting down, it was a "palm tree top view". There was a "resort fee" added every day, but we were hardpressed to find any resort amenities - there was a charge for virtually everything - to park at the property, Internet, bikes. There was no drink service at the pool, only a jug of water & lemons & limes - none of the goodies promised in the little resort newsletter in the room - drink samples, popsicles, fruit. Ricardo, the pool guy was very helpful, as well as entertaining; however, after he packed it in for the day, you couldn't even get a pool towel. The sister property down the road was the real resort, this was more of a nice hotel. The Banana Cafe - just a bit up Duval had awesome breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at the Reach!”
Reviews.Author: ParrotStruck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for 7 nights as our annual vacation. The new changes for the most part were very nice. When we first arrived, Lincoln was most helpful with our bags and for suggesting dining and island activities. We had a Boutique Suite for my wife and family friend. The room was nice and comfortable. Bed was awesome, just like home. The couch bed was comfy too. Only have two complaints about the room: there is no door on the shower and the water ends up everywhere, we constantly had towels on the floor to absorb the water. And there needs to be a mirror somewhere out in the room, not just the one over the sink. The oversized balcony was awesome too, over looking the courtyard, pool and partial ocean view. Our favorite part of the Reach is the natual beach. We spent 5-6 hours a day out there. Billy and his beach boys are awesome and we always looked forward to our time out there. The water is great for swimming! We did get lunch and snack foods from the Strip House but never had dinner. The food was average. We sure missed the tiki bar that was there in the past. Also missed the regular wait staff that would serve drinks and food while you were lounging on the beach. We highly suggest staying at the Reach Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Reach Resort & Casa Marina -- 2 is better than 1”
Reviews.Author: fellow-in-chelsea
Reviews.Content: I and traveling companion occupied an ocean-view suite on the 5th floor of The Reach Resort late June-08 (off-season). The entire package of 5 nights and 6-days, including airfare was about $1500 per person. Alone, the Reach would have been a "good" experience, but with full access to the amenities of the sister property Casa Maria â€” e.g., two pools, hammocks on the beach, pool-side dining, and larger gym facility â€” the experience is upgraded to above average. Plusses: -- 450 foot of real beach with soft sand. -- ceiling fan in room. -- medium firm mattress, king-sized bed, and 4 large European sized pillows. -- 5 minute walk from the main strip, Duval Street, and note the part of Duval Street, closer to the "Southernmost Point" that is less busy (a good thing if you want to avoid the college kids). -- Balcony with two chairs and side-table. Unfortunately for us unusable during the visit because of the 90-degree+ temperature. -- Nespresso machine in the room with (3) caf and (3) decaf capsules, which sat next to second sink. -- i-Home clock radio. -- welcoming staff. Minuses: -- Food at the Strip House Restaurant, the only restaurant at the Reach, is a mixed bag and very expensive. The Decor akin to a dark, was to my mind incongruous with a warm-weather, on-the-beach resort. -- Housekeeping: failed to change the flat and fitted sheets even after three requests (after which we surrendered); constantly ignored requests for additional Nespresso capsules. Although we did not partake of many available activities, I recommend the Sebago Sunset Sail (on a catamaran) and visiting Fort Zachary Taylor. Had there been more time, parasailing would have been our next activity choice.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: illilni
Reviews.Content: this is a great place to stay for the price. They have a very nice pool & beach area. Ricardo makes it even better. The room was awesome & had the most comfortable bed we had ever slept in. You can walk next door to the sister location (Casa Marina) that is a must see hotel. We were able to walk to everything that we wanted to do. The food at the Strip (the hotel restaurant) was good but way expensive. Save some cash & eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved IT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: j0d0b0t
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around, GREAT service! (Thanks Ricardo!) My girlfriend and I are planing to go back...a great VALUE! I highly recommend it for a romantic gate away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Experience at the Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: JazzGi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Reach Resort. This resort is located on the beach and is within walking distance to restaurants, stores, attractions etc. (If you get tired, taxi's are available :) Upon arriving, Lincoln greeted us with his friendly smile and fully assisted us with questions about Key West and The Reach. We self-parked our car and did not get in it again until we checked out of the hotel! Also, we had reserved an Island View room and decided to upgrade (for additional $$) to an Ocean View room....what a great decision. It was such a relaxing feeling to see the ocean from our balcony. The Strip House is the only restaurant on the property. The food, service and ambience create a great dining experience. Also, lunch outside on the patio is great. Loved relaxing, swimming at the beautiful pool which located on the beachside. A special "Thank You" to Ricardo, for making our days at the pool very pleasurable. Ricardo goes out of his way in providing excellent customer service to all guests....he takes care of everyone! Ricardo "makes a difference" and is a great asset to The Reach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Reach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Madameshuz
Reviews.Content: Reach Resort was a great place to stay! The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The pool and beach area are beautiful and kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Made Great”
Reviews.Author: Slowski666
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff at "The Reach", attended to every detail of our stay. Our room was ready and available as reserved. Upon entering our room, we noted that it was immaculate and all amenities functioned properly. During our stay, the room was cleaned and serviced to 5 star standards. Clean robes awaited our after shower time and the in-room fridge enabled us to chill our wine and soda. The hotel lobby provided fresh fruit daily and the valet, bell men, concierge and service staff could not have been more attentive to our needs or special requests. The pool, fitness center and beach area were a welcome respite from our work during the day. Over the course of our stay, we dined at the restaurant "The Strip House" for each meal type including breakfast, lunch and dinner and enjoyed the service, food quality and ambiance. All said, our stay at "The Reach" was a fabulous experience and highly recommend it if you plan a trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jsmith417
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Reach Resort with 4 other moms for a girls weekend. The place could not have been any nicer. I was a little skeptical after reading some of the reviews but we couldn't have been happier. Ricardo helped make our stay most enjoyable. The rooms were very nice and the cleaning service was perfect. We skipped eating at the restaurant as others recommended. They were now serving drinks at the pool but the prices were outrageous even for a resort. We really had no complaints and I would definitely return to this resort the next time in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced...Over Rated!!!”
Reviews.Author: WowTraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our stay at the Reach quite disappointed. This is definately not a 4 or even a 3 star hotel. The outside appearance is like a bland cheap motel. Although the hotel reservation agent and their website had both said there was $12 self parking, the signs and valet said there was only $20 per day valet parking. The front desk was not very friendly nor welcoming at check in. Our boutique suite looked nice on the inside, but there were tiny bugs crawling all over the counters. The hotel charges a $20 per day resort fee for which we received nothing, and then they try to nickel & dime you for everything in addition to that--water $5 a bottle in the room etc. I wandered all over to find an ice maching(following their signs)...finally located one on the other side of the building, only to find it wasn't working. The resort's beach is extremely tiny..not for swimming at all, just to launch their overpriced jet ski rentals(we found many better deals on the island). It was not as clean & beautiful as the website photos make it. The enhanced pool photos etc. on the website are taken wide angle and don't accurately reflect their small size. The pool didn't have any of the serivces they charge you for in the resort fee...we received no towels....no drinks....no fruit. There was no amazing "Ricardo" as others have posted the days we were there. There was some guy walking around the pool straightening chairs, but he never even said "hi." All we wanted from the Reach was what was advertised....a quality resort. What we got was an overpriced...overrated hotel. If you want quality or value stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Stay..”
Reviews.Author: SoInLoVe1899
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the reach resort ..We checked in May 26th and I had a great time and really liked the reach but it wasen't perfect.When we arrived after a long drive (flew into west palm beach) we asked the front desk for the bellman and they told us they couldnt find him. So we asked if we could use the cart to bring up the luggage ourselves and they told us they don't allow guests to use it.Finally after 15 min they found the bellman and he took up our luggage. We were exausted and we just wanted to order room service and chill out. We were then told they didnt start room service until tomorrow. Which we though was very weird , but when we were brought to our room I forgot about all of that and was really happy. The redone rooms are really really nice. We had a boutique suite and it was awesome. The beds were soooo comfortable! The pool was very nice , the beach was nice , and the location was great. We walked everywhere and I not much of a walker. :) I think this hotel is just getting itself together again after being redone and I think it willbe great. I will stay there again if I ever in Key west.( which was wonderful by the way)...At mallory square check of Wire Ryan he is awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, Ricardo and Jonathon really know how to take care of you at poolside.”
Reviews.Author: strprswpr
Reviews.Content: The pool is beautiful and the rooms are great. Ricardo and Jonathon are attentative to every need when your at the pool. This was my second stay and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway”
Reviews.Author: smc83
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Key West were I stayed at the Reach Resort, first of all the rooms were beautiful, I had checked some websites(hotel.com; travelocity; expedia) before I left to get a glimpse, but noticed they have very old pictures that do not relate at all to what they really look like, so I suggest you go directly to their website. We arrived at 1:30 am because we drove from Miami (not the best idea since the road is under construction, maybe it also has to do that it was Memorial Day weekend) the "guy" at the front desk was very helpful in telling us were to go and grab a bite at that hour. The restaurant also has an excelent restaurant, Just opened Strip House and is very close to everything as well. We did rent a scooter to be able to move all over the keys, which is also a good idea. We were also able to use the facilities at Casa Marinal,their sister hotel and was very pleasurable as well. In terms of pool BAR service (drinks and food) Casa Marina is better since it has more people dedicated to this, even though Ricardo the pool "guy" at the Reach is great. In my opinion one of my best weekends ever and strongly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Not really a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: lawood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reach Resort for 6 nights May 18th-24th 2008. Upon arrival the bellman and front desk were polite but not very informative about the property or surronding area. Our room was nice, clean and a good view of pool and ocean. The beach is very small however, we were well aware of this. The pool area is wonderful and Ricardo and Jonathan are by far the best things about this hotel. This is not a resort there is no extras, no turn down service, no free water items, no where to even get a cup of coffee, nothing that really makes your stay there "stand out". We were very disappointed as were other guests that there is no casual bar/food around the beach/pool area. We were not bothered by any construction although the fire alams went off on several occassions and the cable went out for hours at a time. The location is good however, it is a long walk to Mallory Square when the temp is 95+. The breakfast buffet is $17.00 per person so we ate at the Cuban grocery on the corner and had great ham/egg/cheese sandwiches for $5.00. We did hear that the Casa Marina had a more "resort" type atmosphere and we were welcome there however, their beach was much dirtier than the Reach. Skip Louie's Backyard and head to Southernmost on the Beach Cafe on Duval. (Turn left toward the water and it is on the beach only about a block away) Do not miss the Ft Jefferson trip. Well worth the money, We took the Yankee Freedom (BE SURE TO TAKE A COOLER WE WERE TOLD BY THE PLACE WE PURCHASED TICKETS THAT YOU COULD NOT BUT YOU CAN THEY WELCOME THEM AND PROVIDE AN AREA ON THE BOAT TO STORE THEM) Overall we had a very enjoyable trip however, the Reach is no more than an overpriced hampton Inn and at the Hampton you get free parking, breakfast and internet service. I'm just not sure why they charge the $20.00 per day resort fee. Also self park that is $12.00 vs $20.00 per day for valet. We are really not cheap people we just like to get something for our money and I think the reach would be better off tocharge more for their daily room rate and do away with the "resort" fee, it proved to be an irritant to many people we spoke with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: rshee1519
Reviews.Content: We had a wedding there and everything was great. Everyone was helpful and Ricardo the guy at the pool was super

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: vacationMN
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Key West for our wedding anniversary and spent four nights at The Reach hotel. This was our second visit to the hotel. Our first was when it was the Wyndom Reach Hotel. Now it is under the LXR umbrella after some renovations. They just opened and there are a few issues, but overall we were pleased with the improvements. First, the location is perfect for what we want in a trip to Key West. Location is good, still a walk to most restaurants and shopping, but for us that is ok. For some it will be an issue. Rooms are nice with all the expected features - robe, safe, coffee maker, and flat screen. However, the best reason to stay at The Reach is the beach. Water is warm and clear and the beach/pool staff excellent. A few drawbacks. The property next door is behind developed and the noise/trucks are constant. Most rooms are not going to pick up the noise, however. Maid service was inconsistent, but not a disappointment. Also, the hotel management has completely missed the opportunity to serve food/drinks at the pool and beach. The new restaurant (The Strip House) was staffed but they never ventured out to the pool to take orders. We made drinks in our room one afternoon and was approached by another guest about purchasing a cocktail! Other amenities are not operational, but not critical â€“ the business center and gift shop are yet to open so don't expect to be able to print your boarding pass or buy toothpaste for a little while. There's a small grocery store a block away for supplies. Also, parking is not free but valet is optional contrary to the sign out front. You don't need a car in Key West so the in-and-out valet service completely unnecessary and unwarranted. As for restaurants, we ended up not eating at The Reach. We found the best breakfast at Camiles Restaurant 2-blocks away on Simonton; world class sangrias at Santiago's Bodega on Petronia Street; satisfying appetizers at Nine One Five on Duval; great lunch at Salsa Loca Mexican Restaurant; the best dinner at Seven Fish on Olivia Street; the most expensive dinner next door at Louie's Backyard. Lastly, we found the best band performance in town - Kevin Gordon of Nashville - at Hog's Breath Saloon. We would not recommend The Reach for families with children. We have two daughters and I am not sure they would have enjoyed the sedate atmosphere of the pool or beach. Also, the Strip House restaurant may offer steaks but the atmosphere is closer to a bordello than a steak house with its tasteful display of nudes. Overall, we like The Reach, the renovation and, of course, the location - it's Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Let me reach away”
Reviews.Author: dovix85
Reviews.Content: checked in....$20.00 valet parking fee....ac did not work......front desk clerk had no idea what was going on....try to charge you for everything....room was not worth the price......i would say its a 2 - 3 star motel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place In Key West”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_in_IN
Reviews.Content: We booked the Reach at hotwire.com for a cheaper price than listed (booked it for $155). We were aware of the $20 resort fee and were given the option of $20 parking fee or parking along the street for free. We chose the $20 parking fee since parking in Key West is impossible and stressful. Great modern decor in the hotel which makes it clear it is newly remodeled. This hotel has a great location near the action but in a private and quiet area with its own private beach and pool (both very clean and nice). We were given towels and chairs for free on the beach and the hotel offered many fun activities (ex: wave runners) for additional fees. Nice workout room as well. The staff was very helpful with advice on where to eat and visit. Most of the staff wore name tags including the country they were from. This made travel a great discussion. I would ignore the reviews about the air conditioning since it is probably a freak thing. I would also ignore reviews before it was remodeled since it has a great new face lift now. I would go back to the Reach without question. We walked to Anna's Cafe down the road for some great Cuban food. This hotel is only a couple of blocks from the southern point in the continental U.S.A. and Duval Street (for night life and shopping).

Reviews.Title: “Reach Needs Help!”
Reviews.Author: capeandislandsgirl
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by saying I absolutely love Key West and I am sure that, in time, The Reach will be a great place to stay- but wait 'til next year. The Lobby is spare-no big deal, the desk staff is very nice. We had an ocean view boutique suite and the room was beautiful! Big entry/sitting area with a couch, flat screen tv, wet bar, bar, balcony- The bedroom was beautiful- another flat screen tv and an exceptionally comfortable bed. BUT- the AC never really worked- at times our room was over 80 degrees. On the second day of our stay, there was no air conditioning at all in the guest rooms of the hotel-we got a memo telling us it would be fixed and it never really was. Then at 4 am the fire alarm went off, this was the loudest fire alarm I have ever heard. Thankfully it was a false alarm and there was no fire anywhere, but it was deafening! AT 4 AM!!!! We also noticed water on the rug near the AC vent. We called the front desk but nothing was ever done about it. The beach and the pool were beautiful and pristine- the common rest rooms were spotless. The pool staff was friendly and accomodating. The location is prime-close to the action but not too close. It is right next door to Louie's Backyard restaurant- a BIG plus. The Reach Resort has so much potential- I only hope it improves

Reviews.Title: “Could have been Great”
Reviews.Author: sal1215
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was only valet parking for $20.00 a day, their literature said self park for $12.00. They did agree to the $12.00 after we complained. Fortunately our room was available early when we arrived and it was beautifully decorated, very clean but no a/c. We were told a/c should be working in four hours. So after going downtown, eating, etc. came back still no a/c. They still tried to tell us it'd be fixed soon (on a Sunday night after 9 p.m.??). We demanded something be done. We were moved to their sister hotel and on the way out ran into several other disgruntled guests who said the a/c hasn't worked in days!!! Shame on them for not informing guests at check-in, this is Southern Florida!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad We Reach(ed) Out”
Reviews.Author: travelermia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at The Reach in room with partial view of the pool and ocean. The hotel just completed a total rennovation. It is located at a quite section of Key West but within walking distance to Duval St. Room was big, super clean, and nicely appointed with modern furniture. Bed was wonderful, king size and with very comfortable pillows and nice linens. The bathroom was huge and very clean The only negative was the check in time 4:00 pm and check out at 11:00 am!!! We loved The Reach and would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “I'll Try To Be Fair”
Reviews.Author: DuganLandOfLincoln
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort April 28th thru May 1st of this year. I was introduced through a promotion on Travelzoo but booked a promotion offered directly through the hotel's web site. I feel all the amenities offered were more than adequate contrary to some reviews. The beach area is small but maintained as I watched the crew grate the sand and remove the washed up weed in the morning hours with a tractor set up for such. The property around the pool and restaurant area has been landscaped beautifully. I think we were very fortunate in our room assignment. We booked a boutique room that wasn't supposed to have much of a view however we ended up in #434 which had a corner balcony and a "view to kill for". The view over the pool area from the 4th floor, watching boats, and listening to the ocean waves is so relaxing we found ourselves thinking twice about the room. This room has an expresso and complimentary use of robes. In our minds eye the room only had two negatives. First the refrigerator didn't work. It was replaced within the hour by management. The room didn't have a hair dryer which was brought to us once we asked. The rooms can be a walk to get to which can best be described by the resorts name. We found ourselves using the elevators going up but the stairs going down because of their convenient location. If you stay at this resort be aware of the 'SERVICE FEES'. The daily resort fee, which was the only one disclosed to my knowledge prior to booking, is just the start. The breakfast buffet, while very inviting, commands a 18 percent service fee prior to gratuity. The Reach Resort has mandatory valet parking which includes handling your baggage to your room which I admit was nice. We complimented the valet with a generous gratuity both checking in and checking out. However a twenty dollar a day valet fee is charged at check out. I questioned this fee but paid it just the same. Because of these undisclosed fees I will check around before I book here on our next trip to the Keys this fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ryenymom
Reviews.Content: Like others, I read the prior reviews and was ready to cancel our reservation, but it seemed that the Reach was getting it together and we weren't bothered by the construction next door. Without a pool bar and service, we saved lots of $$, but it is well worth a few hours to sit at the Casa Marina beach under the palm trees and enjoy their beach food/drink service to see what a beach resort is supposed to be like. It seemed like the one bellhop was also the valet - so we dragged our own bags. Ricardo at the pool was great - friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff and breakfast buffet staff were very curtious. We were two moms traveling with two 8th graders and we all loved the location! We rented bikes and it was so much fun! If the moms wanted to stay on Duval and shop or have a drink the boys were safe to get themselves back to the hotel. They also could go across the street and get a meal at the little Cuban take out place or snacks at the store. All in all it was a fun trip - after the crummy NY winter/spring the warm sunny weather was fantastic! Not quite sure why LXR would have bought this property it isn't like their other top-of-the line resorts. P.S. If you've read the AAA guide for Key West don't fall for the Conch Train tour to be a "gem" - it wasn't even close! The full day Dry Tortuga day trip was interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk serivce - poor”
Reviews.Author: TRAEH
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort earlier than check-in, but were not upset when our room was not ready, but things went down hill from then on . We walked to the restaurant/lounge to have something to eat & drink and were informed that they were closed from 3:30 till 5:00 to prepare for dinner. We went back to the front desk to see how long it would be to get our room and were told 15 minutes. We left the resort for around 45 minutes and when we returned we were still unable to go to our room. After 45 minutes more and no room - we were asked by EJ "WHAT WOULD WE LIKE HIM TO DO!". A hour and half after check-in our room was ready, only when we got to it the maids had decided to use our door as a meeting place. We had to ask them to please move. Our thoughts: Front Staff: Need major improvement Restaurant & Lounge: If they are a resort they should not close both for preparation Beach: Very small & dirty Pool: Beautiful and Ricardo made our stay very enjoyable- Do not expect fruit, popsicles, etc. at pool - not to be had and we paid for them Parking: Web site states $12.00 a day - Valet parking only and it was $20.00 a day Rooms: Beautiful, very large & very clean I don't really think that I would recommend the resort at htis time

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: ahc002
Reviews.Content: We were a little nervous about staying at the Reach after reading the reviews on this site but were pleasantly surprised after our 3 night stay. Things aren't quite perfect but moving in the right direction. Our room was very nice. Clean, quite, balcony overlooking the pool & ocean, and a ceiling fan (!!). The bathroom was clean and very modern. The most disappointing part of our stay was the beach. We were expecting to be able to swim in the ocean and that was definitely NOT the case due to the size of the beach and the seaweed in the water. We were also disappointed with the fitness center and the lack of services at the pool. The fitness center had nice but a VERY limited selection of equipment. We received none of the advertised concierge services at the pool (fruit, popsicles, etc). I mentioned this at check out and the $20/day resort fee was taken off our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a change for the better...”
Reviews.Author: sammya76
Reviews.Content: My husband, Mother-in-law and 1 year old daughter stayed here for three nights earlier this month. We previously stayed here in April 2006 and got married at their sister property, The Casa Marina in 2005. We were VERY disappointed in the changes they made to the hotel! We stayed in a boutique suite, the same room type we stayed in in 2006. If the hotel were in downtown Chicago the rooms would be appropriate. Unfortunately, they look nothing like a room you would expect in the Keys. We thought they were cold and uninviting. We may have felt differently if we had been given a view of anything other than the parking garage, though. Oh yes, the parking garage that we had to pay $20 per day in valet charges because we weren't allowed to self-park because they didn't have a permit allowing it. Since they only had one valet working at a time and they were also taking guests bags to and from their rooms we almost always had to leave our keys with the front desk. The parking spots on the street were so coveted that people would literally in them to save them for their cars. Pretty sad for a "luxury" hotel. They only had one working elevator and it wasn't anywhere close to our room. Apparently, they had no permits for all the elevators, either.
