We weren't bothered too much by this until we were checking out and the one working elevator was not working, either. The bellman tried his best to help us, but we still had to drag the majority of our bags, along with a one year old in a stroller down 3 flights of stairs. They also took out the hot tub that used to be by the pool as well as the "Tiki Bar" that was next to the pool. They stop serving their extremely overpriced food by the pool at 4pm, which we were rudely made aware of by the waiter on the day we checked in. At the time it was 3:55. The last time we stayed they had good food and GREAT frozen drinks. Those are gone :( We love Key West, so we put up with all the problems we had, but in the end we felt like they should have paid us to stay there. In all fairness, they did adjust our bill, but only enough to take the edge off our anger. I feel for the staff. They seem to have their hands tied by the hotel management and are unable to do much to rectify any bad situation. I know they paid millions of $$ to renivate this hotel, but they would have been much better off giving the $$ to Ricardo, the Pool Guy. He's the ONLY good thing that remains at this place!!!! We won't be staying there, again. It's funny, we thought they had issues when they were owned by the Wyndam. It's definitelt gotten MUCH worse! Save yourself the hassle & stay at Southernmost on The Beach!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better time and value to be had at the Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: solosolosolo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for two nights having just stayed two nights at the Sheraton by the airport. The contrast was quite stark. I guess not so many people immediately check out of one location and then into another as we did and hence do not experience differences quite so soon. The Reach was more expensive, less friendly and the pool, beach and room less welcoming. Indeed we had to move rooms within two hours as the air-conditioning in Room 230 did not work. No appology, just a bell boy expecting another tip! The advantage of moving rooms was that the smell of fuel from the jet-ski rental on the beach did not reach the 5th floor like it did on the 2nd. My advice is you will find a much more

Reviews.Title: “Update on The Reach”
Reviews.Author: glencora
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from The Reach, which is completing a major renovation. In fairness to the hotel, I'll add that all the previous reviews reflect a much less completed renovation. I travelled to Key West with my teenaged son for his high school spring break and was wary about staying in any of the hotels notorious for partying. The Reach was wonderful. All the rooms had balconies and ours overlooked the pool and ocean. Interior decor was entirely new and sleek, with a beautiful modern bathroom. The room had a huge flat screen tv, fridge, espresso maker and iHome for our iPod. I had a queen sized bed with comfy duvet and my son slept on the sofa bed. The hotel has its own parking garage, which is rare in Key West, where parking is at a premium. The staff was incredibly helpful, young and international. They helped us book a great fishing trip and made great dinner recommendations. The steak restaurant and bar on site was open but we never ate there. The pool was wonderful and right next to their beautiful beach, where we rented a Jet Ski. My one complaint, which isn't even really a complaint, is that there was still some work going on around us and the smoke alarm kept going off, but it appears that the renovation is just about totally completed as of our stay in mid-April.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at The Reach”
Reviews.Author: pipesy687
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was apprehensive about staying at the Reach after reading reviews on this site but my recent stay (April 12th thru 17th) was excellent. The hotel was in great shape, clean, staff was great. There is construction going on at the hotel next store but it didn't bother my girlfriend and I. Overall all great place to stay in Key West and I would definitely go back there. Only complaints -- $20 per day resort fee and pricey drinks at the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: jmikusev
Reviews.Content: We too were a little apprehensive after all of the harsh reviews. However, we had such a great time we plan on staying at the Reach Resort again when we return to Key West with friends next Spring. This was my second trip to Key West, but my husband's first. My first time I stayed at the Double Tree Grand Key Resort. It was a beautiful hotel, but out of the way and it had no beach access. The Reach Resort is within walking distance of Duval Street and all of the Old Town attractions. It also has a beautiful beach on the premises. The pool was nice and was manned by Ricardo on most of the days we went. Ricardo was a fabulous host and we couldn't say enough good things about him. The beach was nice and due to the smaller size of the hotel, not too crowded. Part of it is taken up by a company that rents out jet skis, etc. We actually rented one on our last day and had a good time. They were not too loud or distracting to the beach goers as they can only be revved up past the swimming area which is quite large. The room was nice and had a great balcony. The maids did a great job and were friendly. One complaint is that the "do not disturb" fall off the door handles if it is windy in the semi-open hallways. The front desk staff didn't do the best job of providing information unless we asked for it. But they were very helpful otherwise. One other complaint is that there is not room service yet though there are plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Reach - still a work in progress”
Reviews.Author: MidsMom11
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I was a little aprehensive about staying at the Reach after reading some of the reviews but the place is gorgeous. It is still a work in progress and once complete will be an excellent retreat in the quiet section of Key West. Sorry, this is a little long! We never had an issue when asking for something, the Front Desk was very accomodating. If you want anything at the pool, Ricardo is the best and great fun. We never heard any construction noise from the Southernmost next door and according to the Front Desk they are trying to keep those rooms open because of construction. Apparently it is very hard to get reliable construction workers in Key West and that may be why the Reach is still a work in progress. We never once heard or saw a construction worker during our stay and they were working on the Sundries Shop and some closed rooms. Pros: Great pool and wonderful soft sand beach (Ricardo has beach toys for the kids) Great Ocean View Room on the 5th Floor Modern Room - everything is new and fresh Comfortable Bed, IPOD Radio/Clock, Expresso Machine & Refrigerator in room. Flat Screen TV and wirless internet (yes, they do charge) Close to Ana's Cuban Cafe - great cuban coffee! Bike Rentals on the property Cons: Work out room has no equipment but who goes on vacation to work out - Duval Street will do that for you No daquiri machine, apparently they have one on order but we ordered other drinks Only elevators off the lobby currently work, the other elevator is out of service (according to the staff they are waiting on the Inspector to come from Miami for the permit) Ice Machines installed but not totally hooked up to produce ice We did visit the Casa Marina for one day and both pools and the beach were crowded and loud. The beach at very shelly and rocky (you needed to go out on the pier to get into the water. Way too many people for us and is farther from Duval Street. Although it is a walk from the Reach to Mallory Square, we will come back to the Reach for the peace, quiet, sun and sand. You are in Key West, sit back and relax and don't sweat the small stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Ricardo's poolside service makes The Reach "The Place"”
Reviews.Author: jsssj
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Reach several times over the last seven years. The property has almost finished a much needed renovation. The lobby has been moved, rooms redone, but unfortunately much of the lush, beautiful landscaping has been taken out. Our biggest complaint was the strange half-door on the large shower. No way the floor wasn't getting wet. The very best part of our stay was finding that Ricardo is still in charge of the pool. The view is spectacular and we love relaxing poolside. The property needs to finish their overhaul with a workout room, gift shop, and better umbrellas by the pool, but you cannot beat the location and staff of The Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Will be nice eventually”
Reviews.Author: Travel6104
Reviews.Content: The Reach resort will be a very nice location once their renovation is complete. We stayed three nights at the hotel from March 25 to 28. Honestly, this hotel should not be open to the public at this time. We were put in a room that had no working electrical outlets, no mini fridge, no clock, no wi-fi, the phone did not work, bathroom door did not close, no trash can. Additionally, the room was accross from a diesel generator or pump that kicked in every couple of hours throughout the night. It was evident that this room was not ready to be rented. The clerks were extremely nice and helpful but could not move us until the next day. We moved to a much better room, but then faced contruction of a new hotel across the street. Very loud from 7:30 AM until about 5 PM. The Reach needs another couple of months before it should be open to the public. Every staff member we mentioned this to agreed, but I'm sure they were happy to be working. We were disapointed by the game the hotel manager was playing. Every time we asked to speak with her, we were told she was next door at the sister hotel, Casa Marina. We left a phone mumber for her to call but did not receive a call back. We went to the Casa Marina, to be told she was at our hotel at the time. (Figured out her game quicky, can't blame her, she knew the hotel was not ready) Still waiting for a call...... A clerk gave us a $100 good will credit, but the damage was done. My advice is as follows; if you have reservations at the Reach, ask to be moved to the Casa Marina. It's renovation is complete and also has a beach and two pools. If you must stay at the Reach, and don't mind sharing your vacation with lots of construction workers, ask for a room that faces the pool, it will be much quieter and only about $50 a night more. If I knew of the renovation, I would have gladly paid the extra money for some peace. All in all, a very nice place with a terrific staff, (sans manager) but not ready for prime time! Ask many quesitons before you book or stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Post Construction: A list of things you should know before staying”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFLgirl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Reach Resort for three nights and I have mixed feelings. The construction at the resort is 99% complete and the hotel is beautiful, but there are some quirks that you should know before making the decision to stay here. Reservations - Avoid booking over the phone, and use the online system. I was repeatedly refused discount rates over the phone and also told only the more expensive rooms were available. Yet when I checked online, the discounts and lower priced rooms were available. When I called back and informed them of this, availability, the discounts and lower priced rooms were "magically" available over the phone. Private Beach - The hotel sits on a tiny private beach and has a beautiful pool area. The ocean views rooms mostly overlook this pool/beach area. However, we visited one ocean view that mostly looked at the construction going on next door, so be careful! Also, the beach is small and can get crowded so we often used the Casa Marina's large beach next door which had more amenities like towel and drink service, hammocks, and a prettier view. The rooms - We stayed on an ocean view junior suite which was clean, modernly decorated, and the King bed was very comfortable. Nice sheets, linens, amenities etc. We also used the suite's balcony fairly frequently which had a beautiful view. The room was one of the best parts of our stay. Noise - Although the construction is finished at this hotel, the property right next door is undergoing a major construction job. During the week day mornings, we woke up to the sound of jack hammers. Also, there were problems with the fire alarms which went off EVERY morning of our stay, for 20 minutes to an hour. I don't know why they could not fix the problem. Housekeeping - When we arrived at 6pm (check in at 3), we were able to go directly to our room. But many people were waiting in the lobby for their rooms to be prepared, nearly three hours after the check in time. Not good. Also, the hall ways were often lined with used dishes that were not picked up for days. However, we did not have any problems with housekeeping servicing our room. Incomplete Services - the ice machines are not yet installed on each of the floors, the restaurant is not open for dinner, and the fitness room is not yet equipped. Overall, I would be willing to stay here again for a really good price. Otherwise, I would much rather stay at Casa Marina, the sister resort next door, which offers more amenities and better service almost at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Not Happy!”
Reviews.Author: TwoTrips
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Reach in January 08. After booking I called several times to ask differnet questions regarding the hotel. Everything seemed fine, until we got there. Upon check in we relized that the hotel was still under construction, there was no restaurant or bar and the beach was a mess. The hotel was noisy and a mess. We had visited the Reach in 03 and found it to be very nice and expected the same this time. We were very disappointed that no one ever told us about the construction or that there was no restaurant...but hey we could get a complementary boxed lunch. We ended up contacting a differnet hotel and they graciously matched the rate of the Reach and even upgraded us to a suite. When we got to our new hotel we met several other couples who had the same problem at the Reach. Sorry Reach Resort, but you've lost this couple as guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Will be great when it is done.”
Reviews.Author: Beck'sSun
Reviews.Content: We knew that the hotel restaurant and bar were not open. We e-mailed the resort, and a manager said yes, we opened without the restaurant and bar, but if you are not satisfied with the Reach, we will transfer you to our sister resort, Casa Marina (a couple hotels down the beach). We first got there, there was tarps in the lobby and our hotel hallway was a slab of concrete (they were laying a beautiful tile on other floors). Put off, but not shocked, we went to our room, it was stunning, modern, but comfortable. Our view amazing! We were excited to get to the beach we could see, even from our courtyard view. We got there and the beach was fine....no great beach in Key West, and this one is about as good as it gets as far as the beaches we have seen there. We were there about one minute before the drills and saws started. ALL AFTERNOON, we decided to switch over to the sister resort, again, I was put off that we had to walk there ourselves with all our luggage, this being a luxury resort. The sister resort was mostly finished with renovations, and it is beautiful! The beach is not quite as nice, but well worth the move. The Reach will be ALMOST as nice as the Casa Marina when it is done, BUT WAIT TILL NEXT SEASON! They obviously didn't want to miss out on the season this year, and has to be why they would open it under these circumstances. Places to eat....right inbetween the two resorts is Backyard Louie's. Very romantic, best view, great food, (try the ceviche starter), pricey but you pay for the view too. Go for lunch too! Make reservations. La Te Da........great place. I can't tell you how good our meal was here, and to try would not do it justice. Seldom would I say try the crab cakes, but if it is on the menu....do it! Two great cuban restaurants, one closer to the resorts, but it is in more of a residential neighborhood, and mostly locals, called El Siboney. Locals swear by it, and we know why. However, our favorite was in Malory square area, El Mason de Pepe. I judge Cuban by my plantains, the BEST! Everything we had here, including the Margaritias, were delicious! We heard from a Chicagoian local not to expect much food wise, in comparison, we were greatly suprised, especially being foodies! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Reach”
Reviews.Author: IowaGirl2604
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort four nights, the third week of February, and were very pleased overall. We were aware the room renovations were not yet complete, and the restaruant was not open, so we were not unpleasantly surprised upon arrival. In fact, we were perhaps plesantly surprised. The hotel was beautiful, inclduing the lobby, courtyard, pool and beach. The restaurant should be open soon, and it will be lovely. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We were upgraded in advance to a Boutique Suite, and the room was beautiful, with a nice sized patio overlooking the courtyard, pool and ocean. We were never bothered by contstruction noise, with the exception of one afternoon while we were lying by the pool, and they were working on some nearby rooms. But 'Ricardo' was playing some fun tunes by the pool, so the construction noise was hardly noticable. We rather liked the fact that the hotel was not yet to full capacity, as we did not have to deal with a crowded pool area or beach. All guests of the Reach Resort have access to their sister property the Casa Marina, with a stunning pool area, and very nice, long beach with hammocks strung between palm trees. The Casa Marina and Reach Resort are within walking distance of each other. The Casa has a shop where you can rent scooters, which we did one day and had a blast "scooting" around Key West. We also took advantage of Billy's Barefoot WaterSports rental, which is located right on the Reach Resort's private beach. Our only real disappointment was that neither hotel had a hot tub, and we were surprised that none of the suites had whirl pool tubs. The fact that the restaurant was not open was not an inconvenience, as there are so many wonderful restaurants in Key West, many within walking distance. The night we check in to the Reach, Robyn at the front desk suggested we try Camille's just down the street, and it was fabulous! The resort staff also served box lunches by the pool, and had a bar set up so we could enjoy drinks while we lounged by the pool, which we happily took advantage of. The Reach Resort will be a gem when renovations are complete, which I would guess to be soon. We would definitely stay at the Reach Resort again, and would reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: rbakerNC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort four nights and had a very good experience. The restaurant/bar is still not completed but there is no end to places to eat and drink in Key West!!! The location is great, the room was very nice (we were upgraded to ocean view at check-in), staff was very nice and helpful. On the negative there is still a little remodeling going on, not in our area thank goodness, the phones still are missing the overlay for hotel numbers and we had to get security to get the in-room safe working. We would go back to The Reach Resort and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away...still under construction and not work the money!!!”
Reviews.Author: scummings3
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find the hotel still under construction; not notified prior to arrival. First room had jack hammering right below as they are still working on the garage; second room had two men working right off the balcony in the morning....third day, no water at 9am for a shower! To top it all off, the restaurant isn't open, the fitness center isn't open, you run into construction people everywhere and they still want to charge you resort rates and resort fees! Forget the continental breakfast they will offer you and the boxed lunches....not worth the aggravation and not what is expected when you book a high end resort. After 3 days, moved to sister resort Casa Marina, which is where they should have put us to begin with! This resort will be lucky to be finished by the end of 2008 so stay away!!! Once complete, it looks like it will be a beautiful resort, until then, they are only looking to take your dollars to fund their construction....terrible approach to customers. LXR executive team take notice, you are giving a bad experience to clientele who are used to service and resort atmosphere like your Boca Raton Resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “If this is Luxury god help us”
Reviews.Author: fearless54
Reviews.Content: I read the details over 2 months ago on the website and noted $37M spent and completition, attentive guest services,hearty breakfast by the pool. Nothing could be further nfrom the truth Well we arrive to find a part finished building site. We were told there is no bar and no rseturant, We were not prewarned and there seemed to be little consideration of the impact on our precious vacation time. when we got to our room past the part finished walkway on the fithfloor and negotiated ladders, plywood barriers and bags of sand we were greeted with a very acceptable room. however that did not last long. we tried to call for some non feather pillows, after all this was a luxury resort, even Best Western has these. Surprise Surprise the phone doesnt work and there is no key template with service numbers attached to the grubby phone we walkto reception and make our request, after 3 hours we check again to be told they have run out. No one called us we had to chase to add to the issue the safe couldnt be opened either If this is a luxury standard resort god help us dont trust them they havent change and have spent $37M on an incomplete waste of time and misrepresented their efforts as wel

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Dirty, Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: ledial
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there was a sign in the driveway stating "Construction Zone Hard Hat Required." We tried to relax surrounded by the constant noise of jack hammers, workman walking on the roof, and hammering.The conditions were dangerous. I had dodge debris falling from the roof and workmen hauling plywood up the stairs. The facilities were not clean. The elevator smelled like urine and there were dishes from room service that sat for over 2 days straight. The staff was also extremely rude. The maids walked into our room twice despite the "Privacy Please" sign. I was there for a conference and two staff members walked into the conference room and proceeded to have a loud, prolonged conversation in the back of the room interrupting the lecturer. Finally, when we were leaving the bell hop demanded a tip from my fiance for putting the bags in the car. My fiance told the bell hop that this was the first time we had seen him all weekend and that there was a six dollar gratuity for the bell hop on the bill and that six dollars was plenty for one trip. The bell hop then starting screaming at my fiance and tried to block him from getting in the car. In short I have been happier at Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here”
Reviews.Author: anafer
Reviews.Content: The pctures are very decieving this hotel is not open it is closed and under construction. It is not even open to the public do not book here it is a big scam. If you booked this hotel ask for you money back as soon as possible. The staff at the sister resort CASA MARINA will tell you that you have been moved to thier hotel which is also a total dump. DO NOT GO HERE it is old slimy and smells like ----. You ca fish off thier pier at night and all you see are huge shark which are sure to eat you during the day wheh you try to go swimming here. DO NOT GO HERE stay out of key west it is all old and very expensive. Go to Orlando and have a better time. Or try going to California and stay in Shell Beach or Pismo Beach for mush less.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing, filthy and expensive”
Reviews.Author: qayw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for a week in August for our honeymoon and it was a very disappointing experience. We went to Key West after staying in South Beach Miami at the Loews for a week, so we were used to a nice place, and we were shocked when we saw the Reach Resort. It was old and dirty and too expensive (over 300$ a night). When I saw the parking garage, I already knew it would be bad. The room was quite big, that was the only good part, but there was a mildew smell in the bathroom, the couch was dirty (it had brown spots), there was a long black hair hanging on the wardrobe door for the entire week we stayed there. The safe was full of dust, you almost don't want to put anything in it. The air conditioning was loud. We stayed at the pool most of the time, but there was always noise because of the constructions right next to the pool. When people ordered food to their room, the plates would not be removed from the room, so there were always dirty plates and cups on the floor outside the room. It was smelly because they were out in the heat for a couple of days before someone took them away. The gym was very disappointing. I had never seen such old and rusty free weights before. We wanted to get a massage done, but when we saw the Spa area, we decided not to waste any more money at that Resort. We went to the Casa Marina to see what that place looked like and it seemed a lot nicer. We were finally very happy when we had to evacuate because of hurricane Ernesto so we could leave the hotel 2 days earlier than what we had planned.

Reviews.Title: “Stay home, before staying at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: RCBrabec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort in Key West on August 11th, 2006 in the Luxury Oceanview Suite ($475 a night). I would not call this luxurious at all. The shower was full of mold and smelled of sewer, the wallpaper was falling off the wall and had mold all over the wallpaper. We had NO HOT WATER to shower. This resort was very run down, and only had 1 working elevator, which took forever. The resort was not will to resolving any of our issues and the management was very rude. I would stay home before I would stay at this hotel in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Semele
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort 2 weeks ago and can honestly tell you: do not stay here. Bathroom: dirty, full of rust and MOLD Bed: tiny Pool: tiny Balcony and windows: dirty Not to mention the rudeness of the beachboy: we asked if we could have an umbrella. His answer: "probably". (?!) After waiting for a while we took it ourselves. There was no stick to keep it open so we asked for one. His anwer: "just look for one on the beach". There are lovely B&B in Key West. Whatever you do: avoid this hotel. Reach Resort: SHAME ON YOU

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience I've had”
Reviews.Author: travelingheel
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have never had such an experience with a hotel. From the very beginning, it was an unpleasant experience. I was told when I made my reservation no deposit was required and was even urged to reserve two rooms and decide later which room I preferred. Two days later when I checked my account, I saw two withdrawals, a deposit for each room. I called accounting for one week straight in order to have the Reach Resort credit my account the deposit for the room we no longer wanted. I only heard from someone after the matter had been taken care of. Hindsight tells me I should have cancelled my reservation completely and chosen to stay somewhere else. On the website, our room was described as "luxurious comfort and incredible views of Old Town and Key West". In reality, we had a room with a dirty balcony that overlooked a junkpile in someone's back yard, a bathroom with peeling wallpaper, a lamp with a missing switch, a mini-bar that we never received a key for, a non-existent sofa bed as promised in the description, a parking deck filled with dust and debris from the nearby construction, and a hotel with a staff that showed us no concern and was somewhat rude. And the grand finale was when I checked my bank account today and saw two charges on my account totaling $243 over the amount I signed the receipt for when I checked out. I have spent the day attempting to get someone on the phone to handle this matter and not surprising, I have not heard back from anyone. The nicest people working at this so called resort were the people working the pool and pool bar and one of the valet guys that offered to call us a cab. I don't feel that the hotel's rates are in-line with the type of service provided and am telling everyone I know to avoid the Reach Resort if they do not enjoy having their bank account in jeopardy!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $2,000 a week”
Reviews.Author: BrianandMelissa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Reach Resort for our honeymoon and paid extra for a suite with an ocean view, while in fact the only ocean view we had was of hineys over at the Atlantic Shores. We were on the side of the hotel so while we could see the ocean from our room, it was not worth the money that we paid to upgrade by far. The week in Reach cost us 2200.00 not to mention the 300. that they had previously and unknowingly taken out of our account three months in advance when our travel agent decided to book the room for us and let them have our credit card number. Thanks for the heads up Reach Resort - nothing like trying to pay for a wedding and having $300 taken out of your account ahead of time. Anyway - The room. What a dump - I was totally grossed out when we checked into our hotel and there was a hair in the tub that stayed there all week. Next - The King size bed that we were supposed to have barely fit the two of us and not to mention was the hardest thing that I have ever slept on. I preferred the sofa some nights - how great is that for my honeymoon. Besides the fact that this hotel was absolutely not worth the money, it was a dump. Shulas was great, but extremely expensive. I would never recommend this hotel to another person as it is a dump and should be entirely knocked down!

Reviews.Title: “Worse than a Days Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: trums
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Construction noises from 7AM to 8PM 7 days a week. Rooms should cost $70-$80 but were low $200's. Pool is small and overcrowded and the water was about 85 degrees. The internet ad is very misleading. Never again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Option, but Be careful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit pricey. We went on priceline and paid $170/night. However, there was $80 worth of additional costs -- Service Fee, Tax on the Service Fee, Parking Fee, and tax on the parking fee. When we arrived, we were scheduled at a non-ocean view, with a Queen Size bed and by the construction. We asked for a King Size bed at least. There were no King Size, unless you upgraded to a suite, which my priceline deal did not include. This is NOT stated on priceline. However, the reception desk upgraded us to an ocean view suite. The receptionists are not very friendly. The hotel is quite old, but does have that Key West charm. We stayed at the Hyatt two years ago and liked it for location. Reach is definitely at the other end of Duval Street. However, it was still nice to walk to Duval, especially after many hours of drinking and eating. The Reach Resort's beach area is better than the Hyatt. It is much larger, and very private. There is a nude beach next door, so may not be suitable for children.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time”
Reviews.Author: PaGolferPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were with a group. The hotel took care of all our needs and provided good food and drinks for our parties. Our room was fine with the possible exception of the air conditioner not making the room as cold as we would have liked. However, it was definelty not too noisy. The construction was not a problem for us nor for any member of our group. The steaks at Shula's were outstanding cuts of meat although expensive. But, given the location I was not surprised at the prices. We ate breakfast at the Dennis Pharamacy two blocks away which proved good food at a cheap price and provided some local history. The pool was small but seemed large enough since the beach was also popular with sun bathers. The food at the beach bar was good. I probably will not travel to Key West again unless I fly into the Key West Airport, we landed at Miami and traveled by van to Key West (too long a ride - 4 hours). However, if I did go to Key West again, I would stay at the Reach. The unkown is that that the property is on the market so who knows what the future will bring.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here, Casa Marina a much better choise”
Reviews.Author: traveler_with_kidz
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, do not book The Reach. After reading all the reviews I thought that my experience would be different (yeah right). We arrived late Friday night for my husband's SURPRISE Birthday trip. After calling 2 TIMES earlier that day to make sure they will have a room for us for late check in we come to find out that they overbooked the hotel and do not have any more rooms in the whole entire hotel (and they had the audacity to say that they do this very often!). The staff wasn't event nice and apologetic about the whole situation. After aggressively fighting with them we were transferred to their other hotel the Casa Marina with an upgraded room and 1/2 off on the first night's stay (once aging this was after some very loud screaming and yelling), what a nice start to my surprise for my husband. We had to take our bags, put them back into the car and drive to their other property. When we arrived it was like a whole different world. The property is absolutely beautiful and large. They have a proper lobby as opposed to the parking lot at The Reach. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, the grounds are very clean and groomed, the room was OK, clean but a bit old. At the end I was happy that they screwed up our reservation because I hated The Reach but loved Casa Marina!!!

Reviews.Title: “A complete ripoff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The website is VERY misleading. The rooms are incredibly overpriced: they are old and stale, in need of a major upgrade. Bathrooms are pitiful. I understand they are renovating, but please, just lower the prices. Everythng for that matter is overpriced....Pool is small, and terribly overcrowded and not desirable AT ALL. Food is poor to say the least - I had a bit of food poisioning on first day. Car was taken at valet - although valet charges were never explained versus self parking. The staff just doesn't seem to care. The beach is nice, and that seems to be the selling point - and weddings. All in all, stay away until renovatations are complete and the travel editors have visited.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely appalling”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot be classified by any standards as luxury.............arrival via the parking lot, balconies with parking lot view, pool the size of a postage stamp, small and dirty beach and excessively overpriced are but a few of the characteristics. Don't bother going , since there are a few classy hotels with infinitely better everything except a beach.........which is preferably to the other one.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: skippy120753
Reviews.Content: This resort( if thats what you call it! ) is way over priced! There was construction going on every day from 9:00AM until 5:00PM .Dust from the construction was all over our everything when we returned to our rooms every day. They should have let us know when we booked about this!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a run down hotel w/ great beach access then this hotel is for you. I'm sure this Hotel was nice 10 years ago, but it looks like they haven't put a dime into this place in years. Not worth the money. I checked in & out same day. Try the Hyatt ! Read the other reviews on this page - they are 100% accurate.

Reviews.Title: “You might want to know”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Key West and I wanted to share some thoughts about the Reach Resort. I have a mixed opinion about the resort, but thought those going would benefit from our experience. I guess I should go over the good points first. The pool and beach attendants were very nice and were very quick to bring towels and umbrellas to us immediately. The staff at the outdoor grill were always pleasant too. The food at the resort restaurants was very good, but very overpriced. Do not do the breakfast buffet at Shula's...it was $40.00 for the two of us. Given the amount of food we ate, it shouldn't have been more than $15.00. The rooms were clean and cheerful. We were both pleased with the size of the room (we stayed in the boutique style room). The air conditioner is very loud, when you have it on high, but that didn't bother us too much. The location of the resort was probably the thing we liked most. It was nice to have a beach and a beautiful pool to enjoy and it's nice to get away from the loud, craziness of Duval St. Okay, I told you all of that to tell you this...they failed to mention they were doing construction at the resort on the website, or when we called to make reservations. We found out bright and early Monday morning at 9AM!!! when the jackhammer and saws started up. They didn't even tell us when we checked in on Sunday that this was going on...are you kidding me? We were originally going to stay at the Hyatt but didn't because they made us aware on their website that they were under construction. We had planned on relaxing and sleeping in on our vacation...think again!! And don't even consider an afternoon nap, because these guys go from 9-5!! We did talk to some people who were staying on the other side of the hotel and they couldn't hear a thing...make sure if you do book, tell them you don't want to be anywhere near the parking garage, that's what they're working on. A few tips...there are lots of reasonable places to eat that are close to the hotel, for breakfast...Dennis Pharmacy (I think that's what it's called, straight down Simonton St.) they have a great breakfast at hometown prices, Duval Beach Club (a block or two down from the hotel) has great sandwiches and frozen drinks, for snacks during the day I suggest picking up chips and things from any drug store or convenience store, it'll save you time and money. I did read a few reviews before we left, but I don't remember anyone mentioning the construction. I just wanted everyone to be aware of it. All in all, just remember to enjoy the views and laid back atmosphere of Key West. We had a great vacation overall and would probably go back to the Reach, but we will ask more questions before we book next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: my journeys
Reviews.Content: I expected a little more for what I paid. I live in Florida & don't mind paying the price for an upper scale hotel which is what I had imagined considering the website for Luxury Resorts, the owner of this establishment. It was way overpriced. They are still undergoing some construction, rebuilding and updating and they really shouldn't charge high dollar until they are completed. We parked our own car in a very cramped garage because the garage was under repair. The safe in the room didn't work. The room needed updating. The bathroom needed updating. Tile was cracked, cracks in the walls, fixtures were old and in need of repair. The shower head & water temperature, plumbing needed to be addressed as well. Oh last but not least, the a/c units were LOUD!!! Unbearable. You'd think they would have a central a/c system already. Spa prices were unreasonable. We didn't take the bait for that one. The site gives the impression a buffet breakfast is included. BEWARE, it's not, it's $15 per person. Not going to stay with that resort company again. They shouldn't charge full price for incomplete hotels/rooms.

Reviews.Title: “What do you expect?”
Reviews.Author: John45
Reviews.Content: The resort is not exactly what I would call "up to date"... The service was below expectations. We did have some servers at the beach that were good but we also had some servers that were down right awful! I ordered a drink and only got it after the third time I asked for it and at least 45 minutes later... I watched the server I had chat and hang around with some friends of his that had come from the side of the property and decide it was time to hang out... At this poin I figured that there were some serius management changes that needed to occur. If I was the owner of this sort of hotel I would expect my emloyees to be at least focused on their jobs... please remember that a job at this type of resort for the average 20 something on Key West is a great job... The money is good and the job conditions are not exactly tortuous... but yet I had to try and pry my server away from some cronies to get a beer?... come on As far as the rest of the resort - the hot tub was sort of cloudy - the ongoing construction was a bit of an annoyance although my wife and I got up pretty early every morning anyhow - the rooms were not too shabby but as some other reviews stated... no coffee makers in the rooms? you could either have coffee brought to your room at no charge but at a 30 minute wait or you could go downstairs down by the front desk and get some coffee yourself... what on earth is that about? The housekeeping staff was pretty darn good. I would say that they were sort of quick to intrude if you had forgotten to put up the "privacy please" card though. The resort is certainly over-priced but aren't most of them? We had a very good time there overall. That fact had to do with two things... 1... my wife and I have traveled once or twice before and know that any trip is what you make of it... and 2... ther are some people there that care about the guests' experience... as a traveler you need to be able to identify these people and get to know them

Reviews.Title: “Liked it!”
Reviews.Author: bestmomever
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Reach Resort for two nights, from 2/9-2/11. We were nervous about what it would be like after reading several of the reviews of the hotel. We were very pleasantly surprised!!! Our room was extremely spacious, perhaps because of its location at the end of the hotel. (We were on the 3rd floor.) There was construction on the property next to our hotel room, but we could not hear it. The room was clean, nicely decorated, and we did receive turn down service. The staff was all very polite and helpful. The pool and ocean were beautiful. We had brunch one morning at the hotel. What a nice ocean view spot to start off the day. We did have a problem with the air conditioner, but we called the front desk and the problem was promptly addressed. The location of the hotel was also good. It was one block from the quieter end of Duval Street, but Mallory Square was only a short walk away. The southermost marker was 2 blocks away. We would defineitely stay at the Reach Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other posts say”
Reviews.Author: BryanG03
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 1/29/06 to 2/2/06. Was upgraded to oceanview room despite first being told it would cost $50 per day more. Easy walk to Duval St. although at opposite end from Mallory Square. We chose to rent bikes ($12 per day at hotel), which is highly recommended. Hard to find parking spots in Key West so best to leave the car in the parking lot. Hotel has a good oceanside location with one of the few beaches in Key West. Pool is nice and attendants are very nice as well. Room is typical of a Wyndham, although it is not a Wyndham anymore. Room was clean and everything worked. Couldn't hear any noise from next door construction although there was dust in the parking garage and maid service was fine...Hotel wasn't in 5 star condition but it isn't a five star hotel and was in good condition. Booked thru Priceline for $150 per night...which was a good value. Overall we were satisfied and would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Never again! ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a General Manager of a downtown Boston Hotel, maybe I can be critical, but in all our years of traveling this is the first time I have never complained here or to the hotel, as I know things can happen. We stayed in Aruba at the Wyndham Resort, and were sold on the Wyndham name. I highly reccommend it. So making our decision when we had to go to Key West for a Wedding was easy....so we thought. It is no longer a Wyndham, so if your looking to get the Wyndham by Request perks, forget it. Parking garage is flooded just about every day. Our room was out dated and tired, but clean. The over all appearance of the hotel is worn out. The elevator did not work 3 of our 5 days, no explanation, no apology. The construction next door will be your wake up call each morning. I read one review that was just posted in regards to vacation, well we were on vacation too, and we do not need a jack hammer to tell us when it's time to get up. They would not move our room either. $14.00 a day resort fee? For what? Tried to call the desk several times and received no answer, called the concierge to get a taxi to go to the wedding and we went into their voice mail. Oh, we did get turn down service, once! Working in this business for the last 20+ years I know what guests expect and this is not it, not even the basics. I can see why Wyndham sold it.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled my suite two days before we left for trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Talk about complete disreguard for customer service, they were happy to take my $400.00 deposit, then they called two days before we left and said sorry we dont have any rooms. Unbelievable, didnt offer any kind of comp, nothing, nothing.......... still fighting to get my deposit back. Thinking of suing...... Sam

Reviews.Title: “Wish we Had Know it Had Been Sold !!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Being a General Manager of a downtown Boston Hotel, it takes a lot for me to write a negative review....BUT..... My wife and I were attending a wedding in Key West, since we had a great time at the Wyndham in Aruba, we decided to stay here. BIG MISTAKE ! When we arrived we found out it was no longer a Wyndham, it was when we booked it a few weeks prior?? We are (or were) Wyndham by Request members, so any of the benefits of that were not available. sorry, thats a lie, we did receive turn down service one of the nights we were there, not that it matters to us, but they could be consistent. Everything is still marked with the Wyndham logo, so it is very confusing. Parking is cramped, and the garage is always full of water. the room was not what we were hoping, but it was clean. Our view of the pool?? We were looking at the satellite dish from our balcony right above the garage. I hope you are not there to rest on your vacation, the jack hammering from the construction site next door will sufficiently do for your wake up call, everyday! I called the desk to see if we could move our room, but no one answered the phone. I hope you do not need a taxi. We called for one to go to the wedding, but the operator connected us to the concierge desk, and then we went into the concierge voice mail. That's ok we got our own taxi. I am unsure what the daily resort fee was for. As we did not get anything additional for this fee than we would have received from any other hotel. With all of the great choices in Key West, it really does not matter if this is a Wyndham or not, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MJW2
Reviews.Content: After staying at a top quality Wyndham hotel in Palm Springs last year, we were hugely disappointed with the Reach Resort. The hotel is totally overpriced for the standard of the accommodation. The car parking is terrible and the air con in the rooms sounds like it is diesel powered. There is a lot of building going on next door which acts as a good wake up call! The rooms were dirty and need updating dramatically. The only positive points I can make are the pool area and the beach - these are both very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “worst value ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. The room was tiny. The absolute worst bed I have ever slept on. I asked for another room with a better bed and less construction noise, nope, same crappy type bed in that one!! The food was OK but overpriced. Staff was rude. We tipped the bell staff and then found out at check-out that they include that in your "resort fee". I would NEVER stay here again unless in was free!

Reviews.Title: “such a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will never again trust a hotel based on its website. Everything about the Wyndham Reach Resort was bad. I mean, if you ve traveled a little in your life, you can tell right away that this hotel is a rip off. I m not holding any grudges against the hotel personnel (polite but not overtly nice either) but against the chain itself. Here is my list of complaints : -The so-called beach that you re longing for ? Forget it at the Wyndham Reach Resort. There is so much seaweed by the water you can t go for a swim....and the smell...granted, it s not the hotel s fault, but you don t charge $180 a night for a beach that is nonexistent. When we got there at 3pm in the afternoon, there was not a single person on the beach. They were all by the pool nearby. -Be aware that they re having massive construction work going on this summer. There are about 20 workers next door and while we were there, we HAD to wake up at 9 am, as the noise was so loud (huge drilling downstairs in the garage as well) -We had to insist to change rooms later that day. It only worked because we stopped by the reception several times -Upon arrival, we were not offered the option of self parking. The valet took care of our car right away. Now, coming from Miami Beach where there s no other option, we did not question that, until we realized there was indeed a self parking section. We asked for our car keys right away. -The first room we were staying in was full of small ants (on the telephone, in the kitchenette sink, on the floor...) -Inside of rooms is tacky, unless you like tropical colors, Jimmy Buffet style -When we checked out, we had a surcharge of 14 dollars a day for resort fees....now, when I asked, they said that s because 30mns of free local calls are included (we did not know anyone in Key West, too bad...) and complimentary transportation to and from Key West airport (we drove from Miami...). I was so disgusted at that point, I did not ask for the fee to be waived but I think you can do something if you really want to Honestly, I never write reviews online but I told my boyfriend during the trip I owed it to other tourists like us to do it and I wanted to keep my word. Also, I really think they discriminate against reservations made through Expedia, Travelocity, etc...as opposed to those made through their own website. You just need to know it when your room is assigned. In short (well, long now...), go somewhere else in Key west. We liked the little Inns and Beds and Breakfast nearby (I would recommend The Gardens from what I saw) and stay away from the (small) beaches. The smell is too strong. It s not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Deteriorating in Quality”
Reviews.Author: worldsuzandy
Reviews.Content: First off, this was the third trip I have made to Key West and my fiancee and I love it there. The Reach Resort was the only negative part of the week we spent there from the 12th to the 18th of August. I chose the Reach because it looked reasonably good, and I got a good discount through an internet package deal with airfare and a car. Had it not been for this, I wouldn't have stayed there. The place has a beach, but Key West itself doesn't have natural beaches and the one they have generally stinks of sulphur and is coated with seaweed. They try to clean it, but it is not a pleasant place to swim. The Pool is okay, although the hot tub jets were broke. Some of the staff is friendly and some is definitely less than friendly. As for the room, the loud air conditioner kept my fiancee from getting a good night's sleep, we had ants in the sink despite never bringing food into the room, and the biggest one of all is that our housekeeper threw out souvenier drink cups from bars that we had washed out and were going to reuse at home, and moved things around so we couldn't find them, including some of my fiancee's jewelry, which had her absolutely furious. At the end of the stay, I saw on my bill that I had been charged for a drink off the mini-bar, that I had never opened with the key provided, but did leave it in the room. It was charged for the same day as the other problems we had with the housekeeper. They took off the drink charge immediately, but were not remotely friendly about it. The elevators both smell precisely like a garage or auto body shop, and there was a massive amount of construction in the parking garage starting midway through our time there. I only used the rental car to drive up the keys a couple of days and to and from the airport, but came into the garage after 48 hours of not using it to find that my rental was behind caution tape and in the construction zone. They didn't bother to ask if I had a rental when I checked in, and I was so happy to be in Key West I didn't bother to tell them. This means that approximately anyone can just park in the garage for a week, because they won't check. This place has a resort fee of 14 dollars a day, which is ridiculous. It has nothing that a Holiday Inn couldn't provide. Many of the quaint B&Bs or small hotels in town would provide more comfort. Key West is fantastic, but this place is slowly corroding in the salt air and was responsible for nearly all the stress I experienced on my vacation. You trip will be better in my opinion if you avoid the Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research we picked the Wyndham Reach Resort to stay on our honeymoon. The place is great; we barely left the hotel grounds during the daytime at all. Everyday we got up and went downstairs for breakfast. (Ps. get whatever package includes this; itâ€™s really worth it) We sat just above the beach with a breathtaking view of palm trees and water. Then we would get a good place to sit in the Sun with the help of Mike, the person that runs the pool. Go upstairs, change and then back downstairs for some Sun. We would eat lunch just about everyday pool/beachside. The food at the Sand Bar is great and there are lots of frozen drinks to choose from. After some more sun, we would go upstairs and plan our dinner reservations. While we were there we went parasailing, snorkeling, kayaking, dolphin watching, and took a jet ski tour of Key West. We did all of this from the hotel! The Wyndham Reach Resort is a great place to stay if you want some piece and quiet but still want to be near the action of Duval St. My wife and I are in good shape so we walked just about everywhere. The only problem we had at all was with the billing.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for the accomodations and service”
Reviews.Author: JacksonPA
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip and my family accompanied me for some vacation time, from 23 July to 30 July 2005. Desk Staff was courteous and helpful. Service staff needs a manager to lite a fire in their back pocket, to get them motivated. First day no AC, no phone service, and no internet (for business). I was referred to the Casa Marina to use their business center. 3rd day still no AC phone or internet. Requested a room change and was accomodated with a smaller room. Phone service was still hosed up. dialing zero go the Casa Marina. Dialed room service got the Flagler (Casa Marina). High point...close to Duval Street and fun. Would not recommend this place to anyone. Too expensive for the facilities and service offered. Beach smelled like rotten cabbage with sulfur mix. The stench was nauseating. I will ask my company travel agency to remove from the list of preferred/pre-negotiated providers. Key West was great. Stay at a place that holds a high standard in caring for their clientel.

Reviews.Title: “A rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Aberfitchfish
Reviews.Content: The staff was rude and we did not realize it would take us that long to bring our luggage up to our rooms, or we would of paid to ahve ti done for us. We thought it would be quick, but nobody warned us that we would have to drag oru luggage that far. The view was horrible and so was the beach. The only thing i liked about this hotel as the pool and the actual room which was rather comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ignores Customer Service Problems”
Reviews.Author: DickMorris
Reviews.Content: I wanted desparately to write a positive review about this resort. The location is great; the staff was wonderful to me; and everything was idyllic until the approach of hurricane Dennis. I was booked from July 1 until July 12. On Thursday, July 7, I was scheduled for a sailing trip and at the other end of the island. I heard by word of mouth that tourists were being asked to leave. I rushed back and asked the desk what to do. They told me it was my problem and not theirs. I began calling airlines and busses and every other form of transportation. All said no way out and no possiblity of getting out. The hotel said I could stay the night while I found transportaiton. A letter came to me at 9:00 pm saying that I had until Friday noon to close my account, though I had 4 more nights paid in advance. But at 9:00 am the next morning my phone service and electricity was cut off, leaving me no way to get in touch with my tentative transporation (a limousine service had told me they would come and pick me up when they had enough passengers to make it worth their while). At 9:30 Friday morning, staff started to pound on my door demanding me to leave, even though weather conditions were not yet a problem. At 10:00 I checked out in the lobby; I was told that they could do nothing about the 4 nights left, prepaid. I was told that I should have not paid until checkout and then it would not be a problem; they just wouldn't charge me for the nights I lost. I told them I was waiting to hear from my transportation arrrangements. But at 10:30 I was escourted out to the street and told I could not wait under shelter or anywhere near the hotel property. Two of us with suitcases were homeless, with no access to bathrooms or phones. By that time I had tentative transportation at 1:30 in the afternoon, 3 hours later. I understand the hotel was concerned about legal liability, but indeed I was put in much more danger by being put onto the street before there was any immediate threat due to the weather. I had bought sandwiches and other items from a shop on the corner of South and Simonton, one block from the hotel, and the women who ran it told me I could stay there as long as they were open. But no bathrooms and no phones. I managed to find a pay phone to tell the limousine service that they could not pick me up at the Wyndham; I had been evicted. The main reason for this note is that the hotel refused to offer any assistance whatsoever. Management is not concerned other than they don't want anyone on the property. I was not treated in any way as a guest who was welcome. But, even more, why do I have to pay for 4 nights I did not receive when others who closed their bills on checkout were not charged for their bookings? Customer service of this hotel does not answer enquires of this nature. Even if you take this as an invalid review, I do suggest not going to Key West during hurricane season. It was 1 in a million that this would happen. And I thought I was safe. But there are no shelters in Key West and no public help in hurricanes. I was even told that I was violating the law and could be prosecuted for not getting out. How? I did not drive there; I flew there. And no forms of transportation were available. And when I called public service lines, I never got a responce. Plus, Wyndham cut my phone off before I could finish my arrangements for departure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great service”
Reviews.Author: andrewindiana
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Wyndham Reach Resort from July 2 - July 7 and was impressed. We had a very nice, spacious and clean room with an incredible view. We had an ocean view junior suite and couldn't have been happier. Service was exceptional and the food at the restaurant (Landry's) was great! If you're looking for a 5-star hotel, this is not the place. But, it was definately worth the money that we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Some problems, staff rude ”
Reviews.Author: lill2441
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a five day stay in Key West at the Reach Resort. First, when we arrived at 12 noon, our room air conditioning did not work. When we complained about it to the desk, they told us it was our fault for not closing the blinds. Finally, at 9:00 PM (after we complained three times to the front desk about it) and our room was still hot, they switched our room but with some hesitancy. The beach smelled like sewage, but we did just arrive right after Hurricane Dennis and the locals were saying that the beaches smell due to the seaweed and stuff that washed up along the shore. Our toilet in our room constantly ran and we had no hot water. I didnt even bother to complain about this as they would have said it was our fault about that too. Even the guy at the pool to get towels was rude. When I asked him for two towels, he rudely stated that I can only have one towel per person and that most seats were reserved early on in the day by the pool so if I cant find a seat, I should try to get at the pool earlier. I would not stay at the reach again. NO WAY!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Reach!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While booking our trip to Key West, I read the reviews of the Wyndham Reach. Some of them were not favorable, but what we found was completely the opposite! We had a wonderful week!! I signed us up for the WyndhambyRequest program before going down ( a free membership, which promised upgrades etc). Definately sign up! When we arrived we were very pleasantly welcomed at the desk. With our membership our room had been upgraded from a standard, non-ocean view to a little suite with an ocean view for free. The room was beautiful and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and attentive. The pool was nice and the beach was right there (not very common in Key West). So, we were very happy that we were not scared off by the other reviews. Though I can't account for those people's stay, ours was excellent through and through!! If we go to Key West again, I would DEFINATELY stay at the Wyndham Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst...not the best”
Reviews.Author: TeamBossy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the reach over fouth of july weekend. I was very concerned about the hotel after reading the mixed reviews on this site. Like I said, this hotel was not the worst I have ever stayed at, but not the best either. I went with my two girlfriends (we are all 24). I had booked a room with 2 double beds but when I checked in they put me in a room with one queen bed and a pull out sofa bed. They said they did not have anything else available and I could change rooms the next day. We opted to just deal with the queen/sofa. The room was small, but clean. Two of the lights in the room did not work. The staff was fairly attentive when we would request things like extra towels/blankets. The beach was fine, as was the pool. We ate the breakfast buffett twice and that was pretty good. We also ate lunch at the Sand Bar Cafe--food was average but service was really slow. We took the hotel shuttle to and from the airport. We had no problems on the way to the hotel, but on the way out to the hotel, the shuttle was late and our driver was a bit crazy/rude. My bag was the last one he had to get out of the van and no one else on the shuttle had tipped him. When I went to grab my bag, he wouldn' t let it go and said "Aren't you going to give me anything?" At this point, I was extremely hungover and about to miss my flight and this man was holding my bag hostage! I told him I would give him money if he would just give me my bag! I pulled out a dollar and attempted to give it to him and then he didn't want my money. So i just threw the dollar at him. That was really my only complaint about the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton instead!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 night stay and found the resort to be nice but completely not worth the price. The hotel does have the best beach in all of Key West so if staying at a hotel on the beach is your main objective then this hotel may be worth the price. The beach is small but Key West really doesn't have many beaches to offer. Warning: the beach has a bunch of washed up dirt/seaweed on the shore that they rake every night but you still must wade through it to get out to the pretty water. The beach/pool service was excellent though as they have guys who set up your chairs, give you towells, and take your drink/food orders. Our room was kept clean but the maid didn't come to clean until 5 pm. We did encounter a few problems with checking in though. The two parties in front of us had problems with their reservation, which the front desk employees did not know how to handle. We had booked an oceanview suite with a king bed; however, we were given a room with a queen bed and a nice view of the side of a building and some trees. If you turned your neck and leaned over the balcony you could kind of see the ocean. Also, there was construction going on next door so we had to tolerate that noise all week (needless to say we did not have to ever set an alarm.) I called the front desk and asked to be moved to another room but was told that the hotel was booked for that night but we would be the first ones to move the next day when someone checked out. We never heard from them again and our room never got changed. Also, they claimed that the bed size was only a request not a reservation. The Wyndham website is misleading as it allows you to specifically book a suite based on bed size. As we waited for the airport shuttle on our last day, at least 15 people checked in and then complained about their "oceanview" and bed size. Bottom Line: Do NOT upgrade to the Oceanview...it is soo not worth it! There are only a handful of rooms that could have a good view of the ocean. Also, be warned that the hotel is at the opposite end of the island from the sunset celebration and the bar scene of duval street (the other end of duval is one block from the hotel) It is about 1.25 miles to mallory square. (cab fare $10-$15) The Hilton is a far better resort as it is down where all the action is at and offers the same services as the Reach for the same price. Next time I visit Key West, I will be staying at the Hilton instead.

Reviews.Title: “NOT woth the money”
Reviews.Author: syrurs1
Reviews.Content: Even if all that you want is a bed to sleep in at the end of the day--don't stay here because it is not worth the money. As mentioned by other reviewers, someone's hair was in the bathroom that was there before we stepped into the place. There were some ants in the room, and we had trouble with opening the sliding glass door. At night we could hear the bar beneath our patio, so we made little use of the patio. The room was "tropically" decorted with bright colors and tile floors (no carpet at all). The "beach" was rather troublesome-- the sand looked like dirt instead of sand. What was suppose to be, I think, a pier was a glorified gazebo. The pool was quite sad land small, especially because it was surrounded by a bunch of p.o.'d looking pale tourists with "Margaritaville" playing in the background (myself included). If you want to go to Duval Street or the northern side of KW, be prepared to walk... Reach Resort is only close to the "southernmost" attractions (Southernmost point, Dennis Pharmacy, Hemingway House, and Lighthouse). From all that walking, we left feeling more tired than when we arrived, and felt that Reach Resort was definately NOT worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “You must make your vacation what you want it to be...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a 4 star hotel, then you need to keep looking because this is not the place, however we did have a blast in Key West and would go back in a heartbeat, though unless the Wyndham lowered their prices considerably, we would be finding a new place to stay. I loved that this hotel was on the ocean, it did have the biggest beach of all other hotels we saw and a beautiful view, though aside from being outdoors the hotel did not have much to offer. I was dissapointed right from the start, we booked a reg room w/ smoking, 2 double beds and of course an ocean view. Instead we received a non-smoking, single bed and a view of the rooms across the way from us. When we asked to upgrade they said it would cost us $50 a night and wouldn't be able to do it until 4th night of our 5 night stay! The rooms were small, dirty, cracks in the ceiling, very loud balcony doors, not to mention the air conditioning unit on the balcony which puts of extremely hot air making it uncomfortable to sit on the balcony. The whole hotel needs renavating desperatly. It is beautiful from the pictures but very, very cheap looking when you get up close. I am not a picky nor hard to please person, I am 23 and just went there with a girlfriend to have fun and relax, it's not like I have been to many 4 or 5 star hotels but I can't tell you that I have paid a lot less then what I paid at the Wyndham at other hotels and they surpassed the Wyndham by far. Did I mention the big cracks on the outside of the hotel, makes a really pretty view as you think of how they should tear it down? The people there were friendly for the most part, especially the guys that put your chairs down for you on the beach, by giving them even $1 they will make sure they come back around and take care of you. We were always offered popcicles and ice cream. The pool was nice and a good size, it has a ledge around it which makes it nice for sitting in the water but not getting completely in. It was very clean too. The little poolside bar makes excellent drinks, a little pricy but worth it to some. The food was a little too pricey but you do get a lot for your money, good luck in eating the whole meal or appetizer. It is perfect to split with someone and split the cost. There are so many things that you can do around Key West, you definatly do not need a car, we walked or took taxi's everywhere, which were very reasonable. A few great places to eat..Awful Arthurs has great shrimp, the Sands Club next to the Wyndham has excellent prime rib and Crabby Dicks was excellent seafood. There is a lot to be desired at the hotel but your vacation is exactly what you make it, my best advice is to stay busy outside your hotel room. It is a hard toss up on whether the price of the room is worth it or not, you do get the best oceanfront of all of Key West and I had many locals tell us that but your room is going to be less then desirable and should cost about $100 less a night. Also watch out if you buy a package, they really get you on the 14% room fee they tack on each day that ended up being $78 for 5 nights, puts a damper in spending money if your not expecting it! I would go back to Key West in a heartbeat and I would definatly use the Wyndam's facilities, I just don't know if I would stay there again. The Hilton has comparable rates and there hotel was beautiful and nearly new. If you don't mind putting out a little extra money so that you can be close to the ocean and just plan on basically sleeping in your room then I would recommend it highly but if you want luxury or a room worth what you paid for, check out the Hilton or the Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “#43 on this list for Good Reason....”
Reviews.Author: libbsjm
Reviews.Content: Believe the bad things you read here, because we didn't and we were sorry. I will admit, we are used to staying in 4 and 5 star hotels, so maybe our opinion is swayed......but this "resort" still has many problems. First of all, the fact that they call themselves "4 star" and a "resort" is completely false. They have about 5 people total working on the whole property! The same person who is the valet is also the person who comes to your room if there is a problem! The pool, which looks wonderful on the website, is a joke, it's actually quite small and dingy looking, wouldn't go in it if you paid me! Our oceanview upgrade (which we paid for) was a fantastic view of the building across from our room. Though, truth be told, we could actually "view" the ocean if we went out to the balcony, stepped all the way to the left, and leaned over the rail. It does look like they actually tried to redo something, there was fresh paint on the walls in our room, but they decided to keep the old doors, ceiling fan, refrigerator/kitchenette, and sitting table, which didn't match anything in the room. The bathroom floor also had little black hairs as a previous visitor mentioned. All in all, this was our first time at any Wyndham property, and I don't think we'll be too quick to visit any of their properties after this one, definitely not the REACH ever again. It would be well worth Wyndham's money to shut this one down and totally revamp it. I say the ONLY way you should stay here is if you can deal with 3-star or less and you get a deal for less than $100 a night on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: SweetPea
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Wyndham Reach Resort and based on the money I spent to stay there, I was extremely disappointed. The room, a junior suite, was small and in poor condition. The sliding door to the balcony was broken, the bathroom floor had hair from a previous guest and it took forever to get hot water in the shower. The front desk staff, which also served as the concierge, was less than helpful and lacked knowledge about Key West. There are some really lovely bed & breakfasts in Key West and if I were to return, I would select one of them to stay in vs. a large hotel. If you do pick a large hotel, think twice about picking the Wyndham Reach Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Stay Here Again!!”
Reviews.Author: SweetBee
Reviews.Content: This place sucked all around. We booked the best room in the hotel 10 months early and they gave it away the night before we got there. The replacement room had cig butts and peanuts on the patio. The patio had an awful stench due to it overlooking the hotel dumpster. They blew the whole reservation and offered nothing to compensate. An honest employee there tried to help me out because he knew the room we were put in was no comparison, but he got yelled at for trying to help because he's supposed to tell me all the rooms are beautiful but was honest with me instead. I killed a roach in the bathroom the 1st night and put it out with other garbage from the last guests outside the door and it all remained there for 2 days - the roach, glasses, dishes, dirty napkins right outside the room door. I got us switched to another room after complaining some more(definitely didn't make up for it) and they offered us free breakfast as we were checking out to catch a plane - how thoughtful! The Wyndham Casa Marina staff must be from another planet because that hotel has class but the Reach Resort is easily the worst Wyndham I've ever been to, and I normally like Wyndham Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: GHPTVB
Reviews.Content: like many other reviews, we had pre-paid the room via a travel agency and ended up in a tiny room with a queen bed too small to accomodate my husband (around 2m tall) and myself comfortably and a pull out sofa, which was neither comfortable nor usable, since it would have blocked the whole room, overall property more on three than on four star level, poor service, e.g. broken coffeee machine was not fixed on the third day of our stay, while the hotel was the most expensive on our round trip through Florida, it was the most disappointing one

Reviews.Title: “Be careful if you pre-pay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that the staff was not helpful at all. Like most people, we pre-paid over the internet for our spring break vacation. We requested two double beds for four nights. When we got to the hotel they gave us one double with a pull out sofa bed. The room was tiny, especially with four people in it. When we went downstairs to complain, the two guys working told us that we called in earlier that day and requested a single double instead of two doubles. If they made a mistake and gave our room away they should at least admit it instead of bluntly telling us a lie! They didn't even try to accomodate us. We went to talk to someone new the next morning. She ended up changing their story. She said that since we pre-paid it was only a request. You don't necessarily get the room you requested! Also, you don't get any type of refund if you pre-pay. We ended up paying over $400 for a double and an uncomfortable sofa bed in a tiny room. The only thing they did was take off the service fee (about $15 dollars), which is pretty much a hidden fee that they charge you after you have already pre-paid. They say it is for parking and other services. We were moved into a room with two doubles our last night there. It wasn't worth it because it was way in the back. The layout of the hotel is really confusing, you have to go through a maze just to get to the room. When we checked out of the hotel we noticed that they charged us for the room that they moved us into. They took off the room charge, but it was very annoying to have to deal with such an unhelpful staff. Be careful if you pre-pay. You might want to call before you arrive, especially if you arrive late like we did, to make sure you got the room you requested. But than again, they could tell you that you did call and requested a smaller room for the same price. The only thing nice about the hotel was the beach, even though it was really small. Apparently, not many hotels in key west have a private beach. The food was average, nothing spectacular and a little over price. Location was okay, it is on the other side of the island from Mallory Square. The rooms were fairly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 6 Night Visit - 2 Apr 05”
