Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Given where you are at and the constraints of a small island this was a wonderful resort. I looked at all the other options once I arrived and I was very happy with our selection. This is where we would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be alarmed by bad reviews! This place is great!”
Reviews.Author: ChiTraveler79
Reviews.Content: Like a lot of other people on this site, I was very concerned going into my pre-paid reservation. I would like to go on record by saying that you should not have any concerns! We had a terrific stay. We had a standard room and were able to upgrade to an ocean front suite for a very nominal charge. The room was spacious and very tropical. In the room we enjoyed a comfy king sized bed, tiled floors, separate bath and shower, and large balcony with a great ocean view. The beach was nicely taken care of and the beach chair, towel, and unbrella service was exceptional. The beach-side restaurant was crowded, but good. Great tropical drinks and service. The location is perfect. It is close enough that you can walk to Duval and all the sites, but far enough away where you can enjoy relative quiet at the resort. Long story short, don't be concerned! We had a great time and I would be happy to talk to anyone about it. P.S. Take care of the staff and they'll take care of you!

Reviews.Title: “everything is to be loved...”
Reviews.Author: americankiwi
Reviews.Content: i cant imagine anyone complainimg about the reach. the hotel staff was exceptional (anthony solomon,or was it andrew). the rooms were wonderful, cabana boys were great, massage therapists was great. i could go on and on. they were out there every morning with the tractor racking the beach. go and enjoy this place, you'll love it. perfect location also.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: keywesttravelor
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was exceptional. No complaints, clean. Very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Private”
Reviews.Author: jbarwilson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from a 4 day honeymoon at the Reach. I too was a bit leery since I didn't read these reviews until after I had booked. Happily, we had no significant complaints about the property. The beach is small, but they did keep it clean. I learned that the water quality is not too high, so I guess that's why nobody really went in the ocean. The pool was nice, although the walls were a bit greasy and needed a good cleaning. The hot tub had no bubbles the first time we saw it, but later it was OK. The best part was the night time skinny dipping we were able to do in the pool ( and hot tub). I'm sure the staff saw, but nobody complained! One guest came by the hot tub while we were in it. I told him that I hoped he didn't mind that we weren't wearing anything. He asked if he could join us in the tub. He took off his suit and got right in when we said yes.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach is a reach. . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Were do I begin? First, let me say that the bellman was very nice and helpful! The front desk staff was courteous and responsive. After that it was all down hill. We had booked our reservations on-line, junior suite/ocean view. Well, to see the ocean you had to look over the garbage dumpster, past the parking lot for the bar across the street and the piegons on the balcony. The staff allowed me to look at 2 or 3 other rooms but each one was worse. Not to be annoying I wanted to see a manager - I was told that I would have to go to the Casa Marina (the sister property) and met with the Reservations Manager. He was gracious and helpful and put my husband, teenage daughter and myself into an ocean view suite that was lovely (except for the water pressure in the shower). Side note. . . we had stayed at the Casa Marina when it was a Marriott property many years ago. Yes, some areas could use a little help but overall the facility and staff met the needs of my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very sorry for the Wyndham chain that they call this their own”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was barely even OK. I am sorry to say after spending the year in at least 5 other Wyndham hotels from California to Chicago to Miami where I have had nothing but great things to say about each of them- this building was not fit for the Wyndham name. This was a colossal disappointment, based on the photo I had seen on the site, I'd say we were 'had'- this room barely rated as a motel...we had no less than 5 different era pieces of furniture in this room- each was a hodgepodge of junk- from a painted wood sink area to something resmbling brown wood as a nightstand, to yellow wood bureau and white bed posts. I am in complete agreement with a recent poster who spoke of the bathroom- peeling wallpaper that was fraught with mold- no kidding. We stayed for the same reason as others- we had prepaid. Also, the pool and beach were very very nice- but beware, no seats at the pool midday and they shoo you to the beach to find a place to sit. I can't believe we paid nearly $600 for two nights in that place. Wyndham needs to give the building a complete overhaul. You don't need to believe me, just walk into the lobby and notice the musty smell- it starts right there.

Reviews.Title: “Improved since first visit”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my 2nd visit here (Dec. 10-13, 2004). My first visit was in June 2003 and I didn't have a great experience, so I had low expectations this time (only stayed here because I got a great price). I was pleasantly surprised by some improvements: New furniture, linens, rugs, drapes, etc. in the rooms, and the staff seems more attentive and friendly. The room was cleaned exceptionally well during my stay. Two complaints: 1.) the layout of the hotel is very confusing...I got lost trying to find my room a few times, and the ice machines are hard to locate. They should give everyone a floor plan when they check in. 2.) There are no vending machines anywhere on the property, so stock up before you go. One other thing to note, there's an additional $12 daily fee on top of taxes. They say it's for the pool and parking garage, but it's just a hidden fee. The location is great if you want to be out of the fray of Duval Street, but still close enough to walk to everything. The beach and pool are small but nice. Overall I had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reach is great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews on trip advisor panning the Reach Resort. We went for four days over Thanksgiving and I am very please to say that it was a wonderful stay. The staff at the Reach could not have been more personable and gracious. The rooms are small but are spotless and well maintained. It was very relaxing eating meals right on the ocean deck. It is two blocks from Southernmost Point and Duval yet quiet and relaxing. We will definitely stay there the 3 or 4 times a year we go to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Always Great!!”
Reviews.Author: gphilly
Reviews.Content: I been to Key West three times and each time I've stayed at the Reach. Out of all the places I've stayed in the world, the Reach is still one of my favorites!! I can't understand all these people complaining about it. All I can imagine is that some people never have anything good to say about anything. Anyway, if you have future reservations, have a great time!! Wish I was going...

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again - Great Lodging”
Reviews.Author: RichChapman
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, after reading Trip Advisor reviews, we were a little worried that booking three nights in this hotel was ill-researched. I booked through Priceline back in May, thinking I would get an incredible hotel for the money. Fortunately, we were delightfully surprised! The hotel was clean, we were upgraded to a junior suite at no charge, and the location is just far enough away from the local bars and t-shirt shops to afford a resort atmosphere on the property. One evening it was drizzling, and as we were leaving to walk to Duval Street, I asked someone at the front desk if they had any complimentary umbrellas. They didn't, but a staff member offered his own for our use that evening. Nice touch! We'll book here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Reach is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 4 day stay at the Reach in the beginning of October. The rooms were bright, well decorated, clean and comfortable, especially the soft beds. The staff at the front desk, pool, beach, restaurant, etc were terrific, helpful and just plain nice. We could not have asked for better service. We mentioned that it was our 20th anniversary at check-in and we were surprised by a bottle of champagne and a hand written note of congratulations from the management. That was an incredibly nice touch. More importantly, the property was delightful. The beach was steps from the pool, and both were just wonderful places to relax and enjoy yourself. The Reach had more than enough chairs and umbrellas to comfortably seat all of its guests (and the hotel was full when we were there) where ever they wanted to sit. No need to worry about getting out early to make sure you had a lounge chair in the shade. Those people who wrote negative things about the Reach either should not go to Key West because it simply does not have great beaches, or they should not go to expensive resorts because they resent spending the customary resort charges (which are always alot) for food and other items. We did not think the Reach's prices for food were that expensive and the resort fee it charged was similar to what other resorts charged. We had no complaints whatsoever about the Reach. One suggestion, though, spring for the oceanview room and don't expect much of a view of the ocean even with that. The city view you might have is not what you would visualize when you think of Old Key West. Like most resorts we have stayed in at Key West, the Reach's ocean view rooms are not that close to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Reach, will definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Reach for our honeymoon. We stayed for 5 nights. I read the reviews months after we booked the hotel, so I was quite worried after reading some of the bad responses. My husband & I loved it. It was a beautiful resort. It was clean. The beach was just beautiful. The pool was very nice. The staff was excellent, they could not have been any nicer. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a bigger room with a great view. Shulas, their resturant was very good, alittle pricey, but very good. We ate their breakfast buffet ( which was great)every morning. Most of the people on the island (locals and tourists)either ride bicycles or scooters. There really is no parking on Duval St. for cars, so this is much easier & fun. We rented a scooter (there are plenty of bicycle & scooter rentals all over) & we are really glad we did. The Reach really isn't to far from Duval St, but the scooter was a good decision. My husband & I are a normal middle class couple & all we wanted was a nice, clean hotel with a good beach & a helpful staff. Everything exceded our expectations. We will deinately be going there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Reach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visited the Wyndham Reach from Sept 29 to Oct 3, 2004. There are allot of negative comments about the Reach in these reviews. I found no substance to any of these. From the time we called for the shuttle from the airport we found friendly, courteous and helpful staff. The front desk was helpful at check in and upgraded our room. I mentioned that we were there to celebrate our anniversary and that night a complementary bottle of champagne was sent to our room with a congratulatory note. The room (341) was clean and very large. The room had a separate sink area, while the bath room itself had a bath and separate large shower, which was plenty big for two. The view was great of the pool and beach area. The location of the Reach was a bit of a walk to the party end of Duval, but that was fine with us. We enjoyed the walk and found that when we wanted to get away from the bustle of Duval the Reach provided a quiet alternative. Ricardo at the pool was very friendly and helpful by setting up chairs and bringing us frozen towels to help cool us off. The beach was raked everyday to clear it of washed up seaweed, which one has to expect with all of the hurricanes lately. The beach side bar and grill was good, a bit on the expensive side, but so was all of Key West. It was convenient though to get out of the sun, enjoy lunch and a drink, and still have the magnificent view of the Atlantic. Next time we visit Key West we will definitely stay at the Reach.

Reviews.Title: “Total Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We vacationed here August 25th-29th. One of the reasons we went with this is because my travel agent talked about the white sand beach and that if we stayed 3 nights the 4th would be free. I was very excited about going on the trip I had booked 2 months in advance, until I had read the reviews here, and much to my disappointment they were all true. Our room was small, but what can one expect for $150 a night. We couldn't get over the overwhelming smell of mildew in the room- everytime the ac kicked on that was all you could smell. But don't open the balcony door- you will be hit in the face with the smell of rotting seaweed that is abundant on those white sand beaches. Don't even bother trying to get to the ocean, unless you want to tred through 5 feet of seaweed. We could always tell that we were nearing our resort as we were walking along because of the grotesque smell of the seaweed. Besides the smelly ac, there was the mildew stricken "what use to be yellow but now turned green" wallpaper in the bathroom- if you have allergies- forget it- I was sneezing my head off. Plus don't slip on the leaking pipes under the sink that nearly soaked our floor. We never received our complimentary welcome gift of 2 drinks and food, even after calling the front desk twice, and once going down there. The room service was bad- besides them taking away the rubber mat for the tub, taking away one of our pillows, and taking one of our personal hangers- we stopped using them because we did a better job then them- I don't think these people know what a vacuum cleaner or broom is. Let alone knowing how to bend down and pick up the plate of food sitting outside of our neighbors door for over 2 days. As one reviewer said before- It does look like they are waiting for a hurricane to come along so they can collect the insurance money- and if they are lucky maybe Ivan will do the trick. I will never stay at this hotel again- oh, and the 3 nights, get the 4th for free- do you think that was taken off of my bill??? Of course not- I had to go to the lobby and have the office people look at me like I had 3 heads because I wanted the 4th night free, as promised in the agreement with the travel agent. After a couple of phone calls I finally received it- but what a hassle!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Key West on 10.08.04 and intended to stay at the resort for two nights. First we got a small room which wasn't made up when we entered it and then we got a bigger one in a far anckle of the hotel. The room was nicely furnished and clean but it was very clairaudient, we heard our neigbours TV and talk. The door didn't shut properly so that we had loads of midges and the air condition wasn't of much use. The pool was crowded and it didn't look too nice but the beach was nice although full of seawed. The restaurant was very nice, delicious tuna and a marvellous oceanview. The breakfast buffet was disappointing and too expensive. We just stayed one night due to hurricane Charley but we didn't mind, weren't too sad to not have to spend there another night.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: Palmbury
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham Reach July 31 - August 5 for our Honeymoon. I had also read the reviews of it and before we got there I was weary. However, I thought the place was very nice. We had no problems with our room, we were upgraded upon arrival after getting in good with the front desk. We were shuttled from the airport (their shuttles are very worn and old) and got to our room almost immediately. The pool was not too crowded and it never closed, so we opted for some late night swims. We didn't even know there was a hot tub until we passed it one night walking. It is hidden and packed with people. The beach was dirty from seaweed so we didn't even go there. We ate at Shula's and spent $130 and we didn't even get a full course meal. Everything in Key West and the Reach is pricey. Sand's has good food as well. The only thing we would have changed was the fact that the resort is a mile walking distance from all the sites and happening bars, etc. We walked 14 miles the first few days and then decided to take cabs which are about $6-$7 to get to Mallory Square. The bell boy will call you a cab. Tip everyone!! Everything around us closed at 10 p.m. We would stay there again but the distance factor might make us change our minds.

HotelInfo.Name: The Reach, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1435 Simonton Street, Key West, FL 33040
